111.content:
These are some of the newer teachers, who have just been hired on. They're new to the Academy, and may find themselves having a hard time adjusting...


Brooke Morrison
23, Blonde, 5'5", 120lbs
English I / II
Brooke Morrison is freshly graduated from her local college, and just so happened to luck into her position.

She's flighty at times, and isn't the most disciplined. It comes from having a well-off home life and not having to work for much, but she just sort of fell into teaching. That being said, she's very eager to please her students. She desperately wants to be seen as the "fun" teacher, and isn't above breaking class protocol to make sure her students favor her.

Brooke begins as a better-looking than most woman, with a tight waist and a large chest.She wears her hair down to her shoulders.
She tends to get top-heavy as she gains weight.


Penny Price
22, Blonde, 5'3", 100lbs
Government / Economics
Penny Price has always been an eager beaver.

She graduated from college early, always had the highest marks in class, and was even salutatorian of her graduating class in college. Penny has lofty ambitions for herself, and sees Buttercombe Academy as the way to get to them. She's well aware of its status as one of the most prestigious preparatory schools in America, but what she doesn't know might bite her in the butt.

Penny is a shorter woman, who wears her hair back and has a propensity for sweaters.
Penny gains weight in her stomach predominantly, giving her an awkward shape to dress for.
111.title: New-Bee Teachers

choices: ...for a meeting with Dr. Hinamizawa
...for a party for the new teachers
...but first, let's try some of these snacks.
1112.content:
It was a sunny and warm day as Penny was driving her red smart toward Buttercombe, where she would've soon began her career as a teacher.

She was only 22 years old, fresh from college, but had already landed a job on one of the most prestigious schools in America, and she was well aware and proud of that. She had always studied hard at school, and graduated at record time. Finally, all these years of work paid off.
Well, mostly.

Sure, getting a job at Buttercombe is already a big priviledge, but Penny Price was not the kind of person who would've been satisfied by just that. To her it was simply a step toward her neverending ambitions.

Still, that was a very important step for Penny's career, and she was celebrating gleefully whistling a melody as she was hearing "sweet home Alabama", one of her favourite songs, on the radio.
She was wearing a bright yellow sweater, on of her favourite in her wide collection, and thoght it was appropriate to wear in her first day at that hive-themed school. Her long blonde hair were tied into a ponytail that felt behind her back like a golden waterfall.

After more than half an hour since she had been travelling across the same secluded road on the mountains, Penny wondered why would a school so far away from every city, aside of that small dusty town. Shouldn't a school be more connected with the outside world?

Thankfully, it didn't take much longer to finally see the six-stories building, it was definetely big enough for Penny's ambitions. Her meaty pink lips twisted into a satisfied grin at the thought of working there.
She stopped at the gate, and immediately a voice from a box asked: "name, please?"

Penny was caught by surprise and replied awkwardly: "Penny Price. I'm the new economics and government teacher".

The gate opened and she drove through the school's front yard, and parked her smart in the teachers' parking area. Every parking lot had a pole with a name, and the blonde immediately found the new silver plate on which it was written: Penny Price.

There were still no students, as she came very early so she could have the time to get used to the school without any brat annoying her; the empty school looked like a ghost building, albeit there were clearly some renewed parts.

She went to the secretary that gave her the ID card and the direction for her cabin. Penny looked satisfied at that, although she didn't like the serious expression she had in the photo.

"Don't forget, the appointment is at 13 pm" repeated the secretary as the new teacher left for her cabin.

Penny gave a nod to tell her that sue got it, and brought her cases upstair.

With enthusiasm, she discovered it was basically a full apartment, complete with entrance hall, kitchen and living room. In her bedroom there was a king sized bed that Penny couldn't wait to try; she unpacked her cases (the guardrobe was so large she could fit only half of it, and the blonde found an entire compartment where she put her sweaters collection) and jumped on the soft matress.
The young woman grew up in a relatively poor family, and had never rested on anything such comfortable before. Actually, all the dorm was incredible for her as she explored them like a kid in a theme park. The bathroom had any kind of advanced comfort, including a bathub large enough to wash a baby hyppo and sweet towels. A living room with a desk for her job as teacher, a comfortable couch in front of a maxi-television and a kitchen with a hot plate of ultimate generation and a fridge so large it looked like it was made for an entire squad, and it was already provided with different snacks and packages of a brand she dind't recognize.

Penny liked her cabin so much she took a selfie while standing in the living room and sent it to her old college friends, hoping they would burn with envy.

Then she lied on the couch, and only then noticed there was a strawberry cheesecake and a small paper that said

"For Penny Price, I am happy to welcome you in our big family as a brand new teacher.

-Mrs. Polluck"

The blonde woman was so flattered she could not resist and took a slice of the welcome cake.
While munching it, she found it really good, and wondered if all the food is that good or just this welcome cake. She decided to pick a second slice, she deserved a little and well earned indulgence, after all.

Then she looked at the clock on her phone, it was already half past twelve, and thought she should prepare to go down...

Rachel Conrad
26, Brunette, 5'7, 120lbs
English III / IV
Rachel Conrad is not what she seems. Her teaching credentials have been falsified, and she's actually an investigative reporter...

She has been assigned to get deep undercover, and find out just what (if anything) is at the root of the mysterious connection between the Yeng Corporation and Buttercombe Academy. As such, she takes great care to analyze the oddities that seem to run rampant in such a strange school. However, her curiosity may lead her by the nose right into Yeng's crosshairs if she's not careful... Which she never is.

Rachel starts her story off as a fashionable, TV-ready woman. She's cut her hair short recently, for the job.
Though thin now, she tends to gain weight in her stomach and face.

Vivian is mostly apathetic towards school. She has been, all her life.

She was the star women's basketball player through high school and college despite her smoking habit. Recently she's decided to quit, which has left her irritable and cranky. Not so much so that it impacted her ability to get a job at the notoriously choosy Academy, mind you. Vivian is a teacher because she feels her days in the spotlight are over, and she's ready to relax for once in her life.

11131.content:
Even if she hadn’t been assigned to investigate this place, Rachel would have known that something was up with Buttercombe Academy.

A campus this large, remotely located in the upper mountain ranges of Virginia, was just weird. The only town for miles around was that creepy little place Wellington. The reception up here was shoddy unless you were hooked up to the school’s Wi-Fi, which opened up a whole different can of worms based on security and privacy. A lot of the other teachers and students might have not seen the eccentricities of this place as anything other than just the trade-off for attending such a prestigious school, but Rachel Conrad knew better.

What’s more, her bosses knew better. They knew what they were sending her into because she was one of the better investigative reporters and one of the names closest to the Yeng Investigation.

For years now, the media had been following the breadcrumbs left by the Yeng Corporation. First the incident in Daven’s Port, the strange disappearances, and the “relocation” of one of its highest paid scientific minds to the aforementioned, remotely located area full of young and impressionable girls who were eating out of the palms of their hands—literally?

That shit just didn’t fly.

And now here she was, snooping around her new cabin like some kind of lunatic.

If they had cameras in these little abodes, they probably thought that she was a crazy person. Flipping over pillows and looking underneath her couch. Her fridge, her bed. Hell, she’d even looked down the drain! But to the best of her untrained eyes, they weren’t watching her…

Which was good, because she was really tired from the drive up.

Rachel Conrad flopped herself down on the couch, already grateful to be off of her feet. Lugging all of her suitcases onto her personal golf cart hadn’t done her any favors either. The woman at the desk said that they had a staff for that, but Rachel couldn’t risk anyone finding out about the cameras that she’d stashed in her luggage.

Honestly this whole process had probably taken ten years off of her life. First that interview with her pig of a boss Ms. Polluck—watching her gorge herself on all that rich fattening food was sickening. And then her creepy Vice Principal Dr. Hinami-whatever, asking her all those personal questions. Pretending like she was just some dumb new teachers like the others… it had been so stressful, all she was worried about was getting found out.

But now she was here. In the belly of the beast, as it were.

To everyone else, she was just Ms. Conrad, the new English Language Arts teacher.

But she was actually Rachel Conrad, deep undercover journalist. And she was going to get to the bottom of the threads that tied the insidious Yeng Corporation to Buttercombe Academy.

…tomorrow.

Right now, she was tired.

Maybe a little nap.
11131.title: A Nose for News

choices: It says on her chart that Rachel will be receiving Medication?
Rachel is marked as "Group B"... what does that mean?
Nothing out of the ordinary here. Rachel heads back to her cabin.
Nothing out of the ordinary here. Rachel heads to the cafeteria for lunch.
111312.content:
The fact that this wasn’t done during the hiring process seemed a little odd. Instead of performing her physical, or at least requesting her medical information, before she’d made the drive up to Virginia was a bit unusual. If it was so important that she’d been evaluated by a medical professional beforehand, you’d think that it would have been mentioned before now—but whatever.

To Rachel, it seemed that it was more important that she was evaluated by their medical professional staff.

But that was just reporter’s intuition.

It was Saturday, around noon, two days before classes began. She’d had minimal time to get her cabin unpacked and her closet filled. The Summer weather hadn’t quite passed, and she wasn’t required to “dress” like a teacher during her off hours, so Rachel had elected for a simple white tank and a flowing green overjacket to hide the spaghetti straps—they were still thin enough to violate the general dress code on-campus. She wore her hair up, still tired from the move.

She was a pretty woman, to which no one would disagree. She had to be camera-friendly in her line of work after all. Her real line of work. But for now, she supposed she could settle for being the hot teacher. That being said, anyone would feel a little self-conscious in her current predicament.

Stripped down to her lacy black bra and panties, her artificially tanned body standing out against the stark white and creamy yellow of the school’s infirmary.

It made her feel like she wasn’t supposed to be here—perhaps because she wasn’t. Not really. Not Rachel the Teacher—she was more than welcome. But Rachel the investigative, Yeng-tracking reporter… that was a different story.

Her nurse seemed nice enough, though. Not nice enough to let her guard down, but a generally benign woman who didn’t seem outwardly malicious.

Ms. Fukiyama was a tall, thin woman of Asian descent. She had long, silky hair and a somewhat round face. If she were in the position to be comforted, Rachel would have found her soothing voice and gentle mannerisms pleasant. But something about all this seemed… off.

“So.” Rachel said abruptly as her attendant calibrated the scale, “How long have you, uh… worked here?”

The woman smiled and looked over, tucking a stray lock of flowing ebony hair behind her ear.

“Oh, the same as you I’d suppose.” She said with a smile, “You’re a first-year teacher, right?”

“Right.” Rachel hesitated slightly, “First year teaching. I’m… kind of nervous.”

Ms. Fukiyama didn’t say anything. Just made a noise of affirmation that she had heard Rachel, but had nothing to add. She was much more interested in the reading of the scale. Which was Watanagashi brand, Rachel noted, and therefore a product of a Yeng subsidiary. She’d have to remember that.

“120 pounds.” Ms. Fukiyama said after a moment of calibration, “Perfect.”

“That seems a little high.” Rachel joked, “Sure I can’t slip you a twenty and take it back down to 110?”

Her nurse laughed—a little polite one. Rachel wondered how often she must hear that kind of comment around here…

“Unfortunately, there’s not much I can do about that.” Shiro said with a smile, “But the good news is that you’re in perfect health. You’re right where you should be, weight-wise, and it doesn’t look like you need anything extra… at least as far as I’m concerned.”

In a way, Rachel was almost disappointed. Being an investigative reporter and all, she half-way expected to be told that she had some kind of crippling disease that only Yeng could cure. That seemed to be their MO, anyway. Peddling product on the young and impressionable students at this Academy…

And the nurses, it looks like, judging by all the medical equipment. A cursory glance of the little office told Rachel all she needed to know about where Buttercombe’s infirmary got its facilities from.

“I just need you to sign here.” Shiro handed Rachel a clipboard and a pen—it wrote in pink.

Rachel clicked the pen and lowered it down onto the medical waiver. Everything seemed right. Her height, weight, W, Brun., et cetera et cetera…
111312.title: Let's Get Physical

choices: Someone from the management?
A fellow teacher?
A familiar face? Oh no!
1113122.content:
Rachel dropped the pen. “Excuse me?” she raised her voice a little to draw the Ms. Fukiyama's attention. “What's Group B supposed to mean?”

“Oh! Thanks for reminding me, I nearly forgot,” the nurse opened a drawer and took out a decently looking faux-amber bracelet. “It defines your, umm, access rights? Essentially, I am supposed to give you this thing, there's a chip built in and it's good for all the vending machines, the cafeteria, lets you use everything for free. It also opens various classrooms and other spaces that are off-limits to students… To be honest, I don't know myself what else it can do. I've got one myself too, everyone does, but I don't wear it much since it clashes with my skin. But it goes well with your hair…” she trailed uncertainly, seeing the suspicious look Rachel was giving it.

The undercover reporter quickly smiled and put it on her wrist. I need to have it examined somehow, God knows what else it might do – trace my movements at the very minimum. But I now I must play the role of hot dumb teacher. “Oh, really? Well, I'll try it right away. Which way is the cafeteria?” And she rose, giving nurse the signed waiver.

“It's close by, just turn left and then follow the signs.”

Rachel was nearly out of the office when she turned, “Oh, and Group B? So are there Groups A, C, D as well?”

The nurse shrugged, “Well, I'm Group C, I think Bs are most common, all the teachers' bracelets I've issued were B, so I suppose the Headmistress could be A. But nobody's ever asked me yet.”

“Ah, I see. Well, thanks and see you soon – though hopefully not in your professional role,” Rachel joked lightly, hoping it would make the nurse forget her nosing.

Speaking about nosing, her nose was just reporting a cocktail of enticing smells coming from the left. Well, she told the girl she was going to the cafeteria so she might just as well check it out.

Since semester didn't start yet and it was early, she expected it to be empty. As she neared the wide open double door though, she found out she was wrong. True, there weren't that many people but they made up for it with their size. Rachel stopped in her tracks, shocked and disgusted by the avalanche of fat she witnessed.

There were obese teens everywhere, waiting in lines, waddling with their trays, swapping their holiday adventures and eating. Mainly eating though that was too mild a word for this display of gluttony.

When the first shock receded, Rachel had to admit there weren't actually all that many of them, three dozen, four at most. The cafeteria was still mostly empty and she could see it in all its splendor – high ceilings, pristine white walls, dozens of tables with wide upholstered chairs. The chairs drew her attention next. She could fit comfortably in them with her boyfriend (if she had any), and yet for some of the worst blobs she saw it was a tight fit.

Rachel reminded herself she should stick to her role and remain objective. Still, as she slowly turned her attention to the closest buffet her mind was awhirl in confusion. Why did the fattest students arrive all early? Were they so eager to get back to the trough? It certainly seemed so, judging by the amounts they piled on their trays.

Perhaps she should watch what she was eating here?

She was jerked out of her thoughts by a discreet cough behind her. “Excuse me? Are you Rachel Conrad?”

She slowly turned to see…
1113122.title: Nosing Privileges

choices: Rachel soon begins the lessons, and her research
When she comes back, Brooke finds a surprise in her cabin...
Along her way to the cabin, Rachel runs into someone
11131222.content:
.. a young woman standing next to her.

She had blonde and wavy shoulder lenght hair that surrounded her face like curtains and a small nose between her clear eyes. A short jacket covered her svelte body and highlighted her large chest as one of the buttons was clearly having more troubles than the others.

"Yes, it's me. What do you want?" replied Rachel.

The brunette scratched her chin. How could she know her name? Was she a spy working for the school? Did she know her true identity?

"I just wanted to know my close colleague" replied the blonde woman with childish glee. "My name's Brooke Morrison, I'm new just like you, and I too teach English and literliterature! Only, I do English I and II, while you do III and IV, am I right?"

Rachel nooded. "So, are we the only english teachers?"

Brooke tapped her forehead with her index finger. "Actually, if I recall, Mrs. Polluck mentioned another one, a certain Mrs. Porter, who has already been teaching here".

Rachel gave a closer look at the blonde. Was it really a spy or was she really a naive newcomer? If the latter was true, she could turn into a useful ally for her scoop. But she shouldn't reveal her identity, only give her some hints about something strange in the school. Wait, maybe she was just playing this role to give her a sense of false security, then she...

"Hey, there are some students in that table!" said Brooke elbowing Rachel's hip and the brunette's train of thoughts stopped. "How about we pick something to eat and we join them? So we can befriend them!"

Rachel, still not sure if she could trust her colleague or not, decided to play her role and followed her. Was surprised to see that the school could afford so much food. Was it only the first day or it was the standard?

She didn't think there could be something in the food, there was just too much for them to tamper it if that was their intention. They both grabbed a portion of lasagna and approached the table. The three fat students who were sitting there stopped their chatting and their eating and got quiet as they saw the two teachers joining them.

"Do you mind if we sit here?" asked Brooke.

The girls shook their heads. How could they say no to a teacher? And besides, they had already sit down when she asked that.

"Hello, girls!" bursted Brooke with the same enthusiasm of a summer camp's animator. "What years are you?"

"Me... me and Dalilah are sophomores" said nervously a short chubby student patting the girl next to her. Dalilah had long auburn hair that covered her right eye and was the less chubby of the trio, with only a potbelly and some widehips. "While she's a junior" and pointed the girl on the other side. She had dark brown hair tied into a short-side ponytail, and was the fattest of the three, to the point her round belly was pressed against the edge of the table. Rachel thought she was likely the double of her own weight.

"Really?" said Brooke. "Then I'll be your new english teacher this year! My name's Brooke Morrison, what's yours?"

"I'm Lana Dellinger, Mrs Morrison" said the girl who previously answered. She was a chubby girl with a round face. Her black hair were cut short, revealing the numerous piercings on her ears.

"Nice to meet you. But you can calm me by name if you prefer. There's no need to call me that seriously, and it makes me feel young"

Then she presented the brown-haired woman sitting next to her, who had just been eating her lasagna, and placed an arm around her shoulders. "She's Rachel Conrad. She's a new english teacher too, but teaches english III and IV, so be ready" said winking to the fat brunette.

Brooke shook Rachel who was about to spit a piece of lasagna she was chewing. Then Rachel recomposed herself and made a smile at the fat junior in front of her. God she was fat, and she wasn't alone. Not only at her table, but all of the students, save some exceptions, were leaning toward the fat side, if not downright obese in some cases.

"Actually, I have already Mrs. Porter" replied the junior after having gulped down one of her tacos.

"Ops, well, nevermind" said a bit embarassed Brooke. "Changing topic, how is the school?"

-----

The blonde teacher started a discussion with the girls, occasionally making a lame joke that brought at best a cringey smile from the girls, who were getting more and more awkward with every passing moment.

Meanwhile Rachel was quiet, as she was examining the other students. She remembered about the "group B" thing and wondered if the students belonged to another one, like group "D" or "E" or maybe there were different groups among the students, although they didn't seem to have any bracelet like she and her colleague did. She thought it was a good idea to investigate and ask, but maybe not so soon, or she would've been suspicious. Speaking of suspiciousness, she decided to be more interactive so to not appear to silent and strange, and interveened in the awkward discussion. After a while, Brooke even offered to take seconds for the students; this time she really did caught their appreciation of the three teens who eagerly gave her their trays. Rachel offered to help Brooke, despite the blonde's insistence on doing it alone, so she could have some time alone with her. Oh, and get another slice of that lasagna.

"Did you prepare a program?" asked Brooke. Rachel was in her thought and got caught off guard. "Sorry, prepare what?" asked as she took another slice of lasagna.

"A program. Like, did you prepare your lessons beforehand?" asked again the blonde.

"Ah, well... yes" said Rachel. In truth, she didn't, actually, she didn't even remember what exactly she had to teach! Once she got back to her cabin, checking her teaching program would've been the first thing to do.

"Oh, so you're one who prepares in advance" replied picking a slice of pie for Dalilah, the quiet sophomore. "I have just a loose program but I prefer improvising and following the flow of the lessons, along with the student's needs"

"Speaking of program" started Rachel, hoping it was the right moment. "Did you have a medical check today?" asked the brunette.

"Uhmm yes, I had it this morning. Why did you ask?"

"Just curiosity. Are you group B too?"

"Group B?"

"Yes, it's written on your bracelet" said the brunette.

"Oh, I didn't know. I thought it was just to tell the teachers apart from the rest of the staff. I think it's nice, isn't it?"

"Yes, really nice" she still wasn't sure if Brooke was a spy or not, although the possibilities seemed to lean to the latter, but thought she could have been much useful for the investigation. Better keep her close, besides, silly attempts to endorse the students aside, she was a nice company.

"You know, it's been nice to know you, but I remember I have some things to do in my cabin" said hastily Rachel as she gave the tray back to Lana, who wasn't excited to see the teacher picked her only two slices of pizza, and went back to her cabin. She had to take notes. Oh, and see what's the textbooks's program she's been given for her cover.
11131222.title: Meeting a colleague

choices: Study – keeping cover is Rachel's priority
Snoop around – that's why she is here
Sleep – Rachel wouldn't find out anything anyway in this state
111312223.content:
Rachel was striding along the path back to her cabin when she heard the soft purr of an electric motor. What was that? She fought the urge to turn – she shouldn't look like snooping – but she failed again. Her head snapped around to see a small, round woman bobbing towards her in some kind of an overgrown golf cart. Rachel's eyes were immediately drawn to her bright blue locks. And yet she seemed to be past 40, who was this person?

She waved at her, shouting cheerfully: “Hello, Ms. Conrad! Nice finally meeting you! I was trying to catch all newcomers to our staff at the cafeteria to give them a proper welcome but it turned out you already left. So welcome to the Buttercombe Academy at last!”

“Uh, thank you, umm…”

“Oh, where are my manners? Dr. Helen Schwartz, Head Counselor.” The woman braked her contraption to shake hands with Rachel. “May I accompany you to your cabin? I'd like to have a word with you if you don't mind.”

Rachel did mind but she couldn't say that. “Uh, sure.” She gave a surprised look to the resident genius. Better enforce her image of a clueless youg girl. “So happy to meet you, Dr. Schwartz! I've read so much about your inventions! I admire you so much!”

“Oh, that was nothing,” the scientist-turned-Counselor basked in her praise, preening a little. “Well, hop on the second seat, please. We'll make it to your cabin faster.”

She wasn't sure she wanted such a close contact with one of the . “Uh, I'd prefer to walk. After all, it's just two dozen yards.”

The Counselor frowned, lowered her voice: “Listen, better do hop on, please. I didn't want to talk about it here where some student might overhear us but there's a reason for it. There's been an outbreak of Lyme disease, ticks infestation due to the hot summer, or so I've been told. We've had them eradicated on our grounds, hopefully, but I wouldn't risk anything if I were you, right?”

“Uh, right, right.” Rachel joined her, sitting down in a second, smaller seat on the side.

Helen started the cart moving again. “In fact, it might be advisable if you use a scooter within the Academy like I do. You have been assigned one but better hurry to claim it from the caretaker, since scooters unclaimed by teachers will be redistributed among needful students in a week's time.”

“And what about the rest of the students? How are they going around? Aren't they facing the worst risks? Shouldn't we give scooters primarily to them?”

The plump woman waved her hand, “Oh, it's nice of you to think of them but the dormitories are mostly connected with covered walkways and our students seldom venture outside. It is the staff who are most at risk, especially newbies like you.”

Students don't go outside? This was getting weirder and weirder. But she had to stick to her role. “OK, I'll pick up my scooter right away.”

“Good,” the older woman smiled at her warmly. “Also, please remember that the eradication took place only on our grounds so avoid going outside the compound on foot at all. If you need to go to the town, please drive and stay on the main roads. We wouldn't like to lose you.”

So I am not supposed to go outside, eh? What are they hiding there? Rachel nodded, not trying to hide her confusion. It was perfectly natural to feel overwhelmed by all this on her first day.

Dr. Schwartz noticed it too. “Well, sorry for unloading it all on you but it had to be done, right? Anyway, what do you think about your accommodation? Is it adequate for such a valuable member of our faculty?”

Valuable? What did they put in my fake CV? Luckily it was easy to fake a reason for her surprise. “Adequate? It's stunning! I've never lived in anything as grand as this!” Rachel gushed, happy to speak the truth.

“Glad to hear it.” As they drove right to the cabin door. Rachel moved to stand up but the Counselor waved her down. “No, no, don't get up yet. Just wave your bracelet past the lock – good – and now I can show you how you'll dock your scooter when you have one.”

They drove inside, backing to the side wall. “So this is why there's such an empty space in the entrance! I was wondering what was it for…”

“Indeed.” A satisfied chuckle was followed by a grunt as the older woman reached inside a hidden compartment and pulled out a huge welcome basket, almost too large to fit in there. „Sooo… one again, welcome to the Buttercombe Academy. Let's sit and chat a little, shall we?” And she thrust the basket into Rachel's hands.

“Uh, thanks,” Rachel retreated into the living room, putting it on the table. She gave its contents a quick glance - honey buns, apple pies, cupcakes and muffins… not an ounce of healthy food. And while there were no brands to be seen, she didn't doubt they were all produced by Yeng.

As she walked to the sofa, Dr. Schwartz looked even heavier than before. She thrust the basket back into Rachel's hands. “So, have a cake, please. Have a bite and tell me, what's been your experience so far? How do you find our little academy?”

Rachel didn't want to stuff herself with snacks but as the Counselor's questions got ever more personal and she had to invent more about her supposed background, she found herself delving into the basket ever more often to have an excuse to stop speaking for a moment.

When the woman finally finished her interrogation and drove away, wishing her a pleasant afternoon, Rachel groaned, caressing her stuffed stomach. She'd never… scratch that, she hadn't felt this stuffed since her last Thanksgiving with her family.

What to do now? She ought to have a look at the textbooks so she wouldn't be blindsided like this again. But the thinly veiled attempt to discourage her from snooping outside the compound piqued her interest. Perhaps she could pick up her scooter and drive around? After all, the Counselor warned her against walking. She did say driving was OK, right? Her stomach had yet another idea. Wouldn't it be nice to take a nap now?

What to do now?
111312223.title: Heavy Counseling

Rachel goes to class late & hungry—but her girls provide her with plenty to eat!
1113122231.content:
Even if she bought Dr. Schwartz’s tick story—which she didn’t—maintaining her cover was key if she wanted to get anywhere with the investigation.

As hard-nosed as she could be, it would have been stupid to go snooping around this early in the game. She wasn’t going to find anything; she didn’t even know where to start looking! No, the answer was clearly for her to take her time and maintain her image as the helpful, apparently very valuable, much-more-attractive English teacher.

And unfortunately, that meant that she had to at least learn how teaching worked.

Whatever Gia—her contact for this kind of thing—had put on her resume for this job, it had given her one hell of a recommendation. She was teaching English 3, 4 and an honor’s class. Falling behind on her coursework was an absolute no-go. Not for maintaining this cover story of some sort of prodigy.

“Dammit.” She cursed under her breath and rolled her eyes, “Couldn’t have made me out to be some average educator, noooo…”

They had done some of the work for her. Provided her with a lesson plan that was up to standard with what Buttercombe Academy taught the previous year. Shakespeare for the 12th graders, Beowulf for the 11th, and plenty of essays about persuasive articles and TED talks. Basic “getting ready for college” stuff, really.

The only trouble was teaching it.

Rachel was a Journalist, not a bibliophile.

She could barely keep awake reading some of the articles she’d researched on the Yeng corporation, let alone try to peel through A Midsummer Night’s Dream!

By the time she decided that she needed coffee, the moon hung heavily over the mountaintop Academy. She had the heater on blast and the cold Virginia air still made its way through the cracks of the window. Her phone read 11:35—she had to wake up in less than six hours to get ready for classes…

Her first day on-site and she hadn’t done a lick of work.

Rachel hung her head in her hands and groaned. This was going to be the longest job of her life.

***


The beds at Buttercombe were comfortable. Queen-sized, fluffy comforter with a multitude of pillows. She hadn't done much "moving in" but that was to be expected. The heater hummed a low tune as it provided Rachel with the ideal sleeping temperature.

She'd bundled up nice and warm, cocooned herself in the cream-yellow blanket. It made the four hours of sleep that she managed to receive that night all the more bearable. She almost didn't want to get up...
1113122231.title: Hit the Books!

choices: Rachel starts watching the students, alarmed by their obesity
Rachel meets more of the staff
Rachel needs to sleep off her morning binge – luckily she can!
11131222313.content:
“Good morning, class!” Rachel rushed in to find the classroom already full. Silently, she cursed her alarm clock again – and the beds in Buttercombe. She stopped by the whiteboard and turned to face her students, getting a good look at them for the first time. And giving them a good look at her.

“Oh, God, another model!” one of them whispered. “Wanna bet how long it takes for Ms. Perfect to grow a gut?”

“Don't be so nasty, Becky. She might be nice. Besides, it's not like you're thin anymore.”

“I'm still smaller than you, Evie. Or anyone else here, apart from that bitch.”

That was true. At close to 200 pounds, Becky was one of the smallest juniors in Buttercombe and when Rachel surveyed her English class, she had to sit down to cover her surprise. The avalanche of fat was staggering. She heard about the youth obesity epidemic but this was another level altogether.

“Uhm, good morning again,” she forced a smile on her face, “my name is Rachel Conrad and as you may know already, I'll be teaching you English this year. We will be…” her stomach chose this moment to remind her she hadn't filled it since that sweet binge yesterday. And the wave of laughter which followed assured her it could be heard by the whole class.

Rachel's cheeks coloured a little. “Sorry, class, I haven't yet had breakfast today but let's get back… Yes?” A student was frantically waving her hand.

“Would you like my honey cake, Ms. Conrad?” Not waiting for an answer, Evie walked to the teacher's desk, her potbelly quivering, and placed an enticing brown cake there.

“Uh, thank you…”

“Evie Littleton, Ms. Conrad. Please enjoy.” And she sat back with a satisfied smile, watching her teacher.

“Brown-nosing to your teacher already, Evie?”

“Eh? Just giving her what she needs, Becky. Can you imagine skipping breakfast? I'd die of hunger. And look at how small she is! Besides, the sooner she adjusts to Buttercombe, the better for us, right?”

Becky thought about it a little, then she rose too. „Ms. Conrad? I have cupcakes here, would you like some?“ and she put the entire package on the teacher's table. A third girl offered her cream puffs and in a short time there wasn't any free space left.

Another student raised her hand. “Would you like me to bring you coffee, Ms. Conrad?” Rachel hesitated. It seemed wrong to be using her students as her personal slaves – especially students the size of this girl. “Or Yeng Cola? The cakes must be horribly dry without anything to drink.”

If she insists so much… “Latte macchiato then, please.” Rachel watched her student manoeuvre her expansive backside between school desks. She didn't miss that other students took her eating as an unspoken permission to open their own stashes, nor the fact that most of them had trouble fitting in their desks. She did miss, however, that while observing her hand unwrapped another cupcake and stuffed it into her mouth.

The big blonde student was back faster than she expected. Rachel gulped down half her latte before going back to her duties. “Anyway, we'll be delving into A Midsummer Night’s Dream later today but first I'd like to learn a bit more about you. Maybe you can start?” she pointed at the helpful blonde.

“Umm, eh, my name's Lizzie Thompson, and, uh, my hobbies are…”

“I wonder how much teaching she'll do today. And how much eating,” Becky whispered maliciously to her friend.

***


Unknown to both juniors, their teacher was the subject of a similar debate several hundred yards away. “I'm getting some strange vibes from that girl. She's certainly not as ditzy as she makes it seem.” The vice principal swivelled in her chair away from her visitor to a bank of monitors showing the feed from dozens of cameras throughout the school.

“Well, it seems to me she's learned that her 'dumb blonde' pose gets her further faster than if she let on how bright she actually is. Oh, minus the blond part, sure, I know Rachel's a brunette,” dr. Schwartz corrected herself. “But otherwise I didn't find her any less susceptible to our products than any other newcomer.”

Fukuda scowled at the monitors. “She didn't eat her fill at the cafeteria yesterday and today she hasn't shown there at all! The only new teacher not to do so.”

“True, but when I left her cabin yesterday, she's been properly stuffed on our welcome basket,” Helen chuckled. “The poor thing let her subconscious run wild while she struggled with my questions. She overate so much she had trouble breathing. Rachel has to be a repressed glutton. I wonder how long it will take us to break her willpower down, want to bet?”

If it was supposed to placate the fearsome woman, it didn't quite work that way. Fukuda scowled again, for a quite different reason, “And I haven't seen it. Oh, how I wish they let us keep cameras in private rooms!”

“But she is supposed to be wrapping up her first lesson now and we do have cameras there. Why not put her on and see how she's doing? And tune up the volume, please, I'm interested too.”

“Good idea. Let me see, room 2A23… There she is.” Fukuda swivelled the camera and focused it on the teacher. “Oh. Oh, my.”

The display showed a table half-filled with snacks, the subject of their discussion was just throwing away another empty wrapper before saying: “That's it for today, class. Next time we'll start with A Midsummer Night’s Dream so have a look at the First Act, please.” And then, as students slowly filed out, both women watched Rachel stifle a groan and caress her overfed middle.

“See? She's shaping up nicely. I'll pay some… special attention to her and I'm sure she'll come round. Now let's tick Ms. Conrad off and move to the freshmen. There are some well-known names, scions of our top families, among them, but I'm most interested in her.” Helen scrolled to a photo on her Y-Pad. “Ring a bell?”

“Oh, is that the youngest Black? What is her name?”

“Hunter. 'Tis her indeed.”

“Playing your games again?”

“I'll have you know that I'm not. She got the scholarship purely on her own merit. I wonder how far she may develop under our… tutelage.”

Rachel wakes up, hours later, by the sound of her phone ringing.
While she sleeps, Rachel is being watched.
111312223133.content:
The class scheduling at Buttercombe Academy followed the traditional "period" system, rather than the more modern "blocking". It made sense, given the remote location of the school and its heightened focus in academia, to follow a more rigorous scheduling system. Seven hour-long periods a day with two lunch periods was more intense than a four two hour blocks with only one lunch. Out of the seven open periods, five of them were dedicated to classtime while two of them were "free" periods, meant for her to catch up with grading her students' assignments. And despite the fact that many of the students who migrated from public school to this ritzy, out-of-the-way academy, Rachel could say with plenty of confidence that this scheduling system would put far more stress on the teachers than the students.

The front door to her cabin clicked open as she trudged inside, lugging a full satchel that bore heavily on her right shoulder. The first day and she was already supposed to grade quizzes—short quizzes mind you, but at thirty heads a class and five courses a day, that was 150 quizzes to grade before the next few days were over! It was already Monday, and the mock schedules she'd designed for her lesson plan called for her to be done with all of these by Wednesday...

Although, truthfully, that wasn't the biggest source of Rachel's discomfort.

The poor teacher plopped down on her couch for the first time since she'd moved in, immediately undoing the clasp on her skirt and allowing her bloated stomach to surge forward. Those snacks in her first period had only been the beginning! Was it a tradition to feed new teachers around here until they popped? Her girls were giving her crap left and right, the teachers and that welcome party... Rachel had to take it home! It was still out in her golf cart, waiting for her to come pick it up. Bags of off-brand imitations of old favorites, all packaged in that generic white labeling...

Uuugh... she didn't even want to think about food right now.

"I'm never going to get anything done around here." she groaned distastefully, "If I'm ever gonna—"

Rachel paused momentarily. She hadn't yet discovered any listening devices planted in her cabin. But in her weary state, she reasoned that she would have found any that they'd bugged her with by now. After tearing her cabin apart within the first hour, surely she was clean. Even still, she probably shouldn't just out and out say that she was investigating, should she? Bugs or not, someone could be listening...

"Get any work done." she added carefully, leaning her head onto the armrest, "Not if this place keeps feeding me like this."

Her hands came to rest on her turgid stomach, squelching and smacking as it struggled to digest her first three classes' worth of dietary slip-ups and an unexpectedly hardy lunch. Rachel hadn't pigged out this much in years.

"This place is dangerous." Rachel said quietly, referring more to the dietary temptations that lurked everpresent at every corner rather than her actual suspicions with Yeng Corp, "All the more reason to..."

Rachel's eyelids grew heavy.

"Reason to..." her mind grew foggy, slowly drifting... drifting...

"Zzz..."
111312223133.title: Sleeping on the Job

choices: Rachel has another late night of doing paperwork. She misses breakfast again!
Rachel does some snooping—Gia's right, she has a job to do!
1113122231332.content:
Rachel was awoken, several hours later, by the sound of her phone ringing.

Not her cell phone, and not the antiquated butter-cream landline that had been installed in her cabin for inter-faculty communication. Instead it was a tiny, sharp sound that Rachel was unfamiliar with. Her "work" phone—a burner that she'd been given just before she took this assignment. It was entirely off the grid, more or less untraceable. No contacts, no wallpapers, and unfortunately no less horrible options for a ringtone.

Rachel rocked herself back to a standing position, the swelling in her stomach having receded. She still felt rather heavy, a side-effect from eating all that junk, for sure. A gross burp burned her nostrils as she lumbered around her cabin, trying to find the source of that god-awful noise. Surely she could at least change it to something a little less terrible? She'd have to ask—

"Gia?" Rachel mumbled, still half-asleep, "Wh'time is it?"

"9 'o' clock, Rach." a husky voice, smooth as whisky purred into the earpiece, "You weren't asleep, were you?"

Gia Rossellini had been Rachel's contact since she had gone into journalism. Gia specialized in information—she used to be a cop, as Rachel understood it—and had a special talent for keeping her ear to the ground. Rachel hadn't gone undercover much before taking this assignment, and especially not for an indefinite period of time like this one. Gia was her one link to the outside world—no one else knew that she was here. At least, not in this capacity.

"I... might have been." Rachel admitted, "Took a little nap."

"Uh-huh. Have you made any headway over there?"

"Not yet, no." Rachel made a face. Jesus, it was only her first day. Cut her some slack! "But I gotta tell you Gia, it's really weird up here."

"I'll bet." Gia said with a little laugh, "What's going on?"

And so Rachel told her about everything that she'd seen so far. About the mandatory medical checkups. The reception blocking. The weird little bracelets and "Group B"—whatever the hell that was. All of the food and all of the fat; Rachel went into great detail about how chubby some of these girls were.

"Kids are getting fatter every year, Rach." Gia said dismissively on the other end of the line, "Let's just make sure they're not being brainwashed by all this Yeng stuff—anything about the technology you've seen?"

"Yeah, it's all Yeng." Rachel lowered her voice a bit, covering her speaker with a cupped hand, "Watanagashi, Himatsubushi, Yoigoshi... shell corporations like that, mostly. But—"

"That's great." Gia said, Rachel could practically see her smiling, "That's a big step forward. See if you can snag some pictures."

"Okay." Rachel looked around cautiously, "I've... I've got to go. I've got a lot of paperwork to catch up on."

"Good idea—can't have anyone think you're anything less than what I put on your transcript." Gia paused for a bit. At first, Rachel thought that she was pleased with herself, pulling together such a convincing CV like that with all the references to back it up. But when her voice came back on the line, it sounded much more serious.

"Even still, I'm going to need you to do some legwork." she said flatly, "Don't get so caught up playing teacher that you forget why you're there—someone's got to take these people down."

And with that, the line clicked. Gia hung up on an awfully cryptic note, and suddenly Rachel realized just how alone she felt in the dark.
1113122231332.title: Alone in the Dark
