"Okay, but don't tell Dr. Hinamizawa." Score! Rachel can go where she pleases!
11131222313322.content:
The Buttercombe Academy campus was as spacious and vast as one might expect of a prestigious school. With Yeng's support, the campus had slowly spread further out and down the mountainous area that once only a single building had claimed. The Masters building for Humanities & Performing Arts had been built to the east, whereas the Vandergriff building for Science & Business Studies had been constructed a little further down to the west past a slight incline, and the main building had been relegated to General Education courses, standing proud and tall where it always had. Each one was stocked with their own cafeterias, computer labs, plenty of wiggle room...

This was hardly a high school campus at all! By the size of it, Rachel would have guessed it was an especially mountainous university. The need for these golf carts was ever-present, and nothing proved it like trying to trek this spacious purgatory without one. Shunted off behind the main building was the athletic area... there was even more to this place that she'd have to work out!

The moon hung high over the courtyard, half-wax. The streetlamps that lit the pavement had gone out—it was just past midnight, and curfew was in effect.

With some sleep under her belt, Rachel was very ready to get some sleuthing done. She'd stake out one location tonight for maybe an hour or two before heading home and getting a couple of hours to keep her sharp. She wasn't going to get anything done if she couldn't balance out her life as Rachel the Teacher and Rachel the Reporter.

Dressed in her classroom clothes, Rachel felt that she fit the bill. She really was a teacher here, even if her credentials had been falsified. Suddenly the amber-colored boggle that hung slightly off of her wrist didn't seem so useless after all. But despite her confidence and the cover story that she'd concocted—a new teacher who had left her thumb drive in the building and needed urgently to get it back before class tomorrow!—her pace was still too quick to blend in seamlessly around here. Her flats clicked slightly against the pavement as she walked stiff-legged towards the central courtyard...

With no students around, this should be easy.

"Hey!" a voice called out suddenly. It was rough and commanding—not like anyone she'd met at this school so far, "Stop where you are!"

This campus had security?

This campus had security. Of course it did.

A white golf cart with mustard-yellow decals whirred up out of the ether, marked ADMINISTRATIVE SECURITY. Inside the cockpit was this fat, round-bellied woman stuffed into a white and cream-colored uniform. Her huge gut had been tucked into her mile-wide khakis to contend with an even spread of saddlebag thighs and big bulging booty, and it still lapped over her belt-line. Her caramel colored skin made the white of her uniform stand out all that much more intensely. Poor guard looked like an ice cream cone!

"What do you think you're doing out here, ma'am?" the woman commanded, parking the cart in front of her and shining the headlights, "It is well past curfew."

That shit was for the teachers too? What the hell, Gia?!

"I... I left my thumb drive..." Rachel winced at the intensity of the LED headlamps, "Can you... turn those off?"

"Nuh uh." the guard said petulantly, "Are you a teacher here?"

"Y-Yeah." Rachel shielded her eyes while she reached into her satchel

She pulled out the ID that Ms. Hinamizawa had given her. It was a pretty fancy number for just an identification badge. Three separate holograms, a special identification code for no less than three on-campus services (what those were beyond the cafeteria, Rachel had no idea) as well as her picture and start date. She braved the brights of her interloping guard and handed her the little laminated thing. She looked at it for a moment before running it through a reader built into her golf cart.

"You're new here." she said, rather than asked, "They didn't tell you about the Lyme disease thing?"

Rachel thought back to her ride with Dr. Schwartz the night before.

"Uh... no?" Rachel smiled, "Look, I just... you're right, I'm new here and I left my thumb drive in my classroom and I really need to go get it, sooo—"

"Mm-hmm." the guard pursed her full lips, "I can't let you do that, Mrs. Conrad. It's not safe. And it's past curfew."

Shit. Shitshitshit. This wasn't good. How was she ever going to get any investigating done if there was a curfew in effect? Fuck, more than that, how was she ever going to get anyone to trust her if she got a reputation as someone who snuck out in the middle of the night? Ohh there had to be a way out of this somehow.

"Look, I... I just got this job." Rachel smiled weakly, hoping that the large woman would take pity on her, "I-I didn't know that there was a curfew o-or a Lyme Disease... whatever. I just... I really like this job. Can you make an exception for me? Just this once?"

Rachel took a cursory glance at the Guard's swollen right breast. Dangling there like a bug on a gourd was her name badge. Rio Ayala.

"Rio?" she quickly added, "I'd really appreciate it

The great big guard cupped the hang of her second chin for a moment before saying...
11131222313322.title: Late Night Walks

choices: Rachel finds something very, very troubling in her search...
Rachel finds something... but whether its important or not, who knows?
Rachel turns up diddly squat. She only had fifteen minutes, what do you expect?
111312223133222.content:
"Which building you going to?" Rio said with a resigned sigh, "I'll drive you. Can't have you getting sick because I didn't do my job."

Yes! Rachel had managed to turn this around! It wasn't her ideal way to get around campus, given that she'd just picked up a super-sized chaperone, but it was better than being turned away. She figured that, using this "new and confused teacher" bit, she might be able to squeeze at least twenty minutes out of a good snooping session.

"The main building." Rachel said with a smile, "Thank you so much."

"Yeah yeah." the cart-crushing guard smacked the small space between her and the passenger side door, "Hop in."

***


The ride from the teacher cabins to the main building wasn't very long. Rachel lived in one of the older ones that had been built when the school was much smaller, so they were relatively closer to the campus. That being said, what should have been a five minute puttering down the sidewalks felt like it was lasting forever—Rachel's heart was pounding like a jackhammer. Her anxiety was running her ragged and she felt so... cramped in this stupid cart!

"So the main building." Rio continued in a placid tone, "They got those coffee cakes in the vending machines there?"

This fat cow was even bigger in the hips than she was in the belly—Rachel's skinny shape was literally pressed into the passenger side door! It wasn't like she could be rude to the woman who was breaking protocol and giving her a lift in the dead of night, but couldn't she have at least offered her the back seat? No way this woman didn't know that no one would be able to sit next to her up front!

"I-I'm sorry?" Rachel did her best to not make her wincing noticeable

"Yeah, they got different snacks in different buildings." Rio drove with one hand on the wheel and one hand on her gut—caramel-colored diamonds of flesh eeked through her uniform, upon closer inspection—"The Griff doesn't have 'em and that's my usual route. Ugh, I'm hooked on those things."

And a lot of other things, apparently. Rio's golf cart was littered with discarded snack wrappers and cellophane plastic. They crinkled whenever Rachel moved her feet. No guess where that gut came from. Rio must have seen Rachel surveying the damage, because she let out a little snort.

"Yeah, don't ever quit smoking—if it ain't one thing, its another" the huge woman joked with a slosh of her stomach, "Am I right?"

"I... think so?" Rachel smiled awkwardly. Anything that could get her to get there faster, "Do you want me to check while I'm in there?"

"Would you?" Rio smiled, "I'd really appreciate it."

Rachel retreated inwardly. One night? Did Rio just say she'd eaten all this since she went on duty? That was insane. What was it with this place and food? Something had to be up. Gia might not have wanted to listen, but Rachel had seen too many snacks today to completely wipe something dietary off of the table. Yeng's tech and its shell companies were the main concern, but someone might want to seriously consider looking into all this junk they were peddling to everyone on campus...

By the time the reached the main building, Rachel felt like she was ready to pop out of the cart. She opened the door and almost fell to the pavement as Rio's avalanche of ass fat settled back into its rightful place.

"You got fifteen minutes." Rio warned, "If I don't report back every thirty minutes, I get a call on my comm, and then I've gotta report you."

Rachel gulped. Fifteen minutes? That's half the time that she was expecting to have. And she still didn't know this place all that well yet...

"You got it." Rachel smiled, "Fifteen minutes. I can do that."

Jesus this place had a lot of security regulations. Just what was going on here that was so important that they needed regular security check-ups with the guards? With Rio it at least probably kept her from stuffing herself until she was entirely too big for her cart, but just how many guards were there on campus? And why have a steady patrol at night? Something didn't add up here, and Rachel was starting to get more suspicious than ever...

"And don't forget my coffee cakes!" Rio whisper-yelled to the door, "Or I'll report you anyway, newbie!"
111312223133222.title: Riding with Rio and her Junk in the Trunk

choices: Rachel spends the next few days asking around about the drive
Rachel gets called into the VP's office regarding her curfew violation
1113122231332222.content:
Fifteen minutes. Fifteen Minutes! Whoever heard of groundbreaking investigative journalism getting done in fifteen minutes? Rachel had to get enough damning evidence on this place to bring down an entire megacorporation—and Rio the Rent-a-Cop needed to get back to her post in fifteen minutes! This whole night had been a bust, absolutely unbelievable. First she'd fallen asleep then she'd had to tell Gia that she hadn't found anything and she knew that good journalism took time but...

This whole place was creeping her out! Especially now, at night, with no one else in the building! Her footsteps echoed throughout the empty hallways, up into the staircases. Not a soul was in sight, and if they were, they would surely have heard her cussing under her breath.

Fifteen minutes—unbelievable!

She knew that there were cameras in the building, she just wasn't sure where. They didn't exactly make them so that they stood out anymore. They were seamlessly built into the ceiling tiles of this old school. She had to at least look like she was a lost teacher, just like she did at her cabin. Take every precaution.

She slid her bracelet along the electronic lock to her classroom door. A soft metallic ping and the tumbler falling sounded her in. She turned the knob and stepped inside. Fifteen minutes, fifteen minutes. The walk back to the door was five! She just should have stayed home tonight. Gotten breakfast, unlike yesterday. Not have skulked around campus like a crazy person. This whole night had been a waste, and she felt like such an idiot...

Until, of course, she looked at her desk.

Looking at her desktop computer, a thumb drive was sticking out of the USB port. Rachel might have left in a hurry (for fear of getting any more stuffed by her students and fellow teachers!) but she definitely remembered taking her drive out when she left. Even if she hadn't, it wouldn't have mattered. There was nothing incriminating on the drive, nothing that would link back to any investigation—it was where she had decided to keep her lesson plans instead of lugging around her (very incriminating) laptop from cabin to class.

So why, then, was there a flash drive sticking out of her monitor?

It was the generic kind that they gave out to everyone at orientation. 32GB was enough to hold anything a teacher or student needed for quite a while, and it had come in the yellow and white color scheme that had become synonymous with Yeng and Buttercombe's union. It very well could have been hers (she'd probably tell Rio that it was hers, if she had to prove that she found it) but it most definitely wasn't.

Someone had come in after she'd locked up the classroom and plugged this into her desktop.

Taking the computer out of sleep mode revealed that there was nothing on the drive. Not even the orientation PDFs that had been included when Rachel had gotten hers. No recent files listed in her directory, either. It didn't look like anyone had taken anything from her computer or transferred anything over... so why was it just there? Could it have been one of the girls? No, she would have noticed something like that. Besides, a lot of her girls were too big not to notice coming up to her desk...

A sharp electronic beeping made her nearly wet her panties—the timer that she'd set was going off. She'd better start making her way back to Rio, or she'd get reported...

After, of course, she stopped at the vending machine.

***


"You remembered!" Rio said with more passion and energy than she had said anything else since midnight, "And you got me so much—you're such a sweetheart!"

The blobby guard squealed like the happiest little piggy on campus as she wolfed down her favorite treat. They came three to a package and Rachel had gotten four. Hopefully that would dissuade her from ratting her out. Not that Rio seemed like the kind of person to do that anyway. She'd been nice and helped her out when she needed it. But Rachel couldn't trust anyone. Especially not someone wearing a bright white uniform around here.

"Want me to give you a ride back to your cabin?" Rio asked, dark brown crumbs sprinkling her chin and cleavage, "It's the least I can do."

"Aren't you already doing me a favor?" Rachel raised an eyebrow, "By not ratting me out?"

"Yeah, but you helped me get my fix." Rio snickered, tummy trembling in delight beneath her drum-tight uniform, "Hop in and I'll take you back."

Rachel had wisely climbed in the backseat this time. Rio's monster ass was so big and awkward, it was no wonder Rachel hadn't seen that woman leave her cart yet. It was probably a hassle to get all of that in and out like everyone else. The ride was much smoother, and the grumpy guard seemed to be in a much better mood with her favorite snacks on board. But despite the relative ease of this ride as opposed to the last one, physically and emotionally, Rachel spent the whole ride back to her cabin white-knuckling the thumb drive that she'd found plugged into her computer.

Luckily, Rio was far too preoccupied to ask her about what she was holding.

As they pulled back up to Rachel's cabin, the cart came to a lurching halt. Rachel climbed out of the backseat and walked back towards the front, quickly throwing the drive into her purse.

"Thank you again, Rio." Rachel said with her best reporter's smile, "You're a life-saver."

"Don't think anything of it, ma'am." Rio's round cheeks dimpled with a smile, "Everyone needs a little help sometimes."

That was when an idea struck her. One that might help her out on two fronts. Rachel held up a finger and asked Rio to wait in the little mock-driveway created for her cabin for just a moment. The large Latina didn't have time to mutter about the timeframe she was on before Rachel came back from her parked cart carrying a literal bag full of snacks.

"I'm never going to eat all of this." Rachel said sheepishly, "I lose my stuff a lot and... do you think... maybe... I can call you next time I lose my drive? I really like it here and... I don't want to get in trouble."

Rio's piggy eyes were bulging out of their sockets. The great big guard, sandwiched into her cart by her girth, was practically leaning out of the driver's side door to get them before Rachel handed them over! She did her best to hide it, but anyone could have seen that Rachel had touched a very hungry nerve with Rio the Rent-a-Cop. Even still... she had a job to do.

"I, uh... I guess that'd be okay." Rio smacked her lips as she lowered the sack of snacks into the already half-filled passenger seat, next to her ample right ass cheek, "Just, uh... don't make it a habit."

Rachel waved goodbye as Rio sped off, already wrist-deep in the sack of snacks that Rachel's students had given her. And once she was sure that Rio was out of sight, she took the drive out of her purse and gave it another look.

What was going on at Buttercombe Academy, and how did it involve her?
1113122231332222.title: Unfamiliar Drive

choices: Rachel gets another phone call from Gia.
Rachel discovers the owner of the drive!
Rachel starts getting a lot of weird attention...
11131222313322221.content:
The rest of Rachel's first week at her new job had been more or less mundane. At least, as far as "mundane" could take you when you were a reporter pretending to be a teacher.

Tuesday morning, the first thing that she did was ask her girls about the drive. It wasn't anything criminal, and no one was going to get into trouble. But the more that she could count out whose it wasn't, the better idea she could get of whose it was. None of the girls in any of her five classes had any idea whose drive it was. The fact that it was empty was a fact that Rachel kept for herself—that little tidbit of information was only important to her as it was to the person who emptied it.

"Maybe you left it?" Lizzie Thompson raised a wide wobbling arm, her belly cutting into the desk as she arched her back to be better seen, "I know I left mine in the computer lab one year and had to walk all the way back to get it after lunch!"

Murmuring filled the classroom. Some in agreement of Lizzie's statement, some making fun of the poor fat thing (she was easily one of the bigger girls that Rachel had to deal with). It didn't seem to be anyone's, and it wasn't some elaborate prank on her. So that ruled out her students.

"Why would my flash drive be in your computer?" Brooke Smith laughed as she scooped up a hearty helping of ketchup with cafeteria fries, "Rachel, I don't even know what hall you're on."

That made sense. It was stupid to even ask her, but you never know. This drive seemed to just appear out of nowhere, and the fact that it wound up in her computer just a few hours after she'd been talking to Gia (in a very hushed tone!) about some of the weird crap that went on in this school sent all of Rachel's red flags firing.

Sure it could have been a coincidence. But given her precarious predicament, Rachel would rather be safe than sorry.

This added stress, combined with her day job of teaching these porky princesses about a subject she honestly couldn't have cared less about, was really getting to her. Luckily Buttercombe Academy thought of everything, apparently. There was a neat little White Noise program that helped her get through her free periods stress-free. She'd listen to it whenever she ate lunch in her classroom or when she was grading papers—she liked it so much she'd started taking it home to drown out the emptiness of her cabin. Helped her sleep, too!

With all the stress of running this place, no wonder some of the other teachers were on the bigger side. Ms. Polluck ran a tight shift, and seven periods meant a lot of work for anyone who wanted to live up to "Buttercombe Excellence" (whatever that meant). Rachel had found a lot of use in that little amber bracelet.

"Oh, Group B is just your assigned group." Nurse Fukiyama said over lunch one day, "Teachers and faculty are all Group B, students are Group C, and administration are Group A. It handles things like the door locks, overriding equipment—"

"The vending machines." Rachel said with a bite out of her chicken sandwich, "Don't forget those."

"How can I?" Shiro said derisively, "They're everywhere. Anyway, there are a few other things that determine what your bracelet does, like if you're on SSS or not or if you're a substitute teacher, but for the most part it's pretty straightforward.

One thing was for sure; even if her week had been mundane, Rachel had spent an awful lot of it eating. That was pretty much all there was to do in this stupid place! It wasn't like they were close enough to go to town or go out to a bar. Not without "permission" first. Honestly, they corralled these women like they were cattle! And fed them about as much too...

Rachel came home more nights than she would have liked to admit and just collapsed on her couch, stuffed to the brim. She didn't feel like she was eating so much when she was out and about doing her routine, but every night she came home stuffed to the gills! She needed to get a hold of herself of she was going to wind up like that security guard Rio!

Rachel cringed at the thought of being that overweight. An image of herself, round as a ball, getting rolled to and from her classes made her visibly uncomfortable.

The more work she did on this Yeng investigation, the less likely that was to happen...
11131222313322221.title: The Rest of the Week

choices: A few days later, Rachel is snooping around again. This time in daylight.
A few weeks later, & Buttercombe is starting to get to Rachel and her waistline!
A full month later and she hasn't heard from Gia, something's up...
111312223133222211.content:
It was midway through her second week of "teaching" when Rachel received another call from Gia.

Like always, it was at night. It was easier to contact Rachel when Gia knew that she would have the cabin to herself, so calling any where from nine to ten 'o' clock was a sound bet. And it made sense to someone who didn't have to get up and teach a course at eight in the morning after making sure she had enough time to get ready, eat breakfast, go over her notes, get her lesson ready, and all of the other work that Rachel had taken on when she had agreed to go undercover.

"Coming!" Rachel hollered at the phone as it filled the cabin with it's awful tune, "Coming coming coming!"

Rachel had been sound asleep. She either didn't get any sleep lately, or she got too much. The woes of an irregular sleeping schedule. All her sleuthing had really messed with her shut-eye, and getting filled up with food every night wasn't doing her any favors either. She'd been eating like crap for more than a week now, and Rachel felt more sluggish than ever.

"Hey Gia." Rachel gasped after her mad dash to the phone in her bedroom, "What's, uh... what's up?"

"Sleeping on the job again?" Gia asked derisively

"Definitely not. I was actually..." Rachel gulped, "Just about to call you!"

"Sure you were." she could practically hear Gia's eyes roll, "Any updates on our special project?"

The sad fact of the matter was that... no, there weren't. Not for a lack of trying. After that night with Rio, Rachel had been scared straight for about three days before trying again. The next time she went into the main building she had ventured into some of the other classrooms and come up with nothing. She was going to have to find a way to get Rio to let her be by herself so she could go look into some of the other buildings. The Vandergriff or the Masters would surely have something else. Or even the administrative offices. Rachel didn't doubt that she couldn't get Rio to look the other way for some more snacks. It wasn't like she needed them...

But she couldn't tell Gia that. As hard-nosed as she could be, Gia was dead set on bringing this corporation down from the inside. Almost two weeks of "legwork" and nothing to show for it? Gia would be pissed! But at the same time, she didn't really have anything substantial to give her, other than her already-ignored opinions on the food and the mysterious flash drive that had appeared in her office that night.

"Kind've. I, uh... I've got a story for you."

So Rachel told her contact about everything that had happened. About the curfew and the "outbreak" that had kept everyone from walking around at night. Not a lot of legwork to be done when your butt either had to be in your cabin or in a cart, and only before 10pm.

"This flash drive was just there, Gia." Rachel held it in her hands, as if she were showing it to the woman hundreds of miles away, "A few hours after I got off of the phone with you."

"You think your cabin's been bugged?" Gia asked in a serious voice

"I don't think so—I would have found it by now." Rachel looked around for verification, "I've been tearing this place apart whenever I get the chance and the only computer I use is my laptop, but I brought that from home..."

"Keep looking." Gia commanded, "So what's on the drive?"

"Nothing! That's what's so weird!" Rachel almost flung it across the room waving her arms around, "Like, it's one everyone got, but it doesn't have anything on it. No school legislature, student handbook... nothing!"

"That's a long shot." the older woman growled, "But you said it was in your office later that night? You're sure it's not yours?"

"One hundred percent."

"Alright, send it over and I'll analyze it for thumbprints; residual data, hidden files, maybe even some fingerprints." she concluded, "Send it to my PO and I'll get someone to take a look at it for you. I don't know how long it'll take, but keep looking."

***


Sending anything out of this place was fucking ridiculous.

First thing's first, as Rachel found out from the guard (guard!) who worked the on-campus postal service, if you've ever been in serious trouble on campus you are not allowed to send or receive packages. Envelopes are fine, but they have to be weighed. Then, for all those who weren't suspicious characters, you weren't allowed to send anything over a certain size without written permission from at least one faculty member. If you were a faculty member, you needed a co-signer. No Amazon side-hustling on campus, apparently. This place was beautiful and full of incentive to go here, but once you were enrolled (or taught there!) you might as well have been in a gilded prison camp!

Rachel swiped her bracelet over the pinpad, charging her the $3.75 for postage and five dollars even for the box that she'd had to buy. She had to have something else to send to Gia—she couldn't just send a thumb drive. That would look way too suspicious.

Gia might not have thought that the food was worth looking into, but Rachel still wasn't convinced. She'd bought a good bit of snacks that could survive the trip over and tucked them neatly into the box with a note that said CHECK THESE OUT in big curly-cue sharpie. That was innocent enough, right? If anyone asked, her friend Gia was a junk food enthusiast, and Rachel just had to share how great the snacks here were. There was nothing wrong with that, right?

And when she was sure nobody was looking, Rachel slid the thumb drive underneath one of the inner flaps of the box.

If there was anything on that thumb drive, Gia would find out.

And in the meantime, Rachel could continue her investigation.
111312223133222211.title: Snail Mail

choices: Rachel's phone goes off before she can make her exit...
Rachel heads out for a jog—don't worry, she's not very good at it.
Rachel runs into another teacher, who coerces her into lunch.
1113122231332222112.content:
The rest of Rachel's first month passed rather uneventfully. The most excitement that she'd felt was that night in her classroom after hours; everything else was about as hum-drum as could be.

The days passed, turning into weeks, as the sleepy mountain campus puttered along its existence. It was almost scary how quickly time could pass here. You fall into a schedule—a dull routine that buzzes in the back of your mind until you barely notice its there anymore. It was October before Rachel realized it, and she hadn't made much more progress in four weeks than she had in two days.

Not that her job was her biggest concern at this point.

"Oh Goddddd..." Rachel cupped the sides of her squishy stomach that bulged over the wasitband of her leggings, "This cannot be happeningggggg..."

All there was to do in this stupid place was eat! Meeting with teachers was always done over breakfast, then there were the big lunches and the faculty dinners. Her classroom was right outside of a vending machine so she had to look at that stupid Yeng-peddling screen all day whenever she sat at her desk. Which she did a lot because she had so much actual work to do that she couldn't keep her assignment straight! Then when she got home, she'd signed up for this meal delivery service because on the long list of things she could do cooking wasn't one of them and—UGH!

This job sucked.

Rachel looked at herself in the full-body mirror that hung on the back of her cabin's bathroom wall. Twenty pounds in a month. Was that even possible? Even with how much she ate, twenty pounds in a month shouldn't have been possible. For God's sake she had lovehandles! This job was going to be the absolute death of her...

"Or at least my figure." she curled a nose distastefully as she raised her arms and slipped into a t-shirt, "If I don't do something about it."

It was a Saturday morning, and the sleepy campus was about as lifeless as ever. Most of the students, as well as her fellow teachers, were getting lunch in the cafeterias around the school. And while Rachel would have absolutely loved to indulge herself in some of the rich foods and desserts that were made so readily available to anyone with an ID card, her bra was pinching pretty tight as it was now. Another day stuffing her face wasn't going to magically make her figure shrink...

That's why she was going to go on a jog. She'd never done it before, because she'd never really had to. She'd always had a naturally fast metabolism that had helped her stay skinny well into her twenties until now. But desperate times called for desperate measures, she supposed—jogging was an easy, efficient way of keeping her weight down without raising too much attention now that the "Lyme Disease" outbreak had officially been forgotten about.

She could at least move around campus on foot now, even if it was only during the daylight.

"Not today, fatso." Rachel pinched her chubby belly, "Gotta work off some of these pounds before I start blending in a little too well..."
1113122231332222112.title: Fitting In, Filling Out

choices: Yeng—what's the deal with them funding so much of the school?
Campus—anything "strange" going on around that she could share?
Fat—why is there such a high on-site obesity rate?
11131222313322221123.content:
Rachel ran her wristband over her cabin's digital lock, the tumbler falling audibly into place as she turned. The weather wasn't great, and it had started to get much colder as the Fall weather set in. October wasn't the ideal time to exercise, but the chunk on her butt wasn't going to wait until the weather got warm. Rachel wasn't about to let herself get sloppy; she had to make sure she was camera ready in case this assignment didn't get wrapped up as soon as she would have liked...

Even still, it was an especially chilly day. Goosebumps ran up and down her arms, her hair standing on end. Something about seeing a wide open campus like this, almost devoid of life, made her uneasy. Even still, it was the first steps of her first actual exercise session in God knew how long.

Nestling her cordless headphones into the small of her ears, old-school Hillary Heart was jamming out before she took her first steps. She had barely gotten out of her driveway, her back turned towards the cabin, when one of the golf carts that drove around campus like slot cars slowed its pace to ride behind her.

"Rach!" a familiar voice called out over the sound of her music, "Hey Rachel, where're ya going?!"

Rachel stopped and turned as soon as she realized that she was being hailed—no easy feat, considering how loud she kept the music. The white golf cart puttering behind, then beside her carried the sizeable cargo that was Ms. Megan Porter. She was an Arts & English teacher that taught down the hall from two to five in the afternoon, and was the unofficial welcoming wagon for new teachers along that wing in the main building. Rachel hadn't really had much of a choice in their friendship, but Megan was good people.

"Hey, Megan!" her enthusiasm was genuine, the instant relief of putting off her exercise sent a quiet euphoria that widened her smile, "I'm just headed out for the day."

"Well the cafeteria's that way!" Megan jammed a sausage thumb to the main building, her quivering mass of titflesh wobbled accordingly beneath her too-tight black sweater, "You gonna go see the girls in the Masters?"

"No, I..." Rachel gulped. Why was "exercise" such a dirty word around here, anyway, "I was actually going for a jog."

"Well you can't exercise on an empty stomach." Megan said as if it were the simplest thing in the world, "C'mon, climb in and I'll give you a lift!"

Putting aside her quiet unwillingness to actually begin her jogging, Rachel wasn't entirely convinced that some face time with Ms. Porter would be a bad thing. Megan Porter was easily one of the longest tenured teachers at the Academy, having taught here for fifteen years. She'd changed hats a couple of times, but besides that feedbag Polluck, Megan was one of the most senior members on staff. Some face-to-face interface would be good for taking notes...

And getting some lunch. Rachel was a little hungry.

"You got me there." the smaller woman smiled as she climbed in back, "Lead the way, Meg."

***


Ms. Porter was not only one of the most tenured teachers on staff, but also one of the largest.

She had to have weighed more than four hundred pounds of busty yuppie blubber—most of it settling in her gargantuan chest. Those mammoth masses that she called mammaries were county-fair sized; their sheer mass was emphasized by her peculiar choice in wearing exclusively sweaters. They were enormous, resting like overripe pumpkins on a sloping stomach that swung side to side when she waddled around campus. Her chin hung low and mushroomed into a smaller third below it that only grew in size whenever she spoke. Or ate.

On weekends, the cafeteria in the main building was closed off to students so that faculty and staff might use it exclusively. It wasn't a popular decision, at least not with the students, but it at least cut down on the number of people who might overhear Rachel asking questions.

And it gave her a chance to get some of the cobbler before those grabby girls could get to it—some of those kids were mean!

"I love the Salisbury steak." Megan said in a thick voice as she lowered a forkful of the stuff into her mouth, chins bulging and tongue lolled, "I love lots of the food here, but this stuff—mm!"

Rachel couldn't disagree. Buttercombe's choice in menu was always top-knotch, and the quality was incomparable. That was, in part, why she had gone up a size or two since she started. And she suspected that it had something to do with Megan's overall girth as she wolfed down her second helping since they'd sat down about ten minutes ago.

"I like the cobbler, myself." Rachel smiled, making conversation as best she could while Megan enjoyed herself, "Probably a little too much."

"I know what you mean." the big busty blonde breathily answered as she savored another mouthful of her lunch, "It's so hard to diet around here."

Rachel thought distastefully back to her belly blubber, or the extra inch that hung from her arms. It certainly was hard to diet in a fat farm like this. The only thing there was to do around here was eat, and every possible need was taken care of by some possibly (probably) malevolent megacorporation. There was literally zero incentive to exercise besides the view, and they had golf-carts for anyone who needed to get around.

"It's always been that way though." Megan continued, "I think I was about as big as you are when I came here."

Rachel grimaced at the thought.

"Yeah? So you've been here..." her reporter's intuition tingling, she guessed that Megan wasn't exactly sensitive about her size, "...a while then, I take it?"

Megan snorted, her fat chins flexing as she smiled.

"Well this doesn't just happen overnight—trust me when I say that, newbie." she pressed into the side of her stomach as it cut into the table, sloshing it with one wide wobbling arm, "But yeah I've been here for a long time."

"So... do you think I could ask you some questions?" Rachel faltered. Can't make this sound too official. She quickly added, "Just about this place. My girls have been asking."

"Shoot." Megan said before filling her jowls with more mashed potatoes.

Rachel should guide the discussion towards...
11131222313322221123.title: Meeting and Eating with an Ample Art Teacher

choices: Rachel investigates the machines—there really are a lot of them!
Rachel decides that she needs to check out the other buildings.
111312223133222211233.content:
Now, maybe it was because of her recent weight gain.

Rachel knew that she should talk to as many people as possible about the Yeng Corporation and its ties to Buttercombe Academy. The official story was that they were simply sponsors for the remote school, but with this much of their tech (or at least, products that could be linked back to them through shell corporations) even someone who wasn't investigating them would think that something was strange. And since Megan Porter had been at the school pre-Yeng, she might be able to shed some light on how it all began.

Rachel knew that she should have definitely asked that.

But ever since she had gotten to this school, fat had been on her brain. A lot of the students were fat. Most of the teachers. And not just average, every day fat. Some of the girls on campus were bigger than Rachel had ever seen with her own two eyes. Sitting in front of her, Megan Porter was easily one of the fattest people that Rachel had ever met! That hog of a headmistress Ms. Polluck was even worse, and there were rumors of some students who were even bigger than the ones that Rachel had seen. Super-sized ones who were placed on the school's disability program, SSS, and shunted away to finish their studies in their dorm rooms.

This wasn't normal. Technology or not, once Rachel had actually gotten onsite, the obesity epidemic on this campus was had caught her attention. Maybe Gia, or her superiors, didn't see it that way. But if they could have seen all four-hundred-plus pounds of Megan porter wolfing down her lunch like her life depended on it, maybe they would change their minds.

"Well you're not gonna make a lot of friends asking questions like that." Megan's tone changed slightly; it was less jovial and a little curt. Rachel feared that she had touched a nerve, "Us big girls can be a little sensitive about our size."

Despite outward appearances, Megan apparently wasn't as secure in her extreme girth as her jokes would have had Rachel believe. Her reporter's skills were sharp, and she could tell that may have cost her a couple of points with her fellow teacher.

"What I mean is..." Rachel took a deep breath, "There are just a lot of... bigger girls here. Is that recent?"

"Nah, most of us porked out the old fashioned way." Megan stabbed at what remained of her steak, "Like you will, if you keep it up."

Megan was right—Rachel might not have realized it, but she'd wolfed down her lunch almost automatically. As soon as they'd sat down, she'd been too distracted by Megan hoovering her food to realize that she was taking pretty big bites herself. The main course was done and she'd been working on her dessert not even twenty minutes into their meeting. Rachel wisely pushed her almost-empty plate away from her, lest she keep chowing down on that cobbler.

"Look, I'm not trying to be mean." she smiled, "It's just... I can't help but notice that there's not a lot to do up here but... well, eat."

The large woman paused and visibly softened her stiffened exterior. Her meaty shoulders slumped and a small smile tugged at the corners of her lips.

"Well... you've got that right at least." she relented, "It gets pretty boring up here."

"And there are vending machines all over the place..."

"That's true." Megan smiled a little wider, "There's one right outside my classroom in the Masters building."

Good—whatever damage Rachel might have made by being so direct about the subject had been at least bandaged. Megan went right back to eating at her regular pace, even if her eye contact was a bit shoddy. Rachel had never stopped to consider how she must feel, getting grilled by someone who was a third... fourth of her current weight, almost. And a new teacher too, she could really ruffle some feathers if she wasn't careful.

"Mine too." Rachel laughed, "What's your favorite?"

"Ugh—like you have to ask." Megan leaned her head back and made a throaty moan, "Those little chocolate cupcakes that come two to a pack. I lovelovelove those."

"I'll have to try some next time." If I can fit into my classroom... man I'm stuffed! "Its weird—seems like everyone has a vending machine near their rooms."

"Right?" Megan leaned in, the pool of her belly gaining ground on the table in front of her as her tits shifted to their new slope, "There's like four or five on every hall."

Rachel's interest piqued—she'd never been above the second floor on the main building, and she'd never so much as ventured into the Vandergriff or the Masters yet. Four or five on every hall? That was at least forty vending machines crammed into each building! Looking at some of the students and teachers, she believed the demand for large amounts of junk food. But packing them full at every angle... something seemed awfully strange about that.

"Really? Oh no! I'm never going to be able to cut back at this rate." Rachel whined, but not without purpose, "Do you think maybe you could tell me where some are in our building? Just so I can avoid them, of course."

And so Megan prattled off an oddly specific list of machines and their locations. There were of course the ones located in the cafeteria of the main building, then the four on the East wing's first floor, the five on the West wing's, and then five on each floor of each wing from there. With the one in the administrative lobby that she had seen when she first set foot on campus and the one just outside of Ms. Polluck's office (big guess as to why) that made 43 vending machines in this building alone!

"Good luck "avoiding" them though." Megan added with a snort, "I swear, some of the stuff in there is so good!"

"Yeah, yeah..." Rachel committed the layout of the machines to memory, "Thanks again, Meg, but I think I'm going to head back to my cabin."

"Oh. You're going to go jog?" Ms. Porter laughed

"No way, I'm way too full." of work to do, "But uh..."

Rachel slid the half-eaten slice of cobbler closer to the massive woman.

"Feel free to have the rest of my cobbler."
111312223133222211233.title: Chewing the Fat with Megan Porter

choices: Rachel begins her investigation—she maps out the machines over a few days
Rachel begins her investigation—but something goes awry!
1113122231332222112331.content:
Rachel started by making a map of the main building. Starting in the atrium that led to the cafeteria and parted on either side to get to the East and West wings, two vending machines were right outside the cafeteria doors. They were bright and colorful, flashing ads detailing the snacks that were inside as well as display critical school news bulletin-style across the top.

They were sleek, monolithic things. Easily taller than any of the students or teachers that frequented them, Yeng's vending machines were towering behemoths that were mostly comprised of an LED touchscreen. You held out your bracelet, activated the vendor, and then selected from a visual display the kind of snack(s, in most cases around here!) that you wanted to purchase. Most of the tab was covered by an extensive grant included in tuition for students, and employment for teachers. But as Rachel understood it, faculty received a discount. Which was probably good, because these things were going to be seeing a lot of her...

She had a nasty hunch that the placement of these things was crucial to their purpose on the school grounds. Every teacher that she'd spoken to seemed to be placed near one of the vending machines, so they got plenty of use from students and teachers (and Rachel, though she was ashamed to admit it!) every hour on the hour. As her venture into the main building after hours proved, they even remained operational after curfew, so that midnight snackers could get their fix. Presumably this counted for the ones placed on the dormitory halls here in the main building, as well as the Polluck and Harrington dorms across the courtyard.

Rachel cursed to herself as she caught the small red glare at the top of the device just outside the cafeteria. There was a camera in each and every one of those things. Because of course there was.

That was going to make this especially painful. She couldn't just walk up to each of the vendors individually. She was going to have to do this smart. Make it look like she wasn't doing much of anything but exploring the campus and stopping for a snack. If there was anything insidious about these things, it was going to take time. A few days, maybe, if she played her cards right.

She wanted exercise, after all.

"You're going to what?" Gia asked incredulously on the other end of the secured line

"I'm going to check these vending machines out and see if there's anything weird about them." Rachel hissed into the receiver, "See if they're... I don't know, hypnotizing these kids into stuffing their faces all day."

"How are you going to do that?" Gia asked, the sound of crinkling plastic filling the earpiece, "Walk up and hit them? I thought I told you to worry about the tech they're peddling onto these kids."

"This is tech." Rachel corrected her informant, "Except instead of tablets and computers, I'm just going to see if they're fucking with these kids subliminally. There's a USB port on every one of them. You gave me that extractor for things just like this, right?"

"I gave you that extractor so you could use it on their central computers." Gia corrected her flatly, pausing for a bit to take a bite of something, "But hey, if you want to use it to knock off a bunch of vending machines, can't say I blame you. This shit's good."

"You... you're eating that stuff?" Rachel groaned, "Gia I told you to check them out!"

"And I did—with my mouth." whatever she'd been eating, she was finished. The crinkling plastic sound was gone. "Look, if this gets you off this weird fixation you have with how fat everyone is up there, I'm okay with it. But after this, no more. You either get me something to go with or you get your head in the game. Deal?"

"Deal." Rachel relented

"And send more of those Apple Pies." Gia said, opening another one, "Y'know they taste just like the shit down at the office? Can't get enough of that shit."
1113122231332222112331.title: These Vending Machines are Very Odd

choices: Rachel has everything that she needs to send to Gia—until her drive goes missing
Rachel has what she needs—except the stats from ONE LAST machine. Dammit!
Rachel's "laissez-faire" attitude towards teaching has attracted some attention.
11131222313322221123311.content:
Over the course of the next few days, Rachel would find herself becoming very acquainted with the layout of the campus.

She'd been given a map when she first signed on to teach, and another during orientation. Due to the size of the school, each building received a pull-out chart that folded into a larger pamphlet, as well as a broader map that covered the rest of the school in less detail. Using the one for the main building, Rachel began to tick off the locations of the vending machines that she already knew—the one outside of her classroom, the two outside of the cafeteria, and the one in the administrative lobby—and set to work on deciphering the rest.

In a school as geared towards gluttony as Buttercombe, it wasn't hard to make excuses as to why she was frequenting the machines so much. With as many as there were, she could make her way towards most of them without much further of a walk than it was to the one right outside her classroom. The problem was often how to approach a particular machine without the camera catching her sticking the data extractor into the barely-visible USB port.

"While you ladies take your quiz, I'm going to run to the vending machine." she would announce to her classes, "Excuse me."

Most of her students ignored her—it wasn't like they hadn't heard of teachers frequenting the machines around here. Others were excited, seeing as their TV-ready teacher was becoming quite the Vending Machine Queen lately. Even if it meant more tests, the more sadistic students were happy to oblige if it meant their modelesque teacher was going to start officially porking out.

Meanwhile, each trip, she'd go to a different machine. She'd slip the drive into the port as inconspicuously as possible, wait for a few minutes while it did its thing, before finally selecting a snack to take back with her. Sometimes it took her more than one or two trips, given the peculiar angles she sometimes had to approach these things with. She'd copy the data on the machine onto the extractor, go back to her classroom, and she'd usually use the treat as a sort of motivator for good behavior.

Usually.

All that walking made a girl hungry.

Pretty soon she'd gotten all of the ones on the East wing's first floor. She couldn't make it look too conspicuous, since her account was surely being tracked even if the camera didn't catch her, so Rachel limited it to once per class and then twice during her free periods. Then came the West wing's first floor, and then she'd started snaking up and down the upper floors.

By the end of the week, there was some talk about Ms. Conrad's frequent absences.

"I hear she's sneaking off to make out with Ms. Smith." one girl snickered an ugly face as she popped off-brand funyuns in her mouth

"No way, she's just pigging out." said another, her belly wobbling, "Have you seen her? She's gonna be as big as Ms. Porter by next semester."

"That doesn't make any sense and is also impossible." said yet another student, "I think she's pregnant."

"How? This is an all-girls' school!"

Rachel's impromptu flights from her classroom meant that these girls were left unattended anywhere from 5 to 30 minutes, with the timespan leaning towards the latter as she ventured further and further away from her classroom. The elevators were slow and she had to allow her device adequate time to mine the programming of each, individual vending machine. If there was something going on, she had to be sure to get a good pool of information. She had to be sure before she sent anything to Gia that wasn't pertaining to what she was convinced she was looking for.

But there was something up with these machines. She just knew it.

"Sorry class, I just... lost track of the time!" Rachel slipped the drive back into her back pocket, which was growing increasingly snug as of late, "Hand in your quizzes and we'll—"

BRRRRRRING

The sound of the class bell filled the room as huffy heifers instinctively began to pack their things. Full bellies and big butts collided as the swollen senior class shuffled awkwardly in a room that was clearly inadequate for housing girls of such peculiar size all together.

"Get back to it tomorrow." Rachel sighed, "Have a nice day, everyone!"

Collapsing back into her chair, Rachel let her head roll back as a weary groan escaped her. All the walking she'd been doing lately had been killer on her calves, and she hadn't exactly had the chance to adjust her diet any. All the junk food wasn't helping either. She knew that something was up, but the food here really was good! The snacks especially. Rachel wasn't sure what it was, but it was awfully hard to say no when you were making that many trips to the vending machines each day.

"I've got to get to the bottom of this..." the brunette woman groaned as she opened a bag of sour cream and onion chips, "...fast."
11131222313322221123311.title: Calories and Legwork

choices: It had to be the drive—Rachel makes it out with no issue
It was the security camera—a buzzing sound fills the whole hall!
111312223133222211233112.content:
As mentioned previously, Rachel had a dedicated map of all of the locations that Yeng's (potentially) insidious vending machines were located across the main building. In a perfect world, she'd also have included the machines from the Vandergriff and the Masters building, as well as the ones in the dormitories. However, she didn't have that kind of time. Gia wanted something sent to her by tomorrow as it was, and there was just one problem with her map:

There was one machine that she hadn't gotten to.

It was the one on the fourth floor of the East Wing, nestled in a little nook that had absolutely no purpose of being there except to piss Rachel off. It almost entirely obscured the USB port that Rachel had been slipping the drive in and out from machine to machine, and made it impossible for her to approach the machine from the opposite end. That meant that she had to walk past the camera attached to the front of the vendor and try to not make it look like she was shoving a thumb drive into an exposed port.

If Rachel wanted to ensure that she got everything in this building, she would have to get the data from that vending machine. If it was the only one broadcasting subliminal messages, or if it was the only one that contained experimental food, if it was the only one in this whole building that contributed towards making these teachers and these kids as fat as holy hell, Rachel had an obligation to making sure that she got it. Though, given the size of their consumer pool and the frequency with which they were visited, Rachel doubted just one machine was to blame.

One of her girls had gotten wedged in the doorway the other day. That kind of thing didn't happen at normal schools. Poor Augusta Grant, such a sweetheart, had gone and eaten herself so round that she got caught booty-first by the frame of the classroom door. She had been mortified, and it had taken three girls to help get her out. Rachel could still see the poor thing crying, tears rolling down her chubby face as she was told to go to the office. Rachel heard talk about them upping her SSS—she wasn't entirely sure what that meant, but from everything she'd gotten to know about Buttercombe, it surely didn't mean that they were going to put her on a diet and exercise program.

Luckily, Rachel had crafted a pretty believable alibi of being a flighty, forgetful teacher.

"Hi Rio!" Rachel waved the security guard down late at night, "I forgot my... bag.... in my classroom again. Do you think you could help me out by giving me a lift?"

"For you, Ms. Conrad?" The humongously hippy Hispanica said in a relaxed tone, "Anything. Climb in."

With the extra twenty(-ish) pounds that Rachel had gained, squeezing up front with Rio like she had that first night here would have been impossible. Thankfully, it wasn't all her fault. Rio had put on just as much (if not more, somehow!) weight as Rachel had, most of it settling in her big blobby behind that commanded even more space than her doughy hanging gut. It spread further out in the bench seating of her security cart, and bulged against the driver's side door like khaki-colored cookie dough.

"Thanks." Rachel whipped the plastic bag of some of the goodies she'd squirreled away after all her vending machine runs this week, "You're a lifesaver."

Rio's greedy mitts were chubby wrist deep into the bag before they moved an inch. God that woman could suck down snack food. She was reason enough alone to suspect that something was up. Quitting smoking didn't turn you into a junk food addict over night, and the decidedly smaller (though by no means svelte) picture on her ID card told Rachel's reporter instinct that she hadn't been working here long enough to do that much damage to her girlish figure. At least, not under normal circumstances.

"I could say the same about you." Rio smacked her lips, crumbs from her coffee cake spewing down onto her uniform, "I was just getting a hankering!"

***


Rio had told her she had twenty minutes to get her things, so there was no rush. It took five minutes to get from the main building to Rio's check-in center near Rachel's cabin, so that meant that she had fifteen minutes. But since she wasn't going to her room and was, instead, hiking up four flights of stairs, that meant she had ten minutes, tops. The elevators were too slow—she'd have to take the stairs.

Which, admittedly given her doughier physique, was a poor choice.

Poor Rachel sprinted as fast as she could up those four flights of stairs (or was it eight? She never really figured how that ratio worked) and by the time she reached the third floor, her second wind had come and gone already. She trudged up the last flight like she was wearing ankle weights, and she'd actually broken a sweat!

She had to get out and actually jog one of these days.

The silver lining was that the vending machine was literally right there outside the door to the stairs. That stupid nook carved into the wall served absolutely no purpose—it was a remnant of a time when this hall had been smaller, and the staircase had been added later as an afterthought. All that extra slab of brick did was shield the port on that stupid vendor...

And put her dead-set in the camera's line of sight.

Shit.

No time for planning. She was already two minutes behind schedule (running was hard!) no time for subtlety, no time for pretending. Just plug in the drive, get in, and get out. Rachel applied a modest amount of pressure against the machine and leaned it ever so slightly so as to get the proper space for her extractor to fit. Then, while she waited, she slid her wrist along the machine and selected the customary caboodle of coffee cakes for Rio to help keep her quiet.

A small red light caught her attention. That had just been the extractor, right? It was so hard to tell in the dark.

A few minutes more and... YES!

Data extracted and coffee cakes delivered. Now just to make it back downstairs...

The only question that nagged at the back of Rachel's mind as she sputtered down the hall... what was that red light?
111312223133222211233112.title: Breaking and Entering and Eating

choices: ...there was subliminal programming in some of the machines!

...there was nothing of use in ANY of that data. No evil advertisements here!
1113122231332222112331121.content:
"You really cut it close tonight." Rio looked back into the backseat of her security cart, "You're really lucky, Ms. Conrad."

Rachel was still breathing hard by the time she hit the backseat of Rio's cart. Part of it was her being out of shape, and the other part of it was tensions running high. It was the adrenaline of having everything she needed to send Gia's way that kept her going at such a pace. She hadn't moved that fast in... ever, honestly. Recent lack of exercise not withstanding, Rachel had never been a particularly fast girl. Tonight may well have been the sole exception if things kept going at the pace they were headed.

Rio's cart puttered back up to the security post by the cabins. Rachel rolled out, her legs sore from all the running around she'd done today. It was intense—if she'd been even a minute later than normal, Rio would have been late to report in. And then that would have caused problems for her poor hapless getaway driver. As much as she didn't want to get caught, she really didn't want to inconvenience poor Rio.

"Yeah, that's me." Rachel smiled uneasily, "Lucky as can be..."

She held the drive in her hand, her knuckles whitening as her grip tightened. This drive may not have had anything important on it, but at the very least it was a way to satisfy her suspicions. If Yeng had been sending subliminal messages to the kids and the teachers of this academy, then Gia and her team would no doubt be able to decipher them a lot better than she would. And if they weren't, then it was back to square one. But at least she would know that was one thing they could cross off the list.

"You feeling okay?" Rio made a face, "You look sick."

"What? No." Rachel took a half-step back. Play it cool. "Just... y'know, lots of running. It's late. I'm pretty tired."

Rio paused and scrunched her brow a bit. But ultimately she relented with a hearty, gut-wobbling laugh.

"I hear that. Some girls just aren't made for running!" her grating laugh bellowed into the night, "You go home and get some sleep. Glad to know you got what you needed."

And with that, the blob-bootied guard puttered back towards the courtyard. Rachel hurried as fast as she could back into her cabin. She waved her wrist in front of the door and yanked it open as soon as it would let her. She could hear her heartbeat behind her eardrums—this was it. This was something big, she just knew it!

Now to copy the data that she'd mined onto the SSD that Gia had given her...

1 terabyte of data?! What the hell was on those machines?!

Rachel leaned back into her office chair and groaned. This was going to be a long night.

***


It was two more weeks and another ten pounds added to Rachel's chubbing frame before Gia came back with anything substantial.

Thirty pounds up since her enrollment at Buttercombe Academy, putting her at 150 pounds. Still a long ways away from some of the heavyweights that toddled around campus, but far from her ideal shape. Her belly was round and she felt like it jiggled whenever she walked. None of her pants fit—she'd had to go into town and buy new ones—and perhaps most damning of all, she'd detected a hint of a double chin in the mirror a few days ago. Rachel couldn't bear the thought of ever having more than one chin in her life!

Halloween was just around the corner too, and everyone was in the spirit for sweets. Candy was being tossed around left and right from student and faculty alike. Rachel was so stressed out that she couldn't help herself from nibbling here or there. Or ten pounds in two weeks worth of "here or there." She felt like a balloon lately, and only good news from Gia would turn the tide...

Of course, with the bombshell that Gia dropped on her, Rachel was much more shocked than relieve to hear that...
1113122231332222112331121.title: By the Seat of Her Pants

choices: With non-evil snack machines & a month to kill, Rachel indulges suspicion free!
Rachel fiddles around with some of her Yeng tech to pass time—what are Y-Points?
Rachel goes to sleep, and begins to dream...
11131222313322221123311213.content:
"You're joking me."

"I wish I was. We wasted a lot of time on that drive you sent us." Gia said in a gruff voice. She sounded haggard, like she hadn't been sleeping well, "The second one, I mean. We're still trying to see what we can piece together off of the one you sent us back in September."

Rachel hadn't spoken to Gia much since she sent this drive. It had been maybe ten days since she heard from her informant last. But the now signature crinkling of plastic wrapping that came from the outside of snack cakes had become ever present in their conversations. Rachel hadn't thought about it much—the sound had become almost like a heartbeat to her after eating all that junk food, she barely noticed it anymore. But hearing that the vending machines weren't tampered with or loaded with any extraneous or otherwise insidious programming to affect the minds of the faculty and staff juxtaposed with Gia's newfound snacking habits was disconcerting to say the least.

"So I wasted all that time..." Rachel was crestfallen by the realization that her hunch was wrong. Her hunches were never wrong!

"I mean, you didn't waste it." Gia corrected her sternly, "It got you on the right track. Because now you're going to drop this stupid dietary angle and you're going to do what you got sent over there to do in the first place. Which is to get friendly with the technology that they're giving the students."

Rachel couldn't believe it. She'd spent weeks gearing up for this lead and now it was nothing. Worse than nothing, even. She would have really liked to believe that her recent weight gain could at least be blamed in part by some form of insidious outer source affecting her in some way. But no, those extra thirty pounds that she'd packed on since the school year began... that was all her!

"Then maybe they're affecting us chemically." Rachel attempted to argue, "O-Or maybe it's a combination of factors that—"

"Hey, Rachel, we didn't send you there to figure any of that shit out." Gia commanded, the sound of her fist slamming against the desk was unmistakable. She exhaled, calming herself, and continued at a more friendly, but still very stern tone of voice. "You've been assigned, and given the tools, to investigate Yeng's ties to Buttercombe Academy technologically. You can't just switch your assignment. If you think there's chemical stuff going on up there, neato, send me some samples and I'll have someone look at them. But it's gonna take a while, Rachel!"

The investigative reporter let out a long, grueling sigh.

First the button on her pants popped, and now this.

"Look, I'm gonna send you the data miner back. But it's gonna take a while." Gia finally said after an awkward silence between the two of them, "It's a lot easier to get stuff out of that place than it is to get stuff in. You'll probably have it by the end of November. So in the meantime just... relax, I guess. Keep doing your legwork, hang low to the ground in case you hear anything. I'll be in touch."

Rachel threw the phone across the room and fell back onto the sofa. In her frustration, she grabbed a throw pillow and screamed as loud as she could into it, letting the stuffing muffle her cries of anguish. GOD she was beginning to hate this assignment! Late hours, getting yelled at by Gia, being wrong about the one thing she was certain about! She'd spent almost two months on that lead, and all she had learned was that, as far as stupid Gia and her stupid lab tech could see, the vending machines were clean.

Rachel threw the pillow at the wall (it landed next to the phone) and let silence fill the cabin.

This was going to be the longest job of her life.
11131222313322221123311213.title: Squeaky Clean Snack Machines

choices: Rachel tries exercising again—it's the most surefire way to trim her tummy!
Rachel consults the nurse—maybe there's a medical reason behind all this?
Rachel goes about her days as normal—until she's approached by Dr. Hinamizawa
111312223133222211233112131.content:
If there was any consolation to learning that there was no outward tampering with the display programs of the vending machines, its that Rachel could now enjoy her newly formed snacking habit. Getting to know the ins and outs of those vending machines had made it awfully convenient for her to satisfy her sugar cravings at just about any time of the day, and about anywhere in the main building.

Sure, she'd told herself that she'd start cutting back. She'd have to soon, if she wanted to have any hope of keeping herself slim. But gorging herself for the past few weeks, sampling from literally every machine in the building, knowing how good they were... it was hard!

Now that she couldn't do much actual detective work Rachel could work out a more stable sleep schedule, which in turn allowed her to carve out a nice little routine. Every morning she'd wake up early enough to get breakfast with some of the other teachers. She'd ask about a hunch here or there, but for the most part it was simply her making friends. Brooke Smith and Megan Porter were frequently her go-to gals for mealtimes around here, and they had turned out to be her dietary undoing far many times than Rachel cared to admit.

"C'mon, breakfast is the most important meal of the day!" Megan would tempt her newbies into getting another plate almost every day, piling her own platters high with bacon and eggs and grits and toast and jellies and jams, biscuits and ham...

It was mesmerizing—Rachel had never had anything like the food that they served here. No one in her family was a particularly good cook, but she'd gone undercover at a few restaurants when she was investigating police corruption. High-end places, too. They had nothing on whatever those cafeteria ladies were peddling. Rachel would usually stop at seconds (usually) but it was getting harder and harder to say no...

Which was why she put her knowledge of the vending machines to good use! Rachel found herself getting so hungry throughout the day, she knew that if she went to lunch with her friends, she'd pig out. So she put her layout of the school's snack machines to good use! A few snacks a day, just to keep the edge off of her hunger.

Not that it helped much.

With nothing to do other than be a good little Buttercombe Bee, Rachel found herself packing on the pounds at an astonishing rate. By the time Halloween rolled around, she was sitting at just over 160, a full forty pounds over her starting weight! How anyone could gain forty pounds in two months was beyond her—it just wasn't possible! Though between her and Brooke, who'd kept pace with Rachel for every pound she'd gained, it seemed as though anything was possible when Yeng was involved.

But there was no concept of a normal portion size here. Anyone and everyone piled their plates high and snacked frequently and almost always ordered food to their dorms or cabins after dinner at least once a week. The groceries were even taken care of by the Academy, so who knows how many portion sizes she was actually eating even when she did eat at home...

"UGHHH." Rachel collapsed on her queen-sized bed, belly bulging out from underneath her favorite t-shirt, "THIS IS RIDICULOUS."

Rachel Conrad was getting fat, and fast. Pumping herself full of calories day in and day out, stuffing herself some days until she felt like she might explode, was taking its toll in a heartbeat. It was just halfway through November, and she had put on yet another ten pounds. That put her dangerously close to the big 2-0-0, and she had no logical reason to suspect anyone but herself!

Her fleshy gut rose high over her chest, her thicker limbs spread-eagle across the surface of her messy bed. It swayed from side to side, sloshing lazily as it reverberated from her dramatic fall onto the comforter. Rachel's full stomach carried the brunt of the dietary bullet she'd bitten, with only a modest increase in her bras and the seat of her khakis. What's worse, her arms were starting to get wobble and her double chin was growing by the day—the most unattractive places to gain. Because of course that would be her luck.

Sent on this assignment, her leads run out, and now she was getting lunchlady arms. Just perfect.

Rachel had to do something about this...

She pinched the inch that hung off of her once toned and thin arms and sounded a low, guttural whine

Soon.
111312223133222211233112131.title: Laying Low, Living Large

choices: your night-time excursions—we cannot have you breaking curfew, Ms. Conrad."
your health—students have said you have been very erratic lately."
your bracelet—we are making upgrades to the system, and I have your new model."
