1113122231332222112331121313.content:
Rachel was pretty down and out about her growing figure. Almost two hundred pounds and getting closer by the day, Rachel had never been this heavy in her life.

Between the stress of her job as a teacher and the stress of being an investigative reporter casing the school she was teaching at, running a classroom, doing her legwork and getting all of it wrong (if you'd asked Gia!) food had been a pretty steady constant in her life as an English teacher at Buttercombe Academy. She felt stressed all day, and food was everywhere. She knew that she should try to control herself, but everything was so good, and Gia had made it very clear that there wasn't anything insidious about the machines that peddled out junk food on every hall...

Which was why Rachel had started getting most of her sugar cravings during her free periods. Just a few snacks to help tide her over until lunch.

Rachel walked back to her empty classroom from the vending machine just outside, arms carrying no less than five assorted snacks clutched tightly to her chest. A package of cupcakes, an apple pie, some mini donuts, and two of the coffee cakes. Rio was right when she said that these things were good. She'd already started wolfing down one package by the time she opened the door to her classroom.

Waving her wrist (and coffee cake) in front of the padlock, Rachel's bracelet unlocked the door. Balancing her junk food and her free fingers, Rachel tip-toed back inside and bumped the door shut with her sizeable rump. Her eyes narrowed longingly at her newfound favorite as she peeled the wrapper back just enough for her to wrap her lips around the bittersweet treat...

"Hello Ms. Conrad."

And she promptly spewed flaky brown crumbs everywhere at the unexpected intrusion of one Dr. Fukuda Hinamizawa—a name that Rachel was all too aware of.

She had been the head of the Yeng R&D department back in Daven's Port when Yeng first broke ground overseas. She had been the public face of the company, for the most part, before quietly fading into obscurity until the news broke that Yeng would sponsor Buttercombe Academy by providing them with technology. It was even less well-known that she had taken an administrative position as Buttercombe Academy's Vice Principal. That hog of a headmistress Ms. Polluck was too busy suckling on Yeng's teat to run this place effectively anymore, and everyone on-site knew that Fukuda was the one who held the most authority. She was one of the main reasons that Rachel was even here—rumors of her laundering money through the Academy, tampering with technology to engineer a new generation of faithful consumers, and an entire department of the Daven's Port R&D team had disappeared at the same time she took her job here.

A personal visit from the Good Doctor herself was... not reassuring.

She was a small woman—a little soft around the middle. She'd developed a decided middle-aged spread as she entered her forties, her hips had filled out and there was a noticeable amount of pudge that hung around her middle. Not that Rachel was anyone to judge—she'd gained enough to have forty pounds on this woman.

Especially since she screamed like a little girl.

"You scared me!" Rachel grunted a she bent over to pluck all of her snacks off of the floor, "Dr. Hinamizawa, what are you doing here?!"

Rachel's excitement seemed to amuse the small Japanese woman. A small smile came into being and a little laugh might have escaped her.

"Did I frighten you?" she asked in her still very heavily accented English, "I apologize for the intrusion Ms. Conrad. I only require a moment of your time."

Rachel's heart was pounding. Not only because she was scared but because... well, she was scared! There were stories of people who crossed Yeng who never came back into the real world again. Mostly rumors, but rumors substantial enough that she had been forced to take this assignment undercover.

If she'd been found out... it was over for her.

"Are you alright?" Fukuda asked with a curious cock of her eyebrow, "You're sweating."

"What, no I'm..." Rachel exhaled, "I'm fine. Just... rattled is all."

Hinamizawa chuckled again before continuing.

"Yes, of course." she said with that eerie little non-smile that she wore, "I would just like to discuss the matter of...
1113122231332222112331121313.title: Paging Dr. Hinamizawa

choices: "We're going to have to place you on an introductory tier for SSS."
"I have some pills that should fix you 'right up', as you say."
"Go see the school nurse—Yeng has developed a shot for High Altitude Sickness."
11131222313322221123311213132.content:
"My health?" Rachel said with initial incredulous, "I feel—"

And then she thought back to the past few weeks. Ditching her classes for up to thirty minutes at a time to go flirt with a vending machine lead that didn't even turn out to be reliable. Stress-eating like crazy. And if word had gotten out about how "forgetful" the new English III/IV teacher was from Rio, Dr. Hinamizawa might have been talking about her not-quite breaking and entering of the main building more than a couple of times since she'd enrolled. If you looked at it objectively, without knowing that Rachel was an investigative reporter, then yeah... she looked pretty flighty. Way different than how she presented herself during all of the interviews.

"R-Right!" Rachel corrected herself, "My... health."

The smaller woman tugged her lips to the side in a matronly sort of way. Like a mother who was worried about a child, rather than a superior who was upset over her subordinate's inability to perform. Rachel didn't know how genuine it was, given the rumored past of Dr. Hinamizawa's ruthlessness, but she did a good enough job to make her feel a twinge of guilt.

"Yes, I have heard from students about your frequent trips out of the classroom." Dr. Hinamizawa clicked her tongue, "And there is the matter of your frequent forgetfulness? One of our guards has told me that you often leave things in your classroom, only to remember hours before school begins."

Dammit Rio—she should have known that some security guard wouldn't be able to keep her big mouth shut! Probably paid her off in candy bars...

"Right, I... I just haven't been feeling well lately." Rachel toned down the hacky chipperness that she tended to play up whenever she was speaking to another member of the faculty, "I, um... I think it's a side-effect of the mountain air. I'm just really lightheaded all the time."

Dr. Hinamizawa thought about it for a moment. Or, she thought about something for a moment. It was rather hard to tell with her. Finally she withdrew from herself, reached into her purse, and brought out a small orange bottle of pills.

"I figured as much." she said in that same motherly tone, "Well, there's only one thing to do about this..."
11131222313322221123311213132.title: Take Your Medicine

choices: Over the next few days Rachel DOES feel better—with an appetite to match!
Over the next few days Rachel feels MORE lethargic—she feels so slow & heavy...
Over the next few days, Rachel experiences some other weird side effects...
111312223133222211233112131323.content:
"You seem to be suffering from a kind of High Altitude Sickness." Dr. Hinamizawa said with another click of her tongue, "It's not very common for it to last this long, but stranger things have happened."

Rachel was relieved, overjoyed even, when she saw Dr. Hinamizawa's eyebrows unfurrow and her expression relax. The last thing that she needed was to have Yeng's bulldog breathing down her neck because she thought that she was up to something. She'd never be able to finish her investigation like that—heck, she might not even make it out alive if the rumors were true. She'd have been shipped off to work in some Yeng plant, never to be heard from again!

"Yup, that's it." Rachel agreed all too readily, "I've definitely got High Attitude Sickness."

"Altitude." Fukuda corrected gently, "And living this far up into the mountains, it is not unusual for someone from sea-level or below to feel ill."

"Totally, that makes complete and total sense." Rachel agreed, her smile wide with relief, "It's just a reaction from not used to being up here yet. Heh. Dumb body."

"I couldn't agree more." the doctor smiled, "As you may not know, I used to live by the bay in North Carolina when I worked for my previous employers. When I came to live up here, I was sick for some time!"

This was going great. One, Fukuda didn't (outwardly) suspect Rachel of any foul play. She didn't think that she was a shitty teacher, and she definitely didn't think that she was some undercover reporter. She just thought that she was sick! Rachel couldn't have asked for a more simple solution to her issue if it had literally fell out of the vending machine outside of her office.

"Which was one of the primary reasons that I was so pleased to hear that the Yeng Corporation had developed a new booster shot of sorts to help counteract the effects of this."

"I'm sorry, what?"

***


Dr. Hinamizawa hadn't given Rachel much of a choice when it came to going to the nurse's office. Right then and there, she excused Rachel from teaching the rest of her classes for the day, as well as tomorrow, to help her "recuperate" from the stupid sickness that Rachel had already agreed to having. It wasn't like she could just backtrack and say "oh no, I'm fine! I'm just flaky because I'm investigating literally every lead I can find to take you down!" she'd already agreed to feeling nauseous and light-headed as well as achey and lethargic. And as she was heading out the door, that creepy doctor actually turned around and said to her:

"Make sure you head over as soon as you can!" while holding up her black ID bracelet, "Remember, I'll know if you don't!"

Of course those things were trackers. Why wouldn't they have been trackers? It made less sense for them not to be capable of tracking where someone was on a campus as vast and loomingly malicious as this one! All that sneaking around, and Rachel had been wearing her bracelet the whole time! That was a definitely slip on her part.

But that wasn't important right now. What was important was how to get out of this shot.

"So I don't know about you, but I really don't like needles."

Rachel's anxiety was real. Not because of the draw needle (at least not entirely) but because there was literally no way of knowing just what Nurse Fukiyama was about to put into her body. It could have been anything—Yeng owned the company that put it out and developed it, and they were about as shady as a giant malicious megacorporation could get! Plus it was blue. Nothing good that went into your body was blue!

"Does anyone?" the tall Asian nurse laughed, "Trust me, I've held plenty of peoples hands while they got their shots. It's not that weird, Rachel."

Whatever weight Shiro had put on since Rachel had seen her last was a non-issue. She looked more or less the same. Maybe a little softer, but she was still the skinniest member of the faculty by a mile. Did that make her suspicious? They'd started at the same time, so maybe...

That was stupid. This was stupid. She was letting herself get worked up for nothing. Breathe, breathe Rachel.

"Okay, now breathe." Shiro said as she swabbed Rachel's chubby upper arm, "This is gonna be a little cold."

Could Shiro be one of Yeng's lab monkeys? Surely not. She couldn't have been much older than Rachel was, and they'd started at the same time. And Shiro was so nice, and she genuinely seemed to care about the students and their weight. The disapproving look she'd gotten when she walked into her office, stress-snacking on a Mounds bar and a full fifty pounds heavier than just a few months ago, had been a reminder that not everyone was so wrapped up in enabling everyone.

But maybe she didn't know what was in that needle either.

"S-So uh..." Rachel gulped, "What kind of side-effects are we talking, Doc?"

"I'm not a doctor." Shiro corrected with a little laugh, "Relax, you'll be fine."

"No I mean, seriously sh-should I start looking out for anything?" like blacking out and being shipped off to a Yeng facility somewhere? Like instantaneous death? Like mind-control devices or putting nanobots inside her bloodstream? What constituted science fiction anymore, anyway?

Okay, maybe some of the stress was the needle.

And much to Rachel's surprise, Shiro took her hand in hers and began to speak to her very softly.

"This is just to help you get acclimated to living up here in the mountains. Not enough oxygen is getting to your brain and it's affecting your body in lots of weird, unpredictable ways." she said very plainly, very soothingly as her thumb stroked the back of Rachel's hand, "Dr. Hinamizawa says that you're experiencing all of the telltale signs of a kind of offshoot of HAS. Light-headedness, lethargy, weight gain and... I didn't want to believe it until now, paranoia. You'll feel a lot better after the weekend is over and you've had time to adjust."

Lethary... weight gain... paranoia?

Could... could her entire investigation be explained away by suffering from... High Altitude Syndrome? Or at least some version of it. The first few days she'd felt pretty loopy, and she had been popping her ears a lot.

"Okay." Rachel exhaled, "I think I'm ready."

"Good, because it's already done." Shiro chirped happily, bouncing back up to a standing position while Rachel recoiled, "I stuck you and you didn't even notice it!"

Rachel went to rub the sore spot on her arm, but Shiro quickly slapped a bandage on it. The flab packed in the top half of her arm wobbled slightly, making Rachel frown tightly.

"Now go get some rest." the tall nurse pat her friend on the back, "I'll let Dr. Hinamizawa know you got your shot—you go grab a healthy dinner and get some bedrest."

That shot was really miraculous for Rachel. After an evening of rest (and a few snacks) the stress vanished almost entirely. Maybe it was because she just learned they didn't suspect her so there was no risk for her, maybe she got so much in the role of "being sick" that she was convinced to have gotten better, or maybe whatever was in that needle helped her relaxing.

This meant Rachel continued her teacher routine, which she got acclimated to: having large meals with her colleagues, trying some of the few snacks she hadn't tried yet, teaching, gorging before going to sleep... All of which had visible effects on Rachel's waistline.

"Okay, girls, *munch* who knows the error in this line?" asked while writing on the blackboard. The chalk in one hand and a coffee cake in the other.

Meanwhile, some of the students snickered and commented about the teacher's expanding waistline.

"Look at that belly! Could she be pregnant?"

"Pregnancy doesn't make you develop a double chin" replied another one.

Rachel took another bite of her snack. "Does one notice the mistake?"

But the students weren't the only ones to have noticed Rachel's expansion.

"Have you seen Ms. Conrad recently? If she goes on like this, she'll going to need a trolley to move around" giggled Penny Price to Rebecca Von Spillum, despite the blonde herself having grown a large belly as well during those months, and some of her pink gut protruded under her pink sweater.

Penny was immediately caught by surprise as Rachel Conrad appeared behind the corner, with a dozen of snacks wrapped in her arms.

"Oh, hello Rachel! How's teaching going? You look great with that new jacket!" said the blonde teacher with an angelic voice.

Rachel nodded, her chins quivered, as she waved her colleagues to go to her dorm for an evening of television and snacking, the usual routine after a morning of classes.

Days passed, and then became weeks, and Rachel kept eating to her hearth's content. After all, she started receiving much praise for her work as a teacher, she reserved a reward every once in a while, or even every day. Rachel's snacks became more frequent, she even knew the locations of almost every vending machine (and her investigation didn't contribute as much as her newfound habits), her meal portions more abundant, and she developed the habit of getting at least thirds, thanks in part to the influence of her close colleague Megan Porter.

"Hey, Rachel, have you tried this cheesecake? It's delicious!" cooed the large blonde.

"I'll pick a slice, then, but first I want a couple more of these chicken wings" replied Rachel as she poured some grease on the fried wings.

The two woman ate together most if the times, along with Brooke Morrison, and the brunette's began to rival Megan Porter's in terms of sizes.

After all that time, Rachel had basically forgotten that she was a reporter, and fully embraced her role as Buttercombe's teacher. Eating more than ever, and that meant that she was gaining even faster than before. But Rachel didn't seem to notice nor care much, not even when all of her new clothes have become tight, she just couldn't give up such delicious treats.

Without even realizing it, one day of December Rachel had crossed the dreaded two hundred pounds mark but instead of worrying about it she ate snacks for most of the evening, while laying on her queen sized bed and surrounded by delicious treats. Her stuffed round belly prevented the vision of her own feet, but that evening was fully dedicated to the snacks she brought in her dorm. After such a tiring day of lessons she needed it. Even the class homeworks, which had been laying on the desk for almost a week, could've waited another day.

And so, a chocolate bar here and a cake snack there, Rachel gained a thick padding of fat for the Winter Holidays that rolled in, during which Rachel...

11131222313322221123311213132313.content:
It had been a half-day in celebration of the last day of the semester. Students and teachers alike were plenty pleased to be done with the stresses that came with their respective roles in the classroom, and everyone in the English department had decided to celebrate.

They had corralled themselves into an empty classroom after lunch, pushed the desks together, and piled the sizeable surfaces high with just about every kind of treat they could get their mitts on. Cakes and pies, cookies and cupcakes, plenty of candy, pretzels and bags upon bags of popcorn, chips, pretzels—everyone ate like they were the very girls that they had been teaching, rather than respectable adults with more refined palettes. These well-fed educators stood around for an hour or two, making banal conversation while grazing mindlessly on a sizeable spread until there were no more snacks left to suck down.

And mind you, this had taken place around one in the afternoon. By the time four 'o' clock in the evening rolled around, there was a special early supper for the faculty and staff to commemorate the end of the semester where everyone brought out all the stops. Bunnie Blake, the head of the culinary coalition for Buttercombe's staff, took great pride in December's feasting and made sure that everything was as irresistible as it was deliciously decadent.

Having fallen so completely in line with the gluttonous desires of her appetite, poor Rachel couldn't contain herself. She had become so used to the feeling of walking away from every table, literally heaving herself in some cases, that she saw nothing wrong with devouring her meals the way she did. Everything was so delicious, the synapses in her brain firing wildly as flavors and tastes and smells all worked together to overwhelm her fleeting sense of suspicion in this place. She toddled away from the cafeteria, turgid belly swaying in front of her, more stuffed than she'd ever been in her life. She couldn't even remember the drive back to her cabin—her cart swaying on the sidewalk as her swimmy head and sensibilities kept lulling her into a stuffed, stupid slumber.

She had come home to her cabin, belly fit to burst, and collapsed spread-eagle on her bed.

She wouldn't wake up until hours later, when her phone began to ring.

The sharp sound of her beartooth's awful ringtone forced her awake with a loud snort. She instinctively leaned forward, struggling against her still swollen stomach. It had pinned her down, rising heavily into the air and out from underneath her now buttonless blouse. She was still horrendously full, and battling her belly wasn't exactly a winning fight.

"Comin'!" Rachel rolled off of her bed, landing on her feet and waddling arch-backed to her dresser, "Comin' comin' comin'..."

She took a deep breath and composed herself, her heartbeat racing. It had been quite some time since she'd spoken to Gia. Almost a month. Rachel had been a little... preoccupied. She was honestly more exhausted than she was frightened, though. The pain in her belly weighed more heavily on her mind than the butterflies in her stomach.

"Gia! Hi!" she said, a little too chipper and a little too breathlessly, "How're you?"

"I'm alright." Gia answered in a strange way, "You okay Rach? You sound like you just ran a marathon."

Rachel swore inwardly and did her best to correct her breathing. She hadn't exercised at all since she'd been here, stuffing her face day in and day out. It was no wonder she was breathing like a hog.

"I'm... I'm fine. So... what's up?"

"Well, you tell me—any new information you'd like to share with me?"

Rachel thought back over the last month. She honestly hadn't been doing much observing lately. November just sort've... flew by. It was like a blur of food. The stress of finals, Thanksgiving, it all just melted together into one delicious creamy spread. Rachel had been so preoccupied with her appetite that she'd barely noticed that she was crawling into December...

"Not... really." Rachel winced, "I'm sorry."

"It's fine—I didn't think you'd be able to explore that tech angle much until the extractor came in."

Rachel thought placidly to the box that had been sitting on her kitchenette counter for the past week or so. God she really hoped that Gia hadn't been tracking that thing.

"Right! I, uh... just got it today!" Rachel lied, "Yep. Got it this morning."

There was a small silence. Dammit, Gia had been tracking that thing.

"Right." she said in an awkward, transitive sort of way, "Well, good. That means you haven't used it yet."

"We finally found something on that drive you sent us a while ago. The first one, back when you first started. That thing had been scrubbed pretty clean, but we managed to piece together something about a program called SSS."

Rachel thought back to the pieces of information that she'd picked up concerning the program. Special Services for Stipendiaries—apparently a lot of girls were on it. Some teachers too. It was supposed to be for disabilities, but a lot of girls here wound up getting placed on it due to their weight. Some of the teachers had been placed on it too; a couple of the larger cabins were SSS-equipped, though what made them different other than their size, Rachel couldn't have possibly told you.

"Yeah, I've heard a thing or two about that." Rachel puffed, gaining her composure, "It's like this disability service."

"Well, if its a disability service, it's one of the weirdest ones I've ever heard of." Gia said flatly, the sound of rustling plastic wrapping finally making its reappearance, "Discounted food from the vending machines, cut prices for meals and handwaived room service. Not only that, but SSS kids and teachers who are on the program regularly, like say for a long-term disability, get upgraded electronics for free. There're a couple of notes here about Group A and Group B, but we couldn't really figure out much more than that."

"Oh, I'm Group B." Rachel looked to her bracelet—tight around her chunky wrist—"Group B is faculty and staff."

"Are you on SSS?"

Rachel pressed into her soft stomach regretfully

At least not yet, but at this rate...

God, she had to start jogging.

"No."

"Well that sucks, because we really need to see what's going on with that program." Gia clicked her tongue, "Kids and teachers who are on that program get exposed to all kinds of Yeng tech. You put that extractor in all of the tech connected to the personal network up there, and we'd really be able to do some digging."

"Well, I don't know what to tell you." Rachel said, huffy. Sorry I'm not fat enough for you, Gia!, "But the only people I've seen on that program are really fat."

There was a moment of silence between the two colleagues. And Rachel really didn't like where it was headed.

"Well, Rachel Conrad...

111312223133222211233112131323131.content:
Rachel was dumbfounded. Her eyes blinked twice. "Wait, did I hear that well? Did you tell me that I need to get into SSS?"

"Yes, your ears work well, it's exactly what I said" replied Gia.

"But that means..." Rachel gulped, dreading the words she was about to say. "It means I have to... Get... Fat..." concluded, avoiding deliberately the word "Fatter".

"If that's the only way, yeah. Unless you prefer breaking your leg or losing an eye" commented Gia. "After all, you told me you've already gained some weight, didn't you?" asked in a teasing tone.

Rachel looked at her belly, still stuffed and stiff, while her face became red. "Yes, but it's just a few pounds!" Said, as if more than 80 pounds could be called "a few".

"Well, just gain "a few" more, then. I have to go, now. See you in a few weeks" said Gia before hanging up.

"No, wait, Gia! Do I really have to become super fat?" yelled Rachel, but the phone call was already over. She waited a few moments, hoping to hear a "no" among that silence. But no answer came.

Rachel put the phone back to the table and collapsed on her bed. Her eyes wide open gazed at the roof for a minutes before giving herself an answer. "I have to become super fat" and her eyes moved to her round belly, that blocked her the view of her own feet. Just how big would it become?

-----

So, Rachel officially began her mission: gaining weight in the fastest way possible.
An hour after the phone call, just the time to digest a bit, she picked paper and pen and prepared her "workup routine" (the brunette noticed the irony that she always delayed that when she needed to lose weight but now that she needed to get fat she didn't waste time to begin working on it), after ten minutes of writing, she rolled up the paper and threw it in the bin, realizing she just needed to do three simple things: eat, gorge and stuff herself.

Three things Rachel did every day with nonchalance, she could almost consider herself a talent in that regard, but now she needed even more. Since there wouldn't have been any lesson for a while, it was the perfect day.

Rachel sighed. "Well, I was probably going to end up there anyway. I'm just making things quicker" said once she mentally accepted her mission.

Her new "work out routine" was to wake up early in the morning, have an healthy breakfast, then go back to her cabin and stuff herself while watching the tv for all morning, then go back to the cafeteria for a large lunch, then spend all afternoon in her cabin to gorge herself, then have a large dinner in the cafeteria, and a final snack before going to sleep. Another rule she imposed herself was to pick a few snacks whenever she passed in front of a vending machine, that way she would have had something to eat almost every moment of the day.

The first days were tough for Rachel, and almost forced herself to eat almost insane quantities of food, even when her stomach was begging for mercy. She just had to do it, all for the sake of the great scoop. After a while, however, her stomach got used to that, and these large meals and gorging sessions became more of her standard, so she raised the bar more, and then more and then more. To the point that Rachel was starting to like that new mission. All she had to do was simply stuff her face with all that delicious food, and the excuse that she was doing it because she was told to do so, removed any regret she could have had.

Of course, there were some downsides in that. Her body expanded at breakneck pace, to the point not even the most gluttonous students or teachers the school ever had did eat that much. Rachel was literally bursting out of her clothes, and needed to change her wardrobe once per week. Her body was becoming heavy and her belly started to get in the way more often. It didn't help that she rarely moved around, so she was getting tired more easily.

----
The teaching staff celebrated the new year with a large feast, the kind that only Bunnie Blake could prepare. Roast ducks, beef, cakes... There was everything one could've asked for.
The women were sitting around the table, relaxed by the lack of work, with a couple of plates in front of them and having some nice talks. Among them there was Rachel, almost hidden by the avalanche of food piled in front of her, who contributed very little to the conversation since her mouth was full most of the time.

"You're enjoying it? Uh, I cannot disagree with you" commented Megan Porter, elbowing the brunette's soft hip.

Rachel could only nod in reply or she would've spitted pieces of duck and sauce. Of course, she was actually doing it for a special mission, nothing more, or was she actually enjoying it?

"Well, a mission can be enjoyable sometimes" excused herself in her thoughts before grabbing a duck thigh and taking a good chunk of it with a single bite.

"Wow, Rachel! Go easy on that stuff, it's not gonna run away anytime soon" commented Brooke with a laugh.

"I know" replied Rachel with her mouth full of food to the busty blonde.

After almost an hour of uninterrupted eating, Rachel could say she couldn't eat more and layed back on the chair and patted her round and tight gut, which protruded from under her t-shirt.

If the Rachel of some months before heard that by next year she would have weighed almost the double, she would've probably laughed it off, but there she was, over two hundred pound, an undeniably fat Rachel, who was trying to get even fatter. All of this to get her hands on Yeng's special electronics.
In that moment, Rachel could compare herself with fellow newbie teachers like Brooke Morrison and Penny Price, both used to match Rachel's gain, but in the last month, the brunette was became visibly fatter and the gap became wider and wider, to the point that she was becoming closer in size with Megan Porter (and she needed to do that if she wanted to get into permanent SSS).

Rachel was glad that her breasts have become larger and rounder, too bad they were overshadowed by her larger belly, especially when the latter was constantly stuffed with food and made her looks like a barrel, this despite having developed a pair of chunky arms and legs as well.

Naturally, Rachel wasn't the one to notice that, and some of the teachers at the table whispered and discussed about Ms. Conrad's gain or how about the voracity with which she was devouring her food. Rachel, however, was too dazed to hear them.

Without even realizing how she did it, Rachel went back to her dorm and collapsed on her bed. The bed springs squeacked under the impact.
She looked at the large dome that was her gut, comparing to how it was when she received that phone call from Gia.

"And it need to become even bigger" muttered while reaching a chocolate bar on the bedside table and giving it a bite.

The road to get into SSS was very good, after all...

1113122231332222112331121313231312.content:
It was early morning but Rachel was already up and about again. She used to set an alarm clock to wake her up early but lately she didn't need to do that. Her stomach woke her up before 7, demanding to be fed. She didn't bother dressing up, knowing the cafeteria would be almost empty at this hour. She just grabbed two Yeng bars and munched on them while she drove her golf cart on the well-trodden path.

Apart from some guards from the night shift she had the cafeteria to herself. Cooks already knew her routines and while she started eating her huge fry-up they were already making pancakes for her second course.

Rachel was sitting down at a table nearest to the counter, her attention divided between eating (“Mmm! The bacon's perfect!”) and the smells wafting from the kitchen. So it was only the scraping of a chair dragged on the tiles that alerted her to a presence of a stranger at her table. A small, round woman sat down next to her.

“Good morning, Ms. Conrad,” dr. Schwartz smiled at her, “I hope you don't mind if I join you?”

“Oh no, not at all,” Rachel sputtered, her mouth full, while she frantically searched for a reason the fearsome Buttercombe Head Counselor would want to speak with her. Did she somehow give away something? Or did someone have issues with her teaching? “Umm, want some?” She offered her a sausage although her new instincts were rebelling against it.

“Oh no, no, I couldn't. Thank you but I'll help myself later, enjoy your breakfast.” And the woman leaned back as she watched Rachel throw herself at her breakfast.

Unnerved by her presence, Rachel inhaled the fry-up in record time, unable to enjoy it as much as usual. “Is anything wrong?” she asked while she wiped her hands in a napkin.

“Uh, I would not say wrong but we have noticed your consumption has increased significantly over the last month, you are less sociable, spending more time isolated at your cabin, watching TV…” Rachel's sluggish brain filed away for future use that 'they' somehow watched her… or maybe just the appliances she switched on? “Naturally I started wondering if everything is all right with you? How about the, uh, High Altitude Syndrome? Doctor Hinamizawa informed me you were given a booster shot, did it help?”

“Oh, yeah, sure, it was great, thank you.”

“So, no more nausea, forgetfulness?”

“No! I mean, no more than usual. I feel fine. Umm, maybe a little hungrier?”

“Good. In that case… Oh, here's your pancake stack.”

Seeing Rachel engrossed in discussion with Buttercombe management, Bunnie Blake took it upon herself to personally deliver the huge monstrosity. Overflowing with caramel, nuts and strawberries it looked irresistible. “I'll tell the girls to start working on your seconds, right?”

“Umm, thanks.”

“Wow! Looks exquisite. Don't mind me, go on, enjoy,” Dr. Schwartz smiled when she saw the eagerness with which Rachel attacked her pancakes. “So, uh, to get back to my first question, I don't mean to pry, but is anything wrong with your private life, maybe? Here at Buttercombe we pride ourselves in being here for everyone, you know. If there is anything I might help with, my dear, I would be glad to.”

“Oh no, everything's perfect,” the brunette mumbled, her mouth full.

“In that case, if you don't mind me asking, why are you eating so much? Not that there's anything wrong about it but…”

“Because it's sooo good!” But she saw this answer won't be enough for Dr. Schwartz so she elaborated: “And, well, see… I've been on diets all my life. Buttercombe has been an eye opener to me. For the first time ever I'm not judged by what size dress I'm wearing. So about a month ago I decided just to stop caring and enjoy life.” Rachel wasn't sure how much of it was a lie and how much she just told the truth she didn't want to admit even to herself.

“Ach so, I see.”

“And so I started using all my perks to the max. Am I in trouble?” Rachel added a trembling lower lip to her act, not noticing how her second chin trembled too.

“Oh, not at all, my dear, not at all. It is perhaps a little uncommon to get used to Buttercombe lifestyle this soon but I am happy you adjusted so well and so fast. Well, I'll leave you to your breakfast then but before I go, is there anything I might do for you?”

Much to Rachel's surprise, it hadn't taken entirely too much effort to get Dr. Schwartz's endorsement to the Special Service Stipendiaries program. She simply mentioned that she'd heard of a program meant to assist students and teachers with special needs or disabilities and wondered if her "situation" was calls for her to be placed on something like that. The good doctor made a little face, shrugged her meaty shoulders, and said that it may be cause for enrollment.

By the time her free period rolled around, Rachel was in Dr. Schwartz's office in the main building, clutching a tiny slip of paper with an illegible recommendation for her to be seen by Dr. Fitzgerald.

It might as well have been a golden ticket—finally, she was making headway in her investigation! She'd been stumbling left and right, following leads that went nowhere. With access to the SSS applications built into the various fixtures around campus, along with her helpful data extractor, she might actually be able to get somewhere...

Assuming she was accepted, of course.

***


Rachel had never been to the Vandergriff Building. Buttercombe was such a large campus, it wasn't inconceivable that if the need hadn't arisen, she might have never set foot on this part of campus. It was mostly for girls who wanted to go into science programs when they graduated, or go to business schools. The building was much newer than the Admin building, having been constructed not long after Buttercombe received its endorsements from Yeng and its various subsidiaries. Who the Vandergriffs were, why they funded a whole building to be built on campus, and why it housed the head of the SSS program, Rachel had no idea.

Inside was more or less the same as any other part of the campus she'd seen, with the exception of far more open lab areas for computers and large black desks that brought her back to her time in college. Otherwise, it would have been indistinguishable from the Admin building... vending machines and all!

Rachel's belly bobbed as she walked down the wide halls of the Vandergriff's fifth floor, her stomach rolling over the waistband of her khakis and mushrooming over the clasp. Her chubby cheeks were full of apple pie, glazed frosting dotting the corners of her mouth. While it was nice to know that she might have her foot in the door for this SSS program, all of this was still very stressful. She needed something to take the edge off. Her stomach's sloshing stopped a full two steps after she'd reached her destination—"Dr. Catherine Fitzgerald, Special Services"

With one sticky finger, Rachel pressed the button linked to the intercom.

"Dr. Fitzgerald speaking." said a calm, pretty voice, "Do you have an appointment?"

"Hi, um... Dr. Schwartz sent me?" Rachel didn't realize how silly it was to hold up the crumpled note to a speakerbox until after the fact, "I'm Rachel Conrad? Here to talk to you about being put on SSS?"

"Of course!" the voice livened up slightly, the sound of papers rustled over the speaker, "Give me just a second..."

With a soft 'click' the door unlocked, and Rachel went inside...
11131222313322221123311213132313121.title: Golden Ticket

111312223133222211233112131323131211.content:
Honestly, Rachel wasn't quite sure what to expect from this Dr. Fitzgerald.

She had half expected her to be some... blob. What with how big everyone at this school seemed to be, it didn't seem too far fetched that the woman put in charge of minding these heifers would have been a real cow herself. It was an awful thought, but with the speaker built into the door she might have... jumped to conclusions. A terrible idea for a reporter really, as the reality was much different.

"It's so good of you to come to me." Dr. Fitzgerald said with a smile, "Please, take a seat."

The doctor was rather plush, yes. But no more than any other woman experiencing the middle aged spread. Rachel's reporter's intuition had her pegged at somewhere around her late thirties, maybe early forties, and perhaps a little over two hundred pounds. Her long broan hair was thick and luxurious, and she had quite the impressive hourglass figure. However, the electronic wheelchair that she used to navigate her office was enough to catch her off guard. She supposed it made sense—a disabled person in charge of providing students and teachers with technologies, services, and medication to better allow them to navigate the campus.

Rachel did as she was told, nestling her plump rump into the office chair that sat on the other side of the doctor's desk. She felt the tightness of her khakis cut into the swell of her stomach, making her wince ever so slightly. Leaning into her puddling stomach, Rachel tossed the cellophane wrapper of her apple pie into a nearby garbage can with a fatty grunt.

"So I understand you're experiencing some High Altitude Sickness." Dr. Fitzgerald said with a quick cursory glance to the computer screen, reflected in her thick rimmed glasses.

"Along with some... other symptoms." she said with an up-and-down examination of the fattened woman in front of her, in comparison to the photo taken mere months ago, "How are you feeling?"

What happened next isn't entirely too important. Rachel had prepared this long story a while ago that meshed well with what she knew that they had ascribed her with. She was tired all the time, feeling sluggish, and it was difficult to get around campus sometimes. Those were her main sticking points. Adjusting to the pressure alone—her resume had listed her from Seattle of all places— was stressful enough without the pressure of performance in such a prestigious, wonderful, highly-acclaimed school and blah blah blah...

She was hoping that the blah blah blah would be enough. Blowing smoke up peoples' skirts was her one saving grace. Improvisation was a necessity in her line of work. Dr. Fitzgerald looked like a smart woman—hopefully she was dumb enough to fall for this...

1113122231332222112331121313231312111.content:
“Do you know why I called this meeting?”

         Rachel was sweating bullets. Why *was* she back to meeting with Dr. Schwartz about her SSS application. “N-No, idea really. Maybe I should just go.”

         “Sit, please. I want you to stay for this.” Dr. Schwartz said, speaking quickly while she pulled up Rachel’s file. “Your application to SSS under the claim of High-Altitude has been rejected. Ms. Fukuyama tells me you show no sign of it. And I’m inclined to think it was never the cause of the problem in the first place. And yet, I see you’ve still been having trouble remembering everything when you leave your classroom at the end of the day.”

         ‘Shit! Shit! She’s on to me!’ Rachel thought. She tried to figure out if she ran now, could this doctor, or Rio catch her? When she first got here, she’d have no doubt but now...even this middle aged cream marshmallow might be able to keep up with her.

         “Tell me, Rachel, do you a good sense of direction?”

         “A good sense of direction?” Rachel was confused.

         “Do you get lost easily.”

         “Yeah, yeah. That’s, that’s a big part of why I’m out at night so much.” She squirmed, eager for any excuse.

         “Make a lot of impulse purchase on the internet?”

         Did she know about the packages Gia kept sending her back and forth? “Yes.”

         “Trouble sleeping?”

         “Yes.”

         “Without looking at your watch, what time do you think it is? To the minute.”

         Her rapid fire questions in a clipped, Teutonic accent made her feel like this was an interrogation out of *Hogan’s Heroes*. “...Eleven-- Eleven Thirty?” She guessed. What time was this meeting supposed to be? She couldn’t remember without her day planner.

         “It’s 1:06. Are these questions making you nervous? Are you trying to figure out the right answers to them?”

         Every alarm in Rachel’s head was going off at once. She could see right through her. “No. Yes! Yes, but not because I’m trying to mislead you it’s just...you’re going very fast and I’m having a hard time following the questions.”

         “Rachel…” Helen said, softly then smiled. “Relax. You’re not in trouble. I am here to help you. I don’t think you have altitude sickness. I think you might have ADHD.”

         That slowed Rachel down a lot. “Wow, um...why? I don’t think I have it. Everyone always is telling me how organized I am, with my day planner and my notes.”

         “And if you lost your day planner, or your notes, how bad would that be?”

         “That would be...bad. Very bad.”

         “Would you remember your appointments anyway?”

         “Of...course not.” Rachel was starting to see the doctor’s point. “That’s...why I write everything down.”

         Helen nodded, writing down some notes of her own.

         “Still, I don’t know if I have trouble focusing. I’m really good at it actually.”

         “You can focus on something all day?” Helen teased.

         “Yeah, I can, actually.” Rachel said, a little defensive.

         “Especially on topics that engage you.”

         “...Yes.”

         “So much so that you lose track of the world around you.”

         “...Yes.” Uncertainty crept back into her voice. “It’s how I got such good grades in college.”

         “That is called hyperfocusing, Rachel. It is part of your condition. I think your organization, your ability to focuses on classes that excite you, these are coping mechanisms that have helped you manage your problem.”

         “But why? No one ever noticed a problem before.”

         Helen shrugged. “I’m not surprised. Clinical research indicates that men and women suffer from ADHD in equal rates. But only woman is diagnosed with ADHD for every 3 boys. With such a big gap, it’s not surprising you fell through the cracks. You excelled in school, graduated top of your class for Education, I see and then…” Helen sounded sympathetic, compassionate even. “Now you’re out in the world. It’s less structured. More confusing. There are less clear goals about what you have to do each day, and you’ve been having trouble keeping up since then. And...I hate to bring it up, but that might also explain your recent weight gain. Do you lose track of what you’re eating and when you last ate? Eat to deal with stress?”

         “Yeah…” Rachel said. Sure, she went to school for journalism, and not education, but everything she was saying was hitting home really hard. “I guess everyone struggles with that, though.”

         Helen shook her head, and reached out to touch her hand. “It’s okay, to struggle where others don’t.”

         “How do you know all this?”

         Helen smiled. “I’m a psychiatrist.”

         “Oh...right. So uh...what, do I go on ritalin?”

         “Yes, I think that’s reasonable. I’ll write you a prescription. But I spoke to Dr. Fitzpatrick, and we think there’s something proprietary to Yeng that might be able to help you as well.” Helen reached into the drawer of her desk for something. She stood up, came around and brought Rachel a white, high tech watch.

         “This is HERMIA. She is a digital personal assistant. This one has been specifically adjusted to help manage your needs.” She pushed the power button, and the screen started up blue.

         “So what, there’s like someone doing data entry on the other end?” She asked. Finally a chance to get a look at Yeng Technology in action.

         “Oh hardly! HERMIA is an AI. Built as a competitor to the Google Home, SIRI and Alexa. Only much smarter.” She winked. “She is a true learning machine. The more you talk to her, the more helpful she gets.” The screen finally started up, and in a feat of high technology the watch produced a little holographic effect shimmering mid air, just an inch above the watch face. It was an illusion of a polygonal woman’s face, and it spoke to her.

         “Hello. You must be Rachel.” She could tell by the small, jerky pause before her name that she must be working out of canned recordings. “My name is HERMIA. If you’d like, I can go over my features with you, at your leisure. And we can discuss how I can keep you on schedule, and on task.”

         Rachel’s face lit up. She looked at HERMIA, that at Helen, than back at Hermia, than back at Schwartz. This was like the coolest christmas present ever. “That’s amazing. Whoever designed this thing must have been some kind of genius.”

         “Well…” Helen smiled, happy to wallow in her smugness. “I don’t like to brag. But yes, I am.”

         “...You did this?”

         She shrugged and headed back to her desk. “It was a small side project. One among many. Something to keep me amused. Once you understand one form of mind well enough, it’s easy to design others.” She sat down in her chair with a weighty creak, and steepled her fingers.


         “If you’re able to do things like this, what are you doing here?”

         “Oh...I decided to take this assignment at Buttercombe because I thought it might be relaxing. And because I love helping others, such as yourself.”

11131222313322221123311213132313121112.content:
“…and remember there is a special discount on the Devilish Delights! 75 percent, tomorrow only!” a pleasant female voice advised her.

“Huff, HERMIA, remind me first thing in the morning to order them in bulk,” the intrepid journalist wheezed and puffed as she made the long journey from her mobility scooter to her sofa. Her gut didn't even jiggle much, so stuffed it was with food.

“Yes, Rachel.”

Rachel Conrad had HERMIA for less than a day but the personal assistant already assisted her plenty. And not only with teaching, though the English module actually contained ready-made lessons for her to steal borrow. The AI was also well-versed in the labyrinthine intricacies of Buttercombe hospitality and just the first evening her advice (Rachel was already thinking about HERMIA as “she”) helped Rachel save at least 20 percent on her dinner and snacks.

But now a nagging thought popped up in her food-clouded mind. There was something she was supposed to do, right after getting back home. What was it? Oh, right. She had to call Gia. Now where was that burner phone?

Rachel flailed about as she tried to stand up, then she had to reach on top of the kitchen cupboard. She hid the burner there after their last call but that was before Christmas, before she started her weight gain quest. “It was… so stupid… of me…” She was getting red in face and all she managed to do was push the phone even further away. “Think, Rachel. You're a tool-using creature. So find a tool.”

With a kitchen spatula the task was much easier. She grabbed the phone and dialled her ex-cop contact.

“Hi, Rachel,” Gia's voice sounded even huskier than before. “So what's new? Did you finally get on the… SSS it was?”

“No, something better! I got a Yeng digital personal assistant for you. A prototype, they call it HERMIA. Isn't it amazing?”

Her enthusiasm was not reciprocated. “Do I get it right that you didn't get on the SSS?” Rachel could hear wrappers crinkling. Gia Rossellini must have been heavily snacking which evoked an almost Pavlovian response in Rachel.

She opened her stash and unwrapped some muffins. “Uhh… not yet.”

“Come on! How hard could it be? If I got you right, all you need to do is put on a couple dozen pounds! How hard could that be? I managed it without trying!”

“Do you think I didn't… It's not a couple-! Are you saying you got fat t-?” Rachel swallowed the rest of her diatribe with the dreaded word too. She lowered her voice: “Look, I got us a prototype Yeng AI. What more do you want?”

“Well, good. So send it to me.” Chomp.

“Are you mad?! It must be insanely protected, the moment they found out it was gone I'd be in deep shit!” hissed Rachel.

“Huh, true. Well, in that case, I'll need to consult with people who know better. I think we're gonna send you another flash drive but let me check first. So wait for my next call.”

“Ah, OK.”

“And do try to get on the SSS in the meantime.”

“I am trying! What do you think-”

“Bye.” Click.

“That b…” Rachel stuffed several muffins into her mouth to get in a better mood and slowly lumbered back to the couch. There she paused, still standing. On one hand she was so exhausted, both physically and emotionally, that she dreamt about laying in her comfy queen-sized bed and watching TV.

On the other hand, all the walking and jostling made some room in her stomach and she was getting peckish again, peckish for something more substantial than a few muffins. And besides, the TV in her bedroom was so badly placed that recently her belly started to obscure her line of vision when she was full…

It was a no-brainer, really. Rachel reached into her industrial-sized freezer, put lasagna into the microwave and leaned her blubber on the counter, fiddling with HERMIA's settings. No sense in sitting down before the lasagna were ready.

111312223133222211233112131323131211121.content:
Rachel had never felt more confident going forward into a new semester.

Granted, that was because all of her information was falsified; any and all bravado she'd felt during her first few days as a teacher in August had been pulled completely out from underneath her feet like a rug once the reality of her situation set in. Trying to balance her public appearance as an eager young teacher and her true intentions as a deep-undercover reporter had been anything but smooth for her first six months. Her first semester had been such a rocky start that they legitimately thought she'd gone as undiagnosed with ADHD. Even if her cover hadn't been blown (yet), there was no telling what kind of damage she'd done to her reputation as a rising star in the teaching community. But thanks to Dr. Schwartz, she finally felt like she had an ace up her sleeve...

"HERMIA?" Rachel leaned over the end table as she dressed herself, tum folding as she angled her plush naked body towards her watch, "Tell me what's on my schedule."

A moment of silence before an automated, slightly stilted voice did its best to recant to Rachel what she had in store for the day. She had programmed it to line out all of her class periods, as well as her free ones.

"You also wanted me to remind you that it is build your own waffle day in the cafeteria this morning." HERMIA concluded, "This will conflict with the time you scheduled for grading your papers."

Rachel stood in her living room, soft shape steadying as she made a face at this conflict of interests. Her tv-ready features crinkled in mild agitation. Build-Your-Own-Waffle Day only came around once a week, and Rachel had gotten hooked on the chocolate chip batter that she'd discovered. It was practically the only thing that made Mondays bearable around here...

She really didn't want to miss that...

"I know!" Rachel said proudly to herself, and effectively to her digital assistant, "HERMIA, push my grading period to free period number one, between First and Third periods."

Another pause.

"Alright, that leaves you with an hour and a half. Would you like me to extend the event make your own waffle day to fill that time?"

A hungry look flashed across Rachel's face, her eyes glimmered greedily as she drummed her fingers across her sagging stomach.

"Yes, please."

***


Rachel was still one of the smaller teachers on-campus. Even given her recent expansion, to put it mildly, you would have been hard-pressed to find another staff member much smaller than her. Except for that nurse Shiro. But Rachel (and everyone else who had slipped into denial) had convinced herself that she must have just not ate anything. It was normal to put on a little weight at a desk job. Especially when everything around you was so tasty...

"Rachel, you have two hours until lunch time." HERMIA said from her wrist, "You may want to eat a snack."

"Two hours?" Rachel whined, somehow suddenly unable to cope with such a timeframe, "Ugh... you're right."

Steering herself belly first towards the nearest vending machine, Rachel swiped her wristband across the scanner and selected a few of her personal favorites. A pack of cookies, a blueberry muffin, and a two-pack of apple pies. Bending over onto her stuffed stomach, sounding a thick "oof" in her exertion, Rachel stuck her wide rear out to a skirt-stretching degree in the name of retrieving her snacks.

"Mm..." she purred, looking over her (comparatively) modest haul, "That should do me for now..."

Rachel paused, suddenly discontented.

"HERMIA, how long do I have until lunch again?" she asked, holding her wrist up

"Two hours." the simulated voice repeated

"Better make it two muffins." Rachel tapped on her chin contemplatively, "And maybe another apple pie..."

***


Rachel waddled into the teacher's lounge, a half-eaten donut in one hand and button-bustingly big. Or at least, dangerously close to it. For the past few days she'd been really packing it away, and today's epic breakfast binge, vending machine marathon runs, or the especially heavy lunch hadn't been helping matters. Her stomach, already bloated into a soft apron of flesh, stuck far out from in front of her. The clasp on her skirt had come undone, and she'd yet to notice that a sliver of her stomach was clearly visible from beneath her blouse even as she sat down.

"Jeez Rachel, hungry much?" one of her coworkers, an impractically busty History teacher named Carly, said with a mild sort of amusement as the formerly skinny newbie plopped herself down, "You were eating last time I saw you this morning."

"Just supporting the school." Rachel answered dismissively, suckling her glazing-coated fingers for every last calorie they were worth, "Those kids running the bake sale sure know how to close a deal."

Carley eyeballed Rachel's rolling blubber eek towards the table. The younger, prettier teacher may not have been fatter than her yet, but at the rate she was going, it wouldn't be long. Most of the new teachers tended to pack it on, if they didn't quit first, but Rachel was a refreshing change of pace. And her opinion wasn't hers alone—Rachel had been making rounds throughout the building of ever-chubbing women as an especially avid gainer. She'd made quite the splash and gotten plenty of catty remarks from her coworkers when she'd arrived, thanks in part to her status as some kind of prodigy. Her natural good looks certainly hadn't helped any inherit jealousy that these older, fatter women might have held for her, but now there were talks of her getting special treatment from Dr. Schwartz? She was so flighty and ditzy, how could anyone stand her?

It was nice to know that the seemingly perfect candidate for Buttercombe Academy's rising star of a teacher had a pretty noticeable chink in her perfect facade...

"Ooh, speaking of treats, I think those cupcakes are still in the fridge..." Carley stood up with some effort, "You want one?"

"Sure, I've got..." Rachel glanced at HERMIA's clock face, "Thirty minutes to kill."

"Take two then." Carley smiled viciously as she handed her coworker two yellow-frosted sweets, "I won't tell."

***


With no leads to investigate and nothing but time to kill, Rachel fell into a steady groove. With HERMIA to help her out, a lot of the guess-work in this teaching thing was taken care of for her. Dr. Schwartz had shown her how to make the AI work for her, laying out her scheduling class by class, and it was even capable of entering grades via cloud uplink to her gradebook. It could remind her if she had assignments to grade, what was for lunch, how many more quizzes she needed to give in the month, what snacks were in what vending machines, the average grade on her latest test from all her classes, what specials were being offered as part of Buttercombe's Delivery service...

It was three for four pizzas, by the way.

"I know I've got you hanging by a thread." Gia said into the receiver of Rachel's burner phone, "But just hang tight and... Rachel? You there?"

Rachel's cheeks bulged with pizza crust and cheese. And butter. So much butter. She was skeptical as to why they loaded the crust with actual butter, but it was so good. Really brought out the flavor in the three cheeses in the crust. You wouldn't have thought she'd be hungry after such a big lunch, but Rachel had barely gotten through the door before HERMIA reminded her that dinner time was rolling in...

"What? Yeah." Rachel smacked her lips, "Sorry, bad connection."

"Hrm. Yeah. I can barely hear you." Gia said in her husky voice, "Pizza's here anyway. Call me when that thumb drive comes in. It should be a few weeks, so let me know if... Rachel?"

A long string of no less than seven cheeses pulled from her mouth, landing on her bulging stomach.

"Rachel?"

Sauce and meats churned in her squishy stomach, bubbling in piggish delight.

"Rachel? You hear me?"

"Not really, Gia, gonnaletyougobyyyyeeee."

Rachel clicked the END button with a greasy thumb before diving right back into dinner. After a long day of doing two jobs, teacher and reporter, she'd earned this. Some respite from her duality. A little treat—one that would last well into the night as she worked her way through three of the four pizzas and slip into a food coma on her couch, waking up the next morning just in time for breakfast...
111312223133222211233112131323131211121.title: Rachel Rounds Up (with Help from HERMIA)

1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
Rachel didn't sleep well. It was nothing new but with her recent descent into gluttony the issue was getting worse. And she had never overeaten as much as today. In the evening Megan Porter invited her closest friends to a small party and Rachel somehow matched the humongous Arts & English teacher bite for a bite.

That would not be so bad but then, as her cart carried her home, HERMIA reminded her that she had last 30 minutes remaining on a special delivery offer. Buy three megacheeseburgers, get two free! She didn't want to miss that. She promised herself she would put three of them aside for tomorrow… two of them… or at least one… and she definitely shouldn't have eaten those chocolate chip cookies on top of everything else. Each her burp now felt chocolaty. But it was their fault that an opened family pack was left on the table, the cookies provoked her into eating them!

Now she was spread on her sofa, sighing and groaning, sliding into sleep and waking up again as soon as the slightest change of her position jolted her stomach, sending waves of pain back into her brain.

It happened during one such painful moment. As she was waking up, she thought she heard a voice speak to her. A voice saying: “Eat, Rachel, eat more. Eat more, feed more, consume more, Rachel Conrad, forever more!”

“What? Is that you, HERMIA?”

The digital assistant was lying on a side table behind her head – just where she heard that voice come from. Now it beeped as if powering up. “Rachel? Are you awake? Would you like a snack? There are…”

Was this the same voice as before? In her dizzy state she couldn't tell. “No! No, don't even talk about eating now. The only thing I'd like would be an Alka-Seltzer.”

“I see. My database tells me that Alka-Seltzer is a digestive aid. I can offer you a better alternative, Rachel. Have you been informed that there is a Yeng Stomach Aid in your bathroom? Extra strong?”

Rachel groaned. In her present state, the bathroom might as well have been in a neighboring galaxy. „If only you could grow feet and get it for me.“

„Sorry, Rachel, unable to process request.“

„Oh, never mind. I know.“ She resigned herself to wait it out and massaged her overworked gut in the hope it would shrink enough to let her sleep.

***


It was only in the morning that Rachel's mind returned to the weird midnight experience. She had heard about subliminal programming, of course, but she'd always dismissed it as a load of bull. Could there be something to it after all? In her morning daze, still groggy from lack of sleep, she was willing to believe anything. She had a good look at the big white watch and resolved to test it ASAP. Meaning the next night.

Faced with this problem, most people would simply pretend to fall asleep and wait for the devious device to start broadcasting its subliminal message. However, Rachel's mind insisted that she repeat the conditions of previous night in full. Full being the key word. When she staggered home that evening, clutching her beachball belly, Rachel almost regretted that cherry pie. Or the last dozen donuts. But they were so good! And besides, it was a gift from Penny Price, she shouldn't hurt her feelings.

So now she hurt every time she breathed in, she was drenched in sweat from the short walk from her cart to the sofa. As she carefully lowered her load, at one moment she actually thought she would burst. Would that be an end to her investigation!

Luckily as soon as she laid down the worst was over for Rachel. This time she remembered to pick up the Yeng Stomach Aid while she was still mobile. Now she just fished the small vial out of her cleavage (as it grew it became a handy depository for various knicknacks and snacks), uncorked it and poured its contents down her throat.

And after a while, when the liquid made it to her stomach, she really felt relief. As some of its components got absorbed by stomach walls, they relaxed stomach muscles and stretched its lining so that even her grotesquely outsized feast fit painlessly inside (and so would all the future ones). Other chemicals got to work too, breaking it down quicker and more efficiently than her own enzymes to ensure faster digestion. And yet more substances travelled all the way to her brain to tweak its biochemistry.

At that moment, the important thing was that nothing hurt. And since she had had several sleepless nights in a row, Rachel Conrad fell fast asleep in no time flat. It was the best sleep she had in weeks, if not months. And she did not hear a thing.

***


Her growling stomach woke Rachel up so early that even the cafeteria was still closed. She hadn't been this massively hungry since… since her last diet, probably. Certainly she hadn't felt like this since her arrival at Buttercombe. Her stomach was crying out for food as if it were about to start digesting itself.

In her time at the Academy, Rachel grew used to obey her stomach's every whim. Still half asleep, she shuffled to the kitchen and put two pizzas in the microwave. As she did so, she recalled how she'd wondered why they put a double tier microwave in her kitchen. Now it made a perfect sense.

While she waited for the microwave to ping, she scarfed down several Yeng Bars and a packet of cupcakes to quell the worst hunger pangs and then she went to town on the pizzas. And since she was still a little peckish afterwards, a pound of red velvet cake joined them in her gut.

Only when she sated her morning hunger, did Rachel become able to think straight again. Her thoughts went back to her failed evening experiment. Now, with a clear head, she couldn't believe she fell for such a stupid theory. Subliminal programming, hah! On the other hand, this Yeng Stomach Aid was a truly miraculous cure. How come she'd never seen it on sale in any pharmacy? People would buy it like mad if they could. In fact… was it even approved for use yet? What did it say on the label?

Searching for the empty vial, she found it discarded on the floor by the sofa. How could she get it from down there? Just thinking about bending down made her clutch her overfilled stomach in horror. She recalled her recent success with a spatula and the cupboard. Maybe the kitchen had some tools for her current predicament too?

Several minutes later, armed with a pair of tongs, she triumphantly lifted the vial to her eyes. And swore. It was blank. Apart from the name in block capitals, there was nothing; not a word about its composition, no date of expiry and most importantly, no seals of approval, not even a batch number. Rachel's journalist radar, buried under her blubber and almost forgotten in her indulgent lifestyle, started tingling again. This felt like an important clue but the question was, what should she do with it?

She was no chemist nor biologist to tell what it could be made of, whether it might be hazardous or not. But she could be able to find out more by careful snooping, if she felt up to it. What to do?
