1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
"Are you sure you're not just getting used to eating like a pig?" Gia chuckled, "They feed you ladies pretty well up there from what I hear."

Rachel could hear a soft clicking on the other end of the line that was, in fact, Gia's plastic spoon hitting the sides of her pudding cup. She could practically hear the amusement dripping from her informant's voice as she purred into the other end of the line. Her deep brown tone was playful over brusque for the first time in months, since Rachel's last major slip-up with the drive. If it hadn't been at her expense, Rachel might have appreciated it. But right now, spread out in her already too-tight jammies and wrestling her work life with her undercover life, she was hardly in the mood for jokes.

"Har har, Gia." Rachel growled into her end of the phone, "That was so funny I almost bust a gut."

"Well go ahead and bust one then—don't forget, we gotta get you eligible for SSS." The crinkling of plastic wrapping, "ASAP."

On cue, Rachel's belly burbled as it spread out beneath her. Bottoms up on her bed, chubby legs kicking while she idled over some overdue English assignments, Rachel looked every bit the part of a pampered Buttercombe teacher. Her wide rear had begun sloping under its weight, fat thighs coming to rest on the soft cream colored duvet. Her milky flesh puddled out from underneath her, soft pink pudge puddling on the bed as her elbows propped her up properly. She bit into a chocolate anxiously.

Whether or not Gia would keep harping on her, Rachel would have eaten it anyway. But being reminded about her "assignment" at every waking moment just stressed her out—even if it was just doing what she would have been doing anyway. Something about mixing business and pleasure made things a bit less enjoyable for her.

"Look, if I send you the bottle, will you have the lab boys analyze it?" Rachel's chubby cheeks chewed on her chocolate treat nervously, "It'd make me feel a lot better about staying here knowing whether or not I'm being drugged."

"Fine, but only if you promise to send more of those chocolate eclairs." Gia's eye roll was audible, "Those things were delicious."

"They were also a distraction so they wouldn't notice the real reason I sent you a package." Rachel pursed her lips to one side, "Don't forget I'm the one who is in major trouble here if we get found out."

"Lucky for you, you won't get found out." Gia said in her more familiar, powerfully low tone, "Now lemme get—oof—to the computer over here... figure out which PO you should send it to..."

***


The only link to the outside world at Buttercombe Academy, save a lengthy trek down a winding mountain-side trail, was the post office. It was a small building located near the main gate. It wasn't an official, government-sanctioned post office, just a place where pudgy clerks in ill-fitting white shirts crammed themselves into pairs of khakis and also received and delivered packages. Rachel knew most of them by temperament, rather than name, and had made it a point to get the one she perceived as the "nicest" as often as she could during these sendoffs to Gia.

"Another package to go out?" the woman, Marie, said with a dimpled smile

"Yeah, I've got a friend who loves these things." Rachel referred to the sweets in the box, not a lie, and pat it appreciatively, "Says they don't make them back home like they do at Yeng."

"Ain't that the truth." Marie pat her sizable stomach as it surged onto the mail counter, rolling onto the counter and rippling in appreciative softness at the touch, "They sure do know how to spoil us up here, don't they?"

"They sure do." Rachel smiled awkwardly, "Yup."

Rachel watched the clerk, nearly as big around as she was tall, struggle with the package. Leaning into her soft sea of belly, Marie got red in the face as she exerted herself. It made Rachel touch her own tummy tentatively, arching her back slightly so as to feel the severe arc of her stomach as it rolled out and about from underneath her undershirt. Over her sweatpants. Her biggest sweatpants. Maybe it was time for another trip into town...

"Okay, you're all clear." Marie beamed, her puddling cheeks dimpling twice over, "Boy you send a lot of packages out, don'tcha?"

"Yeah, you know..." Rachel gulped, rummaging through her purse for a granola bar, "Homesickness is the worst kind of sickness."

"I hear ya." Marie grunted as she settled back into her triple-wide office chair, "You have a good day now!"

"You too, hun."

Rachel bit nervously into a granola bar. Even if she'd done a good job so far (mostly) of avoiding suspicion, it was little things like that that really set off her inner alarms. Marie had never said anything about the amount of packages she'd sent out before, so why now? The fact that she really was smuggling Yeng property outside of campus certainly didn't help matters. If she'd bothered to cut open that box and see the bottle of antacids beneath the eclairs and other snacks, Rachel would have been screwed...

Rachel chewed more vigorously on her granola bar, and took another bite...
1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.title: Evidence, and Pounds, Pile Up

choices: As the lesson begins, Rachel REALLY gets used to the Special Services
Dr. Schwartz wants to meet up with Rachel
1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
Rachel snorted as she got woken up by HERMIA's alarm. It was a summer-like tun, which made her think of Hawaii but, after a week, she began hating it.

"HERMIA, I'm awake!" huffed the girl while grabbing the white, high tech watch on the bedside table. The lace had been replaced with a longer one, to fit Rachel's plump wrist.

"This morning there's build-your-waffle day , it began at 8.00, fortynine minutes ago" reminded her the watch's robotic voice.

"Already ? What day is it?" asked Rachel gazing at the date on the watch. It was the first of September, soon the lessons would've begun.

Summer holiday had passed quickly for Rachel. The brunette had decided to spend them at school, that way she could check if something suspicious happened while the students were away (and, in case, investigate) and, especially, have access to the school's comfort and food. She had the mission to end up in SSS, and Rachel took the mission with all her hearth. Thanks to not having any lesson to do, she had all the free time she wanted, which she spent mostly stuffing her face and tasting the school's snack, just like with Christmas Break, only this time she had HERMIA's assistance and a larger appetite, which meant the brunette ate more than she ever did.

Rachel got up, the bed creaked while she moved her large body. She glanced at the mirror, the results of the Summer holiday were evident. Rachel had gotten huge: her face was round, almost spherical, with two chins and a small ring of fat instead of her neck. Her arms were like hams and she had to be glad the mirror was particularly wide, or couldn't have reflected the entirety of her large body, of which the belly had gotten the lion share of fat. It sagged down to her knees and had made Rachel impossible to see her own feet or anything below it, for that matter.

After all that time, however, Rachel didn't mind her fat body and accepted that, after passing the 250 pounds, she could have never gotten back to her initial weight. The lack of guilt made every snack and meal she ate much more satisfying. The only downsides were that she was getting clearly more out of shape, moving around had become a chore, her furniture was making strange noises and her uniform was of the largest size available, any size-up and she would've begun wearing a custom-made one. Speaking of, she had some troubles wearing it, especially when buttoning up her blouse, she might as well order a new one before popping the current one. She took it as a good sign, if she had outgrown standard uniforms, she was probably SSS-levels of fat.

-----

Rachel sat at the table carrying a tray with piles of waffle so tall they she couldn't see in front of her, however, by that point, she knew the cafeteria like the palm of her hand. Four piles of waffles, two with chocolate syrup, one with maple syrup, and another with jelly, of course, that was just the first course.

"Morning, Rachel!" Greeted Megan, who had already eaten her fair share of waffles. "Problem waking up?"

"No, I just... watched a movie and went to bed late" replied Rachel. Too bad she didn't even remember what movie watched, although the taste of the chocolate and cherry snacks she munched was still in her mouth, ready to be replaced with the waffles'.

The arts teacher had gotten a bit rounder, but it was hardly noticeable. She probably hadn't gained more than a dozen pounds since Rachel had met her, albeith she was still definitely fatter than the brunette, who didn't need to use two chairs to sit at the table... yet.

"You should get used with getting up early, lessons will begin soon" said Penny, who was sitting in front of her, with a snicker.

The economy teacher had definitely rounded up, not enough to match Rachel, who was the newbie to have gained the most (no one else had to purposely gain weight, after all), but weighed at the very least twice compared to when she moved there. Penny's belly was pressed against the table, with her old sweather unable to cover it all, with some of her pale flesh protruding under it.

"C'mon, Penny. It's still summer holiday!" chirped a cheerful Brooke. "Already colder, but still summer". At the beginn
beginning of the year, Penny and Brooke were very similar, especially if seen from apart. Both were blonde and slim, with the main differences being the hair length and fashion choice. However, as both women gained weight, while Penny stored most of it in her belly, Brooke stored it in her chest, much to Rachel's envy. Although the brunette developed quite the pair, it was overshadowed by the rest of her body.

Rachel noticed that Brooke had gained quite a lot of weight as well, probably as much as Penny. Newbie teachers probably gained a lot of weight during their first year, even Vivian Peace, the new history teacher, had developed a pretty wide hourglass body.

During these thoughts, Rachel didn't realize she had already eaten all her waffles, and didn't even savor them properly.

"Better take another serving..." thought while heaving herself. "... Or two".

------

"Maybe I shouldn't have gone to the infirmary right after lunch" muttered Rachel.

The brunette had just eaten a very rich lunch based off fried chicken, mashed potatoes and a couple of pies as dessert. Her stomach was heavy and bloated, juggling and bouncing at every step, yet that didn't stop Rachel from taking a snack at the vending machine.

Since the new school year was rolling in, Rachel thought it was time for a medical check, which might allow her to finally get into SSS. Recently she had been wishing to get these not only for her mission, but because she really needed some special comforts.

"Hi, Mrs. Conrad" greeted Shiro with a tiny smile, although Rachel could feel her eyes gazing and judging her curves.

During all that year, Shiro barely changed, Rachel wasn't even sure if she had gained a pound of two. Among a school where teachers, staff and students was round and fat, Shiro was still a twig.

The medical check proved that Rachel was definitely out of shape, and when she stepped on the scale, the numbers said...

"286 pounds" read Shiro.

Rachel was surprised by it. She definitely did gain a lot, but couldn't believe she had more than doubled her weight in the span of a year.

"It's no surprise you have all these problems" commented the nurse, there was some worry in her voice, but also some annoyance, she had probably gotten used with people getting obese.

Rachel nooded in agreement. "Do you think that, maybe, I should go into Special Services?" asked directly, either answer, she just wanted to leave and go back to her cabin.

Shiro compiled a paper. "I'm inclined to say 'yes', you really need to. I hope, however, that it would be temporary, just to help make you comfortable while you go back in shape, right?" asked while handing the compiled and signed paper and gaving Rachel an inquisitive look.

Rachel avoided the nurse's eyes and nooded. "Of... Of course" said before grabbing the paper and waddling outside.

Rachel looked victorious at the paper. A big smile between her round cheeks and a greedy light in her eyes. She finally did it! It took her a few months and a lot of pounds, but she finally qualified for SSS! She had to inform Gia. But first, better take a reward at the vending machine, she definitely earned it.
1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.title: New year, new life, new services

choices: "Do you happen to know a woman named Gia Rossellini?"
"You have been trying awfully hard to be placed on SSS... I wonder why that is?"
"Personal. Do you happen to know a woman named Dr. Evie McCarthy?"
1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
It was a few days later when Rachel met with Dr. Schwartz once more.

Like almost everyone else on campus, the small woman had only gotten more plump by the time Rachel saw her. Whereas she had already been quite heavyset, the small psychiatrist had clearly managed to keep herself well-fed. Nothing compared to some of the students, and of course it couldn't hold a candle to Rachel more than doubling her weight in just a year's time, but the needle on the good doctor's scale had managed to climb a good fifty pounds higher than when Rachel first arrived. Surely she had been somewhat chubbier when they had met over HERMIA's initial introduction, but Rachel had hardly noticed it then. Now, Helen Schwartz was getting significantly and undeniably round.

"Rachel, mein gott, it is so good to see you." the chubby blue-haired woman cooed, "Come sit, I called you here for more than just pleasantries, und I would hate for your food to get cold."

You didn't need to tell Rachel Conrad to sit twice. The walk over from one wing to the other wasn't enough to knock her breath away (yet) but it was sure far from her favorite thing to do. After a long day of classes, especially following an entire Summer that she'd spent almost exclusively on her keister, Rachel had been dying to take a load off. She had been happy enough to meet with Dr. Schwartz before learning that her little check-up included an early (perhaps merely first) dinner...

Rachel lowered herself into the office chair without a second thought. A smorgasbord of Mexican food spread wide and inviting across Dr. Schwartz's desk, divvied up clearly between the two of them. Her ample ass had barely touched the cushioned seat before Rachel was already pulling the aluminum container of burritos towards her. She had spent her entire Summer break bulking up with the intention of getting on SSS, and now that she was almost a three-hundred pound chunker, those instincts were hard to turn off...

"Ach, you look so healthy!" Helen bellowed, "Und not so stressed, ja? Is HERMIA helping with that?"

"Like you wouldn't believe." Rachel answered without looking up, her eyes firmly on the food she was harvesting from Helen's order, "She keeps me right on track while I focus on... teaching."

Rachel's chubby hands went right to work on a burrito as thick and round as her arm. Rather, as thick and round as her arm might have been when she arrived. It was so hard for her to register just how big she was getting. It was all happening so fast. It made it all that much easier to justify her increasing need to indulge.

"Of course, teaching." Helen's round face dimpled as she smiled, "Und other things, of course."

"Of course." Rachel answered coolly before biting into a thick hunk of meat, tortilla and red sauce

Though they were around the same weight, Helen and Rachel's attitude towards their little late luncheon couldn't have been more different. Rachel could barely keep herself contained at the spread set out in front of her. She'd been letting her appetite loose all year, the past few months especially so, and this was just one more chance for her to pig out like she'd always dreamed of when she was a diet-conscious teenager. Meanwhile Helen, who had only put on a mere (comparatively) forty or so pounds since the last school year, was much more measured in her appreciation. Measured in all things, naturally, but even her minor increase in girth was far more deliberate than the woman deep-throating a burrito.

"You are enjoying your meal, Rachel?" Helen asked

"Yeah." she answered huskily, "It's... hff... really good, Doc."

Rachel's stomach groaned in protest; it was already quite tight in there. She'd had an especially heavy lunch today, just like every other day, piled on top of a Megan Porter-approved breakfast. Then there was the fact that she'd eaten more than half of the welcome back donuts that had been left in the teacher's lounge. HERMIA kept reminding her of every little sale going on all around campus, almost every time she passed a vending machine. She was eating more and more every day, but it was a necessary evil. It was for her job. For her piece. She was a journalist.

"Good." Helen purred, steepling her chubby fingertips together, "Now, I was wondering if I could talk to you about something..."
1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.title: Jumbo Journalist and a Swelling Psychiatrist

choices: Your friend, Gia Rosselini: we've offered her a job
Our brand new snacks: since you like them so much, we want you to taste them
1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
"Do you happen to know a certain Gia Rossellini?" asked Helen.

Rachel did her best to not be shocked by that question, but was sure that blue-haired psychiatrist had noted something in her reaction, maybe a sudddn movement in her eyes, her jaw that briefly stopped to much only to begin munching faster than before, a drop of sweat... Rachel was sure Helen already knew her answer was "Yes".

"Why do you ask?" replied Rachel. She couldn't deny to personally know Gia, but could've lied about the reason they know eachother. While Helen was answering that question, Rachel could've thought of a good explanation.

The blue-haired woman opened a drawer and picked a folder which she openend and laid in front of Rachel.

"In the past few months, we got quite a few orders from this address, which is Gia Rossellini's home".

"Did she really order three boxes of snacks every week?" thought Rachel while reading the orders in the files. Meanwhile she grabbed another burrito.

"Now, these orders would not be too suspicious," explained Helen, "plenty of people order our snack at home, less so these many. Forgive my lack of humility, but our delivery service iz nothing short of excellent". The plump psychiatrist placed her hands on her round belly while her eyes examined Rachel's face. "We also know you often sneak away some of our products", Rachel grabbed another burrito and proceeded to much even faster, "We once followed where you deliver them, and found Rossellini's address. Now, I wonder, who is this Gia Rossellini and why would you go as far as exporting snacks to her?"

During that explanation, Rachel had found an explanation. "Gia is my long time friend". After hearing the excuse out loud, Rachel realized how lame it was, but there was no going back. "We've been friends since middle school, and she's almost part of my family. So, when she heard about the delicious snacks I eat in this school, she asked me to send her some, since most of them aren't sold in the stores".

"I know, they are exclusive to the school" said Helen coldly. "Yeng and Buttercombe Academy have a very tight contract ensuring as such."

"Usually, sending our products away from school violates the distribution contract that Yeng has carefully set into place with Buttercombe...", explained Helen, Rachel began to sweat as she grabbed some nachos with both her hands and shoved them in her mouth. Even if her stomach was full, Rachel was too nervous to pay attention to it.

Dr. Schwartz stayed silent for a moment, before relaxing her face with a big smile. "But for this time we can close an eye and be generous, only because you are doing a very good job and because you've given us a very valuable customer" said with a laugh. Her belly quivered like a jelly.

Rachel made an awkward laugh. Did it mean she was safe?

"Of course, we'd ask you to never do it again, or next time we won't be so lenient" said Helen with a less joyful tone.

Rachel nooded as she gulped down the nachos. Some cheese dipped on her chin.

"We've also talked with your dear friend, Ms. Rossellini, you know? However, she denied to know you. How is this possible?"

Rachel was panicking again, Helen smirked, that was exactly what she wanted. Play a bit with her toy, just so she could enjoy her job.

"She probably didn't want you to know that I sneaked some Yeng products outside of school. You just said it, it's forbidden" replied Rachel with the first reasonable answet that popped in her mind.

"Yes, of course, this explanation seems pretty reasonable" concluded Helen after a long, poignant pause

"Is that all?" asked Rachel after some moments of silence.

One big smile appeared on Helen's face, touching both her round cheeks. "No, there is one last thing you should know, more specifically about..."
1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.title: Who framed Gia Rossellini?

choices: Investigate SSS Life from a Pro—Rachel slums it with the fattest teachers onsite
Scoop out the rest of the campus—Round up Rio the Rent-a-Cop for a ride!
Free Choice
1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
Rachel had spent the rest of her night in such a tizzy that she barely remembered the drive home. Learning that Gia had been running a cross examination behind her back was one thing, but to hear from Dr. Schwartz that she'd taken a job as a security officer at a Yeng facility along the coast was downright unreal. For all of the talk that Gia had been feeding her about how dangerous Yeng was, she was going to dive headfirst into the fray, and for what?

Did she think Rachel couldn't handle this assignment by herself?

Was everything that she'd worked for going to go up in smoke?

Did she double her weight and get put on this stupid SSS program for nothing?

The overweight undercover reporter was inconsolable, and thanks to all the hard work she'd put in at getting fat, all of her instincts were telling her to eat. And that was precisely what she did.

Rachel came home and tore into the kitchen cabinets. Whatever remained of the groceries that they'd delivered on Monday wouldn't survive this, the latest binge. Any and all of those stupid little snacks that she'd been stuffing herself with went right into her greedy groaning gut. Plastic wrappers filled the trash can and spilled onto the floor as she snacked herself into a stupor. She made herself dinner—a Yeng off-brand substitution for oven-ready pasta—and forced it down on top of her already stuffed stomach.

It wasn't until well into the night, when her burner phone rang, that she rightfully came to her senses.

"Rrurp." she burbled into the speaker, sick to her stomach, "Hello?"

"Rachel—glad to get ahold of you." Gia's dark voice said over the line, "I wanted to talk to you about something."

"Was it the same something that Dr. Schwartz talked to me about?" Rachel said with indignation, "Something about you getting a job at a Yeng Facility out in Georgia?"

"Why would she ask you about me?" Gia said with more anger than concern, "I told her I had no idea who you were."

"Why would you take a job at a Yeng facility in Georgia?!" Rachel asked, shifting on her stomach unsteadily, "And why would you order shit from this school? And why... why didn't you tell me about any of this?"

Gia sighed heavily on the other end of the line, the crinkling of plastic wrapping sounded like static over the phone.

"Did you really think you were the only one on this investigation? Yeng's huge, Rach." Gia said before taking an audible bite, "The lab boys found something fishy in the samples you sent, so I needed more to investigate. Didn't count on them being able to track us down. One thing led to another, I mentioned my time on the Force, and they offered me a job as a security guard. Simple as that."

"Do you think I can't do this?" Rachel asked, very suddenly, "Do you think that I'm not risking my neck out here?"

"For Christ's sake Rachel, you're moving at a snail's pace!" Gia's abrupt, sudden change in volume made anger crawl up the back of Rachel's throat, "You've been there a year, you had a lead on vending machines that went nowhere, you've gotten cornered more than a few times, and you were sloppy enough to get us caught."

"I—"

"Listen, you're doing important work, but you're not going to be the lynchpin in taking down Yeng all by yourself." Gia's voice calmed slightly, though she still spoke gruffly, "This is a huge investigation, and we've got people all over the country... the world probably, working on this. Don't get your panties in a wad because you thought you were the only one taking risks."

"But... who's gonna be my contact?" Rachel asked quietly, almost like a little girl, "I... I'm all alone out here, Gia..."

"I'll still be your contact. It'll just be in my off-time when I'm not at the McCarthy Facility." Gia explained calmly, "That's where most of the equipment that goes to Buttercombe comes from. We managed to get that from your intel. We don't know if it's made there or if it's just designed there, but almost everything you people use up there come from that facility. It's why I took the job."

Silence from Rachel as she felt her anger and frustration melt away into shame.

"Any other pressing matters to discuss?" Gia's eyebrow hook was practically audible, "No? Good."

Rachel had started the night feeling indignant and angry. Like she wasn't being trusted, or that her sacrifices didn't matter. But by the end of that phone call, all Rachel felt was shame. Gia was right, she'd been dragging her feet with this investigation. Getting too caught up in the part of playing a Buttercombe teacher.

Maybe it was time for her to start doing some more detective work...
1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.title: Jarring with Gia

choices: Holly Holiday—Buttercombe teacher of 10 years and an unrepentant fatty!
Megan Porter—her good friend, and the fattest woman in the ELA department!
Go up a level and interview the people on Tier IV
1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
Rachel's formal introduction to the SSS program came with a guide of sorts.

Dr. Fitzpatrick—the woman from before, in the wheelchair—was technically her Sherpa into the larger world of Special Services and Stipendiaries. Whereas Dr. Schwartz acted as a sort of gatekeeper, performing interviews and keeping tabs on those who weren't immediately classifiable, Catherine Fitzgerald's sole responsibility on campus was to manage the thus-far vaguely defined yet impossibly permeated system of privileges, balances, and perks otherwise that went to benefit those who had been placed on the system. However, that being said, that was a large order to fill for any one woman who wasn't as impossibly driven as Dr. Fitzpatrick even without the added weight of one blimping brunette in her sophomore year of teaching. Rachel was officially left to her own devices, as far in as she was given a pamphlet and a very brief explanation of what her new tier of disability services could do for her in the broad sense.

"These services are designed to make things easier for you." Catherine said, leaning over into her desk and emerging with a freshly xeroxed copy of the Tier III pamphlet, "Where we were hesitant to place you on the second tier earlier last semester, it's become a bit more..."

Catherine paused to look Rachel up and down from the other side of the desk. Her soft belly heaved from the walk down the hall, her thick roll of neck fat rising and falling underneath her less and less prominent chin. The young teacher looked so much rounder than the last time she'd seen her, as if someone had blown her up with a hose and turned her into a parade float. It wasn't the first time that something like this had happened, for sure, but for it to occur to quickly—

"Obvious that you require a bit of help in your day to day life." Dr. Fitzpatrick continued after a brief pause, "Feel free to consult me if you have any questions."

The only problem was that Rachel had so many questions. None of which she could ask without immediately painting a target on her forehead. Where were these new perks applicable? What advantages did they bring? How would they impact her life as a teacher? Who else was on this "tier" of SSS, and more importantly, how could she get the code from her bracelet, copy it, and send it off to Gia without either breaking it or alerting everyone that she wasn't exactly the greenhorn teacher that she'd been pretending to be?

Leaving Catherine's office, she felt like she had more questions than answers...

"Hey HERMIA?" Rachel said quietly to the other smart bracelet on her wrist, "You wouldn't happen to have access to the SSS roster, would you?"

A small pause as Dr. Schwartz's AI processed Rachel's request. In the time it took for her assistant to articulate a response, Rachel had grown a bit nervous, but thankful when her artificial voice said:

"I sure do, Rachel." it said in a strugglingly pleasant tone, "There are currently 25 teachers placed on your level of Special Services for Stipendiaries, or SSS for short. Would you like me to list them off to you now?"

"Later, when we get back to the cabin." she said to the device, "...So set a reminder around 7."

"That conflicts with the Italian Extravaganza event scheduled into the Cafeteria Menu. Would you like me to place your reminder after your previous appointment?"

"Yes." Rachel answered all too quickly, "So maybe around... eight?"

A soft digital tone beeped over the swishing of her thighs as they brushed together.

"Reminder set for eight-thirty to read the SSS Tier III Roster."

Satisfied with herself, Rachel's round face smiled as she hurried towards the elevator. Her last class of the day wasn't for another two hours, and her meeting with Dr. Fitzpatrick had gone much quicker than anticipated. This called for a reward, certainly. The cafeteria was closed until dinner hours, but maybe she could swing by the teacher's lounge? Surely there was still something left from lunch, or maybe a sweet in the fridge. Then she could pop by the vending machines on the way back to her classroom, that'd make sure she didn't get too hungry before dinner...

"Mmm..."

A small but husky noise of approval rose from deep in her throat at the thought. One hand rose instinctively to stroke her jutting belly warmly. The thought of her favorite snacks dancing in her head as she rode the high that came with putting in effort at her investigation and, effectively, proving Gia wrong.

She'd ride that high into the teacher's lounge and through no less than three vending machine stops as she trekked across campus, and she wouldn't come down until long after dinner.

***


Rachel would miss the reminder that she set that night, on account of being far too engrossed in her meal plans to pay attention to HERMIA's soft tones meant to alert her. Lost in a basic desire to enjoy herself and get lost in the sea of flavors that only Buttercombe's Culinary Coalition could provide, she could barely hear the voices of her friends with her greedy guts guiding her that night. She'd come home stuffed to the gills, waddling through her doorway belly-first and collapsed on her couch. She remained there for most of the weekend, hardly moving from the well-worn furniture if she could help it.

It wasn't until Sunday night that she remembered the SSS roster, glancing almost blankly at her chunky wrists (more, the tightness of her wristbands) until a flash of realization woke her from her logy lethargy.

"Hey HERMIA?" Rachel asked slowly, "You still have access to the SSS roster?"

Another moment of deliberation, followed by a soft ding.

"I thought you'd never ask!" HERMIA said brightly, "When you failed to respond to your notification, I e-mailed you a copy of the roster."

"Wow." Rachel blinked in disbelief, "Dr. Schwartz said you were handy but—"

"Always happy to help!"

"—Clearly."

It took some doing, but eventually Rachel rocked her way off of the couch. Her stomach, swollen by the weekend's lethargy and blindly binging on whatever was brought to her doorstep by the Cabinside Service crew, hung low to land on her softened thighs. Her most prominent feature besides a rapidly widening face, swelling cheeks, and uncomfortably plush upper-arms, Rachel would often curse at her stomach as it weighed her down on this chair and that. Pinning her on the sofa, or sloshing from side to side when she did even the simplest tasks. But touching the computer desk in her designated office space was met with more quiet resignation—her thoughts far too preoccupied with the list she was reading.

So many of her fellow teachers were on this tier of SSS, some of them she knew.

"So many for weight-related reasons..." Rachel said quietly to herself, "Like that's a shocker..."

If she was going to get an honest answer about SSS and what it did, how it affected the teacher's lives here, she was going to have to pick her sources carefully...

Who should she interview?
1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.title: Investigation, After Dinner

choices: Sarah Walker—600+ lb veteran of Buttercombe Academy
Codi Reuger—the impossibly fat denmother for that WASP sorority
Shiro Fukiyama—wait, the skinny nurse? Does she know she's on here?
1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
"Hm..." Rachel had a thought, one that could only be described as a wild hunch, "Hey HERMIA? How many... levels? Tiers? How far does SSS go up?"

Another pause, then an answer.

"Special Services for Stipendiaries has four tiers. You are currently placed on the third level." the simulated assistant answered helpfully, "Would you like me to e-mail you the list of staff members currently enrolled in the fourth level?"

"Yes, please." Rachel said, struggling to reach for her stash of vending machine snacks kept nearby

The list came a few moments later, and Rachel was shocked with just how many people were placed on this list. Not that it was as inordinately large as the number (or the size) of women placed on the Tier III list—but 12 people were on the fourth tier of SSS, almost all of them exclusively for weight-related reasons.

"There's the headmistress, no surprise there..." Rachel thought back to Ms. Polluck's impossibly round, sagging physique threatening to bust out of those butter-yellow pantsuits, "But I don't think I recognize anyone else on this list..."

Rachel steepled her plush fingertips together.

Who to investigate?
1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.title: Take it up a Tier

choices: Verify the IV tier herself. Rachel needs to gain more...
Investigate more about the school's past
1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
"This Sarah Walker, it looks like she'd been placed in tier IV for the longest among them... I think I could have a talk with her" concluded the reporter.

----

Rachel went to Sarah Walker's dorm, carrying a large box of cupcakes under her arm. If she was going to visit someone who she had never known, better take some kind of gift, and her sixth sense told her that something to eat would've been well appreciated. When she reached the door, the journalist quickly realized it was particularly wider than any average door, but it didn't surprise her much. After all, Sarah must've been even fatter than Rachel's fellow teacher and friend Megan Porter.

Before she could knock, someone tapped her shoulder. Rachel turned around less gracefully than she would've wished due to her bulging belly, and saw a tubby black girl. She was carrying an half dozen of boxes which emanated a delicious aroma.

"Excuse me, I have an urgent delivery, so, if you don't have much more to do apart from gazing the door" said the girl placing an hand on her wide hips.

"Ops, s-sorry" caught by surprise, the journalist moved away. "Actually, I have to go in too. I need to have a talk with my colleague".

"Follow me, then" snorted the girl as she slided a card on the door lock.

The door opened and the girl entered, followed not so silently by the bubbly brunette.

"Here it is! Taiwan special extra-large! Be careful, it's still hot" announced the delivery girl with a tone so friendly and enthusiastic that for Rachel it was like she had suddenly changed personality.

"Finally! I was starving! Leave it here, next to me, as usual" said an husky voice. It came from the bedroom.

Rachel saw the girl quckly jumping in the room and just as quickly quickly leaving it with a pile of empty boxes.

The brunette knocked the door out of education. From the other side, she could hear the sound of munches which barely stopped while the teacher answered.

"What *chomp* is it? *gulp* Did you forget something?" asked the heavy voice.

"No. I'm not the delivery girl, I'm Rachel Conrad. I've been working here for a year" replied the journalist, slightly opening the door.

"What do you want?" snorted Sarah Walker. Said question was followed by the sound of other munches.

"Just a friendly talk between colleagues. I've also brought something to sink the teeth on" replied promptly Rachel while showing off the box of muffin.

Sarah had never been a social person, and years working at Buttercombe had made her even less social, but she was also a very big glutton, and that sweet present made her eager to talk with this coworker. "Come here *munch*"

Rachel opened the door, revealing the fattest person she had ever seen. Sarah was at the very least a houndred pounds heavier than Ms. Polluck, who already weighed more than a quarter ton, but the woman in front of her was absolutely massive. Sitting on what looked like a queen sized bed with a frame made of thick metal bars, the woman was taking up nearly all of it. Dressed in a ridiculously large muumuu, her legs had to be wide open to let her belly flow in front of her, reaching the edge of the matress. Her round face had full cheeks, like that of a chipmunk, with long black hair flowing on her back. Squished against her flabby side, rested the boxes delivered by the girl, probably in a place that Sarah's ham-sized arms could reach.

Rachel had been used to seeing fat women around the school (many of whom fatter than her, much to her relief) and prepared psychologically to meet a tremendously fat woman, or would've made such a face that the titanic woman would've probably been too offended to talk with her. Instead of overreacting, the bubbly brunette handed the muffin boxes to Sarah and sat on a two-seats iron chair, next to a desk, covered with papers, presumably homeworks, and crumbs.

Sarah was busy filling that large gut of her, making hard for Rachel to start a conversation. "Nice room, isn't it?"

The gigantic woman gulped down two cupcakes before answering. "Well, I do spend most of the time here, so I can't complain, but it definitely is".

"If you rarely leave your dorm, how do you have lessons?"

"By live-cam" replied Sarah pointing at a large pad on the bedside table. "The school provided it to me once I got a tier upgrade".

"The school really does take care of us" commented Rachle, looking at her own belly. "When did you get the upgrade?"

"When my old bed began to creak a bit too much" replied Sarah before shoving in her mouth the two last cupcakes.

"No wonder she got that fat" thought Rachel. That woman had gotten so big she was breaking reinforced furniture.

"And what does this tier IV consist of?" asked the brunette.

"Mostly *munch* in furniture more suited for *burp* me. A bonus of multiple free deliveries *gulp* every day, plus three *chomp* full meals in case I *munch* don't want to leave the room".

Rachel took note of everything.

"What was the school like when you just began teaching here? "

----

Afterward, Sarah started to talk less and eat more, becoming much less friendly in the process. Presumably, once the gift was fully eaten, that whale of a woman didn't want to be bothered anymore, so Rachel left after gaining some few more infos. Apparently, the SSS program has begun around 15 years before to satisfy some students' particular needs, but had become too expensive for the school, which began the partnership with Yeng to get the necessary fundings. That was a good start, and Rachel knew what she had to do next...

1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
Rachel knew what she had to do next. Before parting, Sarah Walker mentioned her sister 'Jenny Benny' and her journalist brain immediately brought up a name. Jennifer? The teacher who made her name well over a decade ago, during that controversy over Culinary Education? Rachel recalled it well since the spillover directly influenced her high school years. All the insults the poor teacher had to endure for publicly saying that a Culinary teacher was primarily a taste-tester, not a cook…

What was the woman doing these days? She could be even better informed than Sarah. And perhaps she wouldn't have her nose so deep in the Yeng trough? A quick, innocuous search on the net found that Jenny Walker had established herself as an educational consultant, her web page complete with her current address and phone number. Rachel was about to call her when she paused. She definitely did not want to draw more attention to herself. This required thorough preparation.

When a free hour came up the next day, Rachel set out of her cabin, her golf cart fully loaded with consumables of all sorts. If anyone asked, she was going to have a picnic at one of those huge deserted meadows which made up most of the campus. She also conveniently 'forgot' HERMIA and all other electronic devices at home, except for her burner phone.

Rachel drove to a small copse, parked in its shade and hidden amongst the trees she dialled the number she noted down the day before. And waited… and waited. She unwrapped and bit into her first cupcake before someone finally answered her call.

“Walker Education Consultancy, *huff,* Jennifer Walker speaking.” The voice sounded husky, even heavier than her sister's.

“Ah, hello, Ms. Walker, this is Rachel Conrad,” she decided to use her real name so she could claim innocence if anyone traced it back to her. After all, she was only inquiring for her own good, right? “I was wondering if you could give me a bit of a personal advice. You see, I've been teaching at the Buttercombe Academy and…”

“Oh, really? How wonderful! How's Ms. Polluck, is she still there? Have you met my sister?”

“Uh, yes, she is, she's, well, good, I think. And yes, I have, that's how I came across your name, you sister's mentioned you and…”

“I see, I see. Well, tell her I send my regards and that she should get in touch more often. So…” the woman chomped down on something before continuing: “They're treating you well, I hope?”

Sounds coming from the phone inspired Rachel to reach for another cupcake. “Oh, yeah, sure. They are treating me extremely well, that's actually why I am calling. See, I have been placed on the 'Special Services for Stipendiaries' programme recently and it's amazing but I've begun to wonder how did the Yeng connection come to be? I'm suddenly surrounded with their top-notch technology and it's a little uncanny, frankly.”

Jenny barked out a short laugh. “Oh, I get you, believe me. I really get you. Uh, as to how it started, well, there was some kind of scandal that Yeng was involved in, those fifteen, maybe sixteen years ago. Possibly even seventeen? Doesn't matter anyway, you won't find about it on the net nowadays. Heck, you wouldn't find much even back then. Still, the corporation was pretty badly hit by the public backlash and tried to improve its image by various deals with schools and hospitals, offering assistance and know-how…”

“I see but what's that got to do with Buttercombe exactly?”

“Well, I was completely new here, I wasn't privy to the deal they struck. But Shannon, erm, Ms. Polluck used to be pretty sharp and quick on her feet so it wouldn't surprise me if she used their weakness to milk Yeng for all it was worth. I do know that we got a real sweet deal out of it in my second year there- or was it third?- and you've been living off it ever since.”

Rachel's thoughts backtracked to what Jenny said earlier. “Did you say a scandal? What kind of a scandal was it?”

“Ah, well, I shouldn't be spreading gossip and I know nothing specific, sorry about that. All's been forgiven anyway. Ms. Fukuda was instrumental in revamping Yeng's reputation.”

“That was before she became our Vice Principal, right?” Another cupcake disappeared in Rachel's hungry mouth.

“Oh, sure. She arrived at Buttercombe much later. I'm not actually sure when exactly she took over since I was long gone by that time. I think Shannon was getting too, uh, tired to handle everything herself so Fukuda was sent to help with running the school, part-time at first until eventually they made her post official. Naturally.”

“Ah, right. Naturally.” That did not quite explain why Fukuda came to Buttercombe in the first place. However, Jennifer's changing tone in her last two answers told Rachel she shouldn't be pushing her luck. “Well, thanks. That's actually a lot more information than I needed. I just wanted to get a feel for what I'm getting into, see?”

“Ah, understandably. You said you're on the SSS now? Well, enjoy its perks, believe me, it's worth it.”

“Ah, yeah, I will. I already do, in fact. Thanks a lot and goodbye.” Rachel ended the call shaking and bathed in cold sweat. After months of coddled existence at Buttercombe, both the encounter with dr. Schwartz and now this call reminded her what a gamble she was taking. Now her entire body felt sticky, the shakes made her blouse creep up and reveal her bottom tyre…

“I need a shower,” decided Rachel. However, as she leaned forward to start the cart, her hips brushed one of her two full picnic baskets. This reminder made her switch her priorities. “After I have my snack.”

With a bit of a struggle, she unzipped her tight skirt and started filling her belly. Her fears slowly receded as she ate, replaced with the familiar feeling of contentment. Her stomach inched forward on her thick thighs and Rachel's priorities reshuffled again. “HERMIA, how much time do I have till my next-? Oh. Well, never mind. I can get back to snooping tomorrow.”

1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
Not long after she had finished her phone call with Rachel, the woman on the other end of the line—ostensibly Jennifer Walker, Buttercombe veteran and privatized educational consultant—made another phone call. She took a momentary pause from her herculean lunch (the perks of such an easy façade for sure!) and dialed the Vice Principal of Buttercombe Academy, one Dr. Fukuda Hinamizawa.

“You have reached Dr. Hinamizawa.” Fukuda answered the tone from her electronic speaker curtly, “How may I assist you?”

“Hello, this is Destiny Richards, branch Y-44, South Carolina.” the woman Rachel had spoken to said in a much different, slightly deeper tone. Her natural voice. “I just received a phone call from one of your employees about Jennifer Walker.”

Fukuda had been in the middle of her own lunch—one much more modest than her employee’s, but still somewhat rich by her standards. She put her fork down and dabbed at her lips calmly with a napkin, wiping away any residue and smudging her lipstick slightly. She placed her fork to the side, pushed her plate that much further back, and cleared her throat.

“Did you now?”

Fukuda’s face remained as chiseled and stone-cold as always, but with the added interest of an eyebrow piqued in curiosity. She reached forward, her slight tummy bunching underneath her purple blouse, and picked up the receiver to her phone.

“And, Destiny, when did you receive this phone call?”

“Two minutes ago.” The woman said into the vice principal’s ear before not very audibly taking another bite from the cupcake she’d set aside to make her phone call, “First time in months that anyone’s actually called this number.”

“All the more reason to keep this line in service, Mrs. Richards.” Fukuda kicked her leg over her knee, “You were right to call me so soon—did they ask anything in particular that you feel would be beneficial for me to know about?”

“She was asking about Yeng’s involvement with Buttercombe Academy.” The heavy voice panted slightly, leaning forward at such a size could be quite taxing, “She wanted to know about SSS, specifically.”

“And you didn’t break character.” It was more of a command on Fukuda’s part than a question

“Of course not. I hit all the key phrases.” The sound of rustling plastic and meaty arms plunging into bags of chips, “Sister, time-frame of employment, Polluck. I told her to enjoy SSS without revealing sensitive deemed outside of the character’s grasp.”

Fukuda’s seniors had been overly skeptical of her tenacity in ensuring that this particular loose end was covered up. It had been a very long time since Jennifer Walker was important in the eyes of the press, but the odd phone call, usually those attempting to dig up a scandal that had long been buried, only served to justify the need for Destiny Richards—a suitable stand-in for the Walker woman, at least over the phone. By keeping a small off-books allowance set aside to hire a professional voice actress indefinitely (compared to some of the extraordinary expenses that Yeng could burn through, yes, keeping Destiny on the side for as many years was very small) they could ensure that whenever anyone wanted to look up Jennifer Walker, Yeng would know about it.

Destiny Richards had been Jen Walker professionally for more than ten years now, and it was an arrangement that had benefitted everyone involved. Through extensive voice coaching and a thorough psychological evaluation of the original, with help from Dr. Schwartz, Destiny Richards was so convincing as Jennifer Walker that even her sister Sarah couldn’t tell them apart during their now rare phone conversations. As the years went on, it was reassuring to know that Fukuda had chosen a voice actress so committed to the role.

“Very good, Mrs. Richards.” Fukuda smiled, “I will be sure that your great efforts do not go unrewarded.”

The sound of eating on the other end of the line became more blatant. A happy, guttural noise sounded from deep within her voluminous body. Fukuda picked up on it and smirked.

“Now, Mrs. Richards.” Fukuda said, still smiling, “I am afraid that you have contacted me during my lunch, so I must be going.”

“Same.” The voice said thickly into the speaker

“But before I hang up the phone…” Fukuda switched legs, kicking one triumphantly over the other, “Which of my employees was it that called you?”

***


Dr. Fitzpatrick was also not coincidentally eating lunch, although she had the added benefit of Dr. Schwartz’s company.

They did this often—they were very good friends. Despite the fact that their personalities could clash at times, Catherine and Helen shared a mutual love of many things. The small amount of German that Catherine remembered from college did well to endear her to the school’s counsellor, and the reverse was true in Helen’s ability to tell wonderful stories that kept her on the edge of her seat. The fact that they both worked for Buttercombe Academy—more specifically, that they both worked for Yeng—had nothing to do with their mutual respect and admiration for one another.

It did, however, make it convenient for Dr. Hinamizawa at time s when she needed both women in her audience.

After Catherine had buzzed her in electronically, Fukuda had invited herself in. Standing rigidly where the wheelchair-bound doctor sat, and the now nearly three-hundred-pound counsellor had nestled herself comfortably on the loveseat, she would admit to feeling at least somewhat uncomfortable. As rigid as she was… it was lunch time.

“Doctor.” Fukuda said to the two of them

“Doctor.” Catherine nodded

“Doktor.” Helen steepled her fingers over her belly

“I am here to discuss Rachel Conrad.” Fukuda gripped her orange-trimmed file-folder—a visual denotation of which classification of asset Conrad had been assigned—and stared down the bridge of her nose at her two seated colleagues, “She has been asking questions about Jennifer Walker.”

“Rachel Conrad?” Fitzpatrick made a face, “The new English teacher who gained about a hundred pounds?”

“Ahundertfünfzig.” Helen corrected, “Ah, A hundred und fifty to be precise.”

“She’s a complete ditz.” Catherine turned back to the burrito that Helen had brought her, dismissing Fukuda almost entirely, “Why would she be asking about Jennifer Walker? She would have been a preteen when all of that happened.”

“Well, there is no denying that it was in fact her who placed the phone call.” Fukuda said sternly, placing the file on Catherine’s desk to reveal all of the notes that had been made about her just since the school year had started, “And while there were some minor discrepancies with her conduct previously—her late nights, frequent mailing of packages, and the recent business with one Gia Rossellini, whom we have under servaillance in Y-43—I believe that there is no denying that Ms. Conrad is certainly not here to teach our students.”

Helen and Catherine exchanged looks. The two of them had worked with Rachel far more than their superior had. The two of them knew first-hand that Rachel wasn’t exactly subtle about her desire to be placed on SSS. First there was the bogus HAS claim, and then she seemed to be intentionally gaining weight to be placed on Tier III of the program. This wouldn’t have been the first time a faculty member had done such a thing in the name of receiving a few added bonuses, but it had been precisely these concerns that had kept Catherine from green-lighting Rachel’s admission last year.

Helen had, of course, worked with her the most. And she had also developed her own opinions on the matter. She was a psychiatrist—profiling people was exactly what she was supposed to be doing, after all. However, she had kept quiet on the matter of HERMIA.

That card was going to come into play later, when she was ready.

“I see.” Helen grunted as she rolled into a less reclined position, “So you think Rachel is not what she claims to be.”

“I think that at this point, it is undeniable.” Fukuda said with a grave face

“This is ridiculous, the woman is a complete airhead.” Catherine said dismissively as she readied her knife and fork, “Even if she did research Jen Walker, I’m sure that actor you hired satisfied her well enough.”

“Ach! I love Destiny!” Helen chirped, “She was the perfect choice and I loved her work—she was my first choice for Frau Walker!”

“Nevertheless.” Fukuda said sternly, “We must take precautionary action. I would much rather be wrong and have overreacted than correct and unprepared."

There was a slight pause between the three of them. Despite the fact that they were well and cozy on Yeng’s payroll, only Fukuda had any official authority between the three of them. Catherine had some pull due to her accident and Helen was… scary. But by and large, Fukuda was not only the person with the necessary firepower to get the ball rolling, she was also the only person convinced that Rachel was going to be much of a threat.

“So…” Catherine said with a mouthful of burrito, “What do you suggest?”

"We take care of the problem." Fukuda said, her shoulders squared and her eyes narrowed, "If Rachel Conrad wants to know about SSS, then we will give her all the experience on the matter she can handle."

Fukuda scratched something on Rachel's file and pushed it towards Dr. Fitzpatrick, making her eyes widen.

"And then some."

1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
Despite its prestige, the beginning of every school year at Buttercombe Academy was just like any other school. It was a lot of shuffling around, with teachers scrambling just as much as their students were to remember their schedules, plan out their days, and trying to figure out the most efficient way to get their jobs done while also leaving enough room to enjoy themselves. Rachel had thought, at the beginning of her first year, that it was just her—the stress of her real job, combined with what amounted to very little familiarity with teaching.

Even still, though the concrete hadn’t dried so to speak, somehow this seemed a bit excessive.

Rachel Conrad had come home from her third day of class to find a small U-Haul outside of her cabin, loading up anything that hadn’t come stock in the home they’d provided for her. Clothes, her computer, everything up to and including the fake diploma that Gia had made for her was slowly being lugged into the trailer behind a black truck by several beefy looking guys.

And in that moment, Rachel was sure that she had been caught.

Her heartrate jumped, pounding in her chest and beating loud behind her ears. Everything except the sharp hum of adrenaline faded away as she wobbled out of her golf cart and huffed right up to the moving van.

“Hey!” Rachel shouted, waving her arms, “HEY!!”

Heads turned, slightly, but no one stopped doing their jobs. However, ahead did poke out from behind her doorway. Short curly blonde locks bobbed excitedly as a rather petite woman—lithe around the waistline, a rarity around here—practically bounced down the two porch steps and hurried up to greet her.

“Hi!” she said in a voice that sounded much too deep for a pixie like her, “My name’s Marcia—Marcia Flannagan; I’m the housing director of—”

“What is going on?!” Rachel said in one exasperated breath, “They’re… moving! They’re moving me! All of my stuff—”

“Is being relocated to another, larger, better cabin located right—” the small woman came up to about chest-high on Rachel, and she got closer she pointed a pen down the small paved road that went up along the neighborhood, “Up there. It’s another ten minutes or so to drive, but I’m sure that—”

“What the actual hell?” Rachel puffed up to the smaller woman, her shoulders broad and her chest inflated. She could eat this little shit. “I didn’t ask to have all my stuff rifled through!”

“Now Ms. Conrad, please, calm down. Nobody ‘rifled’ through anything.” Marcia said with what she had hoped to have been a soothing hand on the shoulder that quickly got batted away, “We’re expecting an influx of specialty teachers flown in for the Foreign Languages department, and it’s a lot cheaper and more efficient to—”

“Just move me without telling me?”

Marcia rolled her eyes and put her slender arms on her narrow hips. Pursing her lips and raising her eyebrow, she waited patiently as Rachel descended into a (worry-filled) rampage.

That being said, Rachel’s freakout was much more justified from her stance. Yeng paid for everything around here, and Rachel had no doubt in her mind that Yeng, the very company she was investigating, had bankrolled her moving.

“Are we finished?” she asked with a click of her tongue as Rachel stopped to catch her ragged breath, “Good. Now we’re running a bit behind schedule—we’d had hoped to meet you at the south gate to tell you about the move after it had already happened. But if you’ll give us five minutes we’ll have everything in the back in two shakes of a lamb’s tail.”

“What… what?” Rachel panted

“Go inside, say buh-bye to your old tiny cabin, and then hope in your cart so we can scoot off to your new home, huh?”

Tiny red heels (now that Rachel could take a minute to see it, this woman was short!) clicked against the pavement as she went over to discuss matters with what had to be the moving foreman. Rachel leaned against her cart and parked her fat butt back in the seat to catch her breath. And to think.

Okay, she’d brought her tablet with her to class in her bag—including the usb drive that had all of her notes on it. The data extractor that Gia had sent back was in her right tennis shoe for running (not so good for running these days, but an excellent hiding spot!) and everything else was taken care of. She had HERMIA, she had her bracelet, but she was missing something…

The burner phone.

The off-grid burner phone that she contacted Gia with—it was her only way of contacting her without running the risk of their conversations being dropped in on! She’d left it in the bottom drawer on the right side of the desk in her office. If she left it behind, there was no way that she’d be able to replace it—at least not easily. It’d be months before another phone like that could come her way, if ever. What’s worse was that all of her calls with Gia, a woman whom she had officially no connection with as per her interrogation with Dr. Schwartz, were logged on it. Oh it didn’t get much worse than this…

“Wait!” Rachel called out to Marcia as she passed by the front of her cart, “Did you… I need to get something out of my desk.”

“Oh, sweetie. We’re very efficient.” Marcia clicked her pen, “We emptied out every nook and cranny and we put it all in a box for ya.”

“You… you did.” Rachel felt her heart skip a beat.

“Anything that didn’t really seem to have a home, we’ll put in your bedroom once it’s set up.” The little woman said with a smile that Rachel couldn’t help but interpret as sinister, “Don’t worry, everything will be there. They don’t pay us to be sloppy!”

Okay this got so much worse.

***


It had actually taken about ten more minutes to get everything loaded up, five more minutes than Marcia had said. Of course, it could have been another five years and it would have felt just as long to her. Rachel had been slowly, very quietly undergoing a meltdown as she tore herself to bits over whether or not that burner phone was still going to be there. If they missed it, or worse yet, if they found it. Rachel had no idea if her cover was blown, but odds were that a mysterious non-traceable phone would certainly raise suspicions.

She was so freaked out that she wasn’t hungry—coming home from a long day of teaching usually left the poor woman starved. But as the ever-eating ELA teacher pressed her gut against the steering wheel that she white-knuckled, it couldn’t manage so much as a grumble. Her nerves were fried. She needed to know if that phone was still going to be there when she pulled up to her new cabin. She needed to know if her cover was blown.

The moving truck (Marcia had ridden with the movers) pulled up into the cart-sized driveway, backed out, and allowed Rachel to pull in with her cart. By the time she put weight on her wobbly knees, the men were already busy moving everything into her new—much less humble—abode.

“It’s big, isn’t it?” Marcia said with no small amount of pride, “I worked pre-tty hard to score you this baby.”

“What?” Rachel asked for what felt like the millionth time in thirty minutes

“Well, normally they reserve things like this for the teachers that have been here a while.”

Marcia held out a hand for Rachel to take (more customary than anything else, Rachel now outweighed this woman twice over) as she exited the cart slowly. In front of them was a sizable improvement from the somewhat dinky living space (and increasingly so as Rachel doubled in size over the course of last year) that she’d been living in since day one of her investigation.

Her new cabin looked to be, and upon inspection on the inside, certainly was much bigger. The living room was more than just a couch and a television set, but also included an office setting and large empty bookcase. The kitchenette had graduated to a full kitchen (and in true Buttercombe fashion, the large appliances made an unsurprising comeback). The hallways were wider and the rooms were bigger. Her bedroom (when not occupied by hurried movers placing her clothes back on the rack in her closet) had enough room for a queen sized bed, another television along the wall, and a desk sitting at the window. All with enough room for her to wriggle her wide behind through without any trouble.

“So?” Marcia said proudly, “Feeling silly for being so worked up earlier?”

Better still, Rachel saw the opaque white box that had been left on her bed first-thing by the movers. And distinctive burgundy color of her burner phone was right there in the corner.

“So great.” Rachel puffed, “I mean, yes, really silly. I’m sorry I doubted you.”

“They always are.” Marcia said with a smile, her ruby rips spread wide at the thought of another bonus coming her way, “Now if you’ll just come with me…

         “I’m not sure I like the idea of people coming in to refill the thing without me asking…” Rachel said, nervously.

         “We won’t. Pneumatic tubes under the floorboard. You won’t even have to think about it.”

         “Huh..that’s convenient.” Rachel said, her hand unconsciously shifting to her stomach.

         “Now I just need to finish setting up the refrigerator and the Watanagashi Automated Kitchen.” Marcia explained, heading to the futuristic kitchen where a multi-armed, spider like robot lurked, fixed to the kitchen counter. Marcia turned on the fridge, and started the installation process, while Rachel looked at the Automated Kitchen nervously.

         "That's...Odd." Marcia muttered. Her brow furrowed in confusion.

         "Odd how?" Rachel asked, growing increasingly impatient with the woman who had forceably moved her today, and now was refusing to leave.

         "It's never done this before..." On the little display of the fridge a new image had replaced the menu. A bright glowing scepter, with a pair of snakes repeatedly climbing up and down it.

         A message displayed at the bottom, one letter at a time.

S Y N C I N G

         "Syncing, but what's it syncing to? It's a fridge!" Marcia asked.

         "I am currently synced to this refrigerator, the television, the lights, the heating and air conditioner, the sound system, the dishwasher, the Watanagashi Automated Kitchen, the Recliner and Ms. Conrad's wrist mounted device."

         Marcia jumped back when the fridge answered her rhetorical question. After she realized the strange voice came from the sound system, and not someone sneaking up on her, she resumed her investigation of the Fridge.

         “But why would a fridge need to sync to all those devices?” She asked.

“It would not.” The Fridge answered.

Rachel though, had already figured out the answer to Marcia’s search. “It’s not the fridge. It’s HERMIA.”

1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
Once the doorbell comunicated the end of the lessons, Rachel hurried home as fast as her kart and her waddle would allow it. Since moving into the fancy new dorm, the brunette loved spending her time at home, often without moving from the wonderful recliner armchair, her "magic throne". Rachel sat on her usual place, on which her butt had left a large print and the recliner, with HERMIA's voice, spoke:

"Welcome back, Ms. Conrad. I have some chocolate and mint biscuits" and the snack dispenser, filled to the brim with biscuits, rose to Rachel's armreach. "Would you like something else?"

"Biscuits is fine" replied the brunette picking one. "But something salty with these sweets won't hurt".

"Here's some doritos, your favorites" replied readily the voice as another snack dispenser from the other side of the armchair rose. Filled to brim with doritos. Rachel grabbed an handful of them and shove it into her mouth.

"HERMIA, can you prepare me a lesson for second year class for tomorrow? And a test for first year class for the next week?" asked with her mouth still full of chips. Orange crumbs rolled inside her cleavage.

"Sure! And remember today there's the Super Spaghetti Special at dinner" replied the voice.

"Thanks for remembering it" replied Rachel.

During the last couple of weeks, Rachel had spent most of the time secluded in her dorm, in which HERMIA provided her everything she needed and wanted, meals included (heck, especially meals) thanks to the new high tech kitchen and its brand new appliances which, under HERMIA's control, could make entire courses for the hefty teacher. It couldn't make dishes too complicated, but Rachel wasn't very picky for her food, especially since she ate mostly snacks. Every once in a while, she still went to the cafeteria, partially to still have some kind of social life and spend time with her colleagues and partially for the special meal events the school makes at least once per week.

Without even asking for it, the chair reclined and begin vibrating on its own, without having Rachel asking for it. She had asked it many times, HERMIA must have learnt what Rachel likes over the days. The tubby woman closed her eyes a moment to relax, her fat rippling from the vibration of the armchair.

At first, the bubbly brunette was scared of the idea of an AI controlling her entire dorm, however, in the successive weeks, HERMIA never did anything suspicious and proved to be very helpful for the increasingly lazy reporter. After less than a month since moving in, and Rachel didn't know how she could have done before.

"Can you turn the tv, please?" asked Rachel before eating another handful of doritos.

The tv turned on. There was a culinary program, during which a baker was making a Sacher cake. It made Rachel even more hungry, and ate more voraciously the biscuits. The snack dispenser constantly refilled before Rachel could scrap the bottom. She also noticed that her belly had... rosen and was almost reaching the bottom of the tv screen. Maybe she needed to cut down with the snacks, she didn't need to gain anymore... Maybe after this one last snack.

Rachel was enjoying her new perks, unaware of the hidden cameras inside her dorms, from which Helen Schwartz was monitoring her.

The blue-haired woman giggled satisfied, everything was going according to her plan. Like the others, she wasn't sure if Rachel was a spy or not but, just in case, she had devised a perfect plan: with HERMIA controlling everything in Rachel's new dorm and pampering the teacher, they will gain Rachel's good side. As an expert psychiatrist, Helen understood clearly Rachel's personality: she likes success, but isn't an hard worker, she prefer comforts. But now that they're giving her all of the comforts she could ask for, Rachel would never betrays the school, and instead would be a friendly teacher like many others, while a nice toy for Helen to play with...

"If only Evie could see what I'm doing to this girl. She would go crazy" commented the blue haired woman munching some nachos. Seeing Rachel gorging had always made Helen hungry.

Meanwhile, inside the screen on Dr. Schwarts's desk, Rachel was gulping down some newly made sandwiches. Making some extras which Rachel didn't ask for was also a strategy to break her initiativity and make the woman even more demanding.

Schwartz gulped down the taco. "I'm going to have a lot of fun with you" purred while gently stroking the screen with a finger.

Eventually, Rachel decided that it was too risky to call Gia in her cabin.

That didn’t mean that she was exactly chomping at the bit to do so. Even in the short amount of time that she’d been enrolled at this Academy, her brain had more or less been rewired to always take the easy route. And he easy route was to, consistently, come home after classes and collapse into a little pile in front of the television while eating snacks.

“I’ll do it tomorrow.”

“Thursday’s really better for her, I should do it then.”

“Oh but it’s the weekend and I have so much stuff to do…”

The thought of leaving the comfort of her cabin was honestly the most unappealing part of it. She wasn’t willing to throw the investigation under the bus for the sake of her own comfort. But everything here was so cozy and she hardly had any reason to leave the comfort of her own home aside from classes. Who even went outside anymore? Rachel had managed to sweet-talk herself into putting off a simple phone call with Gia for almost a week before she finally buckled down.

And then, of course, she immediately regretted it.

Rachel had never been an “outdoor girl” to start with. She may have liked skulking around for investigations, but she would have been a much happier woman if there had simply been no outside to begin with. With the bugs and the air and the heat. Yuck. Rachel had come a long way from her humble upbringing, and her desire to get indoors and stay there had been a primary motivator.

So when you add a two hundred pounds weight gain and soft, supple muscles that had atrophied from being carried everywhere by her sturdy, trusty and at-times worryingly overloaded cart, Rachel barely stood a chance!

She looked ridiculous—a great big fat woman, carrying a comically small picnic basket and a large blanket to sit on. She was toddling along, puffing and sweating after mere minutes of being exposed to the Autumn sun. It was one of the early days of October, the Summer heat having more or less faded, and poor Rachel Conrad still felt like she was going to keel over from mild discomfort.

A great belly swung in front of her as she lifted her hammy legs one after the other. It bobbed and weaved expertly, like a boxer in the ring of her too-tight elastic waistband, and eeked its way out inch by inch in all of its pale fleshy glory. Every so often she stopped, wheezing, and tugged the crotch of her leggings up a bit in hopes of sheathing the thing. But every few steps, there it went again…

“I hate this…” Rachel whined, “I’m so fucking huge…”

It hadn’t stopped her from pilfering her picnic basket early. Not even halfway to where she was intending on parking that big round butt of hers and her “lunch” was already almost gone. She’d snacked on the ride over, her way out the door… honestly, Rachel had been eating pretty much since she woke up this morning!

“Gotta start jogging or something…” she puffed, wiping thick sweat from her brow with one jiggly arm, “Can’t afford to get too big…”

By the time she’d finally reached the spot that had pinged as out of the way as possible, Rachel was a mess. Her thighs were blotchy and red, having rubbed their way through her newest leggings. She was sweating down every crevice and every fold, and she couldn’t seem to catch her breath. To top it off—apparently the mosquitos hadn’t quite gotten the message about the season change. She’d been getting poked and prodded by those little bastards since she waddled out the front door!

“Huff… huff…” she gasped, throwing the emptied basket down and readying her blanket in a half-assed attempt to keep the ants off of her meaty backside, “Jesus… Christ…”

Rachel plopped down with fury and thunder, her entire form quaking with impact. She steadied herself—one hand placed firmly on the gelatinous gut that wobbled uncontrollably between her legs. God, she was getting so big. The SSS program was an important part of her investigation, but she wasn’t exactly keen on relying on it for basic things like getting around. If her investigation wasn’t over soon, Rachel honestly felt like she was going to have to be rolled out of this school…

Swatting at a mosquito that had dared to graze her cheek, Rachel pulled out the burner phone from underneath one of her melon-sized tits. It was damp with sweat, even as she placed it against her ear.

While the phone rang, Rachel chomped excessively on her last granola bar…

“Gia?” she whispered hoarsely, both from lack of breath and in hopes of outwitting any surveillance equipment nearby, “Sorry I haven’t called. I think my apartment’s been bugged…”

Gia...
