1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
“Bugged?”

The other end of the line was muffled with the telltale sound of ragged breathing. Rachel winced as she pulled the phone a half an inch further away from her ear as she battled against the sound of Gia’s wheezing. Of course, the one time she’d gotten to call her lead, it would be at a bad time.

“What do you… hff… mean it’s been…”

Gia could barely seem to make the sentence out, frighteningly out of breath. Her speech seemed to stop entirely for the briefest of pauses before an audible impact, followed by a deep exhale.

“What do you mean it’s been bugged?” she said, still sounding exhausted, “Rachel, have you been compromised?”

“No, no, I just… I can’t make phone calls in my cabin anymore.” Rachel made a face of concern as she weighed Gia’s windlessness against her own, “They moved me into a new one—Gia are you okay? You’re puffing like a chimney.”

“Yeah, m’just… phew… l’il out of breath.” Gia gasped, taking another pause (presumably to take a drink of water) before smacking her lips into the phone, “Just got done with my rounds, back to my car.”

“What do they have you doing over there?” Rachel asked, scratching at the already swelling mosquito bites on her thick calve, “Like cop stuff?”

“I wish.” Gia puffed breathlessly, “Most days I’m on guard duty—I sit on my ass all day and scan keycards of the staff that go in and out of the facility.”

“Sounds fun.” Rachel unpacked a small bag of chips that had been rattling around in her mostly empty picnic basket instinctively, “Can you copy the codes or whatever? Get into some private areas?”

“I’m working on it. Everyone gets a new code each month, so the lab boys are trying to rig up one that doesn’t expire.” Gia took another drink, “But they’ve only let me out of the Box like three times so far. I’ll be lucky to get one shift a week where I can go as deep as I need to.”

A not-so-small part of Rachel wanted to say ‘ha, told you so!’ It wasn’t all that easy going undercover on-site in a Yeng facility! These people were crazy prepared and super cautious. All the grief that Gia had been giving her about dragging her feet felt just a little bit unfounded, which made Rachel feel just a smidge better about her investigative skills. Never mind the fact that Gia had had her job for a fraction of the time that Rachel had had hers.

The blimping brunette shifted on her copious amounts of butt blubber, her vast figure wriggling and rolling as she made herself more comfortable in the span it took to catch Gia up to speed. She told her everything—the new cabin, the automated kitchen, and how HERMIA had synced to everything in the house almost immediately.

“Who’s Hermia?”

“The assistant that Dr. Schwartz gave me.” Rachel smacked her lips, salt granules stuck to her puffy pink face, “It’s super convenient.”

“You kept that thing?” Gia scoffed, “I would have tossed it in the garbage—what if it’s listening to you right now, Rachel?”

“Relax, I left her at home. And I never say anything too incriminating when I’m there, or wearing the wristwatch.” Rachel wiped her face, “Besides, she’s been programmed with some pretty basic teaching essentials—I basically couldn’t do my job without her.”

“Ugh, I knew I should have put you undercover as like a secretary or something.” Gia groaned, “This is taking too long.”

Rachel couldn’t have agreed more. This was taking forever, and she felt like she’d done absolutely nothing to contribute to the investigation. Aside from getting put on SSS, every lead she’d had wound up as a dead end. So basically, all she’d managed to do was get really fucking fat.

“That HERMIA thing.” Gia asked suddenly, taking Rachel out of her thoughts, “Do you think you could send it to me?”

“Hermia?” Rachel repeated, “I don’t know, Gia… I kinda like having her around…”

“A copy, Rachel.” Gia growled, “Maybe if it can sync up with all of the Yeng technology up there, it can do the same down here, and I’ll be able to get some answers on my end.”

“You don’t think that’ll raise some eyebrows?” Rachel winced, “I mean, what if Dr. Schwartz—”

“Send me a copy of the program. Use the Data Extractor I sent you. You remember, right?” Gia bulldozed through, “Is that clear?”

“We’re clear.” Rachel curdled at Gia’s police academy training, “Anything else you want me to tackle while I’m up here?”

“Actually there is—a lot of tech that’s made up there comes from this site, and I want to get some detailed specs on it. Do you have that camera we sent you with?”

Rachel thought, long and hard, about where that camera might have wound up. With the move and everything, it could have been anywhere. Admittedy, Rachel had been a little more concerned with her dietary habits than her organizational skills lately. Her cabin was kind of a wreck…

“I can find it.”

“You can find it.” Gia’s eyeroll was practically audible “Well, when you find it, I want you to take pictures of something called the XLR-8.”

“Accelerate?” Rachel repeated in confusion, “There’s not a lot of acceleration going on up here, Gia.”

“I figured. But since most of the tech goes up there to be tested first before being released to the public, I don’t have a clue what you’ll be looking for. All I know is…”

“I want you to find something called the XLR-8. All I know is that it's supposed to be some kind of souped-up mobility scooter, a weird-looking one probably. So move your fat butt, look around, find one, take pictures of it and send them to me. Don't call me until then, lazybone.”

Gia's words echoed in Rachel's mind as she cursed her undercover partner. Gia was one to talk about laziness! She'd had to brave mosquitoes and bugs and… and ticks and God knows what else to contact the woman and this was how she repaid her?!

But her tantrum did not last long. Growls soon reminded Rachel just how long she was sitting on her blanket with an empty basket. She ran her fingers along the bottom for crumbs, found only some ants. After a moment idly wondering what they might taste like, Rachel's anger refocused. She wasn't going to spend outside a single minute more! Not when her palatial cabin awaited with all the snacks she could wish for!

Fired up, Rachel tried to jump up from the ground, stand up somehow… and failed. Her inflated gut didn't let her even sit normally, she had to spread her thighs to make room for all the excess flesh. Standing up like this was unthinkable. She doubled her weight since the last time she'd sat on the floor and she certainly hadn't gained any muscle. What to do now? Call for help?

Rachel was beginning to feel tendrils of fear creep along, gripping her mind. Oh, sure, someone would come to help. But they would be asking. And they might tell Dr. Schwartz or Ms. Fukuda and then they would start asking questions… She shivered and it wasn't just because it was getting cold.

Somehow fear calmed her down and made her think about her predicament rationally. Rachel rolled over onto her belly and inched her thighs higher up. The fatty folds actually made it easy at first as they raised her behind. But soon she began to lift the weight of her gut off the ground and it was murder for her tender thighs. And when she tried to prop herself up with her arms, they protested even louder against the abuse. “Hell! That hurts!”

It took her good ten minutes before she steadied herself, kneeling supported by her hands. Her heart raced like mad, she was drenched in sweat, her gut brushed the ground every time she inhaled. Rachel knew she had only one try. If she failed to stand up, she'd collapse down on the grass and never again gather enough strength for a second attempt.

She took several deep long breaths to ready herself and pushed herself up with all her waning strength. She made several quick short steps to find balance on her feet, afraid she might sprain her ankle. Somehow she made it, shaking like a bowl of jelly and feeling ready to keel over and die.

Rachel even had the foresight to grab a corner of her blanket. Otherwise she'd have been forced to leave it here, she definitely wouldn't have been able to pick it up once she stood. But her trials weren't over yet. She grabbed the basket (luckily the handle was high enough for her to reach without bending down much) and waddled towards home.

Her return journey was even worse. It seemed endless, as if someone kept snatching her cabin away. She trudged on, focused on moving one leg ahead, then the other… she was genuinely surprised when she finally bumped into the wall of her cabin. A couple more steps, a swipe of her bracelet and the door slid open, enticing smells wafted out.

A familiar voice welcomed her back. “Hello, Ms. Conrad. Please, have some mint biscuits, your favorite," and a tray rose to greet her as she huffed inside.

“Thanks, HERMIA… you're a… lifesaver.” Rachel collapsed on the closest armchair and emptied it in record time. After the worst pangs of her hunger were sated, she realized what a sorry state she was in – her clothes torn in so many places, green from all the grass, mud stains everywhere, even on her gut and hips…

“HERMIA, I want a hot bath right now. Get to it. And while I'm there, warm up two pizzas for me – no, three. And some lasagna and coffee cakes for dessert…”

“Yes, Mistress. I can serve you in bath, if you like.”

“Oh, really? Can you? What are you waiting for?”

***


Needless to say Rachel Conrad did not make any more progress with her investigation that day, preferring to eat herself into oblivion. Only when she returned the next day from an arduous day of teaching English Lit, did she recall what Gia wanted her to do. More specifically, what she needed to do before she could even fulfill Gia's demand. Find a camera.

She'd last seen it back in her old, small cabin. The movers should have packed it up with all the rest of her stuff. But where had they left it? She knew it wasn't anywhere among the things she used every day – she'd have freaked out already. So where could it be?

A bit of looking around brought her to unopened crates in the closet. They were there since the movers left them and there were plenty, mostly full of clothes she'd long overgrown. But three crates on the far right had Miscellaneous on their side so Gia's camera was likely to be hiding in there somewhere.

Seeing the size and shape of those crates, Rachel decided she needed to fortify herself first before delving into their depths and waddled away. She retreated to her kitchen and HERMIA's care which inevitably meant that she never got back to her closet that day.

The second day after calling Gia she rose from bed early, woken by a bad conscience or possibly hunger. She almost entered the kitchen but turned back, deciding to start digging on empty stomach, before any more distractions made her forget again.

Clad only in her nightie, Rachel tried to turn the first crate upside down but found she could not lift it in her pampered arms. Cursing again, she brought in a chair from the kitchen and started emptying the junk piece by piece. And then the second crate when she couldn't find what she was looking for in the first one.

Luckily the second crate was the right one. Rachel grabbed the annoying piece of electronics, not even bothering to look at it, and rushed (all right, waddled) to have breakfast.

While she was waiting for a second stack of pancakes, she started thinking about her present assignment. She picked the camera up, turned it over. What was so special about it that Gia insisted she use this camera and not any other? And where in Buttercombe would she be most likely to come across a mobility scooter prototype?

It was never more obvious to Rachel that she had done little to play the part of “fellow teacher” than it was during the rare instances in which she was required to use that part to gather information.

In the beginning of this mess, she supposed that it was due to her guilty conscience. After all, how could she rightfully get to know these—as far as she knew, these totally innocent—women only to sneak around and scribble down notes about them the minute they turned their backs? There was a perfectly practical reason, keeping everyone within a reasonable distance from finding out her dirty little secret. Plus, keeping everyone at arm’s length meant that it wouldn’t hurt so much when she (inevidibly) helped blow the roof off of this place.

But after she’d gotten her stripes (her double-wide, elastic stripes) the real reason that she didn’t keep up regular communications with the other women could be chalked up to sheer laziness. Complacency even, which had been the one thing that bothered her most about Gia’s new dismissive tone towards her.

The simple fact of the matter was that she was a teacher at a highly prestigious Academy that kept its students sedentary with plenty of assignments and homework, giving her a lot to grade. She’d spent half of her time on campus intentionally trying to gain enough weight to be placed on SSS and that had taken up plenty of time in and of itself…

Now that she was an out-and-out couch potato, with her every need capable of being taken care of by her fancy kitchen… why would she want to leave her cabin? Especially if she didn’t have to!

And while she certainly saw her fellow teachers on the clock—in the teachers’ lounge, sometimes over lunch, and between classes if she chose to meander the hallways for those meager fifteen minutes instead of snacking or fiddling with her phone between breaks—she could hardly be bothered to spend even a portion of her Reporter’s Intuition on the women who weren’t running an ostensibly evil corporation through a suspicious prep school.

So when she got a good look at Brooke for the first time in a good long while, she almost didn’t recognize her.

“Hey Rachel—” the sophomoric teacher waved breathlessly, “—haven’t seen you in a minute!”

“Yeah, sorry about that.” The fat woman grimaced, “I’ve been… um… super busy.”

“Don’t have to tell me twice about that.” Brooke’s impressive chest wobbled in tune with her pudgy gut as it plumped visibly over the waistband of her skirt, “They keep us plenty busy around here.”

As she said it, Brooke pat her budding gut derisively. She was by no means as large as Rachel had gotten (somewhat disheartening, given that they’d started at the same time) but Brooke had gone and gotten good and big since she’d started last year. She carried most of the, oh, hundred pounds or so in her upper half. She’d grown great big arms with a flabby chest and an impressive set of round pink cheeks. She looked happy as could be though—like she’d never weighed a pound less in her life, if Rachel hadn’t known otherwise.

“So, how have you been?” Rachel shifted awkwardly on her fat little feet, standing for so long had become unnatural to the sedentary sleuth, “I heard you won, um… some kind of prize?”

“That—it’s nothing.” Brooke waved dismissively, “It was a voucher for the cake walk we had back then. Like I need more cake.”

Rachel laughed, putting her hands on her hips and trying to suck in her stomach as far as it could go. She corrected a few inches of its sagging, but there was still no contest between the two of them. She was clearly still larger by a wide margin. Her gelatinous form far outweighed the chunky shape of her fellow English teacher. Her whole frame was wider, her arms were flabbier, her hips wider, and worst of all her belly had only shrunken to match Brooke’s in size once she’d sucked it in as far as it would go. At her jowl-rippling laughter, it slowly swelled back out to assert its superior size.

“Like any of us need any more cake.” She finally said, shyly, as she held a self-conscious arm in front of her stomach, “Um… I heard that they gave away some kind of… super cool scooter? Do you know who won that?”

“Oh that thing—you know, I heard one of the security guards talking about that just the other day.” Brooke grunted as she leaned into her belly to grab her coffee cup, “I think one of them might know.”

“Security guards?”

“If you can call them that.” Brooke snorted, “Just the other day, some little brats threw eggs at my cabin and they did absolutely nothing about it!”

“I’m sorry to hear that…” Rachel bit her bottom lip as she realized, very quickly, that there was no way to approach her next question tactfully, “…Which security guard, did you say was talking about this?”

***


“Good afternoon Ms. Conrad.” Said a familiar voice with a dimpling smile, “It’s been a long time!”

Rio quickly finished off the ice cream cone that she’d been eating inside the comfort of the toll booth. Her kinky black hair floofing out dangerously from underneath her Security cap and the sun shining brightly in the lenses of her aviator shades, she looked the picture of authority. Well, she might have been. Rachel knew her for the somewhat silly, easily bribable woman that she was behind that booth.

In fact, that was the reason that Rachel had brought the coffee cakes with her—in case Rio needed a little “reminder” as to what helping her might bring.

In the time that Rachel had seen her last, it was clear that Rio had only gotten larger. Even from the waist-up (which was all she could see from outside the booth) Rio looked positively round these days. Her cheeks were round, her arms were round, her chest, her belly… no doubt that her ample rear end was the roundest part about her these days. Without standing up, Rachel could see what she thought were arm rests on either side of her muffintop. Experience (and a little bit of dread) told her that the khaki brown lumps at either side of her were not arm rests.

“It has!” Rachel did her best to smile in the heat, sweating like a mule after the grueling walk from her cart to the booth, “I just… uh… heard you got promoted!”

“I did!” Rio said dreamily, smiling widely (chocolate staining her teeth). She took a celebratory lean back in her chair, which caused an excruciating groan from the invisible thing and provided another six inches or so of Rio’s robust belly to look at as it eeked from the bottom of her uniform, “Out of the hot sun, no more night patrol, and no more squeezing my culo into those stupid tiny carts.”

Yes, it was the carts that were small.

“But I guess that means you’ll need to find someone else to bribe into helping you get your bags after dark!” Rio joked, her round brown gut sloshing with laughter

“Well… I don’t get out much these days.” Rachel said with a depreciative pat of her own gut, “I should, but I don’t.”

“I know the feeling—one day they’re gonna have to butter me up to squeeze me out of this booth.” Rio pat her stomach in a similar fashion, “If it ain’t smokes, it’s the vending machine.”

“Um… right.” Rachel clicked her tongue awkwardly, “I, um… I heard you happened to see a funny looking mobility scooter?”

“Oh yeah?” Rio cocked a prominent black eyebrow, “Where’d you hear that?”

“Through the grape vine.” Rachel sniffed, “And I was wondering…”

“If I knew who got the big prize?” the plump Puerto Rican’s smile turned devilish, “Aht, you know I can’t tell you that.”

“Which is specifically why I brought these.” Rachel said with a greedy grin of her own as she held up her bag of coffee cakes. There were literally twenty of them—all fresh from the vending machine, “Given your proclivity for helping me out in tight jams.”

“The only thing tight after this is my belt.” Rio snorted. Like she’d worn a belt. “You’ve got a deal.”

Rio buzzed the toll booth window open and Rio leaned out the side with some effort. Her flabby gut pouring over and onto the counter, she held out her pudgy arms eagerly in anticipation of Rachel’s bribe.

“Okay, you didn’t hear it from me.” She had already unwrapped and bitten one of the coffee cakes in half, “But it went to…

1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
“It went to some fat girl named Hunter.” Rio said with a little curl of her fleshy brown nose, “The whole thing has Napoleonism written all over it.”

Rachel’s plucked brown brow furrowed at Rio’s malapropped expression.

“You know—when someone real important treats someone special just because they know each other?” the fat bottomed security guard leaned back into her booth, causing another symphony of squeaks and squealing springs, “Dr. Schwartz was the woman who signed for it and, you know, it’s part of the paperwork, so I asked her where it was going and she told me—“

“Oh, nepotism.” Rachel’s pretty features puckered in suspicion, “You said Dr. Schwartz was the one who approved it?”

“Yeah, that’s her. She had to take it over to the Vandergriff and, uh…” Rio took another big girl bite of her bribe, before narrowing her eyes suspiciously, “…why?”

“No! No reason, just…uhm…”

Rachel blanked as she felt the sugary stranglehold that she held on Rio’s attention weaken. It must have been the comfortable job that would have been much more unbearable for her to lose. Rio’s comely Hispanic features began to darken as she hunched herself into a more authoritative position for exactly the first time since Rachel had gotten to know her.

“I was… supposed to get it, actually.” Rachel lied, running her fat little hands in front of her belly nervously, “You see, there was some kind of mix-up and…”

“Uh-huh.”

“I was just wanting to see if, maybe I could talk to her about taking mine once it came in, and—”

“Please step away from the gate, gringa.”

And just like that, Rachel’s reliable connection in Rio was severed like polyglass sliding down on top of her fingertips. The plump-rumped security guard would be of no more help today—that much was for sure. Even as she munched on the sizable bribe that Rachel had given her… the woman had no shame!

Still, at least she had been given a lead. Hunter something. Vandergriff Building.

Worse reporters had done more with less.

***


As much as Rachel liked to tell herself that she was done gaining weight—in that she’d played her part and gotten to be about the right size required to be trusted around here—she had a nasty time kicking thinking like how she’d been living for the past year or so. Scooting over here on her cart hadn’t been her plan of action, but once she’d gotten red faced just climbing the gentle slope that led up from Rio’s guard booth back to where she’d parked her cart, well…

At any rate, stopping for a snack was no excuse.

She had no idea what had come over her—she was out of control lately. Eating everything she could get her grubby grabbers on without so much as a pinch of resistance. It was times like this that she marveled—in a sort of horrible awe—at the quick rate of her expansion. Of course she’d blown up so big! She could barely go five minutes without stuffing her face!

Even as she lifted one thick leg over the other, thighs swishing and chafing and rolling over one another in every awkward lumbering step, Rachel couldn’t help but feel ashamed. Once upon a time she’d dreamed about going into television reporting. What channel would have her now? She was all belly, with a fat little face and wobbly lunch lady arms… she couldn’t wait until she’d blown the lid off of this place so she could get back to normal.

With or without liposuction.

It had only taken HERMIA a quick look at the roster to determine that there were only three Hunters enrolled in the entire school. Hunter Peters, the Junior who was the daughter of a famous author, Hunter Dewhitt, the daughter of a business tycoon, and both of which were housed in the Masters Building. The only Hunter who was boarded in the Vandergriff was Hunter Black—daughter of a Yeng employee with an impressive history of stellar grades, here on sponsorship and merit from one Doctor Helen Schwartz.

Rachel supposed that, even if it was only sometimes, life would throw her a bone.

But of course, whenever it threw her a bone, a long hallway was not far behind.

Rachel huffed and puffed her way down the double-wide halls of the dorm building. It had been constructed sometime after Buttercombe Academy had acquired sponsorship from Yeng, and thus was built a bit more modern than the dormitories still located in the main building. Whereas the first two floors focused on business and the Arts, the top four floors above that were dedicated to cradeling the coddled children of elites and socialites in as much comfort as could conceivably allow. The hallways were spacious, the doorways were wide, the stairwells were spacious and the elevators (and escalators—that was an advantage this building had for sure!) were plentiful.

So, too, were the vending machines. The monolithic LCD screens shimmered down every hallway, staring Rachel down from either end. Cut seamlessly into the wall, she felt like she’d pass one every three or four dorms.

Door, door, door, food.

Door, door, door, food.

It was no wonder everyone on campus was so fat…

“I’ve got to get a hold of myself.” She mumbled after stopping for a bit too long to ponder the contents of the vending machine in front of her, “I’m going crazy here…”

Hunter Black, she had to find Hunter Black. She was her best chance at finding this whole XLR-8 thing and putting another pin into the weird, weighty puzzle that was the Yeng Corporation’s relationship with Buttercombe Academy. With their relationship with her. The sooner she found Hunter Black, the sooner she’d be one step closer to dropping this weight and get put on another assignment. Hopefully one that went far less deep undercover.

Finally—she came to the door.

C 137; Black, Hunter. A single dorm.

For a Sophomore student, even the rich and the famous ones, that was a bit peculiar. Rachel had surmised in her notes that the “buddy system” ascribed the most student housing was to help reinforce conditioning. Slamming two bricks together, mortared on one side as it were. Gia had told her as much upon reviewing (what little) notes she’d sent back—why was some nobody like a Yeng employee getting special treatment over the daughters of celebrities and tycoons?

“Knock knock!” Rachel said in her best “Ms. Conrad” voice, “Hunter Black?”

“Um… are you a teacher?” a tinny, echoing voice sounded from somewhere above, making Rachel jump, “I’ve never seen you before.”

Unsure as to where to actually talk, Rachel just looked around for a little bit like an idiot before finally spotting the small camera that had been placed overhead, as well as the pint-sized speakerbox mounted into the doorway.

“Oh, I’m Ms. Conrad—I teach ELA 3 and 4.” She said, adjusting her long brown hair and running a few crumbs out with her fingers, “I was hoping to talk to you a little bit?”

There was a silence on the other end of the line—made more painful by the distinct electric hum of her speaker. This gave Rachel enough time to probe her memory, concerning what she’d dug up on her newest lead.

“I just figured, you’re such an advanced student, Hunter.” Rachel said with no small amount of flattery, “You’re going to be taking my class next year when you’re a Junior so… why not get better acquainted now?”

Tickled, the privileged teen ticked the button again.

“Okay, I just unlocked it—come on in, I’m in the back.”

Rachel did her best to keep from running her hands together. If only her whole job had been that easy! Lying to children was easily the most rewarding part of her job, especially if it meant she’d be able to get a lead on this XLR-8 chair.

Stepping inside, Rachel soon came face to face with Hunter Black…

1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
Stepping inside, Rachel came face to face with the goal of her quest. Hunter Black drove out into her entrance hall to greet her in the XLR-8. It was a sight to behold. She saw a sleek tricycle, all streamlined chrome in front, yet widened out over the rear axle so much that it would barely fit through the extra-wide door of the dorm. The wheels were small but wide, perhaps to better distribute its weight on the floor. A plush red settee occupied all the space available on top, with a large chrome hump behind it.

Hunter looked a little small for the seat but not for lack of trying. The girl sprawled across her throne, her humongous boobs resting on a well-fed tummy, thighs like trunks spreading across the red velvet. Rachel had seen plenty of bigger students at Buttercombe but Hunter had to be one of the fattest Sophomores here.

“Hello, Ms. Conrad. Pleased to meetcha.” She offered her hand and as Rachel shook it, she noticed the fat-inflated palm lacked any muscle definition – not that her own palm fared any better and she had over fifty pounds on the girl.

“Come in, have a seat.” That flabby handshake was the most vigorous movement Rachel saw her make. Otherwise she just tapped her stubby fingers at the touchscreen and guided the joystick, turning her mobility scooter back to a lavishly equipped kitchen – just like Rachel's, in fact. “Wanna cheesecake?” And before she could even agree, a mechanical arm extended from the chair hump and deftly placed it on the table alongside a thick milkshake. But clearly Hunter's hospitality was mainly a pretense to indulge since a second cake followed and the arm started feeding big chunks of it straight into her gullet.

“So you're the Junior English teacher, Ms. Conrad?” Hunter managed to ask between swallowing. Clearly she'd had plenty of practice in speaking with her mouth full. “Good. I'd always wanted to ask about the meaning of…” and she followed with a question on some obscure French novel Rachel had never heard of.

Rachel was stumped. Despite teaching it for a year, this spoilt student managed to find a weak spot in her armor with her first question. “Umm, I mean,” she squirmed in her seat. As she searched around for an answer – any answer – her eyes zoomed on a spot on Hunter's cleavage where her chest stretched the pristine white Buttercombe-issue blouse. There were a couple darker spots there in several different colors, possibly smudged chocolate, mustard and ketchup. Instead of thinking about literature, Rachel's mind started wondering how long had they been there. Judging by the tidy kitchen, the girl was no slob. Did she eat all that since coming back from her classes?

Hunter noticed her look and must have misinterpreted it because there was a clear hint of amusement in her voice when she went on: “See, I've always thought that the author wanted to express…”

It let Rachel off the hook. She could nod wisely, adding, “Possibly,” “Yeah, maybe,” or “Exactly,” all the time feeling like back at school when she neglected an assignment and had to fake it. It soon became clear that in spite of her laziness and other faults, Hunter Black was frightfully intelligent and remarkably well-read. Evidently she was a favorite of Dr. Schwartz for a reason.

And either she was always this chatty or the presence of an unknown teacher made her show off out of nervousness. It took some time before her tempo slowed down Rachel managed to wedge in a question of her own. “Is that a new mobility scooter you have?”

“Yeah! Beauty, isn't it?”

“It looks real good. Everyone must be jealous, right? I wonder what can it do?”

“Oh, it does everything! You've seen the arms already, there's a storage inside big enough to last me all day and the scooter refills it every time I drive by a vending machine of the right kind… The Y-Tablet lets me download my assignments and do all the homework and browse the net in class. There are massage nodes throughout, it's sooo relaxing when you switch them on…”

Rachel again listened to the verbal flood, nodded and made mental notes for Gia until Hunter swallowed the last piece of her cheesecake and stifled a burp. „Oops, sorry. I've overdone it a little. But if you don't mind me asking, why are you so interested in the XLR-8, Ms. Conrad?”

Uh-oh. Should she stick to what she'd told Rio? Judging by her reaction, better not quite. “Well, I was hoping to get one of these, uh, accelerators, myself. So I wanted to see one first.”

“Ah, I see. In that case, there is one other major factor to consider.” The fat student patted her tummy, a little bigger now that the cheesecake joined everything else she'd put inside today. “Mind you, it is far too early yet for a complete assessment but I can estimate that depending on your previous habits you are likely to put on forty to sixty percent of your current weight due to a drop in physical activity and further twenty to thirty percent due to consumption made more convenient. In other words, if you are unlucky, you might double your current weight. Possibly more, further testing is required.”

It was interesting how her vocabulary switched to a more mature 'tester speech.' Dr. Schwartz had her well trained, mused Rachel. “So you want to give it up?”

“NO WAY!” For the first time since they met, Hunter showed a different emotion than detached amusement. She pushed several buttons, whirring likely signified those 'massage nodes' sprang into action, a robotic arm emerged holding a milkshake. The girl took a long sip to calm down. “It's mine! Once you try the XLR-8, there's no going back. It's better than sex!” Her olive skin turned beetroot red when she realised what she blurted out in front of her teacher but she stuck her chin out, unapologetic.

“Uh, I'll let myself out then?” Rachel rose with a grunt, noticing her cake was gone too. Halfway to the door she remembered what Gia'd instructed her to do. She turned back with a longing look at the XLR-8 that was not an act. “Oh, could I snap a couple shots first? So that I know what to ask for?”

“Sure thing!” The girl's good mood was back. She posed with her scooter for several photos, spread lazily in its cozy embrace with a robotic arm feeding her a burger. “Come back again some time! I might even let you borrow my ride for a while!”

“Oh, really? I might take you at your word.”

1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
Rachel Conrad visited Hunter Black three more times over the following two weeks, and had reached a few conclusions regarding the reclusive and pampered student.

First, she decided to change her original assessment from "frightfully intelligent" to "absolutely terrifying." At one point, Hunter had asked what works she taught in her class. At the mention of Beowulf, the over-endowed teen mentioned in passing that she should start brushing up on her Old English, and seemed disappointed when Rachel told her they were using the modern English translation. "Seriously, what kind of teen learns Old English 'just because'? That is just wrong."

It was quite clear that, while Rio may have considered Dr. Schwartz's interest as mere nepotism, Miss Black was brilliant. Rachel had checked out her test scores between classes one Tuesday, and almost thought about spitting out her honey cake, such was her surprise at how high they were. Even without the good doctor's hand being involved, Hunter easily qualified for any of the available academy scholarships, and it was obvious that Yeng would be very interested in bringing her on at the conclusion of her studies.

Thankfully for the undercover reporter, it seemed that her genius had also left her rather naive and trusting. Given that Hunter knew her curriculum better then she herself did, Rachel had quickly given up disguising that the purpose of her visits was the XLR-8. The widening sophomore had had no qualms about letting her take as many photos of the machine as she wanted, and even let her test drive the scooter. "She is right, though. That thing is really, REALLY nice. No wonder she got so worked up about potentially losing it," Rachel had thought as she reluctantly lifted herself from its plush seat.

As she watched the hefty student tried to rise from her couch to reclaim her throne, Rachel's mind absently wandered to another of her conclusions. Namely, that even in a school as unrepentantly gluttonous as Buttercombe Academy, Hunter Black was almost singularly food-focused. It was exceedingly rare that her jaws ceased chewing for even a moment, and Rachel had yet to see her without something substantial to munch on within arms reach. And if she was drinking something that wasn't a milkshake, guaranteed it was a Yeng-brand cola.

Even the treats she offered her guest mostly found their way into her bottomless stomach, and her body clearly showed the inevitable after-effects. Despite the short time she'd known her, Rachel was certain the already sizable student had gotten fatter. Hunter was wearing the same shirt as she'd been for their first meeting, the mustard and ketchup stains never quite washing out, leaving it easily identifiable. Her generous measurements may have stretched it before, but now it seemed fit to burst, in particular around her monumental bust line. Hunter was currently not wearing the standard Buttercombe blazer, and Rachel could see all three of her thick, well fed belly rolls softly stretching against the too-tight fabric.

It took Hunter a couple of tries to rise from the low couch, and her enormous breasts bounced off her thickly padded knees as she slowly rose, sending a gelatinous jiggle through the lardy things. Her flabby thighs forced her to adopt a heavy waddle as she crossed the room, and as she sat down on her scooter with a grateful sigh, Rachel couldn't fail to notice that even that short trip had left her short of breath.

"Holy Hell, she's getting so fat," Miss Conrad thought as she subtly eyed Hunter's posterior, judging if it filled more of her seat or not. "Forget the sophomores, I think she might be giving some of the juniors a run for their money. It's like she's trying to gain weight. Is that her goal; become the fattest student on campus? At her current pace, she might outgrow that whale Polluck, though she does have one hell of a lead. Heck, I'm maybe 40 pounds or so heavier then she is, and she might out-weigh me before the next midterm..."

Rachel rubbed her own large belly, feeling a little guilty about how good she felt knowing, no matter how big she got, there would always be at least one student far fatter then she is.

"So, how was it?" Hunter said. The caramel colored ball of dough had eaten enough calories while seated on the couch to sustain a small family, but still had room for her robotic helper to feed her a double-fudge chocolate muffin.

"Oh my God, it was divine," Rachel said as Hunter finished her muffin in a couple quick bites. As she picked the crumbs off her suffering blouse and deposited them in her mouth, the "teacher" continued, "I thought my back was going to turn to goo from those massage points."

"Yeah, they'll do that," Hunter giggled as a touch brought another muffin to her maw. "Sorry, I forgot my manners. Did you want one?"

"No thank you. I've taken up too much time as it is; papers to grade."

"Ah. I won't keep you then. Chow!"

"What an appropriate choice of a word," Rachel thought as she watched the growing girl take a big bite of another of Yeng's calorie bombs. She tried to ignore her own stomach's cries of hunger at the thought of food, and took a final, discrete look at Hunter before leaving.

"Yeah, her butt has definitely gotten bigger."

*** *** ***

After Miss Conrad had left, Hunter thoughtfully chewed her muffin. "Hmm..."

Hunter was used to people misreading her. It had happened all the time back at home. She seemed like this quiet, bookish young girl. Unadventurous. Totally sheltered. Nothing at all interesting about her, until puberty, at least. Shockingly naive.

However, that wasn't quite true.

So much of Hunter's life wasn't on any file that Rachel Conrad could read, hidden by the school's privacy policy. Hunter wasn't your standard Buttercombe student. Born to a single Mum with two older daughters already, Hunter had been raised poor. The family had lived hand-to-mouth for as long as she could remember. They'd lived in rough neighborhoods because the rent was cheap. They ate cereal for supper because it was practically free. Hunter ate buttered bread for lunch at school because lunch meat was too expensive.

She'd also seen much of the uglier side of the world that so many of the privileged students here hadn't. She'd been hiding behind her Mum when the 7-11 they were currently shopping in got robbed. She'd seen a guy get beat to within an inch of his life because he didn't have enough money to pay the muggers who'd surrounded him. She'd slept in a cold car with her Mum and sisters when they got evicted for failure to pay the rent.

Ultimately, though, they'd managed to survive. Eventually, the three elder Black's all found work and they finally got a good place to live. Harper, her Mum, was at last able to finish high school. She'd subsequently taken a Business course online, and eventually managed to get her current job at Yeng, solidifying the family finances permanently.

Her two sisters, Parker and Piper, had also made their way in the world. Parker was more then a little rough, and Hunter could still vividly recall the busted nose she'd given to one old creeper who'd gotten rather 'handsy.' She seemed to have a bit of trouble holding on to work for any length of time, but she was usually on time with the rent she owed their Mum. From what Piper had told her, that was actually quite the improvement over how she used to be.

Speaking of Piper, she'd been Hunter's primary caregiver during her younger years, as Harper was working. Once Hunter was old enough and the other two became more available to help out, Piper had held a couple of different jobs over the years, though perhaps the most important was the one which allowed her to meet Helen Schwartz. It was a combination of Auntie Helen's recommendation and the employee scholarships that had allowed Hunter to attend the academy, and open doors the family could never have dreamed of.

And all it had cost Piper was an additional 400 pounds or so. Now, she had lost a ton of weight since then, though her Mum's e-mails did say that she was starting to widen once again...

Regardless of any of that, Hunter's rough and tumble background had instilled her with a lot of street smarts, a healthy dose of cunning, and a perpetual sense of paranoia.

And there just was something not-right with Miss Conrad.

Hunter rolled her way to the kitchen and began preparing a platter of fried chicken for her early dinner. Despite how much she'd already eaten today and the food on the way, she promptly microwaved some pizza for a pre-dinner snack. As she waited for the pizza to finish heating up, she opened her tablet and began writing her report.

The youngest Black was not only a student at Buttercombe, but was also acting as a junior laboratory aid to Dr. Schwartz. She was currently acting as a guinea pig for some of the compounds the two were working on, at her own insistence, though Helen had refused her more reckless suggestions.

Yeng Brand Stomach Aid experiment: success. Stomach elasticity at 123.72%
Milkshake caloric enhancer: partial success. 4k calories per serving confirmed, but still has chalky aftertaste.
Health additive 278-B: success. All my vitals are in healthy ranges.
Additive 42-C: success. Calorie absorption rate up 3.94%.
Weight increase since last report: 14.07 pounds

As Hunter typed, her pizzas dinged, and she paused her report to add another deluge of calories to her rapidly growing form, popping a button off her blouse with a giggle as she did so. As she happily fattened herself, he thoughts turned once more to Miss Conrad. "There's something weird about her. She's way too interested in the XLR-8. Lots of photos, too. Too many, in fact. And her knowledge of her own subject seems poor. Still, I am lacking in evidence. Do I report this...?

1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
Helen clucked her tongue at Hunter. “No books at the table, bitte. You know the rules.”

Hunter sighed. “Alright, Aunt Helen.” She did indeed know the rules. Helen Schwartz had alway been a large, although not very tall, presence in Harper’s life. And since coming to Buttercombe, their relationship had grown in so many ways. One of these ways was coming over for Sunday dinner, every week.

Sunday evenings were only time of the week that the cafeteria closed, so most girls had to subside on snacks and microwaved meals, but Hunter got to enjoy her Tante’s home cooking. It might not be as much as she normally ate, or as fattening as she’d like it to be, but it was infinitely more intellectually and emotionally nourishing. Hunter her put her textbooks away, while Helen poured the tea to get things started.

“How were classes this week?” She asked, moving onto her own cup. “Nothing too challenging, I suspect.”

“No.” Harper said, bored and frustrated. She sank her fat face into her fist, her cheek bulging around it, and her lips, and stared at her tea, waiting for it to cool. “I did have something interesting happen though...Rachel Conrad has been poking around my dorm room--” Harper slowly started on the topic.

Helen raised an animated hand to stop her, rushing to get out of her chair. “Ach, wait, let me get the pollo pibil. I want to hear all of this in one sitting.” Hunter wasn’t going to stop her if it meant getting some food. Helen hurried into the kitchen, and returned with a pot lined with banana leaves, ladling stewed chicken and pickled onion into a bowl for Hunter. She stood over the girl as she took her first bite, making sure she enjoyed it, before she gave Hunter a gentle rub on her lard covered shoulder blade, to aid her digestion.

Only then, did Helen turn to her own meal, and bring out the bread and pickled herring that she was going to have as tonight’s sides. She also brought out a bottle of beer, which she opened with a bottle opener at the table before finally allowing herself to sit down, when Hunter asked.

“Could I have a beer with dinner too, Tante Helen?” She said in a sweet voice, trying her best to sound casual about it.

Helen smiled, and sighed with a mixture of amusement and exasperation. Hunter was trying to manipulate her with that ‘Tante Helen’ line. She pursed her lips and stared her down for a second, a trick she’d learned from watching Harper. Just long enough to make her squirm. “You can have one beer with dinner. And then you will tell me about Frau Conrade, ja?”

“Ja.” Hunter smiled and leaned back in her seat, rubbing her belly with contentment.

Helen brought her the beer, and then finally dinner began. After she slurped down the contents of her first bowl, Hunter said.

“She came around starting a few weeks ago. She claimed she wanted to prep me for next year’s class, but it seems like I could teach her. Still, it’s a good excuse to learn Old English. Do you speak it, Aunt Helen.” Hunter happily told her while dripping pickled herring onto her bread with her fork.

“Nein. Never saw the use for that one. I suppose I could learn it with you.” Helen said, distracted. She took a sip of tea and stared off in thought before asking. “But you don’t believe that’s her reason for visiting?”

Hunter smiled and shook her head, before shoving a huge hunk of bread into her greedy maw. She hurried and swallowed, so she could answer. “She’s definitely up to something. She’s really, really interested in the XLR-8.”

Helen put down the teacup and looked at her seriously.. “You’re mind is not only gifted at science, but at life. You’ve done well to see through her scheme. You are everything I could hope for in an apprentice, and dare I say, heir.” She could see it in her eyes, Hunter was touched. That was everything she wanted to hear, and she didn’t even know it.

Then the serious moment broke as Helen pinched her chubby cheeks affectionately, and poured her another bowl of pollo with pride.

“So, what are you going to do about her?” Hunter said, happily munching away while Helen stood over her and watched. “Do you know why she’s doing this?”

Dr. Schwartz put a hand on Hunter’s shoulder, and leaned towards her ear, her lips just inches away. “Hunter, remember those experiments I wouldn’t let you try on yourself, because they were too dangerous?”

“Yes, Ma’am.”

Helen gave Hunter a firm, almost painful squeeze to the shoulder. “Try them out on her, and report back to me.”

1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
“Another mint milkshake, Ms. Conrad?” Hunter Black drove from the dining area to the kitchen dispenser and stopped to look back. She turned the whole scooter around rather than turning her head, though. She had to be careful, she'd already lost the top button of her blouse and while she didn't mind showing off more of her cleavage, a teacher might disagree. Though this English Lit teacher, firmly lodged in her sofa, was oblivious to Hunter's wardrobe worries.

Rachel Conrad was struggling to reach the last brownie on a tray on the table over the obstacle of her full belly. Now she only gave a piggish grunt, presumably meaning consent, too absorbed in her fight for the last morsel. She rolled on her side, her fat gut spilling out from her blouse, to triumphantly seize her prey.

“OK, and a chocolate one for me. Working on it, just a sec,” Hunter smiled for herself as she punched in the code which would add 35-RX to the teacher's milkshake. It had to be mint or some other strong flavour to mask its distinct taste. That it also hid the chalk-tasting caloric enhancer was an added bonus.

Additive 35-RX had so far been tested on pigs only. Their skin is structurally the closest to human and this substance had been developed as a supplement preventing the formation of stretchmarks, potentially a highly marketable product for Yeng. However, it turned out to be dangerously more effective than intended. It loosened any tissue it got into touch with, beginning with stomach lining.

“And could I have another tray of brownies with it?” pleaded Rachel after she swallowed her last one almost without chewing. “I just don't get it, I can never get full these days.”

“That's normal. As long as you're hungry, just eat, Ms. Conrad. No need to apologise, I'm going to order more pizzas for myself too,” and Hunter made a note on her Y-Pad before sending another order out. According to the reports Tante Helen sent her, test pigs never felt full either as their digestive tracts stretched ever further. Apparently there was even a case or two where their stomachs burst open before the lab assistants realised what was happening.

But Ms. Conrad had been using 35-RX for five consecutive days now and hadn't burst yet, proving human body superiority. Her daily consumption increased by 37%, according to data collated by HERMIA at her home, the cafeteria, Hunter's own kitchen and numerous snack machines around the campus.

I should instruct HERMIA to start adding 35-RX to Ms. Conrad's breakfasts and dinners, Hunter made another note, otherwise she might skip a dose if she fails to visit me.

Though that was getting increasingly unlikely. Rachel apparently enjoyed the company of a girl who fulfilled her every craving and in whose presence she could feel she was holding back. Enjoyed it so much that she was coming here every free hour she could and left only with extreme reluctance, stuffed to the gills.

Truth be told, Hunter was beginning to enjoy the teacher's company as well. Aunt Helen seldom had time these days and when she did, she had illogical objections to testing her experimental substances on herself. It was nice to finally have an eating companion who could hold her own, even if she suspected her motives. Moreover, Hunter estimated that at a current rate of expansion, Ms. Conrad's stomach should even exceed her own capacity in two more days. And then Hunter hoped Tante would finally relent and let her use 35-RX too.

She was looking forward to it. But for now… Maybe she could speed up the process? Give her a gentle push? “Umm, Ms. Conrad?” She put on her best impression of a naive schoolgirl and smiled sweetly. “I was thinking we could have a proper pig-out today, please?”

***


“A proper pig-out? But I thought…” Rachel bit down the rest of her answer. Her blimping teen host evidently did not consider any of their previous feasts worthy of that name. Could the girl cram even more food into her stomach?

Instinct was telling Rachel to refuse and run away while she still could. However, lately it was more and more often her gut which had the last word(s). And right now they were: A feast even bigger than yesterday? Yummy! Go for it! “Uh, actually, that sounds nice.”

“It does, right? OK, we need to plan it all out. Cafeteria closes down in two hours so we can start by ordering the entire evening menu. When we're done with that, I'll tap into the Room Delivery Service while there's still something decent to be had…”

“Wait. You can have food from the cafeteria sent to your dorm?”

“Sure, anytime. As long as there's anything left. You mean you can't? Anyway, after the RDS gets raided by the rest of Buttercombe girls, we can move on to my own supplies, frozen pizzas, pasta, desserts, ice cream et cetera. Sounds like a plan, eh?”

“Uh, right,” Rachel blinked in horror, thinking of the mountain of calories she was about to consume. I need to get my appetite in check, fast. Before they have to roll me out of here. She took the offered milkshake and sipped from the straw to calm her nerves.

“While we're waiting for the first delivery, here's your tray of brownies.” The mechanical arm lifted again, prompted by Hunter's fat fingers brushing the Y-Pad, and deposited several pounds of almost pure chocolate next to Rachel. Than it retracted back to the microwave to pick up the first of three Hunter's pizzas. “Oh! And if you're still hungry after, you can have one of my pizzas. Like pepperoni?”

No way! But Rachel was already salivating. “Yeah, I do. Thanks.”

“Good, you're welcome, Ms. Conrad.” Hunter gave her an eager smile, though that eagerness was mostly aimed at the pizza the robot was holding in front of her mouth. She leaned forward to bite into it and the rest happened so fast that Rachel had to replay it in her mind to put the event together.

As the gluttonous student leaned forward, it set the entire mass of fat covering her body in motion. First a button flew off the top of her blouse, making her cleavage even deeper. Then the sound of tearing cloth could be heard from the area where her hips stretched the brown skirt. And finally the buttons around her midriff gave out as well, olive flesh spilling out like a flood.

Hunter did not seem embarrassed in the least. “Oops. Need to drive down to Mrs. Banks for another size upgrade,” she chuckled. “Huh. This uniform lasted all of three weeks. I hope I am not slowing down. Oh well. Such a little accident won't stop us from eating, eh, Ms. Conrad?” and she took a large bite.

Three weeks? Slowing down? How come the girl's not twice my size already? I should really say no while I can. But the fact was she couldn't; the hollow emptiness in her stomach cried out to her, wanting to be filled. “Uh, right.”

And so Rachel ate. She devoured the brownies and a pizza and a platter of lasagna and a bucket of fried chicken, and her stomach was still demanding more so she carried on filling it until… the world blurred.

1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
"Und vhat did ve learn?"

Hunter had her head hung in shame, her second chin squished under her actual one. "There's a reason we follow established laboratory procedure."

"Und?"

"And that's why we always thoroughly test all products and procedures before engaging in human testing."

"That's right," Helen said. The short woman had her arms crossed over her chest as she gave her "niece" her dressing down. "Now, explain to me vhat happened."

"Well, after you gave me leeway to experiment with Ms. Conrad, I decided to use 35-RX..."

"Ja, ja, I am avare of that part. I should haff known you would choose that one. You bombarded me with requests for self-use daily for several months. I meant, vhat happened to Rachel?"

Hunter cleared her throat before continuing. "She initially seemed to take to the compound well. Her daily consumption was up a full 37%, and her daily calorie count had shot through the roof. I could almost see her swelling right in front of my eyes, so I wanted to give her a little push."

"A push."

"Just a small one?"

"Ms. Conrad is now in the hospital."

"Um... maybe, not so small of one?" If Helen had found any of what Hunter said amusing, she gave no sign of confirmation. "She was going to be my proof that 35-RX was safe for human use! And she could almost eat as much as me! Do you know how rare that is!?"

Hunter had been beginning to shout, but she immediately retracted when she saw the look that Dr. Schwartz was giving her. Continuing on far more meekly, she said, "But there was an unforeseen side effect of the chemical."

Hunter fell silent for a moment. Helen cleared her throat, indicating that she should continue.

Hunter sighed. "Since it eliminates the feeling of being full, it creates the potential for someone to eat a dangerously large amount. In the case of the test pigs, they ate until they suffered internal injuries. I'd thought I'd figured out the problem, and I was partially right! I managed to get the formula to more rapidly increase elasticity before it began to deaden the sensation of feeling full, so a person wouldn't risk tearing their stomach lining before their body could cope.

"And it kind of worked. At least, until her diaphragm got compressed by the sheer quantity of food she'd consumed, leading Ms. Conrad to pass out from a lack of oxygen."

Hunter said that last part half-whisper, and so fast that Helen could barely catch it. Not that she needed to, mind, having read the hospital report before questioning Miss Black. "Still," she thought, "It's important that she admits her mistakes."

She softened a bit as she saw Hunter beginning to tear up. She wasn't used to being wrong, let alone having an idea of hers nearly end so catastrophically for someone else. Helen wrapped her up in as big a hug as she could manage around the tubby teen.

"I'm sorry, Auntie Helen! I didn't mean to-"

"Shh, it's alright," the Doctor said, patting her on the back. "There's no permanent damage done. A few veeks of bed rest, und Ms. Conrad vill be right as rain."

Sniff. "What about long term effects from 35-RX?"

"Ve'll just haff to vait und see. If she cannot properly manage to limit her own food intake, we'll haff to get involved. Othervise she'll do this to herself again, only this time, it could be fatal."

"Um... well, actually... I kind of... meant... me."

"... You didn't."

Helen Schwartz felt Hunter nod into her shoulder. She sighed as she gave Hunter another squeeze. "For someone so smart, there are times I vonder..."

*** *** ***

So what happens now?

1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
It would be wrong to call Gia Rosellini ascetic. She had always been wary of her Italian heritage; unwilling to blow up like her mother, aunts or even her sister, she'd built up iron restraint that kept her appetite in check – mostly – and stopped her when she wanted to indulge. It often sucked but it kept her figure svelte and action-ready into her thirties.

It would be doubly wrong to call Gia ascetic today. Her new undercover assignment required her to indulge every day to fit in – at least that was what she kept telling herself. She also conveniently forgot that her first binges preceded her arrival at the Yeng facility, actually dating from the first package from Buttercombe. Instead she told herself it was her duty to eat if she wanted to avoid drawing attention. So she ate, a little too eagerly perhaps, and as a result she was beginning to fit in among her new security pals in size as well.

It hadn't been so bad at first. Gia's genes blessed her with plenty of curves and they had been getting more bountiful. Sneaky, envious glances at her chest and booty actually convinced her for a time that it was a good thing to throw away restraint and let loose (temporarily, of course). That was a mistake – just like her mother had warned, these days the biggest curve of her body was the swell of her stomach, now resting on her thick thighs.

She was thankful that she had the back entrance desk duty today. Not that she'd get so lazy, no way! But everyone else in her shift did which meant constant fights over who got to stay inside to man (or woman) the guard posts. Since Gia was still one of the more mobile ones, she often drew the short straw. And when she got to sit behind a desk, it was usually the main entrance which had a two-person detail. Today was the first day in weeks that she could sit down unobserved and access the facility systems.

Not that it got her far, today like any other day on this mission. She hated to admit it but her rate of progress was even slower than of that lazy would-be reporter whose incompetence made her take this job in the first place. It was so frustrating! She took another donut from the visitor box to calm her nerves.

Huh. Come to think of it, Rachel Conrad had missed her scheduled phone call. That was nothing unusual in itself, the woman was getting ever lazier as they spoilt her in that boarding school. But she was unavailable when Gia tried to contact her yesterday. Should she try again now? But the reception could be bugged…

“Have a good evening, Toshio, and see you tomorrow,” she broke off her musings to give a warm smile to a departing Oriental. This handsome, muscular youngster (all of 25 years) was the best thing she'd found here so far. He had been enamored with her curves from their first meeting, when she'd had guard duty at the R&D, had been bringing her chocolates and sweets ever since. Today he must have made a detour to see her here since he normally parked in front. She was toying with the idea of making him take her on a date – purely as a way to mine a promising source, of course.

Enough. She forced her thoughts to return to the problem of Rachel Conrad. She glanced at the big clock in the hall; her shift would be over in an hour, it would make more sense to wait until then. She decided to check Rachel's social networks in the meantime to make sure she was OK.

Rachel's posts were more than boring lately – a steady stream of photos depicting all the wonderful Buttercombe culinary delights that made Gia salivate (and eat another donut), and a long list of films and shows the fake teacher watched for free, courtesy of the Academy. But as Gia scrolled down all that garbage, she was growing uneasy.

In the past, Rachel had been posting more or less regularly every other day, sometimes missing a day, at other times she posted every day for a week. But no matter how hard Gia looked, she could not find a single post from this week.

This was getting bad. Gia had to get in touch with Rachel, but how? She'd arranged a dead drop for her in the neighboring town but she doubted the undercover journalist even remembered it anymore. Should she have a look there or drive straight to the Academy and claim her friend invited her for a visit? Direct action was often the best approach, least expected… but it could also bring the direst consequences for Gia.

What to do?

1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
At the end of the day, Gia’s job at the Yeng plant was just that—a job.

Her taking the assignment in the first place had been a split-second decision. One that she’d made in hopes of getting her closer to the root of the strangeness in at least one of Yeng’s plants across America. It had helped provide some extra cash on the side (a much-needed benefit since she seemed to be outgrowing clothes on an almost weekly basis by now) but it wasn’t worth pulling out of the direct line of duty for.

All she’d done is sit on her butt and act out the part of rent-a-cop, and even then she’d only barely gotten any closer to any of the mysterious product that moved in and out of this particular subsidiary. She’d been picking up pieces of valuable information to the investigation at large, but things were beginning to become too stressful even for her. Now that there was even more cause for concern, Gia was sure that she was needed much more on the campus of Buttercombe Academy than she ever had been at this facility.
Rachel had already missed three of their weekly phone calls, but to not have any social media presence either?

Rachel might have been in real trouble—no one knew what these creeps at Yeng were capable of!

Gia knew that she had to get up there…

But at the cost of her own part of the investigation? She’d been making some headway ever since she got here, slowly building up a network of informants. Learning things about the staff and how to grease the wheel to get what she wanted…

The only way she could leave right now would be to cut herself off entirely and quit the Yeng Corporation. Given their close ties to Buttercombe Academy, that might not have been the best idea…

But then again, Gia was listed as Rachel’s emergency contact (under a false name, naturally), and the on-site medical staff hadn’t called her. Maybe this could wait a week? She would still fly down there, but at a more convenient time that wouldn’t sacrifice her job here…

1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
At the end of the day, Gia's job was just that—a job.

Information had to change a lot of hands for her to be able to get into Yeng in the first place without raising at least a few flags. She'd been closely involved with the investigation for more than a few years now, and throwing all that under the rug because some reporter (okay, not just some reporter, but still) got into some hot water and seemed to drop off the face of the Earth wasn't the logical choice.

It could jeopardize everything if one day "Gia Tortelli" just up and quit, and on the same day a woman matching her exact description showed up at the gates of Buttercombe Academy. Even if she didn't show up, even if she managed to get Rachel to come meet her at a safe location, there was no information about the setup of the campus. The place was loaded with the daughters of billionaires, tycoons, and politicians on top of being heavily affiliated with one of the most secretive international corporations of the day and age. If Gia was caught on film, even with her back turned, it could get back to Yeng.

They'd seen her from every angle (unfortunately, there was plenty to see nowadays) and they could ping her ID in no time. Then it was just a hop, skip, and a jump away from figuring out Rachel's credentials were false, and then the entire operation would come under scrutiny.

Years of work, down the drain.

Even for Rachel Conrad—someone who she felt personally responsible for, despite her glibness—that wasn't a risk that Gia was willing to take.

So she did the responsible thing and put in a request for a few days off.

It took two weeks for her to get approved for the time off. She'd put in the request in mid-November and hadn't heard until December that she'd be able to take time off from her job. In that time, she eventually heard from Rachel, albeit in not so many words. They exchanged no phone calls and very few text messages. Gia had sent her a message every three days (a simple question mark) and every time after an hour-long delay she would receive a curt, simple:

not now.

It wasn't like Rachel at all. Even her shorter messages were more flowery and needlessly friendly. On the upside, her social media posts came trickling back in, though many of them were statuses instead of pictures. None of them used the codewords that they agreed upon and occasionally remembered to update, so Gia didn't see any additional cause for alarm. At least she was alive.

And if she wasn't, Gia was going to kill her.

***


Registering to enter Buttercombe Academy as a visitor was a twenty-four-hour process. It required approval from both the Vice Principal, former Head of Yeng's Eastern Seaboard branch Dr. Fukuda Hinamizawa, and one Shannon Polluck. Why it took an entire day's time to submit and achieve approval from just two women was beyond the more curt and officious Gia Rosellini, but that was beside the point.

In the time that she had spent in the neighboring town of Wellington, she had come to discover that Yeng's stranglehold on the mountainous Academy also choked down lower into the valley. Yeng's fingerprints were all over the town, via name-brand and shell company subsidiaries. From the look of things, there wasn't a truly local business in town—just about everything relied on Yeng in some way, shape or form whether they seemed to know it or not.

The scenery was idyllic; the beautiful mountain air was so clean that even Gia's smoke-damaged sense of smell could tell the difference. There were flowers in boxes outside windows of cozy mountain homes, cute little brick sidewalks that connected every corner. Flowers and grass were everywhere, and the town looked to be in great shape... figuratively speaking.

"The size of some of these people..." Gia tried not to whistle as she passed a pair of four hundred pound women in their mid forties, struggling to waddle down the sidewalk, "It's like a Norman Rockwell painting aboard Abercrombie Station..."

Almost everyone that Gia's taxi had passed weighed more than two hundred pounds. The men, the women, the children were all ridiculously obese. It almost felt like she hadn't left the office at all. Officer Nora would fit right in with that poor man who couldn't bend over to tie his shoes. Her superior back at the plant was about twice her size and had about a twentieth of her gumption, unless it came to delegation. Even the new cadet Woody would have looked at home, given the starter belly Gia had left him with. She knew first-hand how addictive Yeng products could be, but the boy had come straight out of Military school with washboard abs that she may or may not have liked to appreciate in a less than professional way. Much like them these men and women toddled, waddled, and sometimes rolled on expensive-looked mobility scooters that filled the walkways, slowly going about their days as members of the Yeng Corporate machine...

"I should have sent Rachel here..." Gia remarked almost casually to herself, "If there's half as much Yeng down here as there is up there, we'd have plenty to work with at half the risk..."

The winding trail up the mountain took a full forty-five minutes to drive. Even with the local driver who cut corners too sharply and sped far too leisurely for the likes of someone rolling up a mountain, forty-five minutes was a long time to sit and think.

Sit and think and worry.

Go over your cover story

Gia took a deep breath, her double chin spreading wider over the beige neck of her new sweater. Her chest rose as she fought the vague feeling of nausea that came with walking into uncharted territory. She'd never been to Buttercombe. She'd studied it on maps, she'd carefully pieced together a profile of the place with the notes that Rachel had sent her over the year and a half that she'd been stationed there, but never...

"Your name is Gia Tortelli." Gia repeated to herself, "You're friends with Rachel Conrad. You work with Yeng at a site in Georgia. You're here to visit her for the holidays before you go back to work."

She let out her breath, belly rolling up the hem of her not-as-big-as-she-thought new sweater as her flesh managed to poke through.

"And you are definitely not a cop."

1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
By the time Gia's cab made its way up to the front gate of the school, she had built up her facade.

She was simply Rachel's good friend Gia—oh, are you not the person I spoke to with on the phone?—and this was the only time she could get off. Yes she did work at a Yeng facility, in case anyone asked. Oh right, she had heard something about Yeng being a sponsor or something to Buttercombe, but she honestly hadn't looked that far into it. A job's a job, right?

She'd been slipping in and out of undercover characters for years. It was almost a habit. Something that she'd do without realizing it, even under certain situations when she didn't have to. It had helped make her job at the Yeng Facility easier, playing Gia the Ex-Cop with a greasy streak. How well that portrayal of herself would go down here was up in the air, she was banking on being able to play it a bit more friendly if it meant getting to Rachel quicker. Gia had been practicing which facet of her created identity she would play out today for the better part of a week. She just hadn't expected to give it to a speakerbox on a wrought-iron gate.

"Can I help you?"

She looked just like someone who Gia could have worked with. That stupid white uniform made everyone look like a marshmallow. At least her dark skin made it look a bit more fashionable, even if it made the fluff of her belly stand out that much more. Her curly brown hair fell into perfect ringlets along her caramel puddles of cheeks, crowding her chocolate-stained lips as her jowls rippled with authority.

"Hi, I'm Gia Tortelli?" Gia said into the talkbox, "I've been approved for visitation?"

"Who are you visiting?" the bottom-heavy Puerto-Rican asked in a bored, flat voice

"Rachel Conrad."

"Please pull up the notification on your DayPass app that you've been accepted, ma'am."

"Of course..."

Gia slid her thick thumb across the screen and readied it in the delivery tray, only for Officer Alvarez's gloved hands to wave it away nonchalantly. Having seen the golden yellow notification ticket on the screen, she extended one chubby finger to the gate button and waved Gia through.

Shifting uncomfortably in her tight black slacks, Gia waddled through the front gate's partition with some difficulty. Officer Alvarez hadn't opened it all the way, leaving just enough space for Gia's wide rump and full gut to catch the sides. It mussed the black double-breasted coat she'd been assured helped hide her substantial weight gain, leaving a faint trail of gray dirt between the buttons and along the torso. She'd been batting at it, trying her hand at dusting it off without making her belly jiggle too much in the process, when she was greeted by a shrill beep.

"Guten tag!" came a high, yet somehow throaty tone of voice, "Velcome to Buttercombe Academy for Gifted Girls!"

A small, spherical woman had driven up to greet her at the gate. She had thick black frames and short blue hair, cut in a deceptively choppy pattern that belied the care taken in the styling. Gia recognized the woman (vaguely) from the file that had been compiled over the years of various notable Yeng affiliates and employees. Give or take a few pounds (in this case, a lot) Gia could still recognize one Dr. Helen Schwartz—head of R&D in Daven's Port for a few years before being quietly parting ways with Yeng and hired on as Buttercombe Academy's new Guidance Counsellor.

The years had clearly not been kind to her.

Helen had grown exceptionally fat since her personnel file had been updated. At such a short weight, the weight was bound to pile on. She barely stood to Gia's chest, but necessitated a near two steps back in order to avoid their respective girths from brushing. Helen's belly was deep, and hung low over her pillowy lap as two squat, thick legs spread wide to support her growing weight. Two hammy arms exploded in size on either side of her smothering chest as she slowly came to stand on her poor fat feet.

"I am Dr. Helen Schwartz—head Guidance Counsellor for the girls on campus." she said in her thick German accent, "I vould like to extend to you our deepest hospitalities. It is so nice to meet you in person, Gia!"

Right then and there, the hardened ex-detective nearly had a heart attack. She felt her insides freeze and the pit fall out of her stomach as this woman called her by her name. For a moment, she considered that her cover might have already been blown from the moment she got there.

"Ach, you don't remember." Dr. Schwartz said with a belly-quivering laugh, "We spoke on the phone, ja?"

"Oh." Gia breathed a sigh of relief, "Oh! Right, Dr... Schwartz."

"Schwartz." Helen corrected her pronunciation, "Helen Schwartz."

"Schwartz." Gia repeated.

"Ja, much better—but you may call me Helen." her gopher cheeks dimpled as she took Gia's hand for a surprisingly firm shake, "In fact, I would prefer it."

"Um... alright." Gia resisted the urge to look suspicious, "I, um... I'm here to see Rachel Conrad. Is she around?"

"Of course, of course, Rachel is on campus, preparing for her last day of classes before the Winter Holiday." Helen took Gia's hand in both of hers and pat the spread of her knuckles placatingly, "Und as soon as we get you checked in at the infirmary, we can go see her."

"Infirmary?" Gia whipped around, "What infirmary—I'm just here to see my fri—"

"Ach, I know I know, I am so sorry about the trouble." Helen grunted as she gripped the pole railing of her golf cart (Gia's eyes widened in shock as the opposite wheels lifted inches off the ground!) and settled herself back into her seat, "Unfortunately due to health concerns, we are required to have visitors undergo a routine check-in with our nurses."

Gia squirmed uncomfortably in her position.

"And if I decline?"

Helen sucked air through her teeth, a short exhale as she caught her breath from all that wobbling around greeting her guest.

"Then I will ask Rio very nicely to open up the gate and you may walk through." she said in a stern, but nonetheless pleasant tone of voice, "We care very much about the safety of our girls here, Ms. Tortelli. I understand that sometimes the red tape can be, erm...verworren... but it is ultimately for the safety of our very dear students."

Gia took another deep breath, testing the confines of her coat as her swollen figure pressed tight against the breast, chest and waist.

"I guess." she said in a Rosellini-style grunt, "Do I ride with you?"

"Please!" Helen said with a cute little pat of the seat next to her double-wide rump, "I will give you a ride, und then I will take you to Frau Conrad once you are finished with your physical."

"Great." Gia grimaced, squeezing her wide hips next to Helen's in what felt like a war between pizza dough avalanches, "Best vacation ever..."
