1113122231332222112331121313231312111212.content:
Helen snapped the rubber glove tightly, causing it to pinch and shape her doughy forearm.

         “Should you really be doing this examination, yourself?” Gia asked, sitting on the cushioned bench, shrinking in front of the diminutive doctor. Gia had always been frightened of doctors, and generally avoided checkups as much as possible. The fact that this doctor was on the Yeng payroll only made this situation a hundred times more terrifying. “Are you like...qualified? Like are you even that kind of doctor?”

         “Let me see…” Helen thought about that for a moment, stroking her chin while looking up at the ceiling. “I have a Medical Degree, as well as a PhD in Pharmacology, Psychiatry and another in Public Health.” Gia whistled appreciatively. Helen’s gaze turned playful back towards Gia. “Do you know anyone more qualified?” She teased.

         “How about the school nurse?” Gia grumbled.

         “I don’t quite know where Shiro did her doctorates.” She joked. “But at any rate she’s busy with students. It is flu season after all. Hence why we are doing medical examinations for guests.” She explained while readying an otoscope. “Open wide and say ‘aaah’” She instructed.

         Gia resisted with her arms tucked under her chest, causing her sweater to ride up slightly. Helen waited patiently, like she was a petulant child. Reluctantly she opened her mouth and let Helen poke around in there.

         “Once the flu bug gets in, being confined in such tight quarters, living and working together, it spreads through the student body and faculty quite quickly.” She elaborated, while looking inside Gia’s mouth.

         She backed away and cleaned the otoscope. Gia started to soften. That made sense. And it’s not like they could learn anything about her just from a simple medical examination. There was no need to be jumpy. She still didn’t have to like it.

         “Where did you say you went to med school?”

         “I didn’t.” Helen corrected her, firmly, while writing down some notes.

         “...right.”

         “But if you must know, Humboldt University.” Helen reassured her, before feeling up her lymph nodes. “Does that hurt, any?”

         “No?”

         “Gut. Step on the scale, bitte?”

         “Is that really necessary?”

         “Perhaps not, but I like to be thorough.” Helen smiled. She reached behind Gia’s arm and tugged her along. Gia was aware, even in her pathetic shape, she’d have no problem resisting the tiny marshmallow trying to pull her around, but that would probably kill any hope of seeing Rachel. So she just sighed, and rolled her eyes, and followed the doctor along. “Your shoes, bitte.”

         And so, Gia took off her shoes, sucked in her gut, closed her eyes, and stepped onto the scale. And flinched as she heard the metallic clang followed by the doctor having to adjust the weights up higher and higher until…

         “126 kilos!” The doctor announced, happily.

         Gia opened one eye. “And in pounds that's?”

Half an hour later Helen Schwartz leaned back in her reinforced office chair, making it creak, and ticked off another answer. “Let us imagine a hypothetical situation. You have three cupcakes. What are you going to do with them, how many would you save for- Wie ist es… Ach! For a raining day?”

Where was the doctor going with her pop quiz? Gia would be the first to admit that a health exam makes sense of sorts before visiting a seriously ill patient but what was all this? The questionnaire so far felt as if Dr. Schwartz was testing her susceptibility to Yeng additives. And while the good doctor tried not to show it, Gia Rosellini was an old pro in her field too, she could easily tell what kind of answer was expected by now.

“Why save any? I'll eat them all right away!” Not that I ever would, she assured herself. As she tried to imagine the situation, it annoyed her that stomach suddenly growled. She could almost smell them…

“Gut, gut. Instant gratification indeed,” and Dr. Schwartz made another note before swivelling around in her chair and opening a laboratory cupboard to produce a half-empty tray. “Also, I am reminded we had some cupcakes delivered this morning so have one. Or three.”

Gia dutifully chuckled as she reached for them. I have to play the role, she justified it to her conscience. “Thanks.”

“Und last question, a practical one. You are a friend of Ms. Conrad, huh? Vhy are you visiting Buttercombe now?” and the plump doctor snatched a cupcake for herself.

The file Gia had on Helen Schwartz was far from complete, far too thin compared to the woman that now watched Gia's reaction like a hawk. Even from the little Gia knew, however, it was apparent that wherever Helen was posted she always played a major role in Yeng plans. And that also meant she was one of the real powers at this school, whatever the official structure said. She definitely deserved looking into.

And she was first and foremost a shrink so Gia made sure she was looking harmless and puzzled as she said: “Well, I haven't heard from her for ages, she completely fell off the grid, then I hear she had some kind of accident… Of course I would come to see her! To find out what's happened, if she's OK.”

“Na ja, natürlich. Ach, vell, this will be all from me, I will now call a guard to show you the way to your friend.” And as Gia grabbed armrests to push herself up from her chair, the doctor unexpectedly added: “She gave us quite the fright, you know.”

What fright? But Gia had been going undercover for years, she wouldn't just blurt it out like that. “Oh, yeah, right. Can you tell me more about it? I mean, as an experienced medical professional…” she let her sentence linger so that Dr. Schwartz would feel tempted to complete it, to show off her expertise.

“Ach, better ask her yourself. Doctor-patient privilege, you know?” The doctor rummaged in her drawer until she produced a wristband with a VISITOR tag. “Here, put this on, it vill let you to our infirmary. Take the lift to the fourth floor, you can find your friend in Room 412.”

“Umm, thanks.”

“You are velcome to stay as long as you like, Miss Tortelli. And while you are here, do not hesitate to sample the fruits of our kitchens. I am sure you would appreciate them.”

“Thanks, bye.” And Gia rather hastily fled the office, resisting the urge to wipe off sweat. Whew! Finally.

***


When Gia entered Room 412, her first thought was that she must have misheard. There was no sign of Rachel Conrad as she knew her inside. In fact, there was only one patient lying on the bed, happily chatting with a tall, plump nurse over a plate of donuts. But that couldn't be Rachel, could it?

Or maybe… The woman was covered with a fluffy duvet head to toes, all Gia could see was her face and there was a certain resemblance, though all her features were swollen – especially her cheeks were making her squint. It looked as if Rachel had met a particularly angry hornet swarm. And the voice was similar to Rachel's, if deeper and slower.

As she entered the room, Gia caught her last words. “-I think that lemon glaze improves on the taste, adds a certain contrast… Oh, Gia! Hi! What are you doing here?!”

“Rachel! What do you think? What's happened to you? You never call, never write… I had to show up, as your friend. I was worried sick.”

Those unfamiliar round features contorted in contrition. “Umm… Sorry, Gia, but I've been sick.”

The nurse raised a finger. “Better use its proper name, Rachel. You had the Dissociative Digestive Disorder.”

“A what?”

“Basically that means you stop feeling full,” Rachel offered helpfully. “There's been a lot of it going on around here. Even Shiro here got a mild case of it.”

Yeah, right, Gia thought skeptically. Put a fancy name on it and everyone'd believe it. I bet that tall nurse made it up just so we wouldn't blame Yeng and their machinations.

But Shiro only sighed, sucking in her stomach. “Uh, hello, I am Shiro Fukiyama, the school nurse,” she offered her hand, smudged with sugar and grease.

“Pleased to meet you, Gia… Tortelli.” The hesitation was minuscule but it was there, Gia chided herself.

Still, the nurse did not seem to notice, going back to their conversation. “And yes, Rachel is right. I must have caught from a student. It is a highly unpleasant disorder indeed. Poor Rachel here was the worst case we've had so far. Anyway, want another donut, Rachel?” she asked while observing her patient closely.


“Umm, I do but I shouldn't.”

“Good, good, that's right.” Shiro sighed with relief, letting her small tummy spread out again. “So, Rachel, since your symptoms have finally receded, you are now officially released from my care. Just remember to watch what you eat, follow HERMIA's nutritional advice and should excessive cravings return, call me immediately.”

“Right, right.”

“And I suppose your friend can take you to your cabin?” Shiro turned to Gia.

“Uh, yeah, sure. Of course.”

“Good. Now let's help Rachel get up and get her to the cart.”

Seeing Rachel in her pyjamas came as a delayed shock to Gia. Even Rachel's cherubic face did not prepare her for the avalanche of fat that poured out from the too tight fabric, jiggling with every move. And from the way she was breathing hard after having to take a couple steps from her bed to the waiting cart, it was clear she was in pretty poor shape too.

“Uh, finally. Here, take this. It's cold outside.” Shiro gave Rachel a blanket, “And come back for a checkup tomorrow. There'll be donuts waiting!”

“Heh, yeah, I sure will. Thanks for everything, Shiro, bye. And Gia? Come join me in the cart. Trust me, you don't want to walk all the way to my cabin.”

“Huh, OK.” The golf cart was wider than what Gia was used to seeing but it was a tight fit for both of them all the same. How could she triple her weight in less than a year? Gia wondered as they were driving out of the building. I know she was supposed to get fat for the mission but she must have no restraint to get THIS big.

“Uh, Gia? Are there any donuts in the box at your side? Can you pass me one? Have one for yourself too.”

Gia grunted, she had to squeeze to get it. “There are… brownies, donuts, cupcakes… someone made sure you'll be well-provisioned. But you did not want any in the infirmary.”

“Of course not. They'd have kept me there for another week otherwise. And back home HERMIA's watching me but here nobody can see me eat them. Except you.”

Gia rolled her eyes but did as she was asked. “So, uh… that HERMIA is your assistant?” she added while her fingers were busy typing. No matter what Rachel said, she would bet Yeng had the vehicle bugged. Only when she was finished, she passed her phone along with the requested donut. “Here.”

***

“Thanks.” Rachel stopped the cart and turned to her. It was a tight fit. Gia had always been voluptuous but now? How could she double her weight in less than a year? At least I did it for the mission, she must have no restraint. Look how she is demolishing that cupcake.

She quickly bit into the donut and looked at the phone. Give me what you have on the XLR-8. And when we get to the cabin, we must make a copy of HERMIA with your Data Extractor.

Frankly, she wasn't interested in hearing Gia's reproofs. “Uh, yeah. But look, it's cold out here, let's hurry inside.” She pretended to concentrate on driving (and eating) while she was frantically thinking how to deal with her real boss.

Truth be told, Rachel Conrad was no longer sure why she'd agreed to go undercover to Buttercombe. The strange sickness somehow messed up her memories, both old and recent. She wasn't even sure how she caught it. Most likely from that fat student with the accelerator, what was her name, Harper? But the details were foggy in her mind.

Plenty of things were foggy these days but Rachel's life did have a couple anchors she was clear about – Buttercombe cuisine, the comforts of her home and a firm conviction she did not want to give up either of them. Right now that meant avoiding Gia's displeasure without revealing her true colors to Buttercombe management. How should she best go about it? Should she give Gia what she asked for, in hope she would go and leave her alone? Or should she stall and delay and hope Gia's attention would be diverted elsewhere? Possibly she could even get infected by the DDD as well?

11131222313322221123311213134.content:
Fukuda finished her sentence with a wry smile and looked Rachel once over. The poor girl was visibly trembling now, and Fukuda had the look of a polar bear ready to pounce on a cornered seal.

"Wh- what do-" Rachel tried to stammer.

"Enough," Fukuda cut her off abruptly. She held her palm outward and the door closed behind Rachel. Startled, Rachel glanced behind her. Of course the doors here were automatic... and a soft click confirmed that the locks were automatic too.

With her other hand, Fukuda gestured to the black bracelet on her outstretched arm. "We've noticed, Ms Conrad, your frequent and... sporadic use of of the facilities' vending machines."

"Is that uncommon?" Rachel gulped. She was sweating now, visibly nervous and cowing under Fukuda's scrutiny. How much did Fukuda know? What had been the giveaway?

"Of course not, dear," Fukuda continued. That "dear" couldnt have been any less sincere. "But your bracelet shows that you have a tendency to frequent these machines at," she paused again to find the right word, "peculiar hours." She began slowly, casually walking toward Rachel, calmly closing the distance between them.

Rachel could have kicked herself. Of course the ELECTRONIC bracelet used to access the ELECTRONIC vending machine would keep an ELECTRONIC record of all her transactions. There was never any point in sneaking around during the night; she'd only justified Fukuda's suspicion!

"Now, you'd be far from the only one to sneak away during class to use a vending machine," she continued with a knowing smile, "but most faculty tend not to wander to so many different machines in a single class period."

So not just the times of the transactions but the locations as well. Rachel knew the jig was up. She had been found.

"All of those on top of your late-night excursions," Fukuda stopped advancing, "lead me to believe that teaching here is not your primary inclination, Ms Conrad. Am I correct?"

Rachel's heart was beating a dozen miles a minute. Fukuda hadn't yet shown a single shred of anger, but that only made Rachel fear any sudden outburst even more.

"I..." she began to plead. This couldn't have been going any worse! Rachel wasn't a spy or an assassin or anything. She was a goddam reporter!

"I- it's just my job! I never wanted to-"

"But to think Huan would stoop to hiring an undercover..."

Wait. Who? Huan? Yeng's... business partners?

"Is the board really that suspicious that they'd send one of their own in disguise?" Fukuda looked down, musing to herself now. "And inspecting every single machine..."

Fukuda looked back up at Rachel, who was still panicked but now equally confused.

"Mmph. I made the mistake of think you were merely enjoying our food... But apparently you're paying much more attention to what you're consuming than you're letting on. I would expect as much... from a food critic."

A food... critic?

Sure, Fukuda's conclusion may have been wrong, but there was no denying that it made sense. Skipping classes to go hunt down vending machines? Making sure to hit every single one? Taking those extra-long lunches with Brooke? This all gave Rachel an idea.

"Well," Rachel began, heart still pounding. This had to work. "I suppose you caught me in the act," she did her best to give a relaxed smiled. She didn't think she'd succeeded.

"However, we can keep this between us, if it's all the same to you, Miss Fukuda."

Fukuda raised a brow. "Oh, can we?" she replied.

"Well, there's no point in reporting me back to Huan; you know they'll just deny everything. Why else do you think they would have hired an independent contractor? No trail."

In truth, Rachel just needed a reason for why nobody at Yeng-Huan would have heard of her.

Fukuda nodded, "Of course."

"And I must say, I've only just gotten through all of the vending machines. I have a LOT of ground left to cover, and you know turning in an incomplete report will only mean my superior will find someone else."

That part technically was true. "Persistent" was Gia's middle name.

"You're the one with the advantage, Miss Fukuda," Rachel navigated carefully, "you're the only one who knows why I'm really here." She looked closely at Fukuda's eyes for any tells.

"This is true..." Fukuda muttered.

'Good,' Rachel thought, 'she just confirmed she hasn't told anyone else yet.' Rachel's breathing was getting easier. This was working after all!

Fukuda looked off to the side, clearly contemplating the woman before her and the situation that she had presented her with. After a few gruelingly long seconds, she looked back up to Rachel. With a stiff smile, she casually waved her arm again. The door behind Rachel clicked open.

"Yes, yes. Miss Conrad. There is quite a bit more ground left for you to cover. Why, you haven't even seen our private dining rooms. Come with me," she said, swiftly walking past Rachel.

Rachel turned around to follow. "But wait," she began, "my class," she gestured to the empty room behind her.

Fukuda whisked around with another faux smile. "I've already arranged for a substitute," she indicated her black bracelet once more. "Now come."

Rachel gulped. It wasn't a request. Still not knowing if she was out of the fire just yet, Rachel followed suit.

The building that Fukuda took her to was one Rachel hadn't seen before. Exiting from a cart, she trailed after Fukuda warily while the older Japanese woman waved her bracelet in front of a sleek black scanner next to a side door, the door opening with a long, clear beep.

"After you," her voiced dripped with honey.

Fukuda led Rachel down a long, lowly lit hallway while she conversed with the in cognito "food critic" by her side.

"We've no more need for pretenses," she calmly explained, looking forward rather than turning to face Rachel. Rachel's eyes, on the other hand, were glued to Fukuda's face. "And you've no need to worry for the dispelling of your facade," she articulated primly. "I'll be honest, you were not exactly the best new teacher at Buttercombe. You'll take the next few days off as part of a "relocation", before being replaced with another, more capable faculty member." She stopped at a large, ornate wooden double door. Despite its size, it gave way with only the slightest push.

"This will be your new station," Fukuda gestured.

Rachel gasped. She had been taken to a fairly large dining room, as Fukuda had promised, fully varnished with red carpet, rosy oak walls and- was that a fireplace? Rachel stepped gingerly into the room, taking care to step around the bearskin rug that adorned the red floor. No telling how much that thing cost.

Rachel's destination was pretty clear. In the center of the room, squared evenly between the two large double doors on either end, was a long oak varnished table that matched the walls. The underneath and legs of the table were embellished with the typical Buttercombe flair; chubby cherubic angels frolicked with various plates of different pastries in each hand. The wooden carvings almost seemed to dance in the flickering of the firelight, the primary source of luminescence in this rustic red room.

The table, although long, was completely bare and only had one chair at the very end. An armless chair, it appeared large, plush, red and expensive like everything else in this room.

"Have a seat."

Rachel did exactly as she was told, pretty sure of what was about to happen. Her stomach let out a loud rumble in anticipation as well; that ride over hadn't been particularly short and Rachel desperately needed something to calm her nerves. Fukuda merely smirked and waved her bracelet once more.

As if exactly on cue, the doors opposite the ones they had entered burst open. Silver carts laden to the brim with the most decadently deliciously smelling cuisine Rachel had ever seen were wheeled out by appropriately dressed but completely silent staff- all thin, wiry and Japanese, who began hurriedly offloading their ferry to the sturdy center table.

Rachel almost moaned audibly. With no prompting needed, she picked up a fork and a knife and immediately began digging in to an absolutely heavenly carbonara that had been surreptitiously placed in front of her. The servers paid her mind, slowly surrounding her with mini-tables loaded down with silver plates, shining platters and even crystal carafes of clear red liquid.

"I see you're already eager to get to critiquing," Fukuda nodded approvingly. "I assure you that you will be dining on only the best the academy has to offer from this point. Of course, I still implore you to make frequent use of the cafeterias during lunch and dinner hours, confirm that we are not cutting corners with ordinary students and faculty either." Fukuda poured herself a glass of wine from one of the carafes and sipped before continuing. Rachel was far too preoccupied to interrupt. "But outside of that, you'll be here. If anybody asks, you're merely involved in an "Assisted Study". Your contemporaries- and Huan- will still only see you as a fellow teacher. However, we'll see how well you acclimate here for the next few months."

Wait a minute, next few months? Rachel made her way through her next few mouthfuls before turning to ask Fukuda a question, but the woman had already vanished, her light footsteps masked by the sound of invigorated chewing.

She returned to the spread now in front of her, only about an eighth of it demolished and plenty more coming her way after.

What had she gotten herself into?

111312223133222211233112131341.content:
"The Yeng Corporation does not believe in shortcuts."

Rachel's hands had become particularly skilled with a knife and fork since she'd been assigned to Buttercombe Academy. Her fingers were nimble and her instincts with cutlery were sharp. While Fukuda spoke to her, she carved up slick meaty breasts of chicken cordon bleu. Dotting the plate with stabbing motions of her fork as her bites fell apart, she ensured that not an ounce was wasted.

"As you can see, we are putting our chefs to good use." Fukuda's narration after her original departure had since come through speakers built overhead, but she was present in the lobby today. Watching and sipping from her glass of red wine, "Headed by the world-famous Bunnie Blake, our culinary team is an efficient, well-oiled service just as dedicated to quality and refinement as it is to the improvement of their craft."

Sip.

How many times Rachel had heard an approximation of this little speech in the past few days would have been anyone's guess. Dr. Hinamizawa often spoke highly of Yeng in a clearly practiced, scripted manner, even unprompted. With her slight accent and her even tone, never raising much higher than a carefully calculated volume, Fukuda could have easily been shooting a late-night infomercial or a training video. Regardless of whether her presence was tangible or not, the hours where Rachel could hear the doctor's speeches were often the ones that proved hardest to get through her "task".

The food was delicious, that wasn't the issue. Rachel had been convinced that Buttercombe's cuisine was the epitome of finery beforehand and, no matter what Fukuda said, she could easily tell the difference between what she'd been feeding her and what she'd been dining on since she had agreed to teach at Buttercombe. The problem was Fukuda's presence—in and out every few hours—was distracting. Her reporter's instincts had told her to grill the woman as much as possible, or plug her for any information she might be able to get out of her. But the instincts that she had developed during her time at Buttercombe, the ones that told her to keep eating despite the fullness in her stomach or the tightness of her belts, found her an annoying obstacle to tune out.

Rachel would tell herself frequently, in the back of her mind, that the next time Fukuda entered the room or spoke over the PA, she'd ask her some questions. Get some information that might move her investigation forward.

She had yet to do so.

"The next course to be served is a smoked duck and peanut butter soup." Dr. Hinamizawa continued over the sounds of the fraudulent food critic's feasting, "Notice the oddity of the pairing—the Yeng Corporation believes that..."

***


Rachel was one of the few in the cafeteria to stop after a single serving.

Her stomach was still tight from her "Assisted Study", a rock hard rounded gut bore underneath her sweater. Four days into her new assignment, and she'd only just now worked up the nerve to enter the cafeteria like everything was normal. It had been the first time she'd seen Brooke or Megan since Dr. Hinamizawa had reassigned her. Her welcome had been a warm one, surely, but her friends had begun to worry.

"So where have you been these past few days?" Brooke asked, "Dr. H wrangled up a sub pretty fast and then you were just... gone!"

"I've been..." Rachel burped into the back of her hand, "Sick."

Sick is right. Day in and day out, she'd been eating like the richest garbage disposal in town. She'd been getting home and collapsing in bed, first chance she got. The fact that she wasn't at home in her cabin right now was a testament to her willpower. She needed to keep up appearances. If she wanted to get anywhere she needed...

Forget the investigation—it was just nice to talk to someone who wasn't Dr. Hinamizawa.

"Well that explains it." Megan laughed, her ring of chin rippling, "I'm sure you'll get your appetite back in no time."

"I'm sure..." Rachel grimaced, sipping from her water...

***


"The Yeng Corporation believes that an excellent whole is comprised of excellent components."

Sip.

Rachel was panting. Who knew how long she'd been eating? The longer the day dragged on, the more dishes were pulled out of that private kitchen, it became more and more difficult to track the hours as they passed. Her stomache distended to rest in her soft lap, warm with the heat of pressure. The button on this, her last good pair of work pants, had busted off sometime this morning between the round of deviled eggs and what had felt like a loaf of french toast.

"Take note of the individualized flavors; the components that make up your Sea Urchin Ceviche are all very distinct, but come together to make something much more rewarding and satisfactory as a whole." Fukuda sloshed her wine in her glass, the bottom of the bulb fogged slightly, "I am sure that you will note the care with which the complementary ingredients have been chosen—not haphazardly, but with precision and purpose."

Sip.

Rachel had to agree, the menu was divine. She'd never had the same thing twice since she'd changed her cover story from English Teacher to Third Party Food Critic. She had expanded her menu and tasted some of the most incredible meals of her life since her cover was "blown". Sure, she often let her mind drift during her meals. But around this time of day, the last thing on her conscience was how her students were faring, or what rumors were being spread about her continued absence at classtime...

"Now, I know you are probably getting full." The sound of the kitchen doors opening came at the slightest pause, Rachel's pink tongue lolled to the side, "So we are beginning our dessert course now. Chocolate parfait has always been a favorite of..."

***


"I have been calling you."

Gia didn't sound happy. She often didn't, at least when business was concerned. But Rachel could tell that the six missed calls this week had left a sour taste in her mouth. And not in the pleasurable way, like the bitter melon ice cream that she'd had for dessert before driving home. If Rachel hadn't left her burner phone right by her bedside the morning before, she probably would have slept through another one of Gia's phone calls too—her stomach squelching, doming above her while she slept off the incredible meals she'd gorged herself on throughout the day.

"Yeah, I'm..." Rachel took a deep breath, her stomach settled awkwardly, "Sorry. There's been a... hiccup."

"A hiccup." Gia repeated in a stern elevated tone, the sound of her palm hitting the desk on the other end indicated that it was not a question.

"Just... just trust me." Rachel managed, her eyes bleary and her brain fuzzy with food and sleep, "Gotta go."

"Rachel Conrad, do not—"

Rachel's thumb hung over the END button on her phone for the slightest of moments before her arm fell back down to bounce against the mattress. She was already asleep by the time she'd shut her eyes again.

***


At the risk of exposing what she was really doing at this academy, Rachel continued to explore the newfound layer to her facade. After her first week ended and she settled into her new routine, she did her best to blend the hiccup (as she'd called it) of her Assisted Study (as Dr. Hinamizawa called it) into the larger narrative of her cover story at Buttercombe. She'd told her friends and any relevant coworkers about a vaguely defined job "with the Vice Principal", and managed to keep them at a safe arm's length away over dinners.

No need in letting leads run dry, now was there?

As expected, between her private eating area and the dinners that she'd worked herself up to with her friends and coworkers, Rachel continued to grow like never before. In an a school where almost everyone, especially the new arrivals, seemed to steadily expand outwards Rachel quickly gained the lead. With a steady influx of food and more calories than any one woman could have known what to do with, slim and TV-ready Rachel Conrad was being buried beneath pounds upon pounds of excess blubber.

As time rolled on, one thing steadily became clear—Rachel Conrad...

Alice Sorensen
25, Blonde, 5'7, 167 lbs.
Math I/II

Alice really wishes she was somewhere else right now.

An alumni of Buttercombe academy, she'd spent her formative years in these very walls. This place had really helped her grow as a person. Literally.

Every semester at Buttercombe had seen her piling on the weight. Outgrowing uniforms quickly became a regular thing, and she was quite the target of fun for her siblings whenever she came home for a spell, far larger and hungrier then when she left. Every time, she swore that she would lose the weight, or at least halt her gain. And every time, she'd restrain her appetite for days at most, then start stuffing herself silly once again.

By the time she graduated, she was a whopping 412 lbs. Walking fifty yards without a break was a herculean task, and going more then an hour without dropping something sweet or greasy into her hollow leg, utterly unthinkable. Her weight continued to rapidly rise throughout her first semester of college, despite the less than fat-friendly atmosphere, but she hit a breaking point. Namely, in a single day during finals, she crushed her couch, split her pants, and got trapped in her car by her gargantuan belly. With the help of her room mate, she weighed herself that night, and was stunned to find out she was only six pounds short of breaking 500.

The huge young woman decided right then and there that enough was enough. Sticking to a strict exercise and diet program, she managed to shed an astounding 327 lbs. However, while her weight loss plan might have been successful, her professional life was less so. Despite sending out multiple resumes, only a handful of schools had called her in for an interview, and none had hired her.

Save one.

She'd only applied to Buttercombe as her back-up, back-up school, and much to her chagrin, they were the only ones willing to hire her. Beggars can't be choosers, though, so she'd accepted the job. Besides, she wasn't the weak-willed girl she'd been in her teens. This time, she'd control herself. This time, she wouldn't stuff herself like a prize winning hog. This time, she would keep working out. This time, she wouldn't gain an ounce. This time would be different.

Right?

Alice is of Danish descent, with bright blue eyes and long blonde hair, typically kept in a ponytail.
She typically gains a lot in her belly, though her booty and thighs certainly hold up their end.

111332.content:
Alice sat in the back seat of the cab. She could feel her pulse quickening with each yard the cab put under its wheels. As they passed the gate, her breath became shallow and stressed. Her nerves were firing on all cylinders. "Calm down. It's just a building. It's just a building. It's just a building."

It was, in truth, more then a building. The whole of Buttercombe campus was a den of memories for the blonde. The new teacher had been a student within these very walls, and she had no shortage of good memories here.

And bad ones, as well.

"It's different now. YOU'RE different now. It won't happen again. It won't happen again."

Alice Sorenson had, in just a few short years at Buttercombe, had grown to a then-staggering 412 pounds by graduation. Given she'd only attended the school for three years and had been a mere slip of a girl at 119 pounds on entry, she'd managed to put on close to a hundred pounds of jiggly fat per year.

It wasn't hard to figure out why, if she was being honest with herself, as her appetite had been totally out of control. On average, she had been eating four meals a day on weekdays, and five or six on the weekends. Pre-bedtime and midnight snacks were the norm, and she was always eating something between classes. Her belly had initially hurt with how much she was putting away, but it was so good she didn't even consider slowing or stopping eating as potential options.

Once her belly had stretched out to accommodate her rate of consumption, Alice had watched her weight skyrocket. During her junior year, she managed to outgrow three uniforms in a single month. Her family had been stunned with just how huge she'd gotten, and their incredulity only increased with with her waistline with each milestone. Her Mum had been an endless repository of diet advice and healthy suggestions, and Alice had found her worrying exhausting to deal with.

Her siblings, on the other hand, had been simply aggravating. They had teased her mercilessly, only getting worse and worse as she got bigger. Her one sister, Cathy, developed a bad habit of slapping her growing behind or shaking her wobbly gut rolls when she was unaware of her presence, even going so far as to sneak a photo of Alice when she was seated on the couch in sweat shorts and a bra. It was a less then flattering shot of the massive young woman, with a large pepperoni on one end table and a plate with four double cheeseburgers on the other. Cathy had dubbed the photo, "the Land-whale in her natural habitat," and used it as blackmail material to force her widening sibling to eat whatever she put in front of her.

Her brother, Theo, had been just as bad in his own way. He was constantly plying her with treats and honking huge amounts of fatty foods, seeming to think if she was going to be fat, then she might as well go whole hog. Even when she was at her heaviest and could eat all day without a break, he somehow managed to force enough food down her throat to leave her painfully stuffed to the brim every single time.

It probably says something about her time at Buttercombe that Alice actually expected to lose weight during the holidays, but thanks to her and her siblings efforts, Alice's weight spiked every time she went home for an extended period.

At grad, she'd been one of the biggest girls on campus, though she knew from talking to the school nurse ("What was her name again?") that the average student weight had gone up in a big way since she'd been there. "And, more worryingly, teacher weights..."

Alice had been a little surprised to hear Shannon Polluck was still the Head Mistress of Buttercombe academy. She'd been a fairly big woman when Alice was a teen, and she was absolutely stunned when she saw just how much Miss Polluck had expanded in the years since. Miss Polluck was now a planetary ball of lard, stretching her poor uniform to its utmost and eliciting some very worrisome creaks from her hugely oversized office chair. "She couldn't even stop eating during my 'Welcome to the Team' meeting. Heck, she's so fat she couldn't reach past her belly to grab another doughnut and had me pass them to her..."

Alice could only hope that Miss Polluck's gargantuan ass was merely skewing numbers to the heavier end, but she'd find out soon enough. There was still about a week before classes start, and only a couple students had shown up so far. Her lesson plan was ready to go, so this time was mostly about meetings and getting to know her fellow staff members.

The cab had pulled to a stop in front of the main campus building as she was lost in thought, and she exited the vehicle and grabbed her bag from the trunk. She looked at nearby sign, proudly advertising Yeng Brand Stomach Aid.

Another major change from her time at Buttercombe was the new addition of Yeng. The corporation had been a major sponsor for the school for a lot of years, but now it had grown into a full partnership. Beyond extra funding, Alice wasn't too sure what this yet meant, but she had a meeting with the Yeng representative that would hopefully answer some of her questions. "What was the name? Hinaizawa?"

Of course, Alice herself had also changed a lot from her time at the academy. Her first semester at college had seen her gain until she was only a hairsbreadth away from the big 500. She'd managed to put on as much weight in three months as she'd put on in a year at Buttercombe, and this turned out to be the wake-up call she needed.

Over the last couple of years, Alice had managed to shed an astonishing amount of weight, managing to drop herself to a comparatively svelte 167 pounds. It had been a lot of hard work (and, admittedly, an expensive bit of surgery), and she was proud of her new figure and athletic prowess.

Alice remembered how she used to be. Her gigantic belly softly stretching to her knees, even when standing. Her couch-crushing ass reaching from one arm rest to the other. Stopping halfway up a flight of stairs for an extended break, panting heavily and feeling sweat pool between her wobbly rolls. Her endless, rumbling belly and its desperate need for more and more and more...

Alice Sorenson really didn't want to go back to that, and her cruel siblings were already placing bets on how much she was going to gain. The fact that they were only giving 3 to 2 odds for her breaking her old weight record stung a bit, but she was terrified that they'd be proven right. "Heck, I'm already feeling hungry."

She frowned, wondering why she felt hungry given she'd only eaten an hour ago. As she looked around, it didn't take too long for her to figure out why.

She was currently standing downwind of the campus dining hall. Her skin went pale and her lip trembled in fear. "No, no, no! It doesn't mean anything! Cathy and Theo are wrong! I can do this! I can hold out! I'm stronger then this! I am, I am, I am!"

Alice was so lost in thought that she didn't see the person behind her approach, and she physically jumped when they called her name. Turning around, she saw...

1113321.content:
"Miss Sorenson?"

"Eeep!" Alice squealed as she jumped from the unexpected call behind her. She turned around, clutching her rapidly beating heart, to see a middle aged Japanese woman. She was a little taller then she was, and a bit thinner. Not a single strand of hair was out of place, and it was a testament to the skill with which she'd done up her traditional bun that it barely shifted as she jumped from Alice's scream.

Eyes wide, she said, "I apologize. I didn't mean to scare you."

"It's okay, it's okay. You just startled me," Alice said as she willed her heart rate to return to normal. "Miss Hinaizawa, I'm guessing?"

"Close. Fukuda Hinamizawa," she said, holding out her hand to the young woman.

"Oh, way to go," Alice thought, kicking herself as she took the offered hand. "Sorry about that, Miss Hinamizawa."

"Please, call me Fukuda. Just arrived I see," she said, thrusting her chin towards Al's bag.

"Yes, I just got her a couple minutes ago."

"Perhaps you'd like to join me for lunch? I know our meeting isn't until tomorrow, but after a quick bite, I could give you a tour of the campus and we could get to know each other a little better."

Her fears of the lunch room once more came to fore, and Alice felt herself grow pale. "Oh, no, I'd hate to impose..."

"Nonsense, I insist." Miss Fukuda picked up Alice's bag, ignoring her reaching grasp. "Shall we?"

Not seeing any way out of this, Alice nodded, hoping her grimness didn't show on her face. "Sure, I'd be happy to."

*** *** ***

Dr. Helen Schwartz was sitting at her desk. Perhaps a bit old school in the digital age, she was looking at the results of a recent formula change on her monitor, and scribbling notes in her messy shorthand as she read. As she wrote, the microwave behind her dinged, and she paused in her note taking to retrieve the cup of coffee she'd just reheated. As she was crossing the little room, her desk intercom went off.

"Ov course," she thought. Taking a sip of her caffeinated beverage, she opted to open the door rather then return to her desk. Seeing exactly who she expected too, she stated, "Miss Hinamizawa. Do come in."

Her "Boss," as much as Helen considered herself to have a superior she need answer to, walked over to Helen's desk and took a seat. Perhaps that might have been construed as an insult by some, but the two women had worked together for enough years that Helen knew there was no offense implied. It was well known that the German doctor seldom sat at her desk, and was prone to pacing when faced with an interesting or challenging problem.

Dr. Schwartz's interest was now piqued.

"Somezing interesting has happened, I think."

"Indeed. I was able to get Alice Sorenson to take our recent vacancy."

Helen, who was somewhat prone to tuning out Fukuda, only vaguely remembered the name. "And? I vould imagine that you haff somezing more exciting than hiring a new science teacher to discuss vith me."

"Math. And yes, most certainly. She's an alumni of Buttercombe from during Phase 1 of Yeng's involvement with this school. And she's the last active recipient of formula 27-B."

THAT certainly got Dr. Schwartz's attention. "Impossible. All subjects are accounted for."

"That you know of, yes. Your paperwork on the subject, as usual, is perfectly detailed. However, Yeng decided to run their own tests on the formula."

"Vithout my involvement or knowledge, I see." The formula in question had been developed by Dr. Schwartz many years ago, back when both she and Fukuda had been based in the city of Daven's Port. 27-B was meant to be an improvement over its sister product, 27-A. In both cases, the formula was designed to enhance the addictive properties of Yeng brand foods, boosting sales accordingly.

27-A had a couple of serious flaws. Namely, certain compounds would neutralize the formula, and actually would turn the addictive chemicals in Yeng products into a deterrent. Depending on how one viewed such things, the other result was perhaps even worse. The test subjects of 27-A to a one were horrific gluttons. Eating non-stop, they all ballooned enormously, and clearly had no self-restraint left for their gargantuan appetites. After a whole string of subjects were hospitalized, Yeng panicked, and ordered all test subjects to be given the antidote and this whole line of research swept under the rug.

This is when Helen Schwartz got involved in the project. The promise of more sales and guaranteed customers was far too enticing, and Yeng gave her their unofficial support. Helen would later confide in Fukuda that she'd never seen a more incompetently manufactured compound in her life. Frankly, it had looked like it was designed while drunk, protein compounds and chemical chains tacked on like someone attaching layers of plywood with a nail gun until, by accident, they'd managed to assemble a house.

A house that only succeeded in barely functioning as a house, to be blunt.

Helen redesigned the chemical from the ground up, aiming for the end result of perfectly addicted customers. Working within the framework she was given, Helen successfully composed 27-B. However, Admin was less than thrilled with the way in which she did it. Namely, rather then deal with the rampant gluttony of her subjects, Helen instead aimed for the formula to correct many of the worst health effects their diets would entail. Once again, every subject exploded with fat, and the bosses were not moved by the fact that they were considerably healthier butterballs then the first batch.

Making matters worse, from their perspective, was that Dr. Schwartz had corrected the "antidote problem," meaning pulling the plug on this project was almost impossible. Many were bundled up and hidden in a mothball facility, and a lot of cash changed hands to keep this quiet. Only Fukuda's insistence had allowed Helen keep her job, and as far as the doctor had known, that had been the end of it.

Until now.

"You can't be surprised. You made great progress on the original, but were seen as a dangerous failure, to use their language." Fukuda made quotes around the words from the report. "There were some who believed they could improve on your efforts."

"Und how did zat go?"

"Poorly." Fukuda pulled out a report from her briefcase on the floor. "42 test subjects in all. 31, no effect. 8, increased appetites for a week, then a sudden drop off. The same eight were also the eight lightest students in their graduating class.

"The remaining three are considerably more interesting. All three with greatly increased appetites. All were consistent, with or without the additive present in the cafeteria foods. Alice Sorenson was easily the largest of the bunch, both in sheer size and in appetite. Strangely enough, her largest gains were away from Buttercombe."

"Und she is still actiff?"

"Oh yes. She's not much larger then I am."

"Remarkable." Helen was right to be surprised. The test subjects in her notes were many things, but certainly not active. All had been immobile for some time, with the majority continuing their rather impressive gains after crossing that threshold. A few had grown so large that even 27-B couldn't correct everything, forcing Helen to develop and administer 27-B2 in secret.

"Indeed. I pulled a lot of strings to make sure she wound up back here. The formula is still having an effect on her, if her lunch is any indication. Perhaps this is a chance to finish what we began so long ago, no?"

Helen Schwartz smiled.

*** *** ***

Alice rubbed her painfully stuffed stomach. She'd made an absolute pig of herself at lunch, and her grand tour involved Fukuda half-carrying her back to her room. Even thinking of all she'd just eaten nearly made her have a panic attack.

"It was just one time. It was just one time. You won't always eat a whole cheesecake at lunch. It was just one time. Just a pie. And a bit. And a rack of ribs. Seriously, just one time..."

1121.content:
15 years ago, Marsha Alberway had joined Buttercombe as a sports coach, bringing baseball to the academy as a way to have fun, as well as to have a chance for others to succeed where she had failed in life. If things had gone their way, she thought, the baseball program would serve as a source of pride, and perhaps it could even help keep students fit as the months went by.

But they didn't. Not by a long shot.

While the first year was somewhat successful, during the second year the team members of the Buttercombe baseball team had bloated up considerably, with one student, a certain Hester Rhea, even getting to the point of being immobilized for about a month or two. The certain cause, nobody was sure about. But Marsha believed it had to do with a combination of a certain sweets loving RA and Hannah Hammond, who briefly served as a TA sub coach for her team before heading off to Stuffington U.

Because of that, the team had one of the worst seasons in the history of all baseball, and to avoid humiliation Shannon Polluck had shut down her baseball team. While she had stayed, she was demoted to a teritary coach, namely forced to help in keeping students fit outdoors via the occasional outdoors run.

About 14 years after this initial demotion however, Marsha would eventually become the primary coach and gym teacher, following Ashley Knight retiring upon reaching an astonishing 600 pounds in weight. Now in charge of the new program, Marsha had made an effort to slim down in time for the new year, trying her best to cut down on eating her beloved hot dogs and instead trying a Atkins style diet to lose weight, combined with some heavy exercise.

Getting to the bathroom, Marsha would look down at her scale. "Well Marsha... time to see what this diet has brought you..."

Stepping on the scale, Marsha would wait for the numbers to settle, looking down to her rounded, sagging belly. Hearing the mechanical ping that it was done, Marsha would push her belly to the side to see the results of her diet.

"350 lbs."

While she had lowered her weight by about a hundred pounds, which was certainly impressive for the newly primary coach, Marsha would frown as she would then move her body to the mirror. Looking at it, while she would see some muscle on her arms and legs from the heavy exercise, her gut was still heavily rounded and stretching out, while her rump still looked like she needed at least two seats to sit down.

"Oh I know it takes time to lose weight but I wish I could be skinny again... at least just for tomorrow so that I can impress my new students..."

Since the first day was all about getting students introduced to the school, Marsha ended up being free for the day, leaving her to spend her day on her own. With this free time, she would...

1122.content:
*Huff*

*Pant*

“God…why do I do this…” A dark-haired figure panted heavily to herself, as she trudged up towards her chalet. Carrie Porter had opted to spend the Summer Break with her family, which meant she had had to pack her bags from her living quarters at Buttercombe Academy and crash with them for a while.

This meant the blubbery brunette had to drag her bags from her car all the way up to her suite from the previous year. As to why she didn’t just lug them into one of the many golf karts and just drive up the small path…that reason was swaddled all around her.

Carrie was big, she knew it, everyone knew it; and if she didn’t want to get any bigger she needed to do something about it. Substituting driving for walking seemed like a good idea at the time, but it was leaving the unfit, un-toned woman drawing deep wheezing breaths like a winded cow.

She should have felt really good about the exercise; especially after staying with her parents for just over two months, most importantly her mother. She loved her mom to bits, but god dam did her life revolve around food. Carrie had had temptation around her every waking moment, not to mention meals that were filled with enough calories-per-serving to feed a wrestler for a week.

Of course Carrie had no willpower whatsoever (which was why she was in her current predicament), and had pretty much cleaned every plate. It was a habitual thing; as a child Carrie had gleefully eaten massive portions and asked for seconds. It wasn’t until High School that Carrie finally realized that her eating had consequences.

Unlike her sister, Carrie had gone to a comprehensive, which meant no excess funding for the fat kid who couldn’t fit in any of the desks, or broke a chair every other week. This pushed her to do something about it; and while Carrie never slimmed down (her genes sought to that, when a pound stuck it stuck for good), she did slow her exponential growth dramatically; all this while her big sister (previously the slimmest member of the Porter household) ballooned under Buttercombe’s care.

Which was why Carrie had been so disappointed by the previous year, and her first year working for the school her sister had once attended as a student. All that hard work and restraining herself, only gaining a scant ten pounds a year at most prior, and suddenly she had ballooned by five times that after stepping foot on the school’s grounds.

Finally, after what felt like an age, Carrie arrived at her chalet. Beeping her keycard on the sensor, she opened the door and dropped her suitcase to the floor before doubling over and placing her hands on her knees.

Sweat poured from her forehead, some even dripping onto the wooden floorboards. Her tongue lolled out as she panted, desperately trying to suck in as much air as possible.

“I…swear…no more…exercise…until…I drop…the weight…” Carrie said to herself in gasping breaths. She had never been anything near fit; a solid F for Gym class every year had highlighted that. But her sentence was part of the problem, Carrie often made little excuses to herself; and last year was full of them. She had even convinced herself to eat three slices of cake at a teachers leaving party. Not a good sign for a prospective dieter.

But Carrie’s ordeal was not quite over yet. Rather than unpack or shower, the hefty woman wobbled over towards the couch, aiming to collapse her huge form across it. As she waddled, she had to stop and hitch up her pants several times, plump fingers wrapping around the waistband and wrenching upwards, nearly giving herself a wedgie. Carrie was an incurably lazy woman at heart, even when it came to her wardrobe. When an outfit she liked stopped fitting, Carrie wore it to near destruction, rather than buy one in a more fitting size.

Her immense width hit the couch with barely a creak from the springs. Being as big as she was, Carrie qualified for the SSS treatment, and as such she had had her furniture reinforced to withstand a woman of her magnitude. As she gathered her breath, spread-eagle across the seat, her piggish eyes darted across the table and spied the welcome basket.

Her dry lips were moistened by her tongue, flirting with the edges of her mouth as it watered at the idea of more food. She hadn’t eaten since she started her drive, and she had just done such hard work dragging her case…she deserved a little treat right?

Grunting like a sow in labor, Carrie exerted as much force as she could, her fat body rolling forwards and her belly slapping the lip of the table. Thankfully the basket wasn’t situated far from her chubby finger’s grasp, so her soft pudgy skin met wicker very quickly.

Returning upright, Carrie peered inside the basket. Yeng brand goodies were practically overflowing it like some cornucopia of sugary treats. Reaching for one of the topmost items, Carrie came away with a muffin so plump that it’s muffin-top rivalled her own in pudginess.

The brunette bit down, and her eyes rolled back at the taste. That was the good stuff; her diet last year had constituted of so much Yeng-brand food that she had become addicted to it. Going an entire Summer without it, coming back felt better than sex.

Within moments the oversized confection was resting soundly in Carrie’s figure-dominating belly, sausage fingers being licked eagerly for the last residue. Carrie looked back into the basket; one more wouldn’t hurt would it? Soon her teeth were sinking deep into a honey-bun, its sweetness dancing across her taste buds.

Minutes passed by in a blur as item after item vanished from the basket and into Carrie’s gut, each one framed with a more pitiful excuse as Carrie glutted herself to her heart’s content.

Many minutes later, and Carrie felt her pink-painted fingernails scrape the bottom of the wicker basket and come up empty.

“Uh oh…” Carrie muttered as she looked down at herself. She was a total mess; crumbs dotted the crease between her breasts and belly, and the latter had emerged fully from its cloth covering; with her cavernous belly-button for the entire world to see.

Looking down at the basket and realizing she had failed again, Carrie gave a dejected sigh. Looks like it was salads and no desserts for the next week to try and counteract that.

With no desire to find herself scraping the basket for specks and crumbs, Carrie decided a shower was in her best interests for now.

As Carrie tried to right herself, she felt the force of gravity yank hard at her confection-filled belly. Her big blobby sphere was looking less like a big sack of lard and more like a beach ball made of fat. Sighing to herself and promising again to rid herself of the swaddling adipose, Carrie waddled towards her old bathroom, undressing and lazily tossing her clothes to one side as she went.

A blissful sigh passed her pink lips as she felt the cool tiles contact her feet, aching with carrying such an immense load all day. But that was nothing compared to the bliss she felt as the warm water rushed across her body, washing away the painful fullness of her belly and allowing her to drift away into…

*Knock knock knock*

“Fudge!” Carrie faux-swore under her breath as she turned off the tap.

“I’ll be just a minute!” She yelled, poking her head out of the shower and simultaneously (and accidentally) splashing the room with her wet hair.

Carrie didn’t have time to be thankful that Buttercombe had provided towels in her size as she tucked the fluffy article around her widest part, before waddling as fast as she could for the door.

“Yes?” Carrie asked as she opened the door, her long wet hair plastered to her chest and shoulders. Standing in the doorway was…

11222.content:
Standing in the doorway was her vice principal—Dr. Fukuda Hinamizawa.

Dr. Hinamizawa probably didn’t remember her, but Carrie had actually interviewed with her last year. They hadn’t seen much of each other since, but she would never forget the pressure that she felt sitting across from such an accomplished, distinguished… downright intimidating woman! She was a much harder interview than the headmistress. And while Carrie hadn’t exactly been avoiding her she hadn’t really been seeking out her company either…

“Hello—I am Dr. Hinamizawa, looking for…” the small Asian woman said politely, her eyes flicking to the clipboard she held in her hand, “Carrie Porter?”

“Well, you’ve found her.” Carrie joked awkwardly, “Is… everything alright? I don’t think I asked to have anything delivered…”

“Of course it is—would you mind if I came in?” Dr. Hinamizawa’s deep brown eyes flicked upwards, into the doorway “This won’t take very long.”

***


Carrie never would have thought that she could have been made to feel like a stranger sitting across from her very own coffee table.

The cabins that the teachers were provided were surprisingly spacious. She had her own office, a living area, bathroom, and bedroom with a full kitchen suite. Even with her considerable size, Carrie never felt particularly cramped or like she couldn’t move around.

However, somehow having Dr. Hinamizawa in the cabin with her made her humble abode seem that much smaller. Which didn’t make much sense, considering some of the rather large women that Carrie had entertained since her employment here began. Perhaps it was her intimidating personality? Dr. Hinamizawa didn’t seem to pose any outward threat, but somehow Carrie could never bring herself to relax in front of her vice principal.

“Thank you for the coffee—you really didn’t have to.”

The good doctor accepted the small yellow mug graciously. She took a sip, and placed it on the table in front of her.

“It’s my pleasure!” Carrie answered a little too eagerly, “I mean, it’s not every day I get surprise company!”

Carrie laughed awkwardly, making her cheeks ripple and her tummy quake. Hopefully it wasn’t too obvious as to just how unaccustomed to company she was. The large woman lowered herself down in the sofa opposite her guest; the reinforced furniture barely making a squeak as she settled her supple form on the off white cushions of her couch.

“So what brings you by today?” Carrie asked, taking a drink of her own (sugary, milky, honeyed) coffee in an effort to calm her nerves

“Are you to say that I cannot visit a fellow coworker?” Dr. Hinamizawa teased

“What? N-No, I just—”

“Relax, Carrie Porter.” The vice principal shifted in her seat, her thick frame brushing against her blouse, “I am only joking. My visit is not without merit, however. There is a matter of pressing importance that we need to discuss…”

Carrie swallowed another mouthful of coffee. Please be good news, she plead to herself, please be good news…

112222.content:
"We're experimenting with the schedule—how would you like two lunch periods?"

Carrie blinked; did the vice principal just say that she wanted to give her a second lunch break?

The fat woman must have been drifting off into space, as Dr Hinamizawa tried to bring her back to reality.

“Hello? Are you ok Ms Porter?”

Carrie blinked again, shaking herself out of her thoughts. “Yes, sorry…did you say two lunch breaks?”

The Doctor smiled. “Yes, we found we have a lot more new teachers and fewer leaving staff than expected this year. So there are plenty of classes accounted for. So we selected a few to have an extra break; as an English teacher, and normally under considerable pressure being an essential class, I am sure you would be pleased with the news?”

“Yes, really pleased…” she replied.

But as she talked, back of Carrie’s mind was screaming at her. No! She did not need a second lunch break. Her weight problems were already on a slippery slope, and the idea of being surrounded by heavy fattening Buttercombe cuisine for twice the amount of time each day seemed like a one way trip to a waistline disaster zone! There was no way she could agree to this!

***


“You get two lunch breaks now!?”

“Yeah…” Carrie replied, drawing circles with her fork on an almost-empty plate. The brown-haired woman felt like she had swallowed a lump of lead; how could she have agreed to this? All those years of dieting and keeping herself under…somewhat control, just to double her temptation like this.

“Well count me jealous; with how the food tastes here, I would give my right leg for a second lunch break.”

Sitting across the cafeteria table to Carrie was Judy Davis, Home Ed teacher and best friend to the blubbery woman. Judy was starkly different from Carrie; with dark brown skin, long luscious black hair that flowed around her shoulders like a waterfall, long legs and standing a few inches taller than Carrie. She was a stunning beauty of a woman, who often found herself the subject of the dirtiest comments scrawled inside the bathrooms. Despite her almost over-the-top makeup and shimmying strut, she was well known for being quite pleasant to her students…just only when they were behaving themselves.

However the two women did share some similarities; both were new teachers who had started one year ago, this connection being the ground-work for their friendship. Like Carrie, Judy had also put on quite a bit of weight last year; arriving at the time, Judy could have been described as slightly thick. Now though she was certainly extra thick; with a large ass that was starting to become a mini-shelf, thick thighs that were beginning to show signs of cellulite and folding over her knees, and a pair of ripe melon-like breasts that did a good job at hiding her newly-squishy midriff in their shade.

She was the kind of build where it would have been hard to initially call her fat, but was now starting to show signs of being a total fat-ass. This was easily demonstrated by how much she like snacking and overeating way too often; she was already on her second slice of pie that morning…

Meanwhile Carrie was still lamenting her predicament.

“Two lunch breaks….gawwwwd! Now I know how Cer got so fat here in high-school!” Carrie whined, planting her face on the table, causing her double-chin to squish on the surface.

“Cer?” Judy asked curiously.

“Cerys…my sister…” Carried prodded.

“Ooooh yeah…” Judy replied, trying to hide how she had totally forgotten that Carrie had ever brought her up. “Well if you put on some more comfort weight you could give her a call…perhaps she can give diet tips?”

Carrie raised her head off the table and gave the dark-haired woman a dirty look. “Cerys? Give me diet tips?” she scoffed.

“What? Don’t tell me she never lost her puppy-fat?” Judy tried to laugh off.

Judy’s chuckle stopped as Carrie’s scowl deepened. “Look I love my big sis…but she’s a total blob.”

“Come ooooon!” Judy laughed again. “She can’t be that big!”

“Really?” Carrie replied, laughing a little herself now. Reaching for her purse, Carrie began to fish around for her phone with comments along the lines of “seeing is believing”. With her phone in-hand Carrie tapped away, heading towards an album marked “family pics”.

Turning the phone around to face her friend, Carrie gave the picture some context. “That’s her at graduation.” she stated flatly.

“Oh my god!” Judy gasped, staring intently at the picture. “Did they charge for the crane?”

“No, dad was happy about that.” Carrie remarked, as if this was a totally normal thing.

“I can see why she hasn’t dropped the weight. Would take me years to lose all…that!”

Carrie could see she had made her point, but wanted to stamp it in a bit more. “She’s bigger now,” the rotund woman commented as she took the phone back and began to slide her thumb across the screen again. “Here she is at the last family meeting.”

Judy looked at the latest photo and her eyes bugged. “Ok…I think I have had enough to eat…” She remarked, pushing her slice of pie away from her side of the table.

“You would be amazed how few people she has that effect on…” Carrie muttered under her breath, recalling the whale-sized friends Cerys had brought home for the holidays one year.

“Well, question is, what are we going to do?” Judy asked, changing the topic.

“No idea…I can’t go back to the vice principal about it, that would mess up whatever system she was trying out…plus I don’t wanna lose face in only my second year here.”

“I was going to suggest something about improving your willpower…especially considering you just ate my pie…” Judy commented, pointing a long well-painted nail downwards.

“What?” Carrie replied; looking down to see that not only had Judy’s plate been emptied, but there were more crumbs than she remembered nestled between her breasts.

“Oh doodlebugs!” Carrie huffed, cleaning herself up. “Alright…fine, I can go talk to the counselor, see if she has anything that can help.”

“You could also see if the nurse has any appetite suppressants?” Judy added.

But Carrie just made a face at that idea. “That sounds a bit…drastic.”

Judy leaned forward, her hefty bosom wobbling like jello. “Hun, I just saw a picture of your mom and sister…and unless you’re adopted or something, that option ain’t drastic enough.”

“Fine fine…any other ideas?” Carrie asked.

“Hmmm…I could try to get one as well? Act as your diet buddy?”

Carrie snorted, “Great, then we’ll both end up fat.” As she said this, both her and Judy’s guts gave out loud synchronized hungry rumbles. “Ok…fatter…”

“Well, I got nothing else.” Judy shrugged. “So unless you come up with something, it’s either those ideas or you get in on the sister act.”

Carrie thought for a moment...

11231.content:
Reputation meant everything at Buttercombe. Throughout the years, the academy maintained its reputation of attracting the best of the best. The private academy vouched for the best teachers and the brightest young minds of the next generation of women. The partnership with the Yeng Corporation was a testament to that, as the company become one of the most prominent in the world and one of the best to work for.

And when it came to talent, one of the most notable the academy had attracted was a certified music genius. Even if she was a big tall ditz.

Rebecca Voll-Spillum had been a prodigy in the music arts from as far back as she was able to talk. She wowed her classmates through elementary and middle grade, received special attention and went through an entirety of graduate work in only a matter of years. Then, after choral and viola auditions, she became the youngest viola first chair of the Intercontinental Orchestra, debuting in their revival tour.

That was all before she started work at Buttercombe! Although, many critics and fans alike thought she was cutting her career in the orchestra short when she walked away to teach prep at an exclusive Virginian boarding school hidden away in the mountains. There had been rumors circling around for a time, when inquisitive minds started looking into what made the mind of the brilliant classical musician tick.

Some thought she had a failed marriage, indicating her hyphenated name as proof when compared to the rest of her family. Others dug into the Spillums directly to root out every last sordid detail. Of the Spillum family life that had moved about constantly to better Rebecca's music education at the cost of home life stability for her younger sister Pauline. Of a father who owned a nightclub with shady dealings, a mother with a maiden name of Francine Ulster who was a minor Buttercombe alumni in the same class as Headmistress Pollock. Surely her mother's connections had landed Rebecca her teaching career?

In truth most of that gossip was hogwash. Rebecca had been hired solely for her talent, not connections, leading to an awkward period as the gifted genius had to learn what it meant to actually teach. Rebecca's mother was remembered by the headmistress, as you would remember a former friend from your school years, but the connection ended there as time drew people apart. Half of Rebecca's initial year teaching was spent trying to reconnect with her sister, a transferred Sophomore, to variable success.

That was all in the past. To see Rebecca Voll-Spillum now, all these years latter, was a sight in and off itself.


"Now on the chord changes," Rebecca was seated at the piano, "the transference from the minor to major key brings a triumphant sound, especially with this crescendo to fortissimo."

It was her first music class of the semester, one of Rebecca's favorite times of year, when she got to meet returning students and see what new minds where brought to the academy. She usually pulled out all the stops of her repertoire.

It was hard to tell what about the music classroom was more unusual. Perhaps it was the tidbit that Rebecca was not leading off her Music Theory class with the likes of Chopin, Bach or Beethoven, but the ska beats of No Doubt while she imitated Gwen Stefani's singing perfectly. Or maybe it was the fact that you never saw a baby grand piano flanked by two water coolers.

Rebecca was known as one of the more fun teachers on campus. Her personality was sometimes far younger than her maturity suggested, plus she didn't mind if students brought snacks and treats to share in class. Although, having food remnants in your throat was problematic for most vocalists and musicians, so Rebecca ensured that plenty of water was on hand to flush down the phlegm.

It was quite common to see the music professor with water or beverage on hand. Her desk was a clutter of bottles and cans at any one time. When Rebecca stood to her full, full height the evidence of her lifestyle at Buttercombe was quite visible. She favored loose, flowing clothing with plenty of give, usually in dark or neutral colors. Her tall frame had rounded out considerably, although not to much fat graced her face or slender neck. Each curve had soft, shimmying fat that made Rebecca look like a human water balloon when she walked. That wasn't too far off of a description, given how long she could quaff a drink. Her stomach formed two rolls even when her belly was empty.

Rebecca liked all kinds of music. From classical, rock, bossa nova, blues, metal and many others, she used several examples in her lessons. Her tastes were as varied as the contents of her mini-fridge. Overall Rebecca was an enthusiastic if ditzy genius adaptive to change. The start of the school year was always one of change and for Rebecca this one would be no different.

"I heard she was as big as Miss Walker, you know, the OLD culinary arts teacher?" whispered one girl to her neighbour.

Rumours aside however, the entire senior class was about to discover exactly what the fabled Jafit Gamor looked like as the door to the classroom creaked open.

Jafit had always found enjoyment in food, be it producing delicious meals for her family and friends to over indulging herself regularly. The latter enjoyment was one formed whilst studying at Buttercombe in her youth that she never managed to shake upon returning home much to the surprise of her parents who didn't recall their beautiful daughter looking quite so...American. All that aside, she now strutted into her first class of her fifth year teaching at the prestigious Buttercombe Academy rather than receiving lessons and she could not be more excited. Based on their expressions Jafit could only assume that her new class were just as excited as her!
If only she realised they were in awe at her very presence itself.

As a prolific foodie to boot and much to the shock of her parents, Jafit had put on some pounds over the years but few were so blessed with such an eye popping hourglass shape as she was. As she strolled to her desk, each sun kissed leg brushing past each other with feet donned in her ever stylish heels, her bouncing rear resembled twins fighting under her tightly stretched skirt, the faint bite of her skimpy underwear visible against the bulging smooth fat of the blossoming cheeks contained within. Each clicking step caused her heaving bosom to jiggle in protest against her slightly too small bra which in turn was trying to escape her tailored collar shirt which only served to highlight her deep cavernous cleavage. "Good morning class" cooed the Spanish beauty, her accent the only aspect of her being thick enough to contend with her immense proportions.

One particular student at the front of the class nearly fell out of her chair at the sight of such quantities of breastage as the rest of her class nodded in answer to the buxom tutors question.
"That is wonderful! So, because of this, I am asking of you today that we shall all prepare an American treat for our first class together. I know that you are all expecting to learn some more...exotic recipes but first you shall all show me something you enjoy" Jafit happily rattled off to her students with some enthusiasm. Despite her Mediterranean heritage, the Spaniard had inherited quite a taste of American 'delicacies' throughout her years living state side and felt it was an appropriate first lesson to get her new class accustomed to her teaching styles as well as gain some early insights into each students ability.

With a smile on her curved lips, Jafit leaned back slightly in her chair as she peered down her figure which was largely blocked by her immense chest. "Thank you, thank you" cooed Dr Fukuda Hinamizawa as she strode through the class and delicately planted herself down on a chair opposite Jafit, a slight roll of pudge resting on her thighs as she did.
"How may I be able to help you?" asked the bloated cookery teacher, idly running her finger tips over her swollen stomach beneath a tighter shirt than the one she put on that morning.

Jafit's prolific career as a chef meant she was frequently complimented and, as such, had become accustomed to such positivity to herself or her creations. She would also be lying if she were to tell anyone that she did not enjoy the adoration associated with compliments, a sense of enjoyment that was currently warming her heart knowing that the good doctor was impressed with her attitude already.

"Let me just start by saying you are a wonderful asset to this school and have yielded fantastic results within the student body" continued Hinamizawa "barely a day goes by when I don't hear somebody speaking highly of you and the work you've done since joining the staff at Buttercombe"
"Oh why thank you" Jafit blushed visibly through her sun kissed complexion "I just wish to help by sharing my skills"
"Well you certainly have so far, it's hard to believe you have only been with us for five years" Hinamizawa continued to gush, well aware she was feeding Jafit's ego by the spadeful at this point "I was hoping that you would be able to help with a new venture concocted by some of my colleagues within Yeng that they wish to trial within the school"
Curiosity piqued, Jafit looked intently at the woman before her. Jafit was well aware of Buttercombe's association with the megacorporation Yeng Industries but had rarely needed to mingle with it so directly, certainly not being asked to be directly involved before now.

The Spaniard readjusted herself in her chair causing her bosom to jiggle within its confines (Jafit could not wait to get her bra off at the end of the day) as she pondered this vague proposition.
"What exactly would you want me to do?" asked Jafit resting her chin in her hand, gaze wandering slightly to the remains of her chocolate cake longingly. Her look did not go unnoticed.
