12232.content:
“And the luggage, young Miss?”

“Just throw it on the floor, Rick, and be gone.” and Carolina Griffith-Johnson threw herself onto a sofa, exasperated. She had a lucky break, her mother got some sort of a last minute emergency meeting or what today so she couldn't go along as she'd originally planned. But still! She was forced to relocate as a sophomore, lose all her old friends, live in some stuck-up boarding school with equally stuck-up schoolmates all year!

“But, Miss… I'll unpack and put away your clothes, at least. Your mother specifically instructed me to do that.”

“Meh. If you want.” She had been sulking all the way here from Washington DC and the walk to her room did nothing to improve her temper. Buttercombe was even more ostentatiously luxurious than she'd expected but Carolina was unfazed. She'd seen plenty bigger and better places (well, actually not that many, her inner censor chimed in). As she looked around the living room she was supposed to share with another girl, she had to admit it looked pretty good. In fact almost as good as her own room back home. A nice big TV screen, two plush leather couches and several armchairs to entertain guests, there was even a fully equipped kitchen in one corner. She reached for the remote and the screen came alive.

“I've unpacked your things and put them away, Miss Carolina! Is there anything else you'd like me to do before I leave? Want a snack, a… ?”

“NO! Thank you, Rick, but GO!”

“Eh, sorry, Miss, you know I had to ask… Uh, see you before Christmas.”

“Yeah.” While he was leaving, Carolina unwrapped another Yeng bar and stuffed it into her mouth whole to quell her anger.

Wait a minute. A bar? Another bar? Where did it come from? Carolina blinked, looked around and discovered a welcome basket on the coffee table in front of her. A basket she had subconsciously taken from while she was engrossed in the channels the TV had on offer and in her feelings. She knew the basket was there to tempt her - her personally - into overeating. It had to be her Mom's doing again!

Her anger turned into regret as her gaze fell down on her waist she just stuffed 500 more empty calories into. She pinched her folds in disgust, wishing them to go away. Oh, she knew it could get worse, much worse. And it might. She had seen a living, breathing warning sign just this morning. Her 'little' sister Virginia, two years younger and already twice Carolina's size. She had to remain strong.

She looked around to divert her mind from food and found some leaflets peering from underneath all that junk in the basket. Taking it out, she scanned the brochures quickly. Plan of the campus, amenities, services, introductory tour… Ah, yes. Carolina knew her Mom signed her up for the tour but you know what? Her Mom wasn't here anymore so f*ck her!

She no longer breathed down her neck so Carolina was free to do whatever she pleased today. Chat with her friends back home, browse the TV, Netflix, laze the afternoon away… As part of a compromise her Dad had brokered after their first stormy fight, Carolina would get all the subscriptions she wanted, no matter age restrictions, while studying at Buttercombe – as long as her academic results didn't suffer. But that was a problem for another day. Today she could laze around…

Or maybe not as she caught her hand sneaking towards the basket again. As much as she tried to resist, throughout her childhood Carolina had been conditioned to mindless snacking. Perhaps it might be healthier to go out and explore?

***


Meanwhile, in an office at the top of the main wing:

„What's the issue you wanted to cover with me in person, Dr. Hinamizawa?” The speaker was small, round and not exactly imposing; now she was out of breath, her rolls quivering with barely suppressed anger.

“Ah, come in, come in, Dr. Schwartz. Make yourself comfortable.” The de facto head of the school gave her Head Counselor a long, calculating look, reclining in her chair behind a mahagony table.

“What's so urgent that I had to drop everything and trudge all the way from my lab to here?” Dr. Schwartz steadfastly refused any of the mobility aids that she so readily recommended to all her students.

“Oh? I would swear I used the phrase 'at your leisure' in my e-mail, didn't I?” Fukuda's English had greatly improved in the years she spent in America, to the point she could efficiently use it to manipulate others.

“OK, OK, I am sorry,” the doctor knew all too well that the phrase meant ASAP in Fukuda's parlance and this was just another pissing contest she was bound to lose anyway. She grumbled something barely intelligible and went on: “So what is the sensitive topic?”

“Ah, I have received a… request, you could even say a plea, from an old friend of mine – and yours too. Dakota Griffith-Johnson sends her regards, by the way. And asks if we could help her little Carolina along. Apparently the girl is dead set against the idea of gaining weight, poor thing. And she is strong-willed just like her mother.”

“Are you saying I can make Carolina one of my special projects?” Her anger was gone. You could hear the eagerness in Helen's voice.

“Eh, no. For starters just pay more attention to her than to regular students. We'll see how she develops in her first month in a… more friendly environment.”

122321.content:
Carolina had never been a very active girl.

Of course looking at her even now, that much was obvious. Even at a school notorious for fattening up its students like holiday hams, Carolina had been right on track before she even set foot through the door—and that was in spite of her protests, pouting, and petulance regarding her mother’s unorthodox parenting style.

With her wide belly and wider hips quivering with each lumbering step down the hallway, Carolina may as well have been made of cookie dough. She was a lazy, spoiled thing who had never so much as jogged once in her entire lifetime. Despite the fact that she liked to think that she was better off than her “little” sister Virginia, Carolina was just as soft in the will as she was around the waist. Perhaps even softer.

So watching her get red-faced and frustrated as her doughy body struggled to keep up with the exercise of walking at a moderate pace through the halls of her new home for the forseeable future, one could already piece together the problems in her creed to keep slim.

“I hate this place…” she huffed, her soft double chin folding slightly as her mouth hung open, “They should have… a water fountain or something… somewhere.”

Her unused leg muscles ached. She was a lazy girl at heart, and she wanted nothing more than to indulge in her true nature. Laying out on the sofa, watching television. But those darn snacks were still there—waiting for her. And she wasn’t about to let her mother win another round of their weird little game.

Even if it meant that her thighs would chafe.

Correction, were already chafing.

Carolina leaned against a wall—her fat bottom squishing against the cool creamy plaster well before the rest of her did. How was she already this tired? Of course, she couldn’t remember the last time she’d gone up or down a flight of stairs. Mom had installed elevators early in their childhood home since she was in, like, first grade… she couldn’t be that out of shape, could she?

She was already on the third floor—that was three floors down from her dorm room! And going up stairs was going to be a lot harder than going down. That much Carolina knew for a fact...

“Well…” she sighed heavily, “I guess there’s no point in turning back now…”

She slumped down against the wall, letting her full weight fall onto it and off of her aching legs.

Where was she even going?
122321.title: Carolina Rebels

1223212.content:
“What are you doing here?”

Carolina blinked at the hostile tone and looked up. A bespectacled redhead strode towards her, her tummy jiggling with every step. “Huh? What does it look like?”

“It looks to me you're loitering in the History hall.” The girl stopped in front of her, her arms akimbo. She was actually a smidgeon smaller than Carolina and around the same weight but judging by her swift movements she must have been in a much better shape.

“This is History hall?” she looked around for the first time. Old presidents hanging on the walls looked at her, silently confirming it. What now? Her mother's favorite saying was: If all else fails, use the truth. “Would you believe me I got lost?”

The redhead pointedly looked at Carolina's fleshy midsection. “You don't look like a lost freshman.” She narrowed her eyes suspiciously: “I want your full name!”

There was no way around it. “Carolina Griffith-Johnson.”

“Really?” The girl pulled out a Y-Pad, pushed her glasses up her nose and started scrolling. Suddenly her demeanor completely changed. She forced herself into a smile. “Oh, I'm really sorry! I didn't mean it like that, it's just that this wing is off-limits for most students on days off. But it turns out you have every right to be here, uhh, Carolina.”

Carolina had just about enough. She'd sworn never to use her mother's name to get advantages at the Academy and yet this obnoxious nerd forced her to break her promise the very first day?! She used the haughtiest tone she'd copied from her mother: “I believe it is considered polite for both parties to introduce themselves first. I haven't heard your name yet.”

“Oh, sorry, sorry! Penny Parker, Residential Advisor. See, I'm supposed to watch out for unruly behavior though maybe not here but this is a handy shortcut and I was on my way to the cafeteria so would you like to join me? Since you're really new here, maybe I can give you some tips, show you the ropes kind of thing? Maybe we can be friends?”

Friends? That was new. At every school Carolina had attended so far, her surname brought her either ridicule or wary respect. The handful of friends she'd made liked her despite being Griffith-Johnson. Did this… Penny mean it? A friend, an ally against Mom's machinations would come in handy in this strange place.

But it would mean going to the cafeteria. Yes, she could have just a salad or some fruit but Carolina knew her willpower (or lack thereof), knew she wouldn't be able to resist temptation. And based on her mother's enthusiastic description there would be lots and lots of it. Was an ally worth that?

“Umm, maybe?”

“Anyway, this is something you cannot do without. Sooner or later you'd come to a door which you won't open without your bracelet- Come to think of it, how're you going to open your own room without it? How did you get in in the first place?”

“Umm, well…” Carolina knew how it would sound but she was interested to see Penny's reaction. “My driver opened it for me.”

She wasn't disappointed. The RA blinked, gaped. “Wow! I wish I could say that one day. Well, let me take you to Ms. Fukiyama to outfit you. It's not far if we take the lift.”

“Thanks.”

“And, uh, I'll leave you there and run to the cafeteria, OK? I mean, the physical's going to take half an hour minimum.”

“The physical?!”


***

To Carolina's surprise Ms. Fukiyama didn't weigh half a ton. Not even a quarter; she was a tall, skinny woman of Asian descent (Carolina guessed at least that part right). She had a soothing voice and gentle mannerisms, yet something seemed a bit off here. “Please, strip down to your underwear, Ms. Griffith-Johnson.”

“Strip? I mean, like, why?”

“So I could properly examine you. Sorry, I got my orders. Go on.”

Our plush brunette had no choice. She had to take off her dress with all its little rubber bands and slimming tricks and let her blubber on full display. This was hell she was trying to avoid.

Carolina would swear the nurse tsking when she emerged from behind the screen, blushing in embarrassment. “Step here, please. Let me see. Height 5'6, weight 181 pounds- 82? Well, let's write down 181.5.” She took a tape measure and went on: “Chest 39, waist- where's your waist? Let's say 35, hips 44…”

“What do you need all these numbers for?”

“Ask the management, I've been here for two weeks only. I understand it may be unpleasant but all I know is, I'm supposed to do this with every student. Thighs 28. Now, sit down and give me your arm, I'm going to measure your blood pressure.”

The nurse was nice to her but clinically professional, she even gave her a short speech about eating right and exercising. All this sounded horribly familiar – and humiliating. But wasn't Buttercombe supposed to be different? As much as she struggled against her mother's machinations, right now Carolina would have welcomed someone like auntie Hannah Hammond, telling her how undernourished she looked and how she ought to eat more.

“Now sign here, I'll outfit you with your bracelet and you'll be good to go.”

“Uh?” Carolina carefully read the paper. Her mother had given her several painful lessons in how costly it was to sign a document without reading it. But today everything seemed in order.

While she was reading, the nurse opened a drawer. “Oh. You've got your own special envelope. And you are Group Cee Plus Plus. Nice.”

“What?” Ms. Fukiyama clipped it on her chubby forearm and Carolina turned her amber bracelet over to see C++ stamped on it. “Isn't that something to do with computers? What does it mean?”

“Actually, I don't know myself. Most students I fitted out got C. I had a couple C+ and those were all snotty brats so,” the nurse had a good look at Carolina's beautiful dress thrown on the floor, carefully tailored so it almost hid her wide waist and even wider behind, “so maybe you are extra privileged?”

“No! I mean, umm,” now that she thought about it, it looked ever more likely. Damn Mom! “Maybe?”

“Griffith-Johnson? Oh! Aren't you related to the, uh, Health Secretary?” Seeing Carolina's angry look, the nurse backpedalled. “Sorry for prying. Anyway, your bracelet defines your access rights. Basically, there's a chip built in which does two main things – it lets you into areas where you have access and it's good for all the vending machines, the cafeteria, local shopping et cetera. So don't lose it!”

“Thanks.”

***

After all the excitement and exercise, Carolina felt ready for bed. Luckily the bracelet let her take the lift so she did not have to walk all the stairs, somehow she didn't get lost and made it to the right suite.

Another swipe of her bracelet and the door opened, letting out the noise of afternoon TV. What the-? Did I forget to switch it off?

“Hi, roommate!”

Roommate? Oh, God, I have a roommate. Why couldn't Mom use her money or influence to get me a solo room? Oh, right, she must've picked someone as a 'roll' model for me. So who is it?
12232122.title: Roped Into the System

choices: Carolina doesn’t want that – she rushes for her uniform
Actually, she could try to get herself kicked out…
122321222.content:
One look into the living room confirmed Carolina's suspicions. The girl was lying on her side, letting her fat gut spill out on the sofa. And while Carrie had seen much bigger stomachs, starting at home, this one looked impressively round and taut, swollen with whatever her roommate was currently eating.

She turned her head, getting her dirt blonde hair slide in her bowl, stretched her chipmunk cheeks in a welcoming smile. “Hi, I’m Evie! Evie Littleton, junior, pleased to meetcha. Sorry for not standing up, I’m bushed. The way here was horrendous, my feet are killing me.”

“That’s OK, I’m Carolina Griffith-Johnson. Hi.” And she collapsed into the closest armchair, feeling likewise exhausted after her trip around school.

Evie grunted as she swivelled her upper body to better see the newcomer. “Have we met last year? I have a bad memory for faces…”

“No, we couldn’t, I am new here.”

“A newBee? You don't look like one.” Her roommate plopped several more chocolates in her mouth. “Oh, where are my manners. Here, have some.”

“Thanks,” Carolina picked the last two pieces, looking lost at the bottom of the huge bowl. I need to replenish my energy, she argued. “Well, yeah, I’m a sophomore. But I had to switch schools this year.”

“Really? Why? Were you at a co-ed school? What did you do? Got caught with a guy?”

Were it not for a cheerful grin, Carolina would’ve slugged her. “No! I did nothing. That is, I did pretty well at Forsythe. Almost made it to the honor roll. It was Mom who made me come to Buttercombe. Said I'd feel better here.”

“She was right about that, believe me. Buttercombe is da bomb! The best school in the whole round world. You'll feel much more welcome here. Say, you did get a welcome basket too, right?” asked the bigger girl suddenly, “Umm, could I, y'know, have a bite? Please?”

“Didn’t you get your own?”

“Well, yeah but it is already gone. I was hungry. Still am, in fact,” Evie caressed her bloated belly, “y’know what? I’ll tell you a secret if you share with me.”

Carolina hesitated. On one hand this would get rid of her temptation. But the basket was for me. But she promised me a secret. But she needs all those empty calories even less than me. And I want to rest here, no walking to my room to fetch it. And I don’t want to share, when all’s said and done… No, I swore to keep slim. As she pushed herself up from the armchair, her bottom tyre brushed against her thighs, reinforcing her motivation to share. She brought the welcome basket from her room and placed it mid-way between the chair and Evie’s sofa. “Here, go ahead. Eat it all if you like.”

“Really?”

“Really, I am not hungry.” Except as she looked at all the sweets and candy, her mouth started salivating. And her stomach chose this moment to remind her it wanted to be fed.

Evie had to hear its growling too. “Y'know what? Let's split it in half, OK?”

“Yeah, fine, I don’t care.” Except her hand shot and seized a bag of trouffles even before Carolina finished those words. “So what’s the secret?”

“See, they include some goodies in the baskets that never made it to the vending machines before. And they want us to tell them if they’re any good. Except most people never bother so they started offering rewards for our feedback. I found out by accident that if you log in to your school account, there’s an icon, bottom right, that says FEEDBACK. And if you tell them what you liked most you get another basket just like this. I already filled it in. Don’t forget to do it too.”

“Uh, well, maybe.” That would defy the whole purpose of sharing the first basket, yet Carolina’s mind already filed it away for future use. “So tell me, what’s life like in here?”

“Oh, it’s perfect, girl, believe me, just perfect…” and Evie told her at length the benefits of studying at Buttercombe. Carolina listened with interest, noticing that for some reason all the high points included eating… and failing to notice that as Evie’s mouth was occupied with talking, most of the goodies ended up in her own stomach.

Eventually Evie ran out of superlatives to describe their school with. “Just have a look at us. Ah, that’s the life. I missed this all summer long. Mom made me go on a diet, said I was eating too much, getting too fat! Can you imagine?”

Seeing the porker stuff herself with chocolate, Carolina had no trouble imagining it. But it would be much better to have a friendly roommate. And maybe means of disposal for her temptation too? “No way! Like, really?”

“Yeah, right.”

As the basket gradually emptied with their collective effort, Carolina finally discovered the letter Penny told her about. It was buried under the avalanche of calories and when she opened it, she found a copy of school rules, her timetable and also a warning she had to go to the school nurse and get a bracelet (check). And she also had to visit the seamstress to get a uniform before the welcoming dinner – what? “Listen, there's a seamstress at this school too? I am supposed to go there to have my uniform tailored, is it for real?”

“Wow, you get to have it tailored? Me, I have to make do with off the peg model.”

“No, I mean, we have to wear uniforms here?” Come to think of it, the RA – Peggy? - did wear something ugly brownish-yellow.

“Of course, silly. It's to promote a feeling of community and alleviate income disparity.”

“Now you're quoting the brochure,” Carolina had to grin.

Evie grinned too. “Sure but it makes sense, don't you think? Anyway, shouldn't you better hurry? The dinner starts at 6 and you still don't have your uniform. The seamstress is in the new building, umm, Vandergriff?”

“Ooooh. I don’t want to move.” She was beginning to feel the all-too-familiar effects of shoving two pounds of chocolate down her mouth.

“I getcha, girl, but you better do. The school’s pretty laid back but uniforms are the one thing where they put the foot down. You don’t want to start your studies with an infraction like that.”
122321222.title: Eating With Evie

choices: Carolina is too tired to walk to her dorm! Luckily someone will cart her over...
Carolina heads back to her dorm and grills Evie—"What's C++?"
1223212221.content:
The Vandergriff was all the way across campus.

Literally the worst place to go right after stuffing herself, however inadvertently, was literally in the opposite direction. And so far! Carrie had enough trouble trudging around when it was just the one building–let alone cutting through the courtyard. Her poor little muscles were aching, too. As much as she whined about her fatty home life, it hadn't afforded her a lick of stamina. She just so badly wished that this could have been put off another day. She barely had a muscle to her name and somehow this school with a reputation of fattening up freshmen was going to make her burn all of the calories!

And she had to make the trip alone! How horrible!

"Nah, I'm not feeling it." Evie had told her with a dismissive wave as she popped a couple of candies in her mouth, "But you go and do that. Don't want to get in trou~ble!"

That paunchy little pig was so ungrateful. Carrie had gone and shared her snacks with her, and this was the thanks she got?!

All alone in the Vandergriff building, distinguished by its more modern design and significantly different layout to the main building, Carolina Griffith-Johnson felt like she'd stepped out of one frying pan and onto the oven eye! She had no idea where she was going, until that nice older girl had given her a helping hand in pointing her towards the tailor's. What's worse, all of the lower floors were almost devoid of human life since classes hadn't started yet–creepy!

"Carolina Griffith-Johnson?" came a voice suddenly, and from behind her no less, that made the bottom-heavy girl let loose an undignified squeak of fear

"Y-Yes!" Carrie yelped, fearful for her life as she slowly turned to face an older black woman in the doorway

"I thought so." the teacher chuckled, "Come on in, I've been expecting you."

***


Somehow, the design studio was different than what Carrie was expecting.

Sure, there were pushpin models and mannequins. That much was pretty much a given, thanks to the nature of what it was that Mrs. Banks (the Fashion & Design teacher, as well as the woman who had rescued Carrie from wandering the hallways!) worked with. However, the computers lined up against the back and left walls suggested that this studio doubled as her classroom. And what's more, Carrie was given a firsthand look at just where her measurements had gone.

"So this is you." Mrs. Banks referred to the wireframe outline of Carrie that catered to her measurements, taken by Nurse Fukiyama not two hours ago, "Or at least, these are your measurements."

Carrie narrowed her eyes at the fleshy bits of her wireframe counterpart. That fleshy belly and those wide hips were the bane of her existence, and laying them out like that on a tablet (no matter how big and impressive it was!) was enough to make the fire in her belly grow hot.

"Trust me, I know it's never easy to look at your figure when it's laid out like that." the older woman laughed as she ran a hand over her stomach, "But maybe this will help."

With a tap, Carrie's silhouetted simulated shape was tarped in a digital rendition of the school uniform. Yellow jacket, mustard skirt, with a white blouse. The knee-high socks and the uncomfortable looking shoes weren't the worst part, either. She'd look like a bottle of Heinz in this getup! And that little ascot. How dorky!

Obviously she'd made another face, because Mrs. Banks was quick to swoop in again.

"Don't worry, it's never as bad as it looks here." she smiled, playing with the image a bit, "But I'll admit, not everyone looks good in bright yellow."

"Do I have to wear the whole thing?" Carrie curled a nostril distastefully at her prescribed outfit for at least the next three years

"Not the whole thing. But at least the blouse and the skirt." Mrs. Banks clicked her tongue, "Ascot too, I'm afraid.

"No cute little dress alternatives?" Carrie asked hopefully

"Afraid not. But if you'd like, there's a sweatervest option."

Carrie looked at the example and recoiled in horror. The sweatervest hugged her model's tummy so tightly that you could see where her belly cut over itself on the skirt's clasp! That just wouldn't do at all!

"No thank you." she whined

Eventually they settled on her getting the whole basic uniform. Mrs. Banks said that Carrie'd thank her when winter came, and she had a blazer to wear with her longer skirt. She'd done her best to tweak the measurements to the spoiled carolina girl's liking, but she still wasn't happy with the overall product.

"Now it'll be ready in a couple of days, so in the meantime you'll have to wear an tailored fit." the older woman cautioned, giving her a stack of plastic-wrapped clothing for Carrie to carry, "That'll be your spare. You can always come back and get it altered when you have your new clothes in a couple of days, free of charge."

Ugh. Untailored clothes. They were going to be so baggy. With Carrie's wide hips and plump rump, her blouse was probably going to make her look twenty pounds heavier than she actually was. She hadn't worn anything that wasn't to her specific liking since she was Ginny's age. This was going to be miserable...

"And don't worry about stretching your clothes out, now." the instructor said with a pat on top of the pile of clothes, "We get to play with some pretty neat things in the design department, and you've been put down for the Yeng-Huan fabric blend. That's what's going to take so long."

Carrie's ears pricked up.

"I'm sorry, what?"

"Your clothes, sweetie." Mrs. Banks raised her eyebrows and cornered a smile like she'd said the most obvious thing in the world, "They're going to be great. They won't stretch out, but they won't look baggy. Trust me, lots of girls love it. You'll have plenty of room if you need it."

"Why would I need it?" Carrie made a face

"You're C++, Carolina; it's part of the package!" the teacher tapped Carrie's bracelet, dangling from her wrist, "Now go on, I've got to get ready for Monday."

And just like that, Carrie was alone in the Vandergriff once again, holding a pile of clothes and armed with more questions than answers.
1223212221.title: Carolina Gets Fitted

choices: Pick prim and proper Penny
Eat with expanding Evie
12232122211.content:
As Carolina trudged back with her bundle of new clothes, she felt even worse than on her way to Vandergriff Hall. She would have sworn she had been going mostly uphill on her way there but now there was another hill for her to climb. She sighed, feeling abandoned by the whole world. She felt muscles she didn't even know she had as they screamed against the abuse. Her thighs felt sore from all the chafing and unless some miracle happened, she knew they would be raw by the time she reached her destination.

She walked on a couple dozen yards but then she simply had to stop. Utterly exhausted, she paused to wipe sweat off her brow and think about her predicament. Why, she must have walked two miles already today! In Buttercombe of all places! Maybe… maybe she could find a shortcut?

As she looked around, she spotted a faint trail, barely visible in grass. It deviated to the left from the paved path that went straight uphill, designed for cars or the carts people drove around. And most importantly, it seemed that the trail avoided the climb and went around the hill. Ideal for a tired pedestrian like her!

Carolina didn't even think about it and turned left. After years of her mother's conditioning, taking the easy way out was ingrained in her.

And this trail definitely was easier; it veered a little downhill, soft soil and grass didn't hurt her feet as much as hard concrete. Still, it didn't take long before her fatigue got back with a vengeance. With every step her pace slowed down until she was crawling at a snail's pace and praying for a miracle.

***


A miracle did happen – though it didn't seem that way first. As she trudged down the grassy patch, Carolina heard a voice shout: "Hey! You there!" Her mind clouded with fatigue, she actually made several steps before it registered.

"Can you hear me?! Miss! You mustn't go there!"

Carrie stopped moving so abruptly that she nearly keeled over. Taking her time to steady herself, she turned around to see on of those overgrown white golf carts wobbling dangerously on the uneven green as it sped towards her. A plump woman sitting behind the wheel drove it rather carelessly, her boobs and belly shaking at every bump. She stopped in front of the unhappy student. “Are you going somewhere, Miss?”

Only now did Carolina notice the yellow stripes and the sign on the side: Administrative Security. But she paid more attention to the white uniform, stretched tight over the guard's sizable chest. The nametag said Sofia Mendez. “Uh, yeah, Ms. Mendez, I had to collect my uniform from Vandergriff and I was now hurrying back to make it before the welcoming dinner starts.”

The woman nodded, highlighting her second chin. “I see. Are you aware that this route goes out of the campus, Ms… ?”

“Carolina. Umm, no, I didn’t know that, sorry? I’m new here.”

“Look, you don't look like a newBee. You have to have some kind of… Oh, just show me your bracelet,” and Sofia reached for it. When Carolina did as she asked, she tsked. “C++? Don't you know that you are entitled to use mobility scooters? This seems fishy. What were you going to do there? And what's in that sack you're carrying?”

“My uniform! Look, I told you… I just want to get back before the dinner starts. I thought I could take a shortcut through here...”

“Oh, no, no, no, trust me, you don’t want to do that.” The guard leaned forward, her belly bunching up in her lap, and whispered, “You don’t want to spread it around but there's been an outbreak of Lyme disease, some kind of ticks infestation. We've been told by the authorities that they had it eradicated on the grounds but I wouldn’t risk it if I were you. Walking around is unsafe. Look, hop on, I'll drive you to the main building. And I'll check your bracelet there.”

“Oh, thank you, thank you!” Carolina surprised her by the outburst of joy. She was up in the cart's second seat before the guard finished her speech. It was rather a tight squeeze, both of them being bigger in the hips and while Carrie could console herself that she still fit into her seat, it was only because it was supersized.

Sofia Mendez gave her another suspicious look, detained students in her experience seldom welcomed it with such enthusiasm. “Anyway, let's drive back.”

***


Back at the main building Sofia picked a side entrance that let her drive inside with the cart. “Hi, Jess! Caught another interloper already! Am I good or am I good?” She shouted gleefully at a blob of a woman that munched on donuts as she watched a wall full of camera feeds. “And now I'll check you in the system and you'll have to spill the beans!”

“I told you three times already…”

“Yeah, yeah, yeah, you're new and you were picking up your uniform. But now we'll know the truth!” The guard stopped at a data terminal jutting out of the wall so it could be easily accessed from a cart. “Beep your bracelet here.”

“Fine.” Carolina shrugged as she did so. She had to stretch over the guard's body to do so, both squishing uncomfortably.

Sofia then peered on the monitor, silence stretched and her olive skin was getting a little pink. Eventually she gave out an embarrassed cough before turning to Carrie. “Oh. Well, according to the log it seems you really are here the first day and you did just pick up your uniform as you said… And since you have C++... Well, we'll let you go with a warning, Ms. Griffith-Johnson, and, uh… sorry.”

“Oh, that's fine. Thanks for the ride, you saved my life.” Carolina didn't think she was exaggerating. If that trail didn't go back to the main building, would she ever make it there?

“Oh, right. Remember that as a C++ student you’re allowed to use the mobility scooters if there are any available. And it is dangerous to walk outside. So stay inside or take a cart, OK?”

I really need to find out what the C++ stands for. But not now. I do not have the time for it, the dinner s about to start. “I… see. Thanks, Ms. Mendez.”

“And promise me, don't go on any more dangerous adventures like this, Miss!”

“Oh, believe me, I've had enough! Thanks, Ms. Mendez!” and she rushed out.

Encouraged by the outcome, Carolina tried to beep her bracelet at the lift. And lo and behold – it opened! “Finally!” she jumped inside and punched her floor. She never spotted the irony; for years she'd wished to be able to exercise without her mother stopping her. And the first day her wish came true she already did all she could to avoid exercising her flabby body.

***


Back in her room Carolina discovered that her freeloading roommate had already gone. A scrap of paper on the coffee table told her where to:
Gone for the feast. Hurry up!
E

She glanced at her phone to see what time it was. “OK, fine, no need to panic, you still have fifteen minutes left, girl. Let's get dressed and get down there!” She unpacked the uniform and spread various pieces on her bed. “Maybe it won't be that bad.”

But it was. When she saw herself dressed in her attire for the next three years, Carrie winced. All her dresses had various clever ways to disguise extra pounds. This white blouse looked as if it was designed specifically to draw attention to the way her paunch spilled over the hem of a too tight skirt. And when she turned around, the mirror showed her the mustard skirt didn't spare her behind either. It looked huge, almost Ginny-sized!

Carolina knew she let her guard down a little over the summer. It wasn't like she had a choice. After hammering out a compromise with Mom that included full access to cable TV, she didn’t want to lose it again over a cupcake. Or a dozen. So she ate a little more, indulged her sweet tooth on Mom's urging, and now its result was in plain sight for everyone to see.

“Ugh! God, I look like a cow!” She closed her eyes, half hoping it would go away. Alas, no. She hurriedly put on the rest of her attire and rushed out without a single look in the mirror, leaving all her clothes strewn about.

“I hope the cafeteria won't be as hard to find as the design studio was,” she worried as the lift carried her downstairs, sparing her the need to exert her muscles again. Carrie needn't have worried. As soon as its door opened on the ground floor, there was a large arrow pointing that way. And as she walked from her dorm, the din of students eagerly waiting for their first meal of the year was echoing down the hallways.

When she entered the great hall, Carolina was almost overwhelmed by the crowds she saw there. It was huge, with so many tables, large and small. Unused to such large crowds, she stopped dead in her tracks, trying to find a friendly face. And against all hope she found two. At one table the bespectacled RA Penny Parker looked alone and lost in thought while at another, her roommate Evie Littleton was regaling some tale to her friends.


Where would she sit?
12232122211.title: Warding Off Trouble and Exercise

choices: Go back to the dorm with Evie—Carrie's indulged enough for one night...
It'd be rude to just eat and leave, right?—Carrie keeps eating and makes friends
122321222112.content:
Eventually, Caroline decided that her roommate was the best route to go. After all, they'd be rooming with each other at least until the Summer. Why not make making friends a little easier?

Evie and her friends were sitting at one of the singular tables that dotted the cafeteria, crowding their eating space with stuffed bellies that rolled onto the top like beached whales. They were a loud bunch, and as Carrie made her way towards them she could hear their conversation and laughter well before she had actually reached the group of gourmands. Evie had seen her, her chunky cheeks bunching in a big smile, and raised her head slightly in acknowledgement of Carrie's approach.

"Hey roomie!" she raised her thick arm high in the air and gave an excited little wobbly wave, "You wanna sit with us?"

Rightfully, Carrie didn't think that she would fit. These girls that Evie acquainted herself with were all double-wide fatsos, taking up plenty of room at what should have been a roomy table. The curvature of their bellies as they pooled in front of them, diamonds of pampered gut flesh eeking between the buttons on their blouses, kept them a comfortable distance from their table. Each girl's wide rump, prematurely ripened until they were vast and heavy, made an insular circle of booty blubber that Carolina doubted she could squeeze into. All of these girls were so big, even Evie was dwarfed by one or two of them...

"Sure!" Carrie tore herself back to reality and forced a smile, "Sorry, I... excuse me, could you just...?"

The flock of fat girls scooched as best they could allow. Chairs scraped beneath them as bellies rocked, quivered, and trembled in their slight motions. Laughter became a chorus of fatty grunts as everyone made slight adjustments so as to allow the newest addition to their group a spot to sit.

"Oof."

"Hrmm..."

"Hrurp."

"That's better."

After a fair bit of adjustment, Carrie was officially seated. What's more, Evie's friends were comfortable once more. They didn't seem particularly bothered by Carrie's addition, nor the added space that she took up, so that was nice. Carrie had sat next to Evie and a rather plain (if not excruciatingly fat) girl whose wide hips and side rolls kept nudging poor Carrie into her roommate. It was something of a tight fit, to say the least.

"Guys, this is Carrie." Evie introduced the smaller girl with a showcasing motion, her arms jiggling with the motion, "She's my new roommate."

The girls smiled, some waved, most of them gave some variation on "hi". They introduced themselves, but Carrie couldn't bring herself to remember all of their names. There were five girls, not counting Evie, and the most important and striking thing about them all was that they all looked to weigh well over two hundred and fifty pounds apiece.

"These newbees are always so sweet and innocent."

"You're just so cute!"

"Do you know Maggie Beaufort? You look just like this girl I knew..."

Carolina smiled and did her best to keep up in conversation. It wasn't one of her strong points, getting to know people. But it was either eat with Evie and her friends or be lonely with the RA, or worse yet eat by herself. She was going to have to build a circle of people she could talk to at some point, might as well just grin and bear it...

And thankfully, Buttercombe Academy's orientation spread made it that much easier to do so.

In due time, Evie escorted Carrie to the service station, where the culinary coalition that worked for the school had laid out plenty of options and servers to cater to the students and staff in attendance. Wide spreads dotted a tiny room, round girls bumping into one another butt to gut in anticipation of getting to taste what this year's welcome feast had to offer. It didn't disappoint!

"Ooh, you got the duck." Evie's soft arm pressed into Carrie's side as she leaned over her tray, "Good choice."

She had done her best to keep it light. Moderation was the key to staying thin. Or at least, not winding up like Evie or the rest of her friends who'd all piled their plates high with portions of ungodly sizes. Somehow, fitting back into place seemed more difficult as the girls entered their second (and in two instances, third!) heaping helpings of food.

"It's not always this good." said a girl with a particularly round, flat face, "You'd better enjoy it now."

"The food's always good though." the whale beside her chimed in, practically licking her plate clean

"Just not this good." a girl a little smaller than Evie concurred.

Surrounded on all sides, Carrie didn't have a lot of elbow room. Her knife and fork motions were severely stunted by Evie's eager command of space, and the fatter girl beside her's general girth. However, she had to agree! These people at Buttercombe knew how to roast a good duck...

Their sauces were superb...

Their selection of sides amazing...

Carrie melted at the meal that she steadily began to wolf down. It was in her nature to indulge, she could hardly moderate her appetite better than she could subject herself to exercise. The spoiled little thing didn't stand a chance against the culinary excellence that Buttercombe money bought; she sucked down the soup, downed the duck with ease, and pounded down her potato like it was nobody's business!

"Get your fill, girl?" Evie asked her roommate as she scooted out from the chair, patting her belly contentedly, "I'm gonna head up for the night. You wanna come? I know you didn't eat much..."

"Didn't eat much." Ha! Carrie had downed enough food to keep anyone well fed for the night, for sure. But she'd also wolfed down her welcome basket and had a couple of snacks throughout the day. She was stuffed! Her poor round belly was filled with the day's indulgences, each of them more enjoyable than the last...

"You're stopping after three plates?" one of the girls said with a piggish snort, "What are you, dieting all of the sudden?"

"We're gonna stay here a little longer if you wanna stay with us, Carrie."

"Yeah, don't let her be a buzzkill."

"I had a big lunch, okay?" Evie playfully stamped her foot, causing her entire body to wobble for a second that almost lingered into a moment, "Whatever you want to do is okay by me, Carrie. I don't mind hanging out with these jerks a little longer if you're still hungry."

Carrie bit her bottom lip contemplatively.

On one hand, less temptation. On the other, more food. Plus, it might be nice to get to know these girls a little better...
122321222112.title: Eating with Evie et All

choices: Eat! I mean socialize.
Don't! Moderation, remember?
1223212221122.content:
Although Carolina liked to pretend otherwise, she enjoyed eating as much as her 'little' sister Virginia. Sure, if her mother were there to push another course on her, Carrie would have rebelled out of principle. But her Mom was far away and these girls were nice and friendly so why not stay and indulge in conversation? Make friends? “Sure, I could have a bite. I mean, I didn't have any dessert yet.”

“Oh no!” the landwhale next to her exclaimed in mock horror. “You must – simply MUST – taste the cheesecakes they make here. With pecan and rum, lemon and white chocolate, raspberry…”

“Peanut butter-chocolate...”

“Yeah, I saw at least a dozen different ones today. Let't go get'em, guys, before they're all gone.” And the girls started standing up. With their bellies already filled, it was a long, strenuous process that required plenty of rocking about, heaving and groaning. While Carolina wouldn't admit it, she struggled as much as bigger girls. She was new to this situation. Not that she would never overeat, far from it! But back home there was always a maid to rush in and help her get to bed. Here she had to do everything on her own, balance her wobbly feet and all.

Eventually they were all up. Evie stepped back from the wall of fat rolling at her. “OK, guys, I don't need to be around for that, I'm going We'll catch up later. Roomie…” she paused, sizing Carrie up, “make sure you get back in one piece. You watch out for her, guys, will ya?”

“Yeah, right, bye.” “OK, see you.” “Don't worry.” It was obvious the fatties focused on cheesecake, ignoring any other output for now. Evie shrugged and fled.

“Bye!” Carolina actually found out she was alone. Given their size, her newfound friends could move surprisingly fast when it came to getting more food. She followed them slowly to the dessert corner, letting out a few burps, when she spotted another familiar face. A small, round, blue-haired woman was leaning on a wall there, surveying the feeding scene with a benign smile.

Wasn't there something I wanted to find out? “Auntie Helen? Hi!”

“Ach! Is that you, Carrie? Hello! I could not recognise you in the uniform, you look so grown up! Come here!” and she wrapped her in her hug.

It still felt a little weird to Carolina, to see her so small. She used to look up to the dr. Schwartz, literally, but now she'd grown taller than her by half a head. Luckily she hadn't grown wider than her old family friend but even her present size brought other problems along as their bellies squished. “Oomph, careful! I'm stuffed.”

“I see, excuse my carelessness, dear.” Helen quickly let her go, her eyes on Carolina's tummy. “How are you enjoying Buttercombe so far?”

“Oh, it's good! My room's actually better than back home and… The food here tastes incredible! As good as in the best restaurants in the DC! Even better! I don't get it!” Carrie beamed, then sobered up. “But, uh, actually, there was a thing… could I ask you something?”

“Of course! That's what I'm here for! My door is always open. And for you not only metaphorically, Carrie! Come whenever you like! So what ails you?”

“Uh, I noticed I am in the C++ group but I don't know… Could you tell me what exactly that means?”

Her Mom's friend paused. “Actually, I am not exactly 100 percent sure myself but there should be an easy way to… Oh, there it is! Come, mein liebchen.” And she dragged the poor girl to a vending machine which looked out of place by the cafeteria entrance. It was also different than the others, an even bigger behemoth, a sleek chrome monstrosity which displayed laptops, cellphones and various electronics on offer.

“This is a service terminal, Carrie. It dispenses various, uh, 'gadgets' for our students. And here,” Helen used her own bracelet, then scrolled through a menu fast as hell – evidently she was used to it. “Ja, here are the brochures. Wait a second…” they heard a hidden printer at work, then a single sheet of paper slid out that she quickly snatched. “Here you are. Group C++ covers all the benefits of Tier IV SSS even if said student does not yet meet its prerequisites-”

Yet? thought Carolina.

“-namely it provides an unlimited meal plan at the cafeteria as well as unlimited credit for vending machines, the Buttercombe Takeaway and Room Delivery and all other campus services. These services include unlimited wardrobe alterations and/or replacements as well as technology rental…“ here the doctor paused, „In short, you may request a brand new Y-Phone, Y-Top, Y-Pad, anything you like from the list and it's been already paid for by your parents. The current favorite is the Himatsubushi 3-D VR Gaming Rig. Hurry and ask for it.“

“That sounds good. Thanks!”

“Glad to be of help, mein liebchen. But aren't those your friends waving at you?”

“Where? Oh, right, sorry.” Carolina spotted their frantic waves from the dessert table. “Gotta run, Auntie! See you next time!”

“Enjoy your desserts, Carrie. Give my regards to Mom. And take the paper with you, you might need it soon.” Helen Schwartz watched the girl stuff the paper into the pocket of her jacket and rush to the dessert queue as fast as her jiggling bottom let her. She couldn't help wondering how much wider those hips were going to get if little Carrie kept up her enthusiasm for Buttercombe cuisine.

“Hurry up, girl! Where have you been? The cheesecakes are, like, almost gone! And all other cakes too!” Her humongous new friend chided her. “Quickly! Grab a tray – the biggest one – and load as much as you can! While you still can!”

This was another new thing for Carolina. At home there had always been an absolute abundance of food. No matter how much she'd overeaten, there had been still plenty more left over. Did she have to compete for food here? If so, she wasn't going to to make it easy to other girls! She crammed every nook of her tray with delectable-looking confectionery before registering her order by beeping her bracelet and heading back to their table. Dr. Schwartz watched it from her corner spot, her smile a fraction wider than before.

When the girls got back to their table, silence ruled them for a time. They were all too busy stuffing their faces but eventually, as last gaps in their stomachs filled up, conversation sprung up again. “Man, I missed this all summer long!” the girl next to Carolina sighed as she struggled to swallow another bite.

“Oh, don't remind me, Chloe! Mom made me go on a diet, I lost ten pounds!” one of the smaller girls complained.

“Yeah, she did that to me too. But Gran lent me her car and credit card so I just spent my afternoons going from one drive-in to another. And evenings at the all-you-can-eat with my girlfriends from home. Would you believe I put on twenty?” Chloe proudly patted her gut. “But still. None of that fast food can hold a candle to Buttercombe.”

“Is the eating really this good all the time?” Carolina gathered her courage to ask.

“Oh right, I keep forgetting you're actually a newbee, you fit among us so well. Right, guys? Anyway, yeah, normal dinners aren't as, like, this big, but they're still the best grub I've ever eaten. And then there are the holidays. Oh man! Last year's Halloween there was so much candy around everyone got sick of it. And our Thanksgiving dinner lasted, like, all day. It was crazy! And then Christmas! If you can, try to stay over the holidays. They go all out for those who can't go home. You don't have to leave the cafeteria all day long, all day every day, none of that crap about cleaning breaks! And you take as much as you want, whatever you want, no snotty senior is going to hog it for herself! Oh!”

Carolina had her own reasons to stay at school over the holidays but this sounded so… so… either good or bad, she couldn't quite decide. Her stomach gurgled at this point, reminding her how much she’d already forced into it on top of all the chocolate and snacks. She saw the crease between her two biggest tyres fill out as her stomach inflated with food, making her navel clearly visible in the white fabric of her blouse. At home this normally happened only on the said holidays and it was always a sign for her to step away from the table (or at least, have the maid help her).

But she wasn't home anymore. She was having a good time with these girls and her tray was still half full of cakes she didn't get to taste. What to do? To eat or not to eat?
1223212221122.title: Feasting Makes Friends

choices: Fill in the feedback. It may come in handy
More empty calories? No, thank you!
12232122211221.content:
Her stomach gurgled again but Carolina took it as a sign there was still room in it and she ought to fill it with those wonderful cheesecakes. Besides, she really needed friends here and these girls were nice to her; a pleasant change to the bullies she'd known at her previous school. They were rather… big too but that actually helped sway her. In this group she could be the skinny sexy one.

So she abandoned all restraint. There was more room at the table after Evie's departure so she found a more comfortable position in her reinforced chair, one that didn't squish her poor tummy, and dug in. It is just for tonight. This is a celebration of my arrival and making friends, she tried to justify it, starting tomorrow I’ll be watching what I eat.

For now she watched the cakes disappear in her gullet one by one. They weren't big, five or six inches in diameter, but there still were nearly half a dozen of them left. Soon Carolina struggled with every bite, fought to swallow the sweet buttery substance, to add it to the mass that filled her throat. She felt herself redden from the effort. She was also sweating profusely and in the rare moments she looked at her companions, she saw the sweaty sheen on their pink faces too. But that didn’t stop anyone from cleaning their trays. Chloe and the girl who complained about dieting (Sally?) even went for another helping.

“Man, that was awesome!” Carolina's exclamation interrupted their laboured breathing. Completely stuffed and exhausted, she let her hands hang limply down. As they did, they brushed a paper in her pocket. What was that? She took it out.

“You betcha!” “It was, right?” “Welcome to Buttercombe!” “What's that you got there, gurl?”

“Yeah, what is… oh.” Carrie pulled out the leaflet she forgot about in her feeding frenzy. She briefly scanned it again but Auntie Helen already covered the most important points. “Just some info for me since I'm new here. Umm, guys, can you tell me what is, uh, a Himit- Himatsubushi Gaming Rig?“

“Oooh! I been trying to get that for ages! I'm still on the waiting list. In fact, only Chloe already got one but she's on the SSS.”

“Oh, don't stretch it, Sal. You asked for it right before we all went home for summer. They just didn't have enough time to deliver it.”

“Yeah, I know, but still. Can you imagine how many quests we could have done together in Alter Ego already?” the (relatively) smaller girl was apparently a bit of a gamer as she launched into a convoluted explanation of all the benefits of the VR Rig. Other girls let her talk, only grunting in agreement. They were happy for a moment of respite, waited for their stomachs to process enough food to be able to move again.

But eventually a chime resonated throughout the cafeteria. It sounded important and several students elsewhere stood up and rushed to get more food. Carrie saw nobody at her table looked concerned. “What's that?”

“Oh, that's just the first warning. And the service station will be closing now. We can stay on some more and rest.”

“Yeah but I think we should- *urrp* -get going anyway. By the third bell all hallways will be packed.” And the speaker rocked herself upright, her packed gut almost defying gravity as it jutted ahead of her.

“Yeah, true.” “Let's go, guys.”

With many grunts and sighs, and some swearing, the five fattened whales and Carrie heaved themselves from their seats and lumbered away to digest the feast they just consumed.

***

Another sweep of the bracelet, her door opened and Carrie stumbled into her suite. She made it to the closest armchair and collapsed in it, swallowing hard to keep her dinner in.

Evie was watching the TV lying on one of the couches, the dome of her belly aimed at the sky (or at least the ceiling). Now she gaped at her. “God, you're in such a state! Poor girl! I'll have some words for the guys tomorrow. I told them to look after you!”

“Uumph, that's… Ouch! That's OK, really.” Carolina slid the hem of her skirt below her stomach and struggled to unbutton the bottom buttons of her blouse. She massaged the swollen pink orb that rose out between its white flaps. “I'm… used to this… sorta.”

“Yeah, well, let me at least help you deal with it.” Evie walked to the bathroom with surprising ease, given her size and the fact her dinner was not that much smaller. She returned with a small bottle of bluish liquid. “Here, this'll help you. Yeng Stomach Aid; Extra Strength. They re-stock the stuff regularly.”

“Oh, right, I know this! Thanks! Ginny – my sister – sometimes takes it.” Carrie knew that she'd had some objections to this particular medicine back home but in her present state she couldn't recall any. Besides, anything was better than that dull throbbing pain! She quickly opened the bottle and gulped what had to be at least a double dose. While she didn't lie that she was used to overeating, she had never let herself go as thoroughly as today. In the company of Evie's friends she felt – no, she was eating the least. And she still ended stuffing herself more than ever before.

Now she released a series of burps as the vile-tasting concoction began its work. “Ah, thanks again. Already feeling better.”

“Right? Works wonders, doesn't it?” Evie chuckled back on her sofa. “So… what d'you say to the girls?”

“Oh, I like them. They're fine.”

“Glad to hear you're not going to hold this against them,” Evie pointed at the stomach obscuring Carrie's view of her.

“Oh no! No, this is… nothing big, really.” Maybe it was the Stomach Aid at work but Carolina's mind cleared and she rushed to add, “and it's entirely my fault. I went and stuffed myself though I should have known better. Don't tell the guys anything. I'll be more than happy to sit with you in the cafeteria again… I mean, if you let me.”

“Ah, good. Why shouldn't we let you? I think you fit quite well among us.”

***


They chatted a little more before Evie announced: “I don't know about you but I'm beat. All that travelling… They should finally invent the teleport they've been promising us, right? See you in the morning, roomie.”

“Bye.”

Carolina browsed the channels for a while, noting that as her roommate, Evie, too, benefited from the selection Dakota Griffith-Johnson purchased for her daughter (or perhaps she had equally generous parents?). But although the Yeng medicine helped her feel human again, fatigue soon overwhelmed her too.

With a sigh she switched off the TV and lumbered to the bathroom. She did toy with the idea of rebelling against hygiene and going straight to sleep. But while that appealed to her lazy side, the dried sweat on her skin made her feel like she ran a marathon and made her want shower now! And she knew from experience that if she didn't brush her teeth now she'd wake up in the middle of the night with her mouth feeling awful.

So she trudged to the bathroom and performed all necessary ablutions. When she was finished, she faced her naked reflection in the full-size mirror there. She could see her gut shrunk a little but it was still painfully swollen and Carrie knew she was in for a fitful night.

“Well, congrats, Carolina. First day at your new school and you’ve already broken just about every pledge you made to yourself. You used your family name to get around, you abused the privileges your Mom got for you and you stuffed yourself silly. Twice, first with the basket, then even worse at dinner.” Interestingly enough she didn't even think about the biggest transgression of her code at all – that given the chance, she avoided all exercise she could. “I need to restrain myself better.”

She put on her nightie and trudged to bed. She was already drifting asleep when her mind brought up a reminder. There was something else to be done today – what was it?

Oh, right, the welcome basket. Evie told her the school was requesting feedback and bribing them with a second basket if they told them which new brands they liked the most. Should she fire up her laptop and fill in the feedback before she forgot it all?
12232122211221.title: More Feasting Makes More Friends

choices: was with some giant landwhale, Ms. Porter—and her worst subject, English!
was clearly going to affect her waistline—culinary arts with Ms. Blake
was up stairs—this simply would not do.
122321222112212.content:
Carolina decided against adding even more empty calories to her already spoiled appetite. She'd already eaten enough today, thank you very much! And she didn't intend on waddling home Ginny-sized either; that would have made her mom entirely too pleased with herself!

Ugh.

Great, now she was upset. Maybe a little something to take the edge off...

The sound of crinkling cellophane capped off her night as she indulged in one last snack from her welcome basket. Or was it Evie's? Hard to remember this late at night. Carrie might not have wanted to bother to leave feedback, but she sure was satisfied with how everything tasted around here. The chocolate cupcake that she'd unwrapped (careful not to get any crumbs on her bed, of course!) was divine. Like nothing she'd ever expect to come out of a vending machine...

***


The next day officially marked Carrie's first day of Freshman year—and, unfortunately, she was already off to a rocky start.

"I look like a cow!" Carrie wailed into the full-length mirror, immensely frustrated with the reflection that wailed back at her, "I hate this stupid school and I hate this ugly uniform!"

Much like Carrie predicted, her untailored uniform fit her like a sack of potatoes. Without all of the tricks she used in the very specific construction of her own custom-made clothing, she just looked like a formless chubster. Her waist was hidden in the billowing white blouse that pooched over the waistband of her skirt, making her look like a bonafide fatty. Her hips pushed the pattern of her skirt outwards, making her butt look huge, and the sleeves gathered around her arms so it looked like she had bingo wings and... and...

UGHHHH.

"If you're a cow, then I'm a total whale." Evie chuckled as she entered the reflection, nudging her roommate over with her bigger shape. Their soft stomachs collided in a way that only added to Carrie's combustion, rather than pacified it, "You look adorable. Stop worrying about it."

Evie, despite being much fatter than the younger girl, looked much more at home in her uniform. She had already put on her butter-yellow blazer, her belly reaching forward and distending the plaid of the skirt. Her thick legs were hugged tightly by the stupid knee-high socks, but the sleeves on the blazer did well to hide her jiggly upper arms. All in all, Evie might have been fatter than Carolina was, but she looked so much better than her...

"Hrmm..." Carrie whined, "This is so unfair."

"You're so cute!" Evie pinched Carrie's round cheeks, "Look at you, so grumpy!"

"M'not grumpy. I'm legitimately upset."

"You'll feel better after breakfast."

Like last night had never happened, cupcake and all, Carolina had woken up hungry. A spoiled appetite to last a lifetime and a deeply-ingrained sense of eating her troubles had left her practically smacking her lips at the thought of some bacon and eggs. And buttery grits. Big fluffy biscuits. Carrie felt like she could have eaten an entire farm at this rate...

"Is breakfast as good as dinner around here?"

"Better."

"As long as its better than these stupid ugly uniforms..."

***


Lumbering down the hallways along with the sea of other similarly stuffed students, Carrie was in no mood to go to class.

She'd had an hour to eat her breakfast. And in that hour, she managed to eat almost as much as last night. Not only had Evie, Chloe, and the others insisted that she get her fill of bacon, eggs, grits, et cetera, but they'd practically pushed her back for more! French toast, plates full of waffles drenched in butter, those peanut butter pancakes (which had not lived up to the hype!} and more all found their way into Carrie's poor stuffed tummy and she was suddenly very aware of the fact that she had to go through a whole day like this.

"This is so stupid..." Carrie grumbled, waddling along her fatter friends as they slowly broke apart to go to their respective classes, "I don't wanna go to class..."

"Tell me about it." Evie hiked the top fold of her belly up and struggled to unclasp her skirt, letting out a sigh of relief as her stomach distended even further out, "Ahhh... that's better..."

Carrie's homeroom was in the main building. Which was good for her, because that's where Evie's was. Almost everyone else had broken off to head towards other buildings. Some by cart, some by foot, but each and every one of the girls that had walked out with Carrie were just as stuffed as she was. Some of them even more—a couple of landwhale seniors looked like they'd have to rolled back to their rooms by the end of it. Poor Carrie was too sore in the stomach to make a comment about it, but she hadn't exactly protested seconds, thirds, or fourths...

"This is me." Evie puffed as she came to a stop outside Mrs. Jackson's room, "Have a good first day, Carrie!"

"I won't." Carrie puffed, "Wait, where did you say my homeroom was?"

"Oh, right, I was supposed to walk you there..." Evie grunted, obviously just as stuffed and tired as her smaller roommate, "It's really easy to get to."

"Evie!" the bootilicious brat whined with a stamp of her foot, "You're the worst!"

"It's real easy, newbee. Stop stressing about everything so much." Evie stuck her tongue out playfully, "I've gotta get to class."

Carrie grumbled to herself as she waded through the sea of whales that were her fellow students. She collided with ripe booties, shimmied against stuffed jiggly guts, and bumped into more than a few fleshy side rolls as she struggled to navigate her new environment. How was she supposed to get anywhere with all these chunky girls slowing her down?

Ugh.

She just wanted to nap. Her belly was so full and she was so tired. Carrie had almost never had to do anything she didn't want to do before, so this mild inconvenience was almost entirely too much for her poor pampered self. To make it even worse, her next class...
122321222112212.title: Breakfast, Binging, and Bitching

choices: Their little chat gets noticed by Ms. Porter
The lesson – and snacking – goes on
1223212221122121.content:
When she finally reached her classroom, one of the last students to do so, Carolina was utterly beat. So much exertion, and on a full stomach too! Out of breath, she leaned on the wall to steady herself and searched the room for a free seat.

As she looked, she found out to her immense relief she was the size of the average sophomore. Maaaybe a little bit bigger than most but not by much. And there were some who made her feel almost slim, like that lardball in the back… Waitaminute! She looked familiar.

“Hi, Carrie! Wanna join me?” Yes, it was Sally. And there was an unoccupied seat next to her.

“Hi!” Carolina shuffled there and sat down, relieved to ease the burden on her overtaxed muscles. “Umph! Aaah… I didn't know… I thought you were a junior like the others.”

“Yeah, well, I'm not. I used to be Chloe's roomie last year, that's how we got to be friends. I spend most my time with them but hey! I finally have someone I can chat with in English II.”

“Yeah, well…” Carrie's nervousness returned. English was her worst subject! In her anxiety she completely overlooked that the company of her new friends made Sally balloon in a single year. “Umm, how's the teacher?”

“Ms. Porter? Oh, she's not that bad, you'll see. Actually she never taught us yet but the girls didn't complain much last year. Except, uh, they said she insists that we read… Oh, there she is.”

As their teacher lumbered into the classroom, Carolina actually felt a little relieved. After all, she had just observed the behemoth seniors in cafeteria and those were at Buttercombe only for four years. A teacher could have been here easily double or triple that so she had been expecting a real landwhale, carried by one of those oversized golf carts.

“Welcome back from holidays, class! In case you don't know me yet, I am Ms. Porter and I will be teaching you English this year.” Carrie was half-right, the brunette did arrive in a cart and she was big, yes, tall and wide, especially around the waist. But she wasn't the size of her sister Ginny yet, though her sprawling gut already drew a lot of attention. And more importantly, the teacher arrived equipped with a full bag of goodies so there was hope yet the lesson may not be so harsh…

“And I see we have a new arrival in the class. Can you stand up and tell us a few words about yourself, please?”

Oh no. She was singled out in her very first class! Public speaking – public attention in general – had always been one of Carolina's great fears. Mom could never understand her reluctance, her shyness in the spotlight. After all, Ginny took to it like a fish to water. But for Carrie it was the worst possible torture. And now this…

She bought herself some time as she struggled to rise from her seat. “Umm, hi. My name's Carolina and, uh, I've transferred here so… Umm, well, my hobbies are…” watching TV probably didn't count, “animals and nature,” it looked good on the widescreen TV, “and travelling.” Preferably sitting down in a car seat far away from her mother.

“I see. And what kind of books do you read? Do you read?”

“Uh, sure. I like… classical mysteries.” Just last week she binge-watched the old Sherlock Holmes series.

“And what did you read last?”

Oh, crap. What was the name of the original book? At least one of them? “Umm, the… the Sign of Four?” Carrie overplayed her stage fright a little, letting her voice tremble, in the hope the teacher would ease up in her interrogation.

She was successful. Ms. Porter turned her attention away. “Interesting. Thank you. And now, class, just like last year you can find the reading list for this class, English II, on the subject webpage under my name, easily accessible from your Y-Pads. Unfortunately there is very little in the way of mysteries, Carolina…” Some people chuckled. “…but I hope you will enjoy reading the books anyway.”

“See? She's not that bad, right?” Sally chuckled next to her.

“Uh…” Carolina wiped sweat off her brow and decided not to comment. “I'm not much of a reader, you know?” she admitted instead.

“Oh, none of us are, don't worry. There're more important things, like, do you game?”

“Umm, sometimes?” She was interrupted by her belly growling. When she was nervous, Carolina ate.

“Really? What kind of stuff?” Sally turned to her. “Uh, never mind. Are you hungry? Here, have a snack. I always come prepared.” And she held out a packet of cupcakes.
1223212221122121.title: Sizing Up Sophomores and Teachers

choices: Carrie stays strong—she manages to keep the weight off
Carrie porks out—it doesn't take long before she's putting on weight... fast!
12232122211221212.content:
Carrie and Sally weren't the only girls snacking in class. Plenty of girls had gotten used to being able to munch liberally throughout their days as freshmen, and the returning Sophomores of Ms. Porter's English II class were no slouches in the snacking department. They were, however, the only girls who were actively not paying attention in class.

"So, like, you and Chloe used to be roommates?"

"Yeah, last year." Sally sucked on an off-brand gummy worm until it slurped past her pink lips, "She got me hooked on these things. I swear, everything tastes so much better than back home."

Carrie couldn't have agreed more. Even given her mother's government and Yeng connections, everything at Buttercombe had tasted... better somehow. Not in a way that she could directly put her finger on, but it was as if Sally had said it for her. Last night's dinner, this morning's breakfast, the welcome baskets... even these gummy worms were pretty great! Carrie had been pilfering pretty steadily from the king-sized bag of candies, much to the distaste of her already stuffed stomach. After a breakfast as big as hers, you would have at least thought that after her nerves died down, she'd have reeled her chubby little hand back in from Sally's snack bag...

"Then she got put on SSS, and I got assigned to a new room." Sally whined as longingly as her hushed tone would allow, "I miss my Chlo-Chlo."

"You get a new room when you get put on SSS?" Carrie asked, a gummy worm dangling from her mouth, "Huh. That seems dumb."

"So dumb." Sally's belly growled loud enough to give the girls in front of them pause, "Hey, what hall are you on after this? The baking club is doing a fundraiser, and..."

***


"No fair! Sally was supposed to go with me to that bake sale..."

Chloe, the largest of Evie's friends currently wedged into a desk so tightly that her stomach cut deep into the wood, was much less quiet than Sally had been. That meant in regards to her tone of voice as well as her snacking. Just like the smaller brunette, Chloe had brought plenty of junk food to tide her over until the next lunch break. Muffins, cupcakes, granola bars... honestly, Carrie didn't think that the blimpy blonde had actually managed to pack her schoolbooks into that backpack of hers!

"Oh, well..." Carrie gulped down a big bite of extra-frosted cupcake, "It's still going on?"

Carrie had left her English II class topped off, her breakfast nestled comfortably underneath a pile of candy that Sally had been nice enough to let her snack from. Then she'd walked her to the next hall, where her next class and the bake sale were going on. Coincidentally enough, her Economics elective was the same one that Chloe was taking, which meant that this was at least two times a day where she'd have someone to snack withtalk to!

"Fine, you and me will just loop by there after class lets out." Chloe pouted, crossing her thick arms over her bib of billowing breast flesh, "Ooh, hey, are they giving an SSS discount?"

Carrie paused. She hadn't thought to ask for a discount. It stemmed from her not liking to ask for special treatment, given her mother's connections. However, the thought that she could have gotten her cupcake... and the half-dozen cookies she'd wolfed down on the walk to class... made her bristle a bit. Those things were expensive!

"I... didn't think to ask." Carrie made a face, licking her chops for stray frosting, "This whole SSS thing is still kinda new to me."

"Oh, you're on SSS too?" Chloe turned, the desk creaking ominously beneath her as she wrestled against her bulky sides to face her friend, "No way! You're so skinny!"

Carrie immediately swelled at the compliment. Her? Skinny? Nooo!

"Aww!" Carrie gushed, cheeks rosy red with pride and false modesty, "We can go see for ourselves after class!"

"A-hem." the voice of their instructor interrupted their conversation, "Is there something that you two would like to share with the rest of the class?"

"N-No Ms. Pembsler..." both girls groaned in unison...

***


By lunchtime, Carrie wasn't any less full than she was at breakfast.

Three classes, and all of them explicitly with at least one of her friends. English II with Sally, Economics with Chloe, and History II with Evie. And all of them brought a beaucoup of snacks, junk food, and treats to tide them over until this very moment. Looking at them all, as well as a few of the other members of their friend circle who had this lunch period, you would have thought that they'd all starved themselves before today!

"Oh boy, you're really gonna like the chicken." Evie smacked her lips as she placed her cafeteria tray down in front of the server, "It's so good."

"Burgers too." Chloe mumbled glassy-eyed as she drank in the sight of those sweet buns

"Oh my god the macaroni pie is to die for!" Sally squealed, "You're gonna love all of it, Carrie!"

Carolina was still a little green around the gills. All the food she'd sucked down all day hadn't magically gone anywhere. Here these girls were, the same girls who she'd spent the day snacking with, ready to pound back even more heavy food like they hadn't eaten since the day before! Everything did smell good, and it wasn't in her nature to say no to anything tasty. But it was starting to feel a little ridiculous...

"Ooh, they just put out the chocolate silk pie!" Evie extended a fleshy arm to point, "Better grab it before—"

"Too late, it's mine!" Chloe hefted her way through the crowd, "Come to mama!"

Carolina Griffith-Johnson had spent her whole life around people who liked to eat. Her whole family, especially her mother and her little sister, had always picked on her for holding back. But in a place like this... how long could she ever hope to hold out?!
12232122211221212.title: Scheduling Snacks

choices: Help Carolina grow
Let her grow on her own
122321222112212122.content:
“Hot pink would suit you well.” Evie, reclining on a sofa, reached for another handful of cashews in caramel and then, unhappy with how little her tubby hand got, she grabbed the whole bowl and poured its contents down her throat. “Oh, heck, they're gone already. Try the pink.”

“No way!” Carolina munched on her nuts too, now noticing with pride that her bowl was still half-full. Almost. “I've never worn pink. It doesn't suit me, trust me.”

“Just try it. After all, what's a couple extra clicks to you?” Evie grunted, starting the laborious process of getting her obese body upright. Her huge gut, spread around when she laid down, now bunched up in her lap, greatly complicating her movement. She rocked back and forth a couple times before finally dragging herself upright. “Ugh. Listen, Carrie, I'm gonna go for ice cream next. Want some too?”

“Nah, I'm good. I'm not that that big an eater. No, thanks.”

“Really?” Evie turned back in surprise. “You'll have to go pick it up yourself.”

“Oh, fine, bring me one too. Cookies and cream. For later. ”

“Riiight…”

When Evie stopped obstructing her view of the widescreen TV, Carolina fumbled around for her remote. She licked stray caramel off it and zoomed in at her virtual avatar. She ordered the Himatsubushi 3-D VR Gaming Rig mostly to please Sally but she found some apps she liked too.
Virtual Fashion Studio was the best one of them, letting her design new clothes from scratch without having to move more than a couple fingers.

She seldom used the 3-D goggles, though – they were so big you couldn't quite snack when you had them on. So she tested the limits of their TV instead. And she had to admit that even there her avatar looked very realistic. Too much in fact – wide hips, big butt and all. It was based on her measurements as uploaded by Mrs. Banks and reminded Carrie of the one thorn in her paradise.

But she was holding back! Sure, there were some slip-ups but overall she felt she stayed true to her goal. Like today. It was Sunday and Carrie used her C++ status to order roast lamb and mashed potatoes for lunch to their room. And while Evie went for thirds and fourths, she stopped at seconds and had only one cake. And some cupcakes. And the cashews. And she would eat the ice cream too, soon…

To divert herself from unpleasant thoughts, she lifted the remote and clicked several times. The black gown her digital copy was wearing turned pink. Carrie fiddled with the joystick, making her copy twirl around. Huh, not that bad…

“See? What'd I tell you?” Evie was back with two gallons of ice cream and two dining spoons. “Pink suits you. Here, take your cookies and cream.”

“Ah, thanks. Well, yeah, but all pink is too bland. It needs…” she struggled with her ice cream for a moment, in the end balancing the tub in her lap. It was getting a bit small for it but the ice cream nicely cooled her tummy. “…spicing up. Like, maybe, a white vertical stripe?” She opened the tub, stuck the spoon inside and with both hands finally free, she touched the buttons to make it happen.

“Girl, that's good!”

“Do you really think so?” Carrie preened, raising a full spoon of ice cream to her mouth.

“Yeah. Except I would make the neckline lower.”

“No way!” A second spoonful of ice cream found its way to Carrie's mouth, unnoticed. A couple clicks. “It would look like this.” Another spoonful, then she took the bowl and poured the remaining cashews into the hole she made. I wonder how they might taste together…

***
