The knock on their door was hard not to hear. “What? Is it the guys already? What time is it?” Evie stopped scraping her cake to ask her roommate. She was watching reruns on TV and spread on the couch, she couldn't see over the mound of her gut that Carrie was in a food coma.

“Uhh,” Carolina blinked a couple times to wake up from her stuffed slumber. She pressed a button on the remote. “2:05. Weren't the girls supposed to come at 3?”

“Yeah, they were. And they're not the sort to come early. It must be someone else.” Another knock was heard, the visitor was getting impatient. “And I'm not getting up this time.”

“I don't want to…”

“Look, I've already gone and brought you the ice cream and the red velvet cake…”

“Yeah, because you wanted them yourself!”

“That's besides the point. Plus I'm older and you're still tiny. And it's most likely that boring RA of yours anyway, coming to chat with you. So lift your skinny butt and let her in. And order some more cakes while you're at it, will you?”

“Oh, all right.” Carolina dealt with the order first, with a couple clicks on her tablet, before hauling herself upright. “Coming! Coming!” As she huffed to the door, her chubby cheeks noticeably reddened from the effort, her rounded belly bobbed beneath her blouse. No wonder, the better part of a red velvet cake was only the last on a long list of things she stuffed in it this morning. She could feel her stomach churning as it processed the flood of calories when she opened the door. “Uh, hi.”

“Hello, mein liebchen.” The round Buttercombe Counselor smiled at her. “May I have a word with you?”

“Uh, yeah, sure, come in. let's go to my room. Sorry, I was asleep…”

“Oh, that's all right, dear. I know how beneficial a siesta is and I'm glad you respect the needs of your body.” Helen Schwartz patted her on her arm.

Only when they entered her bedroom, did Carolina notice empty wrappers spread around her bed. “Umm… please ignore the mess.” Carrie was no slob! She just… didn't quite master the art of tidying up after herself, she'd always had people for that. “Umm, would you like a snack or something to drink?” And she cursed herself she didn't think of it sooner. Now she would have to trudge all the way back to the kitchen because her bedside storage was empty and waiting for a refill.

“Oh no, no need! I won't hold you long, dearie, I just came to ask if you are adjusting well to Academy life?”

“Oh, sure, Buttercombe is, like, perfect!” Carrie launched into an enthusiastic, if somewhat rambling description of her first weeks at school. “Really, I mean, everything's perfect.”

“Well, good to hear that. But still, if there's anything you need, do not hesitate to ask Auntie Helen.” She paused, waiting for a reply. “Or just drop by. You know I'll be happy to see you anytime.”

“Umm, thanks, Aunt, I will.”

“Anyway, I won't hold you up any longer, you must have plenty of schoolwork and friends so enjoy yourself. And drop by! See you.” And the small round woman was gone before Carolina could even stand up from her bed.

“Sure, Aunt Helen, bye.” She went back to the living room to see Evie unpacking a fresh stack of cakes.

“The cakes are here! Was that the Head Counselor?”

“Uh, yeah, she's an old family friend. Mom must've sent her to check up on me. Ugh.” She made a face.

“Here, have another cake, it'll cheer you up.”

I don't want to get fat… but I've been holding back, one cake won't hurt me. “Thanks.”

***


“Hello, mein liebchen.”

A bloated face framed with multiple chins leaned into the camera and frowned. “Hi, Helen. Is anything wrong? With Carrie or…”

“No, no, no, nothing wrong. Quite the opposite, Dakota. I know you don't want me to put too much pressure on her but I went and checked on her today. After all, she has been with us almost a month so I was interested to see how she was adjusting to Buttercombe.”

“And…” The behemoth stuffed half a donut in her mouth, her cheeks bulging.

“And everything is going well. Very well indeed. We have found her a suitable roommate and Carrie has become a part of her circle of friends. She is picking up the right habits without any pressure from us. In fact, she has had her uniform resized twice already, frequently orders room service, I am confident she will break 200 soon, she is only three pounds away.”

“How… How did you manage that?”

“Like I said, by handling her with velvet gloves. Carrie does not feel any pressure in Buttercombe. She is free to do whatever she likes – and her likes play straight into our hand. She is not even aware of it, I just checked. For instance, her uniform pieces were resized under the pretense of replacing off-the-peg product with custom-made clothing.”

Strangely, the mammoth Secretary didn't look happy with that. “Huh, but that means we can expect a backlash as soon as Carrie gets it. You should make sure any diet or exercise is impossible by the time she tries it. I know you've got more than enough tools for it.”

“Nein, I would not recommend that. Like I said, best let her think she has everything under control.”

“Well… you're the expert. I don't much like it but do whatever you consider best. As long as it doesn't blow in your face. Anyway, gotta go, I have an important… meeting. Bye! And thanks.”

“Sure, bye.” Dr. Schwartz rubbed her chins in thought. What should she do?
122321222112212122.title: A Sunday Siesta Interruptions

choices: “Yeah, I ought to do something.” Carolina tries to restrain herself.
“Nah, just a trick of the light.” Carrie carries on eating.
1223212221122121222.content:
Dr. Helen Schwartz rubbed her chins in thought. What should she do with Carolina Griffith-Johnson? Of course she could help her grow, she had done so innumerable times. She could have filled her so full of helpful chemicals that the girl would stuff herself to the brim at every meal and beg for more. But… wasn't she doing that already on her own?

It took Helen some browsing on the school camera network to find Carolina on recent footage. There she was, eating her fill at a cafeteria table with her new friends (Helen made a mental note tables needed expanding), going for seconds and thirds and fourths… Another camera showed her waddling to the class, red in face from the effort, pausing to refuel at every vending machine on the way. Yet another showed her in class, barely paying attention to the teacher as she happily snacked on her friend's stash. And here… several more clicks of the mouse showed the entrance to Carrie's room and the endless parade of deliveries from school kitchens and sweet shops.

In short, Carolina was doing a fine job of expanding her figure already, enabled by the school environment. Was it really necessary to interfere, to have her overeat even more?

The thing was that in recent years, Helen Schwartz was becoming a fan of a hands-off approach. It was a lot more challenging to set up the conditions just right and then wait for the test subjects to succumb to gluttony of their own volition. But it also felt so much more satisfying to know that her subjects pumped themselves full of calories of their own free will.

Yes, she would wait and see. After all, she could always change her approach if the girl unexpectedly started showing resistance to her new regimen.

***


Meanwhile, the subject of dr. Schwartz's deliberation was firmly wedged in her sofa. It felt a little snug since she somehow ended sharing it with Chloe and the girl was huge! There was also the small matter of Carolina's own growing behind but she preferred to ignore it, focusing on her triple cheeseburger instead. Delivered from the Buttercombe kitchens straight to her room at no extra charge, it tasted heavenly.

It was her second but she somehow failed to notice, engrossed in idle chitchat with her roommate and friends. She did notice when Chloe polished off her third burger, making Carrie feel like a paragon of restraint next to her. Still, as talk slowly petered out with everyone getting full and drowsy, she too became gradually aware of growing pressure in her stomach.

Blinking to to drive back sleep, Carrie licked stray ketchup off her lips. It was hard to pin down why but she was feeling vaguely dissatisfied. Maybe because she had promised herself to resist Buttercombe temptations? She stifled a yawn. “You know, guys, maybe we ought to do something?”

“Like what?”

“Like order a couple pizzas? Good idea, Carrie.” Sally completely misinterpreted her suggestion. It looked like her fellow sophomore was making a conscious effort to catch up in size with her older friends. She was always suggesting more food and eating past her limits. Today her greedy gut already slipped out from a too-tight T-shirt and bulged out in all its pale round glory.

“Right, guys. I am getting peckish too.” Chloe's trained appetite was always up to a challenge and she was remarkably quick with her phone when it came to food. A couple swipes later she added: “And I just came across a special offer on pizza rolls today. Buy a dozen, get a dozen free. Wanna me to order? My treat.”

“Wow! Go for it, girl.” “Yeah, right!” “A dozen for me too.”

“OK, there are seven of us so… seven dozen pizza rolls, times two, here they come.”

“Uh, actually, I meant…” Carrie struggled to express her vague feelings. What 'something' did she have in mind? Certainly not walking or exercise, the girls would just laugh at her and she was no fan of that herself. But more eating did not look like the answer to her problems. She made a sweeping gesture at all the burger wrappers spread around to express what she could not put into words.

Since her intentions weren't clear even to her, no wonder she was misunderstood. Chloe nodded, highlighting all her chins. “Yeah, it needs some dessert too. Since you've been such a great host to us all today, Carrie, I'll add on some of those cheesecakes you love so much. There! Done.” Smiling cheerfully, she raised her hand to high-five Carrie.

It was hard to resist the girl's enthusiasm. Carrie smiled too and high-fived her. “That's nice of you, thanks, Chloe.” Truth be told, she was looking forward to that cheesecake or two. And maybe some pizza rolls too.

***


The rest of the day was a vague blur for Carrie. Eventually even the biggest eaters stuffed themselves into a stupor and they spent most of the afternoon napping together until their appetites stirred again. And then they repeated their feast. When Penny the RA sent the other engorged girls back to their dorms late in the evening, they could barely waddle out.

Carolina never thought again about her dissatisfaction until she was brushing her teeth before bed. As she looked into the mirror she noticed her cheeks were looking puffy. Was it a trick of the light or was her face really getting rounder?

Alarmed, she took out her phone and swiped to find a good photo from the time of her arrival at Buttercombe. Putting it next to her reflection in the mirror she really looked bigger today but she just had a big dinner, right? Were those hips looking wider too?
1223212221122121222.title: The Illusion of Free Will

choices: Halloween comes and indulgence ramps up
Halloween comes as an eye-opener for Carolina
12232122211221212222.content:
Carolina carefully compared herself in the mirror with the old photo. She did look rounder but the lighting in her Buttercombe bathroom was so much sharper, adding more and deeper shadows, making her seem rounder. Yeah, that had to be it. It had to be just a trick of the light, no need to be alarmed.

For now. There was always the possibility that her new eating habits might lead to gaining weight. On impulse, Carrie snapped a photo of her reflection and vowed to do so every Sunday so she could compare. And do something about it, if it turned out she was really getting fat.

But for now she could carry on eating. Happy with her conclusion, she stopped worrying about her size, switched off the lights and went to sleep.

***


The following days reinforced Carolina's belief that she was keeping back. All she needed was one look at her new friends, spilling out of their uniforms as they filled their bellies with ever-greater feasts, to feel like a model of restraint. Her uniform fit perfectly. Yes, she'd had to visit Mrs. Banks again for another refit but it wasn't her fault that the Fashion and Design teacher goofed up!

In short, Carolina felt good. She ate as long as food was in front of her, and at Buttercombe that was always the case. She ate until her stomach would stretch to new limits during massive binge sessions she had partaken in, until she groaned and moaned that she couldn't swallow another bite. But that did not deter her from picking up the fork again as soon as she found some more room.

If she ever thought about it, she wouldn't find a single memory from her first weeks in Buttercombe where she wasn't eating. Carolina spent plenty of time in the cafeteria, she ate in the class, she munched while chatting with her friends or when watching movies. She binged whenever she was bored. There wasn't a second in the day that she didn't have something delicious in her mouth.

Especially while studying. After her laziness peaked in her first month at school, Dr. Schwartz warned her in another friendly chat that her grades were slipping and she needed to do something about it or her mother might take her home. Carrie didn't know this was an idle threat. Since she enjoyed Buttercombe far more than Forsythe, her previous school (and she certainly didn't want to go home to her annoyingly perfect little sister), she set about to remedy it. While she seldom used it, she inherited Dakota's drive and determination and now she thrust all her efforts into improving her grades.

She didn't want school to cut into her socializing, though, so she started studying late at night. While Evie lay groaning in the next room, unable to sleep after another excessive feast, Carrie would switch on her laptop and pour over her textbooks, pouring a steady stream of chocolates into her mouth. Yes, her stomach would protest but Carolina wouldn't hear it, her attention fully focused elsewhere.

This dedication to her studies soon brought fruit. Even before October was over, she was well on her way to the honor roll… and she had to arrange another meeting with Mrs. Banks as her uniform stopped fitting again.

Fitting was becoming a problem not just for her, though.

***


“Ugh, can't you move over a bit, Chlo? I can't fit in there!” Sally got held up at the service station and came to their table late because she (again) overloaded her lunch tray so badly she could barely lift it. Now she was balancing it precariously above Carolina's head as she tried to squeeze into the tiny space left around the last seat.

“I can't!” Their biggest friend wiggled on her chair, making it creak, as she tried to scoot to the right a bit. Her huge hips were overflowing it on both sides, touching another girl's thighs. “See? Lizzy's in the way!”

“I'm not! You're too big!” But Lizzie was no twiggy herself.

Meanwhile Carolina shifted to the left, worried she could get a food shower if Sally let go of her tray. But she couldn't move far either; an inch or two and then she hit a flabby wall named Evie.

“This sucks!” Sally gave up and collapsed on a chair by the next table, luckily it was empty. She quivered from the effort, her prominent belly pushing up the white blouse as it spread on her thighs.

“Yeah, it does,” Chloe paused eating to add: “Y'know, I think we'll have to split tables. It's supposed to seat six but…” she gestured at their bulging figures, bursting out of ill-fitting uniforms.

Carrie looked around the cafeteria and saw similar issues repeated elsewhere. Its furniture was clearly inadequate for the growing Buttercombe population. “You're right. You know what, guys? I think I'll visit Aunt He– I mean, Dr. Schwartz. Something should be done about this, the tables are too small.”

“Would you? That's awesome!”

A quick check on her tablet found a free slot in the Head Counselor's timetable that very afternoon and so a couple hours later Carolina outlined their issue to her Mom's friend. She used to be wary of Aunt Helen but her incessant friendliness, helpfulness and good humour made Carrie trust her implicitly. “… so as you can see, the tables are simply too small – and the chairs too. Something should be done about it. I know it's not your responsibility, Auntie, but I don't know who else to ask.”

The portly woman nodded her head and patted Carrie's hand. “Ach, ja. You did well to come here, my dear. I wonder how the management could have overlooked such an important issue. Here, have a cupcake.” And she pushed the bowl closer. “I will make sure something is done about it.”

“Thanks!” Carolina grabbed two for good measure. “And while they're at it, maybe add some kind of automation too? Self service is so last century. Serverbots like in better restaurants would be nice… they're Yeng-made anyway, aren't they?”

“I can see you have given it a lot of thought, mein liebchen. I cannot promise you serverbots but larger tables and better chairs should not be an issue. I shall speak with Dr. Hinamizawa right away. Is there anything else you would like me help with?”

“Umm, no?” Carrie stuffed the other cupcake into her mouth whole and grunted as she stood up. “Thankth,” she mumbled.

“Gut, gut. Come again whenever you feel like it. And take some more cupcakes for the road.” Dr. Schwartz watched with barely hidden glee how her most prominent charge perked up as she loaded on more calories to go. When she turned to leave, Helen could admire her most prominent feature, the ever-growing behind. She called up Carolina's vitals on her screen and nearly whistled. Her growth even accelerated in the second month, yet the girl seemed oblivious that she had eaten herself into new dimensions. Helen's strategy seemed to be paying off. “Oh, and Carrie? Do call your mother again. She yearns to speak with you.”

“Ugh… I will. Bye.”
12232122211221212222.title: Growing Pains

choices: Run to her room to change
Ignore it for now, the hunt is more important
122321222112212122222.content:
A couple days after her visit to Dr. Schwartz, Carolina was reclining on her sofa, chatting with Evie and eating fresh pastries. It was another typical lazy afternoon at their dorm and now, as they had all but exhausted conversation topics, she was slowly drifting to sleep until she heard: “So… Had any ideas yet?”

“Ideas?” Carrie wasn't sure what her immense roommate, stretched on her own sofa, was talking about.

“For the Halloween party and scavenger hunt.” Evie grunted as she shifted her body to see Carrie over the crest of her belly bulge. “I mean, Halloween's this week, right? So what costume are you going to pick?”

“Oh… this week already? I completely forgot.” As Carolina thought about it, she reflexively reached for another morsel. Eating was becoming just as common as breathing for the growing girl. “Huh, actually, I'm not sure.”

“Well, high time you come up with something.”

“No, see, I'm not even sure what kind of things I've got here, y'know?” As much as Carrie hated to admit it, since her arrival she hadn't worn anything but the school uniform or stretch sweatpants. She hadn't seen most of her wardrobe since her Mom's driver unpacked it and it was packed by her maids. “Maybe I should have a look, see what I could use.”

“Yeah! Good idea, girl! Let's make a fashion show out of it!” Evie grunted as she stretched to get her last pastry. “And maybe order some cupcakes first?”

“Uh, I'm not so sure…” frankly, the smaller girl felt too stuffed and moving (whether to show off her dresses or simply to order more food) was the last thing on her mind right now.

“Come on! All right, let's make it something salty if you insist. What tickles your fancy?”

Carolina was surprised to see that her tray was empty too. “OK, how about those mozzarella sticks? I think I saw a special offer on them… yeah, here it is. Interested?”

“For sure. That SSS is a wonderful program, eh?” and Evie groped her gut, as if measuring how far she had to go before she became eligible too.

“Definitely. And some Yeng Cola to go with it. There.” Carrie made the last click, rocked herself upright and lumbered to her room to inspect her wardrobe. A while later, a surprised exclamation could be heard. “Ugh! Come on, Mom! You can't be serious! Why'd you tell them to pack this? You know I'd never wear it.”

“What?!” Evie shouted, not willing to get up. “Show me, girl!”

“You'll gag,” Carrie warned her before showing up with a fairly elegant, long red dress. She leaned on the doorframe and the cloth cascade down her curves.

“Why? It looks good. Try it on!”

“Huh… It doesn't look as bad as I remember it,” admitted Carrie. “But I'm warning you, it's going to hang off me. Mom keeps ordering me clothes two-three sizes too big, hoping I'll fatten up into them.” With that she retreated into her room again.

A series of grunts followed. She wanted to get out of her sweatpants first, stretched uncomfortably tight over her growing behind. And when she was done with that, the red dress was nowhere as roomy as Carrie'd recalled either. It pinched her waist too much and her hips fit in only because they stretched the cloth, smoothing out its folds.

But she ignored that feeling now, focused on how she looked. As she posed in front of the full-length mirror built in the wardrobe, she was astonished how well she looked in it now that it fit. Even the cleavage, her old sore point, was suddenly looking so much fuller. And when she emerged in the common room again, her roommate confirmed her feelings.

“Wooow! Carriekins, you're looking good! And seriously intimidating! All you're missing is a crown and you could be the Red Queen.” Evie gushed.

“No way! That's so… so nerdy. But maybe I could use some white makeup and false fangs, what do you think?”

“A vampire? Nuuh, that's been done to death… but if you insist. Or maybe you could be a vampire queen?”

“Huh, we'll see. And what about you, Evie, what're you going to be?” Carrie was interrupted by their bell ringing. “Oh, the sticks are here.”

***


Halloween came with some strange news. The day before, when they were told their cafeteria would be closed all day until 5 p.m., pampered Buttercombe students nearly rebelled before Ms. Fukuda assured them they could order to their rooms all day, as much as they liked with no additional charge.

Everyone partook of this offer as much as they could and as they trudged to the cafeteria for the grand opening at 5 p.m., you could hear groans and moans from most of the overstuffed students as they waddled towards yet another meal. Carrie and Evie were no different and while her roommate the Arabian belly dancer enjoyed the advantage of a bared belly, the Vampire Queen had no such luxury. She groaned. The constricting cloth hurt her full tummy and yet she was feeling hungry again – or at least peckish. She trudged forward, hoping the trial would be over soon and she could sit down again (and eat).

Ahead of them, standing on a raised dais, Fukuda Hinamizawa watched the waddling throng with satisfaction. She coughed twice and reached for speaker phone. “Dear students, let me welcome you all to our annual Halloween celebration! But first let me say a few words.”

She ignored the muffled groans and went on: “You will be pleased to hear that we have listened to your numerous pleas and when you enter, you will find your cafeteria reborn, transformed to better cater to all your needs. You can enjoy new, sturdier, armless chairs as well as bigger, wider tables. And that is not all! You may recall we promised you a scavenger hunt. Well, we delivered! The new tables and chairs are still wrapped up and each piece of furniture has some kind of a prize inside. So hurry up, unpack as much as you can and don't tear up your prizes! There are vouchers for all kinds of goods and services, you may find unlimited access to our kitchens or even access to higher tiers of the SSS for the lucky few…”

If the statuesque Japanese wanted to go on, the assembled students did not let her. As soon as she mentioned the SSS, a deafening roar filled the hallway and the crowd surged forward to the cafeteria doors. Fukuda barely had time to stand aside.

Both girls went with the flow, Evie as eager as anyone to win the SSS and Carrie unable to resist the stampede. Once inside, they both instinctively headed to where their table used to stand. However, their movement soon slowed down as they had to get around their round schoolmates who were tearing the cardboard off their chairs. Larger tables meant less space to walk and although the designers tried to compensate for it by stretching the dining area all the way from the serving counters to the entrance, there was simply not enough room for all the plumpers who poured inside all at once.

Carolina was pushed and pulled, jostled around and almost knocked down. She bent over, catching her balance at the last moment by grabbing a still-wrapped chair ahead of her. And as her belly squeezed against the confining dress, she heard an ominous ripping sound.

She froze. Her fingers probed the gap which suddenly appeared on her left side. Luckily nobody seemed to notice so far but it was bad. Three or four inches of the seam around her waist were gone, her tender flesh in plain sight for everyone who would happen to look there. What could Carrie do now?
122321222112212122222.title: Costume Capers

choices: Carolina rethinks her approach to Buttercombe hospitality
Carolina doesn't think, she eats
1223212221122121222222.content:
Some other time, Carolina may have turned back. Two months ago, she probably would have. In her time at Buttercombe, though, she had seen enough wardrobe malfunctions to become a little blasé about them. Besides, there were benefits to be reaped here! Caught in rush, she went on the treasure hunt as if nothing happened.

She was still grabbing the chair that stopped her fall. Now she started tearing off the wrappers, hoping to find something good. It was surprisingly hard; Carrie had never exercised her muscles much and since her arrival the most strenuous activity for her biceps was carrying an overloaded food tray.

Still, she persevered and soon enough she managed to tear off the first flap. Then a second one and when she slid the back out she caught a glimpse of white amid the brown cardboard bits. What was it? She snatched it and turned the voucher eagerly over to read: 50% discount at all vending machines until end of semester. Huh. Not bad except her Mum kept her credit topped up. On the contrary, she might get angry if Carrie's monthly bill suddenly halved.

At that moment something soft bumped into her, almost causing her to lose balance again. “Look what I got!” Evie waved another strip of paper, almost jumping with joy despite her size. Her huge gut jostled from side to side as she did her little celebratory dance, pushing Carolina further away. “Unlimited uniform alterations and-or replacements! I really, really needed that.”

“Wow, good for you,” Carrie couldn't quite appreciate this perk given she'd enjoyed it since her arrival but she tried to fake her cheer.

Luckily Evie noticed nothing, too engrossed in the hunt. “OK, now let's get another… chair?”

As both roommates looked around, it appeared all chairs – at least in their vicinity – had already been stripped bare of their wrappers and other students, quicker on their feet, had moved on. Then Carolina had an idea. “Hey, Evie, Fukuda said every piece of furniture…” and she gestured at the table in front of them.

“Right!” and they both started tearing cardboard off the top. Soon enough, another white paper appeared and both Evie and Carrie reached for it, almost tearing it apart. Evie was more persistent, winning the reward.

“Hey, it was my idea!”

“Yeah, but I saw it first. And…” when she finally looked at the paper, Evie burst out laughing. “And… all right! Just look at it! Why fight?” and she threw it back so Carrie could read what it guaranteed: Table service for you and all your table mates until the end of this school year. “Aren't we lucky, huh?”

“Yeah, really lucky.” Carolina tried hard not to think it may have been rigged. After all, she had asked Auntie Helen for serverbots and this table was placed exactly where they used to sit... “Uh, should we search on?”

“Yeah, well, no.” Evie tested her new, much wider chair and happily sighed as her legs were relieved of the burden of hauling her body around. “One, I'm too tired and two, everything's been unwrapped anyway, see?”

“Umm, well, maybe not everything…” Carolina was just getting into the spirit. “Maybe there's something else special that we've overlooked?”

“Like what?”

Their debate was interrupted with Fukuda's voice that boomed throughout the cafeteria with the help of loudspeakers. “Please, everyone, take a seat. And watch out for the empty wrappers, girls.” The Vice Principal paused for a moment. “When you are seated, all students please register your prizes by running your tablet over the code bottom right.”

A moment of confusion followed as people searched for their friends, for free chairs, there may have even been a scuffle or two over a prize. Carrie and Evie lucked out as it were. They could claim their vouchers in relative peace and quiet and then wait. In due time, Chloe, Sally and the rest of the gang gravitated to their table too, huffing and red in face, too out of breath to even boast about their prizes.

Carolina used the free time to have a good look at their new table. It was a wide, broad oval with semicircular cutouts, big enough even for Chloe's gut to fit in. Conveniently, it also allowed up to half a dozen plates to be placed within arm's reach, or three full trays. And there were eight of these bays while there were only six of them.

She was not the only one to notice. Trisha, the dark-skinned, bottom-heavy friend of Evie's, asked: “Uh, guys, could I invite my roomie to sit with us?” And after a series of noncommittal grunts, she shouted at the top of her voice: “Hey! Abby! Come'ere! We've got a place for you!”

The girl who dragged her chair to them in response was notable for being almost slim, though the tightness of her elven ranger outfit revealed she'd already succumbed to the Freshman Fifteen (perhaps even Thirty). She looked around the table from one plumper to another, nervously curling up her black hair. “Umm, hi, I'm Abby. Abigail Hearns?”

“Come on, why so formal? You're a freshman, right? Don't worry, we won't eat you, Abby. Any friend of Trisha's is welcome here. Come, sit with us.” And Chloe introduced her to everyone else.

As they started chatting, a mob of caretakers swarmed the cafeteria, picking up the torn pieces of packaging and tidying up the place. And while they were at it, a trio of older women showed up at their table. “Can we take your orders, please?”

“Orders?” “What orders?” “What do you mean?”

“Oh, right! You're those servers, aren't you?” Evie beamed as she turned to her friends. “Just imagine, girls, we won table service for the whole year! Aren't you glad you joined us, Abby?”

The new girl just nervously smiled while everyone else went overboard with their orders.

Everyone except Carrie. She fingered the tear in her flanks, thinking furiously. Luckily, nobody spotted it yet but it was a clear warning sign. Yes, she wanted to eat, she needed to eat, her stomach was crying for sustenance. But when she burst her dress on empty stomach, what might happen if she overate? And she should curb her eating. This was a slippery slope… with the spectre of her 'little' sister Ginny looming at the bottom. What to do?
1223212221122121222222.title: Slippery Slope

choices: Back in her room, Carolina realises she has a weight problem
Back in her room, Carolina is too stuffed to think
12232122211221212222222.content:
It was a slippery slope indeed but when the server asked what she would like, Carrie started ordering and didn't think twice. Her short time at Buttercombe had already ingrained in her that the only correct response to offered food was: eat.

Meanwhile the microphone was picked up by Mrs. Banks, the Fashion and Design teacher. “And now, students, while you are queuing for your dinner, have a good look at costumes of your peers.” All seven girls at the table shared a sigh of relief they were spared the ordeal; today's queue looked especially vicious. “And if you see one you really like, don't hesitate to nominate it to our Best Halloween Costume Contest. You'll all find it on your tablets, you can add descriptions, photos, whatever you like. And don't forget the costume owner's name! The grand prize is another top-tier SSS berth for the lucky winner!”

“Uh, d'you know what that means?” Lizzie sighed and tugged at her beauty queen sash that slipped in between her boobs. Then she pushed up her coronet. “We can't win because nobody will see our wonderful costumes. That's so unfair.”

“Would you rather, like, stand in that shove-fest for eternity when you can wait for your food in the comfort of your new chair?” asked Sally. “Besides, what's keeping you from taking your own photo and uploading it?”

“Oh, I know, I know. But still, it isn't fair.”

“Those girls over there could claim it's not fair they don't have personal servers,” commented Evie.

“And we're getting preferential treatment too, girls. They're already carrying our order on that cart, see?” As Chloe pointed, her bingo wing jiggled. “Oh no, they're turning the wrong way!”

“Uh, someone else must've won this prize too,” Carolina deduced. “But look, the second cart is coming our way! We can finally eat!” And she made the whole table laugh when her stomach chose to highlight her declaration with an ominous growl. When the servers handed over their first course, she dug in as eagerly as her friends, her worries over weight forgotten; at least for the time being.

***


Much later, Carolina swallowed the last bite of her tiramisu, scooted back on her chair and stifled a burp, her stomach distended from an almost endless dinner. She could feel a draft on her side as the tear grew ever bigger. But she wouldn’t let it bother her, opting instead to take a sip of hot chocolate.

At the faculty table, Mrs. Banks picked up the microphone again, looking a little red in her face. “I hope you liked the Halloween feast, dear students. I know I certainly did,” she paused to stifle a burp. “The nominations for the best costume contest are now officially closed and you may begin voting for your favorites.”

Carrie did not bother, afraid if she bent down to retrieve her tablet, her belly might split her dress entirely apart. Instead she just sat motionless, taking shallow breaths since the mass of food in her stomach pressed on her lungs.

She noticed that plenty of other girls did did not care either, too stuffed or lazy to care about any contest. But others took it up with glee. Abby, who spent the last half-hour dying of boredom since she couldn't eat a single bite, now enlivened the sleepy atmosphere at their table with a running commentary on the weirdest and most awkward creations she could find.

A couple minutes later (after another order of desserts by the hungriest girls at the table, Chloe, Evie and Sally) Mrs. Banks took the microphone again: “Without further ado, let's get to the point you've all been waiting for! The grand prize of SSS goes to… Saturn, a creation by Camela Mencia! Come forward, please, Camela, to receive your reward.” When the girl finally stood up with the help of her peers, applause was replaced with a wave of chuckles, some laughed out loud. The round girl really resembled a planet, nearly as wide as she was tall.

At the faculty table a hushed debate ensued that Mrs. Banks bent down to follow, unsure what was going on. “Err… but now it has been pointed out that Ms. Mencia already is on the SSS, actually, uh, so…”

As the poor teacher stood there, unsure what to say, Fukuda Hinamizawa snatched her mike. “So she will instead have the use of all vending machines and the room service for free until the end of her studies at Buttercombe!” She waited for cheers to subside before rushing out: “And a new SSS beneficiary shall be determined from the contest front-runners by a teachers' committee led by our resident fashion expert, Mrs. Elmira Banks.”

Another bout of hushed discussion later, Mrs. Banks announced, “So, uh, the teachers' committee picked Gina Lollobrigida a.k.a Hunter Black! Ms. Black, please come here.” This time, the applause was rather subdued. The evening gown looked really good but admiration was tempered with envy as the skinny freshman to take the coveted prize.

The name sounded familiar to Carrie. “Who's Hunter Black? Does anyone know her?” she turned to her friends.

They all shrugged, only Abby the freshman predictably nodded. “Yeah, well, we've got Fashion and Design together and she's good, works hard…”

“Ah! A teacher's pet!” exclaimed Evie.

“That explains it all. Anyway, I'm getting a little peckish again,” added Lizzie. “Anyone else for ordering another round of cakes?”

“Yeah, sure.” “Me too.” “One for me.”

Carrie didn't ask for one but since everyone else did, the servers brought her a cake too. And what could she do when it landed right in front of her? She went on eating.

***


Several hours later and several desserts heavier, Carolina shuffled back to her room, wishing she had a cart to carry her weight. The tear in her dress was growing with every swing of her overstuffed belly but she was past caring about that. Now she was in grave danger of bursting. She trudged on, slowly and carefully, both supporting and being supported by Evie who was in very much the same state.

“Only a… couple more… steps…” Huff.
12232122211221212222222.title: Sliding Down the Slippery Slope

choices: Give up, her Mom means well.
No! Fight on! But enjoy it.
122321222112212122222221.content:
The great Halloween feast was over. Carrie bade Evie good night and waddled to her room, tearing off her red dress even before she closed the door behind her. Then she dropped down on her bed just in her bra and panties, fighting off a food coma. She should… go and wash her face… brush her teeth… but she couldn't.

Gradually her clouded mind became aware there was something wrong. Since when is my belly so big it forces my legs apart to sit comfortably? I am full, sure, painfully so, but still… She turned to her wardrobe (she left it open when she'd run away to the feast) and had a good look at herself in its full-length mirror. She gasped.

The fatty that looked back bore only a distant resemblance to what Carrie'd been used to see. All her features were swollen, her face had chipmunk cheeks and a clearly defined second chin, her arms inflated, losing all definition, even her chest grew a little, now resting on the monstrously bloated belly that filled nearly half of her lap. Her biggest feature was luckily out of sight but given how far her hips spread, her bottom must have grown too. And her thighs, oh God! She had to have put on at least forty pounds since starting her studies, maybe even fifty.

Sure, back home she'd still be called slim and even among her friends here at Buttercombe she was still on the smaller side. But for how much longer? Fifty pounds in two months!

Faced with the naked truth, Carolina did what she'd learned to do whenever faced with adversity. She opened her bedside table drawer and took out a Yeng Bar from her emergency stash. And another one…

It seemed like a good plan until she her hand scraped the bottom of the drawer. Then she suddenly felt she had only made things worse. Bloated and fuller than she ever had been in her life, the poor girl collapsed in the bed, closed her eyes and groaned. As her hands gently caressed the mound of her belly, she felt like a whale trapped in her own blubber on the coast of her bed. There was no way she’d be able to get up now, much less make the hike to the bathroom.

***


Carolina had a bad night. Her stomach woke her up whenever she put the slightest pressure on it, so she kept tossing and turning nearly all night. Only when it processed enough calories to subside a little, she could finally enjoy some uninterrupted sleep.

Not for long though. Soon after her senses registered distant thuds. What was it, an earthquake? Then someone seized her arm and shook her awake.

“Carrie! Wake up! It's breakfast time!” It was Evie.

“Lemme sleep… 'm tired…”

“Aren't you hungry?”

“Noo…” except just as she said it, Carrie felt she was hungry. Impossibly hungry.

“Well, it's your missed meal, not mine,” Evie chuckled. “I'm going, with or without you.”

“OK, OK, just a minute, I need to get dressed.”

Her uniform felt a little tight, which was weird. After all, she'd had her adjusted less than two weeks ago. The skirt was not that bad, although it hiked up a little higher than she remembered. But her white blouse was seriously constricting her tummy. Then Carrie's thoughts flew back to last night. Oh God, I must've been blind. All those refittings and adjustments – that wasn't Mrs. Banks doing a bad job, that was me getting fatter.

But now there was no time to dwell on it, Evie was waiting. She dragged her blouse down to properly cover jiggling tyres of her belly and hurried away.

***


There were servers at their table again, waiting for their orders. As she chatted with her friends, Carolina's weighty woes were forgotten for the moment. Just like everyone else, she went a little overboard, knowing she wouldn't be the one carrying it all. And then she had seconds, just like everyone else. And third, like Evie and Chloe and Sally.

Only when Chloe almost coaxed her into fourths, did Carrie wake up from her gluttonous haze. A feeling of light breeze on her tummy made her look down. It pushed out from her blouse, its pressure forcing two midriff buttons to open. Her full stomach expanded, filling out the space between her rolls and turning them into a single taut dome.

As she watched her pale belly, the brunette was feeling fatter than ever. Fatter and maybe a little tired of her rebellion against Mother. Frankly, she couldn't even remember anymore why she'd started it all those years ago. Wasn't it a little childish of her to refuse all the good things in life just because her mother was pushing them on her? Perhaps this was a sign she should give it up and enjoy all her perks to the fullest?
122321222112212122222221.title: Musings Over Weight

choices: How the time flies when you are having fun…
How the time flies when you are having fun…
1223212221122121222222212.content:
It was 4 a.m. the following morning and Carolina was sitting on the toilet, groaning and bemoaning her yesterday's gluttony. If she strained her ears, she could hear Evie snoring happily away. That girl had an iron stomach but Carrie had no such luck.

Except was it really just luck? Didn't Evie offer her some stuff from the bathroom cabinet a couple weeks ago? She stood up and rummaged in there, finding a half-full bottle of a bluish liquid: Yeng Stomach Aid; Extra Strength. Carrie took a good swig, hoping it would kick in soon.

She trudged back to her room and sat down on her bed, gingerly feeling out her stomach. There was a lot of it to feel out. Her growing rump was still Carrie's defining feature, likely it would always be, but her midsection was doing all it could to catch up. Her rolls were growing together, slowly merging into a single keg-like protuberance reaching from her bust to her crotch. Sitting down, it filled an ever larger part of her lap.

She sighed. I overate again, despite all the promises to myself I won't let Mom dictate what and how much I eat. This was the old argument. But now, in a lucid moment, she took it a step further. On the other hand if I refuse to eat just because Mom might want it, then in fact I AM letting her dictate my diet anyway. So if I want to completely ignore her I should eat whatever I want whenever I want it.

Carolina's epiphany came at the best possible moment. Her stomach gurgled again but this time it was a happy gurgle, announcing it was ready to digest. Despite the recent painful reminder where her gluttony led, she was feeling peckish once more.

Without even thinking about it she took her tablet from the nightstand. Nobody's going to serve you at this hour, she chided herself while her fingers deftly opened the Room Service tab. Nobody… But the app was still active, although there were remarkably few goodies left on offer – eager Buttercombe eaters probably decimated it overnight. Those pizza rolls did look enticing though and it was amazing that someone was ready to serve the whims of her appetite even at 4 in the morning (or perhaps ominous but Carrie preferred not to think along those lines). Her fingers placed an order for a dozen pizza rolls before she realised what she was doing.

Are you sure you want to eat that, girl? Not that long ago you complained about feeling sick and now… She almost cancelled it, almost. But the display changed too quickly for that, announcing Order confirmed, delivery within 10 minutes. This made her stand up. She didn't want the delivery boy to wake up Evie so she shuffled outside to wait in the hallway.

Once she was there, she was drawn to the huge vending machine. She eyed the many snacks in the machine's window, salivating. She could almost hear them speaking to her. Eat us, Carrie! It was all too easy to use her bracelet and unwrap a tasty treat. And another one…

It took three more bars before hum of the elevator finally announced her delivery. She eagerly rushed back to her bed, unwrapped the paper bag and started munching. It felt good, perfect even, so much better now that Carolina felt like sticking it up to her mother. Empowerment through eating, this was going to become her favorite way of rebelling against her mother.

Midmorning found her spread on her bed with a contented smile, sleeping off the effects of her latest binge.
1223212221122121222222212.title: Stomach-Serving Sophistry

choices: your mother
your studies
12232122211221212222222121.content:
Several weeks later, Carolina surveyed their cafeteria table like a conquering general. It was strewn with corpses of their enemies – empty plates and wrappers that the servers couldn't keep up with carrying away.

Her allies didn't look much better, though. Abby, the little Freshman girl, had tried to stop eating an hour ago and constant prompts to have a taste put her in a food coma not long after that. Lizzie and Trisha, Sally and Evie had far better training but they too dropped out and dozed off as the evening went on.

But not Carrie. She had the genes for it and now that she no longer held back, she discovered an appetite so voracious it surprised everyone present, her included. Her capacity was improving in leaps and bounds and today she was evenly matched with far bigger eaters – like Chloe who just licked her last plate clean.

Noticing her look, the SSS behemoth leaned over to her to whisper: “Finally full, eh?”

“I was full five or six plates ago. Not sure why I keep going.” Though that wasn't quite true. Carrie did what her family friend Hannah Hammond had told her many years ago: “You know the stomach is a muscle just like any other, sweetie. You have to give it challenging workouts it if you want to use it effectively. And it's important to stretch it as much as you can.” So she did.

Carrie noted a hint of triumph in her friend's voice. “Buut… if you give me a sec, Chlo-Chlo, we can go on eating.” She unbuttoned her white blouse and slid the hem of her brown skirt below the overstuffed orb, letting it hang out in all its glory. Then she waved. “Hey, server! Bring us another batch of cheesecakes.”

The woman had a look at their bulging guts, shook her head and went for their next order.

***


If students stayed in the cafeteria until closing time and were unable to leave, they were transported to their dorms in carts by helpful attendants. Buttercombe Academy never advertised it to avoid students abusing the service but once Carolina found out about it, she regularly did just that.

Now she watched the door to her room approach over the pink dome of her belly and almost – almost – regretted it. Had she not known about the carts, she would have never had her latest binge go so far. When she caressed it, her stomach could be clearly felt beneath all the fat tissue, tight as a drum. She had never overeaten so much and now she felt every bump, every seam in the floor. Even breathing hurt.

And doorsteps were much, much worse. As the attendant drove her into her room, Carrie swallowed hard to keep the contents of her stomach down, then she tried her voice. “Hey, you… can you… bring me… Yeng Stomach Aid… from the bathroom… cabinet?”

Yes, there was a third ingredient to her success. Her genes and determination would mean far less, were it not for the miraculous Yeng cure to every stomach ache.

“Thanks.” As she swallowed the bluish medicine, Carrie was already planning her midnight snack. Her bedroom cabinet was half-empty. Did Evie leave some uneaten ice cream in the fridge or not? Perhaps she should use room service again? Oh well. Plenty of time to decide. First she must digest a little and roll over to her bed.

***


When she was leaving her class the next day, all Carrie could think about was lunch. Not that she would starve herself during lessons, far from it. But she had English with Sally and the girl spent the last hour chatting about today's menu. No wonder they were both salivating in advance.

And no wonder she was annoyed when Ms. Porter stopped her. “Carrie?” the humongous teacher called just as she was to leave the room. “Could you… come back for a minute?”

“Uh, yeah?” she stepped aside to let others through, looking at her friend. Sally gestured to the cafeteria and was gone, waddling remarkably fast for her size. Carrie wasn't offended, she knew that for Sally anyone came a distant second to eating. “Yeah, what's wrong?”

“The Vice Principal would like to speak with you ASAP.”

Carrie gulped. “Umm, and… why? I didn't do anything wrong!”

“I don't know anything else, Carrie, why don't you go and ask her yourself? Right now?” And the teacher started her cart, signalling the discussion was over.

So poor Carolina trudged for a good while along the corridors on an (almost) empty stomach, hungry and tired. At least she was allowed to use the lift! And from there it was only a couple steps on the top floor to the door marked Vice Principal.

She knocked and entered. “Uh, hello, Dr. Hinamizawa? You wanted to speak with me?”

“Hello, my dear. I did indeed, come in. I am so very happy to see you are coming along nicely.”

Carrie just shrugged and grabbed a donut, mumbling something unintelligible.

“Ah, you are probably wondering why I asked you to come. Well, it concerns…”
12232122211221212222222121.title: Eager Eater, Accelerating Appetite

choices: “OK, I'll do it.”
“I'd rather stay here anyway.”
122321222112212122222221211.content:
“You are probably wondering why I asked you to come. It concerns your mother, Dakota Griffith-Johnson.” The formidable Vice Principal, Dr. Fukuda Hinamizawa leaned back in her chair and frowned. “Specifically, she called me yesterday to request your presence at your family Thanksgiving dinner.”

Carolina frowned too. She wanted to do more, to scream and swear, though she didn't dare. Did her overbearing Mom interfere with her life again? Then she recalled a tidbit she overheard from Evie. “But you don't let students leave the Academy for shorter holidays, right? A friend mentioned it recently.”

“Uhh, you spotted my problem. You are correct that we normally do not let students leave whenever their parents request it. However, yours is a special case, given your family ties with our partner-sponsor. Therefore I would like to ask what is your personal position on the issue.”

Carrie had to juggle the sentence around in her head a couple times before she understood it. “Well, actually, I've been looking forward to spending Thanksgiving here with my friends.” Evie had also mentioned what Thanksgiving dinners looked like at Buttercombe and she was looking to the feast as much as avoiding her mother. Although avoiding that constant tug of war with her Mom would be a welcome bonus. “So I'd much rather stay here.”

When she said that, she expected Fukuda to welcome her rejection. To her surprise, the aloof Oriental sighed again. “Oh, do have another donut, my dear. You see, as your mother pointed out, your presence there might draw favourable attention of high-placed dignitaries to our school. It might… smooth out certain past misunderstandings between us and the establishment.”

“Do I have to be there?” feeling stressed out, she inhaled the donut in a couple huge bites and took yet another. “I mean, with my Mom?”

“Ah, well, I am somewhat aware of your differences. I am not forcing you into anything but consider the following, please. In my experience, if you do someone a favor, you are far better placed for any future negotiations. And in this case you would be owed favors from both your mother and me.”

“Yeah, true…” Was this how her Mom thought all the time? It took some adjusting but she was beginning to like the idea.

“The other argument in favor of going is that it is always better to face the issues head on. As you know, Fortune favors the bold. And who knows? Maybe you will find some common ground with her. So what do you say?”

“Well, I don't really know.” Carrie wasn't just playing for time. She was genuinely torn between her old distaste and new desire to move on, to grow out of her childhood.

Fukuda could see that. “Ah. In that case I am officially asking you to spread the good name of the Buttercombe Academy.” She tried a warm smile, perhaps she was taking some lessons from Dr. Schwartz? “I have known Dakota Johnson since she was only a little older than you are today and you show the same promise. If you help me – us – you have my word that I shall assist you on your journey just like I helped your mother. At the Academy to begin with. Does it sound good?”

That was all fine and dandy but Carrie noticed she was promising vague future benefits in exchange for immediate consent. On the other hand, she wouldn't want to have the Vice Principal as her enemy. What should she do?
122321222112212122222221211.title: Fortune Favors the Fat

choices: Onward to home
Onward to home
1223212221122121222222212111.content:
Carrie decided to test Fukuda's promises right away. The evening before departure she threw a party for her new friends. Strictly speaking it wasn't quite allowed but she was not risking much. It was a fairly quiet affair like she expected. She'd ordered heaps of food on her Mom's card – pizzas, burgers, fries, pies, cakes, plenty of snacks and sweets – and everyone was too busy chewing to make much noise.

As she watched the six girls of varying girth enjoy themselves, Carolina couldn't help thinking what a stroke of luck she had. Evie et al. helped her come to terms with her figure and appetite and hopefully with her mother too. The next few days would settle that but she already felt much better than ever before in her life, less under pressure and with more friends than she ever had. She was lucky indeed.

Or was it not luck? Thinking about it, she suddenly realised it would fit her Mom's sneakiness if she'd somehow arranged for Evie to become her roommate. Huh, never mind that. However it came about, I was the one who made friends with her and it was my choice that brought me here. And now stop dwelling on the past and get back to the present, girl, before they eat it all and you'll have to go hungry.

Not that there would be any danger of that. Carrie'd taken their appetites into account when ordering and there was more than enough food for everyone. A lot more, in fact. As evening slowly turned into night, her friends parted one by one, wishing her a good Thanksgiving and staggering away on the verge of bursting.

Abby and Lizzie left first, claiming they could not eat a crumb more. Trisha, Chloe and Sally had better trained appetites but even they eventually gave up and departed around midnight, sneaking along the hallways to their rooms (as much as they could sneak at their size). They envied Evie who did not have to go anywhere; the big-bellied junior was snoring in her armchair, unlikely to move before breakfast.

Which left Carrie to deal with all the leftovers. She, too, felt stuffed to the brim but the mere idea of moving all that stuff into the fridge felt so exhausting. Plus everything was so yummy she was getting peckish just looking at it. “It might be easier just to eat it all, or at least things that might go bad. Can I fit it all in?”

Then she remembered she'd brought along a bottle of Yeng Stomach Aid from her last visit to the bathroom. She took a good swig and while she waited for the effects to kick in, she started making a list. First the uneaten quarter pizzas, those rolls over there, the ice cream must have melted already so I can just drink that, I should also get rid of that unfinished cheesecake…

***

Morning found Carolina lying on the couch, empty plates and trays strewn all around. When Evie woke up to rush to the bathroom, she rolled over on her side so her stomach would have plenty of space to roll out, and slept on.

“Carrie?” her roommate had to shake her shoulder. “Carrie, wake up! It's breakfast time. And don't you have to go somewhere soon?”

“Lemme sleep… plenty of time…” Then she jolted, fully awake. “Oh no!”

“So are you coming with me?” Evie was already refreshed, her uniform blouse tidily tucked in under her gut. “To breakfast, I mean?”

“Uh, sorry but…” next to her Carrie looked in a poor state. Her pale belly peered out of a too-small blouse strewn with crumbs and even some ketchup stains, her hair was an unkempt mess. “I can't. I need to pack first. I should've done that yesterday.”

“To pack? What for? You're leaving for a couple days only.”

“Well, yeah, but… I need to find something to wear, y'know?” Carrie didn't like to admit it but that was the real issue. Would anything still fit? “Besides, I've been eating until 3 a. m. so I'm not hungry yet. Go on without me, I'll come later. Maybe.”

“Ah, OK. See ya then.”

Alone in their rooms, Carolina heaved herself up from the couch and trudged to the bathroom to splash some cold water into her face. Then it was time to face her wardrobe.

While she rarely moved outside these days, she was vaguely aware that it was getting cold so her summer things were out of the questions. So she went through her warmer outfits, hanging as her driver left them two months ago. “Too old, too small, too nerdy, this might fit, this definitely won't…”

When she looked at the all-too-small pile on the bed, she sighed again. There was a reasonable selection of blouses and loose sweaters that would hide possible gaps, but no skirt and only a single pair of pants. And even those did not look wide enough for her new behind.

She had no choice. Plopping on her bed, she forced first one trouser-leg, then the other up her growing thighs. The real struggle came when the pants came up to her buttocks. Fighting the fabric and pushing the pliable meat inside, she eventually slid the hem over the shelf on her back.

But the fight was not over yet. Her recent overindulgence made her belly grow too. She pulled the flaps but it soon became clear they would not button over the fat. Sucking it in as much as she could, she buttoned her pants under the biggest tyre. It made the flab hanging over look even bigger and was a really tight fit. She scratched her belly, wishing for a snack. Or breakfast.

“Ugh, I'm a mess.” As she watched herself jiggle in the mirror, an unpleasant thought surfaced in her mind. If I didn't feed myself this fat, maybe Mom wouldn't be so eager to show me around? Was I hoisted by my own petard? She scrounged her face in distaste. Was it really possible? No, no, Mom has no way of knowing how much I put on at Buttercombe, right? Besides, that's a moot point anyway. Whether she knows or not, I have to stand up to her, be it now or at Christmas.

Relieved at her conclusion, she stepped out to the bathroom again– but before she could put on her make-up, on the third or fourth step she heard the unmistakable sound of tearing cloth. And a quick glance showed her a tear running down her hip along the seam. What now? What would Mom do?

As she searched for the number on her phone, Carolina absently scratched her tummy, “Uh, hello, Dr. Hinamizawa! Could you put in a word for me with Mrs. Banks, please? It's an emergency. I'm supposed to leave soon to go to my Mom like we agreed but I have nothing to wear, I just busted my last pair of pants… Yeah, thanks a lot.”

***


“Oh, you poor little thing,” the Fashion & Design teacher welcomed her in her realm with a suitably understanding face. “Dr. Fukuda told me about it. Do not worry, you're not the first student to have this little problem. I have plenty of discarded clothing from your older schoolmates. We'll surely find something there that you like and fits you.”

“Oh, really?” Carrie's face lit up. “I need just some pants or a skirt, I don't want to go home in these sweatpants.”

“I see. But first we need to update your measurements so we that know what to look for.” The older black woman took a tape that looked weirdly out of place among all the monitors and electronics. “So let's see… waist 43, that's plus eight inches, hips 51, plus six compared to September.”

“Oh…” Carrie didn't know what to think. It was one thing to come to terms with the fact that she 'gained some' and quite another to hear the exact numbers. “That's… quite a lot.”

“Ah, well, you're a big girl now but don't worry, we've got more than enough spares that are chic and look good on a girl of your figure. Such as…” Mrs. Banks opened the storage room and strolled to the racks on the left, “… this. All of this.”

“Wow!” In no time at all, Carrie found a pair of pants she really liked, dark blue with silver seams. “I want these!”

“Good, try them on.” But when Carrie left the cabin, the teacher frowned, “Aren't they too big on you? No, no, no, I get that you like them, and you will haveet them, I'll just make a few adjustments first, at the back of your waist so that they fit you better. Here, feel that? Isn't it better? And I'll use a thicker thread so you could easily cut it and make the pants bigger again if… if needed.”

“Umm, thanks.”

“Take them off, have a seat and wait, it'll take me only a couple minutes.”

As Carrie watched the teacher sew, her stomach reminded her she skipped breakfast. “Umm, Mrs. Banks, could I run to a vending machine? I haven't had breakfast and I'm getting hungry.”

The older woman paused her sewing machine to have a good look at Carrie. It seemed she was getting ready for a long speech but then she deflated. “Of course, dear.”

***


Several minutes and a package of cupcakes later Carrie strutted around in her new pants which fit her like a glove. “Thank you, Mrs. Banks! How can I repay it to you?”

“Oh, perhaps you could donate your old clothes to my reserves?”

“I definitely will! I mean, when I return to Buttercombe from Thanksgiving! Thanks again, Mrs. Banks! Now I have to run!”

That was a figure of speech. Carolina did no running any more, she drove the cart and she made it to her dorm just in time to see her mother's driver ask about her whereabouts. “Hi, Rick! I'm here! Wait a minute, I'll pick a couple things and be right back.”

And as soon as she was comfortably seated in the back of family limo, she licked her lips. “Umm, Rick? Do you have any snacks on board? See, I had to skip breakfast…”

“Oh, of course, Miss Carolina. Your mother made sure you'd be well-provisioned for your journey. Just open the box on your left.”


/I had intended to to cover her visit at home in time for Christmas... Oh well.

Enjoy the holidays./

finally reconcile
12232122211221212222222121111.content:
As she let the driver help her out of the limo, Carolina felt heavy as never before. Yes, she was over fifty pounds heavier than when she'd left home for the Academy but mostly it was due to the state of her belly. It was fully stretched out, frantically churning to process everything she had crammed in it during the long morning drive. On top of her Buttercombe breakfast she'd emptied all the snacks in the car and had the driver make a pit-stop at a Yeng-Dowell to steady her nerves.

Not that it helped. She felt nervous like never before, coming to face her mother after three months of separation. She'd vowed to start anew, without childish tantrums, speak to her as one (almost) adult to another. But she knew it was going to be hard to avoid old habits. Especially if her mother were to be as overbearing like… like she always was.

“Look at you, Carriekins! You're looking really good!” Even coming from Buttercombe, the sight of her mother was a little unnerving. Dakota Griffith-Johnson was a firm believer in 'the bigger the better' philosophy and a desire to consume everything in sight turned her into one of the fattest humans on Earth, though her exact weight was a state secret.

When she drove into the garage in her custom-built mobility scooter, her Mom looked indeed bigger than ever. She'd always been wide-hipped but now her inhumanly big behind looked ready to spill out of the confining space again. Not that her gut would be any smaller. It domed ahead of her, propped by its supports, obscuring the view of the Secretary's bloated face. She was looking ever more like her caricatures in the opposition press, “The Blob that Ate America.”

But Carrie bit her lips to keep snarky comments inside. “Hi, Mom.” As she leaned over to hug her mother, her widened hips knocked down a toolkit off a bench. “Oops. Sorry, I keep bumping into things nowadays.”

“Be it a lesson to you, young lady. If you always drove in your scooter, it wouldn't have happened.”

“Uh, right but I'm still not sure how I feel about my weight,” Carrie noticed that hearing these words, her gluttonous mother frowned and started huffing as she switched on her Y-Pad. “Is anything wrong, Mom?”

“Umm, I will take your luggage to your rooms, young Miss.” And Rick the driver fled the looming confrontation.

“Uh, nothing, nothing, pumpkin, just… ah, here it is. I've been informed that your snacking declined by 40% last month. I hope you aren't trying to diet again.”

“Mom! Are you saying you've got snitches at Buttercombe to report on me?!”

“No, no, no! I wouldn't even think about it, sugar. My old friends mentioned it in passing, they were concerned.”

Carrie had a pretty clear idea who they probably were. “Ugh. Well, in that case those 'concerned friends' should have told you that I won a 50% discount at all vending machines. If, as you say, my snacking declined by 40% in November, that actually means I ate, uh… 20% more?” Ouch. Was it even possible? Judging by the state of her wardrobe, very much so.

Dakota beamed. “Ah, I'm so happy to hear it. Remember, all boys love a soft, round girlfriend,” and she patted her flanks, making her entire body ripple.

Her daughter wasn't amused. “Really? Then you should've sent me to a co-ed school, not to Buttercombe! I haven't seen a boy since August!”

“Carolina, please! I'm your mother, not your enemy! I want the best for you!”

Carrie swallowed her first reply. Somehow they started off on the wrong foot again, mother always riled her up. She wanted to…
12232122211221212222222121111.title: Gravy Danger, Part I

Mom wants more bonding first
122321222112212122222221211112.content:
Some might say she chose the path of least resistance. Still, Carolina wanted to finally have a normal relation with her mother – as much as anything could be normal with that blobby behemoth, the immensely rich and powerful Dakota Griffith-Johnson.

“Sorry, Mom.” To offer an olive branch, she climbed into her scooter that was gathering dust in the garage since she'd got it for her birthday. Except there was no dust in it today. Someone must have cleaned it in the hope Carrie would use it, and filled in the snacks compartment too. Without thinking, she took a big bite off a Yeng Bar. “Sorry, Mom. I know you mean well. It's just… there are better ways to show it, you know.”

Dakota Griffith-Johnson looked sheepish, though you had to know her pretty well to recognise the emotion in the way her chipmunk cheeks puffed up. “Of course, sweetie-pie. I am sorry too, truly sorry. Let's go to the living room. So how have you been? The school is treating you well, I hope? Given…” She bit down on a remark regarding Carolina's weight.

Carrie was thankful for that. They chatted on in a remarkably civil fashion, Mom asked about her classes, schoolmates. To her surprise half an hour passed without any further hiccup. It was possibly the longest conversation they'd ever had. But eventually they were running out of topics and Carrie hoped she could go to her room next, to rest and recuperate.

Instead her mother asked: “Listen, is there anything in particular you'd like to do today? I cleared up my schedule to be with my girls all afternoon but Virginia stood me up, she's got some party she can't miss. So it'll be just the two of us, perhaps we could bond?”

Carrie bit her lip. A whole afternoon alone with her mother sounded like a nightmare. As she lowered her head, her gaze fell on her new blue-silver pants, now covered with crumbs from an apple pie the cook had brought them. Maybe… “Uh, could you take me to that tailor of yours, Mom? Apart from my uniform, I've outgrown every single piece of clothing I got. Even these pants are a gift from the Fashion & Design teacher at school, otherwise I'd have had to drive here in my sweatpants.”

“Oh, right! Let's have fun clothes shopping! I can take you to our favorite Frenchie…” Mother drummed her belly, “right after a second lunch, huh?”

***


When they arrived at the Yeng Drive-In for a late lunch in the family van, a bored teen asked without looking: “How can I help you?”

When Carrie saw Mom's eager look, she nearly answered I don't want to eat, purely on reflex. But in fact she was getting a little peckish. All that adrenaline pulsing in her veins must have sped up her digestion. She leaned forward from her back seat so the boy could hear her, her tummy bunching in her lap. “One Mega Burger Combo, please. And double cheesecake.”

“And four Combos for me. I've got a figure to keep up!” joked her mother. This made the boy look up, Carrie saw his eyes widen in shock. He must have been new, Mom was a frequent client in here.

When their order was ready, she put it all on the empty back seats and drove to a parking spot. The van was custom-built with a ramp, front seats torn out to make place for Dakota's scooter. Now she turned it around, away from the steering wheel, to face her daughter in the back. “So? What are you waiting for? Dig in!”

“I was waiting for you, Mom.”

“Oh, no need to be formal among us girls, sweetie! Ginny would've inhaled her first burger already. Can you pass me the first tray?” She leaned back, placed it on her doming gut and started eating.

Carrie hadn't planned on eating too much. She nibbled on a fry, took a bite of her burger… and suddenly her new appetite overcame her. It felt just as pleasant as feasting with her Buttercombe friends. Occasionally they commented on the taste but mostly they kept filling their stomachs in amicable silence.

Carrie's order was much smaller though, so she found herself licking off the last cheesecake crumbs while Mom was still going strong – if that was the right word. She was gulping down the last burger almost without chewing, her breathing heavy and ragged, she seemed exhausted merely by the act of eating.

When she was done, she spent several minutes catching her breath. “Whew! That hit the spot. But I should have told Rick to drive us in the limo.”

Carrie slid down in her seat to make more room for her stomach, winced as the safety belt dug into it. “ *Uurp.* And I shouldn't have eaten so much.” She felt her belly straining against the fabric.

“What? Nonsense, sugarplum! You need a full tummy for a proper fitting. You'll see.”

***

Carrie had been to Boutique Fabrice before but this was the first time she drove there with her Mom. It made sense she got to meet Fabrice for the first time too. Soon after Mom announced her name to the parking lot attendant, a dapper little man, slimmer than most Mom's acquaintances, scurried out of the building to welcome them in person.

Fabrice was looking harried and uncomfortable. “Bonjour, madame et mademoiselle, welcome to my humble etablissement.” He wrung his hands, visibly nervous. “Umm, please understand that with the Thanksgiving ahead of us this is a very busy day for us…”

“But you'll find the time for your best customer, right?” Mom threateningly drove her scooter towards him, stopping at the last moment so she loomed over the man.

He gulped. “Oh, yes, certainement! Only it might take a little bit longer than you are used to,” sweat beaded on his high forehead, “an attendant will be with you momentarily and please accept our refreshments in the meantime.” He pointed to a table in the reception area that two boys were just filling with snacks.

Mom's haughty expression melted a little at that. “Oh, fine. That's better.”

“Bon appetit, madame et mademoiselle.” And he nearly ran as he disappeared in the rooms beyond.

Her mother chuckled as she set her scooter in motion again. “Don't be fooled by his accent, pumpkin. I found out he was born in New Jersey. So what do we have here?” And she stretched her mouth open to fit an entire pastry inside.

Carrie was about to ask her how she could still eat when she found her mouth full of canapes too. They both lost the sense of time as they grazed on snacks. Their table was half-empty when finally a discreet cough made Carrie turn around.

“Uh, hello, Ms. Griffith-Johnson, Miss, my name's Suzy, can I help you?” The seamstress wasn't much older than Carrie but she was much slimmer and as she looked at her big customers there was a hint of worry in her expression.

“Oh, good!” Mom exclaimed with her mouth full. “Ah, yes, my little Carrie needs something nice to wear tomorrow so

“Yes, ma'm. And I'll tell the boys to bring more refreshments. Follow me, please, Carolina.” And she hurried away.

As she waddled behind the seamstress, Carrie was struggling to keep up and regretting her appetite. “Umm, could you… slow down… a little?”

“Ah, right, sorry.” The girl glanced back at her. “Listen, we have several dresses we'd set aside for your sister, uh, Virginia? Except she's, uh… outgrown them. Would you mind if we adjusted them to your size? You have essentially the same figure, it'd be much faster than sewing something from a scratch. Quite frankly, I doubt we'd be able to manage on such a short notice.”

“I know. But I've got a very different taste than Ginny. Well, show me what you've got.”

Suzy led her into a large cabin. While Carrie sat down to catch her breath, she ran to the storage and returned with an armful of clothes. The first two dresses were just as bad as Carrie feared – flashy, colorful, the deep neckline a bit vulgar. The third gown, though… Dark blue, flowing, changing hues as the light shone on it. “This one! I want this.”

“Ah, a perfect choice, Miss. Some silver jewelry and you'll shine wherever you go. The cloth is stretch so it'll adjust to your body but we should take it in anyway, in a couple places, so it would fit. I'll take your measures now, please.”

The girl was properly deferential but Carrie would swear she frowned at her size when she thought she wasn't looking. She even tsked when measuring her waist. “OK, it shouldn't be too difficult. I'll stitch it up for you to try it on. Want to wait here or go back to your mother?”

It was a long walk. “Umm, could you send me some pastries in here?”

Suzy audibly sighed. “Of course, Miss.” And rushed away again. A quick snack later she was back and Carrie could finally put on her dream dress. It fit her well as she paraded before the mirrors, watching her reflections with mixed feelings. Aren't dark colors supposed to be slimming? Oh well, with how much I like to eat these days, it'd be stupid to think I'd stay slim. And I'm still much slimmer than Evie. Or Ginny.

“Perfect. I'll sew the new hems and have the parcel sent to your home. It should be there this evening.”

“Thank you!”
