1223212221122121222222212111122.content:
Finding Mom wasn't hard – her scooter hadn't moved away from the table with refreshments. Someone had to have refilled them in the meantime too since many plates were still full and yet Dakota Griffith-Johnson was looking content, her inflated gut spreading high and wide, dangerously stretching her burgundy blouse (Fabrice's product, how else).

The sight made Carrie pause. Like so many times before, she wondered what drove her mother to such heights of excess. She felt repulsed again but today she had to parse her emotions to identify what else she was feeling. Fall at Buttercombe had taught her the bliss of senseless indulgence, the lure of lazy idleness. As she watched her mother, there was envy mixed in her feelings, and a desire to match, to exceed her Mom's sloth and gluttony.

Carrie huffed to the table, rewarding herself with a cupcake for the effort. She inhaled it in one go before turning to her mother. “Hi, Mom. I'm finished here. They'll deliver my dress so we can go home now.”

The humongous chest lifted with a sigh. “Oh. Already? I was hoping we could spend more time together, Carrie, just the two of us. We meet so seldom…”

Carrie reminded herself that she wanted to be the bigger person – at least figuratively. “OK, Mom.”

“Perfect!” Her mother's jowls stretched with a smile. “I'll show you my new favorite place inside the Beltway! Polly's Patisserie! We'll have a blast, you'l see!”

Carrie stifled a groan, hoisted by her own petard. “Yeah. Hurray, mom.” She furtively probed her tummy. She'd been stuffing it all day today, would it be up to the job? I should have taken some of that Stomach Aid along. Oh, well. I can manage a couple bites.

***


Somewhat to her surprise, Carrie enjoyed herself in Polly's Patisserie. The owner, a jovial (and jowly) woman of indeterminate age, was so friendly and forthcoming that she easily forgave Mom her barbs in the vein of: “Sweetie, there’s no way that’s going to be enough for you.”

It stung but her mother was right. The first Carrie's plate was only half-full: a brownie, some macarons and a tiny piece of cake. But they were all so tasty that she gladly went for seconds in the buffet-style patisserie. And thirds. And when she saw Mom still gorging, she succumbed to temptation for the fourth time too. Now she was regretting it.

“Well, it's been exquisite like always, Polly,” her mother smiled at the owner, “your people do a wonderful job, worth every penny. I am well and truly stuffed. Come on, let's go, Carrie.”

“Oh… yeah, Mom.” If even her mother was stuffed, Carrie felt about to burst. She reclined in the booth, breathing heavily, her tummy stretched into a big round ball. When she tried to stand up, she had to fight off the urge to vomit. “Just a… second.”

When Polly saw her pleading look, she rushed to help her. The owner was a big woman too but there were plenty of muscle underneath her blubber. She lifted Carrie up by her shoulders and half-carried her all the way to the van. “Perhaps you should start coming in your scooter, my dear, like your bigger sister does.”

'Bigger sister,' that hurt. Though strictly speaking Polly wasn't wrong. “Uh, maybe I should. Thank you, bye.”

Mainly she should have known better. She'd had plenty of parties with Evie et al., she knew she ought to rein her appetite in before it was too late. Now she was too full. Fuller than ever before in her life. Carrie moaned, unsure whether from pain or pleasure. It was all Mom's fault for pushing so many tasty pastries onto her!

Then again, she shouldn't begrudge her too much. After all, apparently her mother had been spending these 'bonding afternoons' with her gluttonous little sister. Perhaps she should have felt flattered that Mom expected her to have the same capacity as Ginny. But now she was feeling more than a little queasy when she shuffled from the van to her scooter waiting in the family garage.

Every step was sending waves of pain throughout her body as her stomach protested against so much jostling. For a painful moment she wondered how she would ever climb inside before recalling the scooter had a retractable ramp. She pushed the button and waddled up to collapse in the seat. Somehow this felt like unimaginable torture and she honestly regretted she hadn't taken the scooter for her afternoon romp with Mom like Polly said. Next time, she promised herself.

When she raised her head again, she noticed her Mom's impatient glance. “Uh, don't wait for me, Mom, I'll stop in the bathroom first.”

“Sure, pumpkin.” And the supersized scooter whizzed away.

Carrie was glad mother left her alone. She was about to attempt something Mom would surely not approve of. I don't have my Stomach Aid but I'm willing to bet either Mom or Ginny use similar stuff. And if they do, there should be plenty of it in the bathroom next to our dining room. I'm not happy about it but if Mom expects me to eat like Virginia, I wouldn't want to disappoint her.

Her heart racing from both the thrill and the exertion of hauling herself upright, she leaned out of her scooter to open the bathroom cabinet. A quick inspection of it found a dozen familiar vials with bluish liquid in two separate batches, one marked D and the other V. It didn't take a rocket scientist to tell what was what. I don't dare use Mom's stomach aid… or do I?

12232122211221212222222121111221.content:
I'll take Mom's medicine, I need as much help as I can get, reasoned Carrie as her hand took the familiar vial. She sniffed but the liquid was just as odorless as the Stomach Aid she'd been using at Buttercombe. Let's see what it feels to walk in her shoes.

It was most likely a placebo effect but Carolina began to feel better as soon as she downed the vial. Her stomach stopped churning as much, her heart ceased thumping as if it were trying to break out of her chest. Her spirits lifted, she drove to her closet to change – only to have them crushed again.

She was going through her wardrobe but all her favorite T-shirts were too small now. In the end she did squeeze into an Abercrombie University shirt that used to hang loose on her. Today it was wrapped tight around her enlarged chest which would make Carrie happy, were it not even tighter across her belly. And the yoga pants she put on next were even worse. Yes, they stretched all the way around her sizable bottom but they stretched so much the black was turning to pink over the two jiggly globes.

She turned around in front of her mirror for a second time but it only confirmed her first impression. Wrapped in too-tight fabric, she was looking like a burrito. She sighed. “Oh well. Wasn't the tee an XXL? At least Mom's going to be happy.” And yet, the more Carrie watched her reflection, the she was liking her new look. With bigger boobs, a bigger butt – and yes, a big belly – she no longer looked like a scrawny poor relative, living here on sufferance. She was looking so womanly, so sexy! That was a novel feeling for Carrie.

When she walked out of her closet, her steps were almost jaunty. She walked halfway to the kitchen before her stomach reminded her it was still kind of full and did not want to be jostled. Only then she realised her mistake and returned for her scooter. She rationalised she wasn't driving it out of laziness but out of necessity. What if Mom made her overeat again, eat so much that she wouldn't make it to her bedroom on foot?

After a breather she drove to the kitchen in its comfort, certain she would find her mother there. Dakota Griffith-Johnson was sitting at a half-moon table, surrounded with snacks and chatting with the kitchen staff while she was answering work e-mails. Carrie stopped her cart next to it and snatched a muffin before asking: “Hi, Mom, what time's dinner?”

“Umm, Ginny should be coming home from her party in two hours so…” she was interrupted with a growl of Carrie's stomach, “how about a pre-dinner snack?”

Carrie expected to be feeling hungry again, though she felt a little different than when using Stomach Aid. Hungry, more than just peckish. “Yeah! I was about to suggest a pizza…”

“An excellent idea! Girls, warm up two Quattro Formaggi for us. And some fries too.”

***


Her pizza was gone and Carolina nervously nibbled on the sweets the cooks brought them as she chatted with Mom. Strangely enough though, her nerves weren't caused by Mom. By now she almost felt like a BFF. Carrie was nervous because she knew she had to hold back, otherwise she'd burst at dinner. And yet something was urging her to gorge on everything in sight. Was it the Mom's concoction? She was holding her appetite in check but only just.

What it meant was that she ate only one morsel for every five her Mom inhaled. While she ate more slowly, she was filling up anyway and it had its consequences. As her stomach kept expanding, eventually it slipped out of the confining T-shirt and revealed her bottom roll; pale, jiggling and crisscrossed with faint stretchmarks. Carrie wouldn't have noticed it, were it not for Mom's approving glance. She felt a ghost of old annoyance at that, her hand reflexively shot to pull the hem back down. But… why bother? It was going to spill out again anyway. She let her belly hang out and chewed on.

However, soon after that their chewing was interrupted. The sound of garage door opening announced that Dad was bringing her sister home, much earlier than expected. Carrie braced herself for the first encounter with her gluttonous (not-so-) little sister – the last potential conflict today – but she needn't have worried. Ginny just breezed through the room in her scooter. “Hi, Mom. Hi, Skinny. Going to bed, OK?”

That was rather abrupt even for her. When her Dad walked in Carrie didn't ask, too busy eating. But her Mom did. She frowned, turning to her husband: “What was that about?”

He shrugged. “Ah, a disagreement with her friends, from what I gathered.”

“Oh, poor sweetie! Becky!”

“Yes, ma'am?” One of the kitchen maids jumped up.

“Bring a tray of cookies to Ginny's room. Or no, no, wait. I'll take them myself. Gimme that!” And her mother stepped on the gas, with a last apologetic glance towards Carrie.

Left alone with her father (all those kitchen helpers did not count) Carrie felt a little uncertain. After all, it had always been Dad who'd been on her side, supported her when she refused to be stuffed like a Thanksgiving turkey. What if he saw her change as a betrayal? She gave him a sheepish smile, looking at the kind man who seemed perpetually in tow of her domineering mother. “Hi, Dad. I'm so happy to see you again.”

Pleasantly plump but now relegated to being the thinnest member of the family, he'd been the rock she'd clung to during the most turbulent years of her puberty. Now he smiled. “Me too. Come here, sweetie. You've grown so much!” unable to hug her in the scooter, he settled for patting her thigh while his eyes searched her face for signs of her true feelings.

She suppressed giggling. “Dad! You're not supposed to say that!”

“Well, your Mom likes to hear it,” he chuckled too. “But seriously, though. Everything OK, pumpkin? With school, friends… Mom?”

“Sure. Better than ever, Daddy. Why?” Following his glance, Carrie was reminded how her well-fed bottom belly roll hung out of the too-tight T-shirt.

“Oh, well, suddenly you are best friends with Mom and let her push food on you and…” he vaguely gestured at her figure.

“Couldn't I simply decide to grow up?”

“And out?” he grinned, patting her belly this time. “Well, if it's really so… You're looking good, really good, Carrie, don't let anyone else tell you otherwise. One day soon your curves will make some boy very happy.”

“Oh, Dad!” she blushed. “Don't talk like that!”

“Your parents used to be young too, sweetie, believe it or not. Not that long ago. Still, I'm worried about you. Just don't let your Mommy push you into anything you wouldn't want.”

“Daddy! You should know by now that I'm not gonna let Mom push me around.”

“Oh, right. You're my clever little girl.”

Carrie returned his smile a little uncertainly. It was getting a little awkward, as much as she was glad for his support. Thankfully Mom returned soon, and she was fuming.

“Oh, damn those raging hormones! I must say, Carrie, I'm sooo glad you've put your teen angst behind. You'll never know what it's like until you have daughters of your own. Ginny these days is… Ugh!” She washed her frustration down with a pitcher of juice.

Huh? So perfect little Ginny wasn't flawless after all? “Umm, I had no idea I was that bad? Sorry, Mom, I didn't mean to…”

“Oh, that's OK, sugar,” she drove her scooter to pat Carrie on the shoulder. “As I said, it's a part of life. Though I'm really happy you're shaping up so well. But let's talk about something more important.” She winked. “Is dinner ready yet?”
12232122211221212222222121111221.title: Gravy Danger, Part IV

choices: Drive to the comfort of her bed
Have a nap first
122321222112212122222221211112211.content:
It was well past midnight and Carrie was lying awake in her bed, watching shadows play on the ceiling. The wild churning of her stomach wouldn't let her sleep.

Dinners at the Griffith-Johnson household had always been lavish affairs but until this day she'd never fully participated in the stuffing ritual. Today, elated by her reconciliation with Mom (and prompted by the mysterious contents of her Mom's blue vial) she'd overeaten like never before in her life. She'd eaten so much that kitchen maids had to carry her to bed.

She'd seen Ginny manhandled like that many times but she'd never thought that one day she would be in her place. Not that she was regretting her gluttony. The only thing she regretted was that she couldn't order the maids to bring her Mom's stomach aid. Well, she could but they would have told her. So Carrie had to wait until she became mobile again – at least mobile enough to roll over from her bed to the scooter.

She was ready to try now. Not that the pain in her stomach would ease much, quite the opposite. And Carrie wanted quick relief. Jerking and gasping with pain, she started crawling towards her salvation. She crawled a foot and paused, another foot… The worst part came when she had to lift her body across the gap between the side of her bed and the scooter. Her unused arm muscles quivered with the effort but she made it and sped away to the common bathroom.

She took Ginny's vial this time, not willing to risk her Mom's again. She sighed with relief as she felt her muscles relax and her stomach stretch. She massaged her belly a little to help speed up the process, then her gaze was drawn to the mirror. Was that a zit forming on her nose? And another on the left cheek? And one in her cleavage too… it must have been all the chocolate and sugar and stress. Oh well. She'd have to mask them with make-up in the morning before the Thanksgiving feast started.

That reminded Carrie she'd not seen her new dress yet. A messenger delivered it from Fabrice's while she was in the middle of eating frenzy. Now she eagerly drove her scooter back to her rooms to unwrap the package.

As the pain in her stomach subsided, she climbed out and unrolled the dark blue fabric, admiring how it looked on her. She put it on and twirled around, tried various angles in the mirror. She was entranced and would have spent even more time in it but she soon started feeling another effect of the Yeng medicine – she was getting peckish again.

Then she heard a click nearby. Was it her sister's door? No doubt she was heading for her midnight feast. Carrie hesitated. Of all the people in the household, her sister was now the one she wanted to meet the least. On the other hand, she was beginning to feel first echoes of new hunger. She knew it was artificial but that did not help.

She undressed again and looked at the pale mass around her midriff. I'll show you who's the boss here. It's time to sleep, not to eat. She put on her nightshirt and climbed into her bed, trying to will herself to sleep but to no avail. Her stomach was quickly emptying with the help of Yeng chemicals and demanded to be filled again. And Carrie had been conditioned in the last months to obey her appetite…

***


“Gah! Fine! You win!” Endless minutes rolling in her bed convinced Carolina she had to fill the gaping hole in her belly, otherwise she'd never get to sleep tonight. Hopefully Ginny would have already left?

However, as soon as her front wheels emerged in the corridor, she saw the light in the kitchen. And when she drove there, Carrie found the young teen nursing a half-gallon bucket of ice cream in her scooter.

Ginny didn't even look up, hypnotising her bucket instead. “Whaddaya want?”

“Umm, I was… thinking about having… a snack.”

“Oh, that's you? I though you were Mom- Wait a minute! A snack? Driving a scooter? Who are you and what have you done to our Carrie?” Suddenly Ginny chuckled – though perhaps cackled might be a better word. “OK, fine, wanna ice cream? Just pick whichever flavour you like from Fridge Three.”

Ice cream? That looked like a sound idea. Carrie picked rocky road while racking her brains for a safe conversation topic. “So… what's new, Ginny?”

“Eh, same-o, same-o.” Her little sister finally looked at her. “How' bout you? You retaining cake, Skinny?”

Carrie decided to let the barb be and take the sentence at its face value. “Well, yeah. Buttercombe Academy is… is…” She struggled to find words. “You'd like it there, Gin. I know I do, even though I was ready to hate it. Just imagine…” Filling her stomach with ice cream, she waxed poetic about all the perks her school offered before noticing her little sister's gloomy look. “But what about you? Have you fought with Mom? Why?”

“Ugh! Don't ask! Mom's so clueless!”

That was new too. Not that long ago, Ginny would claim Mom couldn't put a foot wrong – at least if she ever walked again. And as she reclined in her scooter, Virginia was looking a little… smaller. Sure, she still weighed far too much for her thirteen years but Carrie would have sworn that belly used to dominate Ginny's looks far more. Certainly her nightshirt was a little loose on her now, even with a full stomach. What was going on here?

Lost in thought, she spooned the ice cream until she scraped the bottom. “Huh? It's gone already?”

Her sister cackled again. It had a bitter undertone. “Want another bucket?”

“I don't see why not.”

“Here, have mine. I don't think I'll finish that. I've had too much as it is.”

This comment made Carrie uneasy. She couldn't recall her sister ever admitting she overate. Especially when there were no other empty plates, wrappers or containers on the table. Since when were two gallons of ice cream too much for her? She drove closer to pick up Ginny's ice cream and then she pressed her sister's fatty hand. “Listen, don't let that get to you. You know how many times I have fought with Mom. Just do what you consider best and the rest will sort itself out. It won't be tomorrow, nor next week but give it a couple years… Mom means well but she has weird ways of showing it.”

“Yeah, I know. Well, I'm gonna sleep now.” And as her scooter crossed the threshold, she turned back to whisper: “And, ah, thanks, Carrie.”

“You're welcome.” Carrie found in the meantime that Ginny's bucket had completely melted so she upended it into her mouth, gulping the thick sweet cream. It was still over half full but when she licked last drops, she still did not have enough. Ice cream was fine but she wanted something a little more substantial, something like- yes! Like this batch of brownies cooks left here for anyone who would be hungry overnight.

Carrie took the tray out of the fridge on the table and started munching.

***


Finished with writing her last reply to Sally on the Yeng Friendsbook, Carrie's hand reached for another brownie but came up short. The tray was empty. She picked up a couple crumbs, finally full and content, and patted her belly – a habit she'd learned from Evie. It was time to go to bed, except she was getting so sleepy…

choices: Onwards to Part II
1223212221122121222222212111122112.content:
“Miss! Wake up!”

“Huh? Wassat?” At first, Carolina thought she was back in Buttercombe. But why would Evie wake her up? She wanted to sleep…

“Wake up, please! We need to start working on the feast!”

“Huh?” Now that she thought about it, her bed did feel a little… wobbly. Like that scooter she had back home. “What feast?”

“Your Thanksgiving feast, Miss. So please, could you leave the kitchen and go to sleep in your room until the first brunch course is served?”

“Uh… Oh, right.” Carrie finally woke up enough to recall she was back home. “What time is it?”

“Half past four.”

“Ouch. Umm… Would you have something small to tide me over 'til then?”

The head cook rolled her eyes and grabbed a gallon of butterscotch ice cream from Fridge 3. “Here you go, Miss. Can you go now?”

“Oh, yeah, right. Thanks.” Carrie slid her thighs apart to put the bucket there. There was less space than she remembered and there was something else missing too. “No, wait! I need a spoon!”

Finally satisfied, the girl drove out of the kitchen so the kitchen helpers could start cooking.

***

Five hours later, refreshed and no longer sleepy, Carrie was looking forward to a festive stuffing. A Thanksgiving feast in the Griffith-Johnson household was never limited to a mere turkey and pumpkin pie. It was an all-day affair that started mid-morning and stretched long into the night, seconds and thirds were compulsory at every course (though Carrie used to rebel against that).

Today she had intended to hold back too, at least a little. However, as soon as she saw the piles cooks had prepared for their “brunch,” she just couldn't put down the fork. There was so much good food to be had, ravioli with triple cheese, cheesy garlic bread, fried calamari, platters of brownies and… and… she couldn't leave a single bite uneaten! Her Buttercombe conditioning took over.

However, a couple bites into her second helping she noticed that Ginny looked like she wanted to refuse it. Mother didn't notice anything yet, entranced in her own humongous portion. But she was bound to see it soon. Carrie frantically thought how she could prevent their fight. She smirked and squeezed her sister's biggest roll, trying to act playful. “Hey, squirt! How about an eating competition, like in the old days?” Before Ginny stretched her stomach and started beating her so often that it stopped being fun.

Ginny's reaction was predictable. “Squirt? Who're you calling a squirt, Skinny?! You're on! Becky! Another helping for me!”

“Yes, Miss.”

As Carrie slid the rubber hem of her pyjama pants below the belly bulge in anticipation of heavy eating, she congratulated herself. Despite growing into puberty, there were still ways her little sister could be easily manipulated into eating – such as the use of sibling rivalry.

***

Brunch was followed by a short nap to digest everything everyone crammed into their stomachs (Carrie again 'borrowed' Ginny's concoction for better results) and then it was time to put on her new dress. She was admiring her looks in the mirror when several cars stopped by the security booth outside.

The guests were arriving. The Johnson grandparents eagerly greeted her oldest granddaughter, on their heels Uncle Kenny came with his newest skinny girlfriend in tow, even Aunt Piper showed up. Everyone milled in the living room a little before the head cook came to ask: “Uh, should I start serving, Madame, or would you prefer us to bring more appetisers first?”

The behemoth sighed. “Ah, we're still waiting for one more guest – Hannah Hammond was supposed to come too, Piper – but I'm getting really hungry, snacks won't be enough… Yeah, we can start without her, no doubt she'll show up later. Let's move to the table, people!”

Both Griffith-Johnson girls waited for their lighter, more nimble guests to clear the way, gobbling up leftover appetisers, before they drove their scooters to the dining room. Their mother gave them a stern look, already waiting at the head of the table. “Ahem. So, we meet here again, my dears, for this humble Thanksgiving repast. As always, there is plenty to be thankful for…” and she launched into another of her beloved speeches.

Carrie fought the impulse to roll her eyes, then she saw Ginny do exactly that. Luckily, Mom made it brief today, perhaps all the lovely smells wafting from the kitchen helped. “Amen. Now dig in, my beloved family and friends! Remember, a well fed home is a happy home.“

“Ah, I see I've arrived just in time,” Aunt Hannah stood in the door, her killer curves stretching a demure business suit. “Let your hair down and your bellies out, ladies… and gentlemen!”

Needless to say everybody heeded her advice, even Ginny forgot about her grudge when she saw the turkeys being rolled in. Silence ruled the room for the time being, interrupted only with industrious munching and chomping.

***
1223212221122121222222212111122112.title: Fat Is Thicker Than Water, Part I

choices: Carrie continues working on her appetite
Carrie looks for an easy boost
12232122211221212222222121111221121.content:
Carrie was scraping off last mashed potatoes from her third helping and while she felt quite full, she wasn't that full. Sure, there would be more courses to come but… “Uh, Becky? Could you give me another helping?”

Her sister was sitting across the table from her and no longer eating, so it was no surprise she noticed. She cackled again, elbowing the guest on her right. “Aunty, look! The skinny bitch started eating!”

Carrie gave Ginny an amused look. “Shut up, Squirt. Becky, pass me the gravy.” As she stretched to get the bowl, she found another advantage of the sleeveless dress she was wearing – it didn't restrict her plumping arms, letting her pour a generous amount on her portion.

The dress was also giving Hannah Hammond a pretty clear idea of her recent developments. “Oh, you're looking good, Carolina! Real good! See, didn't I tell you, Kodi? Blood's thicker than water.”

Mom paused in her eating for a moment, her face a mixture of amusement and annoyance. “Yeah, you did.”

Discussion around the table veered to her newfound eating habits but Carrie studiously ignored it, focusing on her portion instead. She was soon interrupted again, though. As she was making her way through the fourths, her phone vibrated. Evie had sent her a photo of Buttercombe feast and a message: Wish you were here, right? it said.

Carrie chuckled and copied the question with a photo of their spread to send back. Truth be told, both piles of food looked comparable – and knowing the Academy chefs, Evie may have been eating better. Carrie was determined to trump her by eating more. Today and every day. She may have to slow down for now, however that only meant she could converse while eating. She turned left to her tablemate. “Aunt Piper, I think I saw your littlest sister Hunter at the Buttercombe, was it her?”

The old family friend looked like she found some of the weight she'd lost recently. Despite that, though. for the first time ever she was smaller than Carrie. Now she nodded, making her second chin appear for a moment. “Yeah, she's really enjoying it. Tante Schwartz is letting her help with some extracurricular projects…”

***


“Ooof. I've really overdone it today. ” Another hour later, Carrie was well and truly stuffed. Sweating heavily from the heat her stomach was generating, she pushed away her last plate for the helpers to carry away and leaned back, massaging her swollen midriff.

“That's why we have ice cream – to soothe full stomachs, dumpling.” And Mom passed her a bucket.

Of course, adding another half gallon to her load did not exactly help her digestion but another drive to the bathroom for a swig of Ginny's medicine did. By the time pies came in, Carolina was feeling fit again – fit to continue eating, at least. Pumpkin, apple, cherry, chocolate or pecan, she did not really mind, devouring everything in sight like a hungry monster – even like her mother.

Eventually everything blurred. Carrie later recalled only hazy wisps of memories – a series of toasts that Mom proposed, Aunt Helen offering her more pies, her grandparents saying goodbye, Aunt Helen bringing in a special order from a Belgian chocolaterie, her stopping Ginny's outburst with another reminder about their little contest…

Actually, that was the only thing she remembered more clearly – her eating competition with Ginny. When they met in the kitchen the next morning, eyes still bleary, it was the first thing her 'little' sister asked - “Who won?”

Carrie shrugged. “Uh, nobody, I guess? We can say it ended in a draw.”

“Yeah, or in a food coma. So what do we do? I want to beat you, skinny. Do we go on eating?”

“Sure.”

And so Carrie spent the rest of her stay at home permanently full. Thanks to some illicit help courtesy of Yeng the competition winner was never clear. She suspected that Ginny may have eaten a little more but neither girl was sure so they agreed on a draw – and another round on Christmas.

And then it was time to return to Buttercombe, in hot pink jeans borrowed from Ginny.

***


“Evie, hi! I missed you!” Carrie waddled in, carefully holding her tummy with both hands to avoid too much sloshing. She added all the edible contents of the limo pantry to it on her drive back to the Academy and now she was feeling a little queasy from all the walking around.

“Uh, hi…” her roommate was lethargically spread in a sofa, her gut pointing to heavens, presumably stuffed to the brim judging from the groan she let out when she tried to face her.

Carrie heard Rick the driver walk in too. “I'll put all the things in your room, Miss, and leave, if it's OK?”

“No, wait. Leave one basket here. Evie, look, this is a gift from Aunt Helen, Belgian truffles and chocolates. Wanna have a taste?”

“Oh, sure!” the beached whale suddenly mustered enough strength in her underused muscles to swing herself upright. “Give it here.” The driver promptly obeyed.

“Bye, Rick!” Carrie gingerly sat down on her own settee.

“So how was family Thanksgiving?” asked Evie as she unwrapped the first morsel. “Wow, those are good!”

“Oh, fine. Actually, it was the best Thanksgiving I've ever had…” as she talked, Evie's all too visible – and audible – enjoyment of her gift was making her hungry again. Well, not hungry, she still felt her stomach pushing out but she was a little peckish. And those truffles were so small they'd hardly take up any space in there…

She took a package of them. “Imagine, Evie, if all the cooks from Buttercombe were there only for the two of us…”

***


It was well past midnight, the basket was empty and Evie was snoring on the sofa. However, Carrie was still a little peckish thanks to the last swig of Yeng Stomach Aid and she recalled Aunt Helen giving her two baskets (“one for you and one for your friends”). Back then she found it hugely excessive, now she was thinking she should have asked Ginny for hers too.

Stretched on her wide bed, she continued plopping chocolates into her mouth until a beam of moonlight reached her window and lit her towering belly. This awoke Carrie's curiosity. She stood up, grunting and sweating, and opened the wardrobe to have a good look at her expanding figure in its mirror. As she did so, she noticed her scale at the bottom. She tapped it with a toe to switch it on. I wonder how much I weigh now.

She had to crane her neck forward over the belly bulge to see the numbers. I should ask around for a talking scale. How much is it? Huh… Have I really put on five pounds in four days? Where did all that new flesh come from? In the mirror she could see all the empty wrappers strewn around. Oh, what a silly question. Well, now I can really start pulling my weight.

She cupped her breasts in her hands. Though she would have preferred more calories to have ended up there, nobody would ever call her flat again. Then her arms slid downward, to the heaviness of her stomach hanging below. Its full roundness was almost hypnotizing. Soon she was rubbing it, massaging it. it felt so sexy. Later her gaze slid further beyond, to the hips that jutted out on both sides. They were so wide that they nearly filled even a Buttercombe mirror.

Girl, you are getting so big… Yet she found she didn’t mind it. She'd already admitted to herself that she loved eating to excess. Now she was surprised to find out she liked the results as well. Buttercombe, watch out! The new and improved Carrie is coming!
12232122211221212222222121111221121.title: Fat Is Thicker Than Water, Part II

choices: Fukuda speaks to Dr. Schwartz
Carolina gets back to her friends
122321222112212122222221211112211212.content:
The next day Carrie got into the Buttercombe spirit in full; full being the keyword. She managed to squeeze two breakfasts into her schedule (and stomach), two lunches, countless snacking in between. Her newfound greed came to a sudden halt when she managed to squirt ketchup all over her face, to the merriment of Evie et al.

Carrie grunted, rose and retreated to the bathroom to wash herself. Then she took out her makeup but before she could reapply it, second thoughts came as she stared at herself in the mirror. Her face looked bloated, her breasts strained the yellow blazer, her painfully full belly bulged over the belt, her thighs touched all the way down underneath the mustard skirt. Huh, I am becoming what I fought against so long, so hard. Perhaps I should cut down a bit? And move around more?

But then new reality reasserted itself. What am I thinking? Do I really want to diet and exercise? No way! She grabbed a vial of Stomach Aid from her purse, only to find it empty. Didn't Ginny have an improved version? Perhaps I should ask around. And I know where.

Leaning on the washbasin, she quickly fired off a text message to a number she'd acquired recently: Back from Mom. Wanna talk about it?

***


An hour later she was knocking on the door marked Vice Principal.

“Come in, it is open!” Dr. Fukuda Hinamizawa ventured a rare smile, her face muscles straining with the effort. “Glad to see you round, Carolina. Please, have a seat, have some donuts. From your disposition I surmise everything went well?”

“Yeah, sure, even better.” Her mouth full again, Carrie launched into a redacted description of her Thanksgiving festivities. “As you can see,” she concluded some time later, “I tried to uphold the Buttercombe reputation as much as I could. Definitely at the table but I didn't get into any fights either… Actually, I think eating makes people mellow out, be less confrontational.”

“Ah yes, I am glad to hear that. And you are absolutely correct, food does help smooth out the wrinkles. Not that there wouldn't be plenty of power struggles in the present system too.” Fukuda looked uncomfortable saying that. “It is a – what do you call it? A dog-eat-dog world? At least we do not have to eat real dogs, Yeng feeds its people well. Still, the price of defeat is steep.”

The way she said it made Carrie pause. Was this the reason why the woman who once epitomised Yeng now ran only a tiny boarding school? And was she perhaps looking to regain that position with Carrie's help?

Carolina felt deeply uncomfortable, as if she were trying to use an atrophied muscle. Was this how her mother thought all the time? She didn't like it much but she did like the fact that Fukuda was the first adult ever who treated her as a player on her own, not like an extension of her mother.

Uneasy from the attention, she squirmed in the plush seat, her eyes darting around the room. She noticed a small mirror in the corner, oriented so that it showed a bloated caricature of Carrie. Looking at it, she realised she looked a lot like Dakota Johnson in the first photographs from their family album. Am I turning into my mother? She asked the mirror silently. What should I say? What would she say?

The truth, or a version of it, her reflection seemed to answer. It is the easiest solution and has the added bonus that it might confuse your enemy.

“Well, for what it's worth, Mom didn't speak ill about you, Dr. Hinamizawa. Quite the opposite. So perhaps your… exile here is only temporary?”

“Ah, well, let us hope so.” Fukuda lost her introspective look, returning to the present her eyes focused back on Carrie. “And what are your plans now, young lady?”

“Uhh…” Carrie licked her lips. Donuts were gone. “I'd go for a second lunch?”

“You mean a third one, right? Haven't you had two lunches already?”

Was she watching her? “Eh, who's counting?”

The Oriental woman chuckled, her mood visibly improved hearing those words. “Quite right, Carolina. Anyway, I meant to ask if there is something I can do for you to make your stay in Buttercombe more pleasant? Anything?”

Perfect, this was what Carrie was waiting for all along. “Umm, while I was home, I noticed that Ginny- my little sister…”

“Yes, I know.”

“Ginny was taking some medicine like the Yeng Stomach Aid we have here. But it was better, more powerful. Could I start using it too?”

This time the smile seemed genuine. “Oh, well, I would not call it more powerful but rather more focused, tailored to your personal needs. And I don't see why you shouldn't get one too, Carolina. However, I am not a medical professional, I will have to have a word with Dr. Schwartz and nurse Fukiyama first.”

“OK?”

“Expect one of them to call you ASAP.”

“Thank you.” Carrie squirmed in the low seat, trying to stand up. It took her three tries to succeed while the Vice Principal watched her struggle.

Only when she was finally standing, red in face, and smoothing out her blouse, Fukuda concentrated again. “No need to thank me, I will be glad to help one of my favorite students, Carolina. Oh, and one last thing. Mrs. Banks reminded me to ask you for the clothes you have outgrown.”

“Yeah, sure, I'll be happy pass them on. It's not like I'd fit in them ever again.” And Carrie patted her stuffed gut, curious about the effect it would have.

Fukuda blinked. “Oh. Right. Quite right you are. Well, do not let me detain you any longer, my dear. Goodbye for now.”

“Bye.”

1223212221122121222222212111122112121.content:
“Meine liebe Fukuda, I feel you are too strict towards poor Hunter Black,” Dr. Schwartz chose a conciliatory tone. “Remember we were young too, once. It was merely an innocent prank.”

“Not so innocent if two freshmen had to spend the night in the infirmary,” grumbled Fukuda. “The girl was justly reprimanded and that's it. I don't want to argue about your protégé any more.”

“Uh, fine. Here, have a Belgian truffle, it shall sveeten your mood.” The round doctor pushed a box to the tall Oriental and rose from the plush guest chair, huffing. “Anyway, if that is all…”

“Ah, not quite,” Fukuda paused to plop a couple chocolates into her mouth, adding them to the dozen she'd already eaten during their meeting. “Dakota Johnson… uh, Griffith-Johnson called. She is ecstatic about the way we turned her errant daughter around. I have to confess that Carolina's progress astounded me.”

“Indeed. It has been most entertaining to vatch her transformation.” It looked like Dr. Schwartz found the whole world entertaining.

“Certainly the speed with which she started imitating her mother was astounding,” admitted Fukuda. “She proved my point – peer pressure is just as effective as your chemicals.”

“Not entirely, though. We should still vatch her. And get ready to employ them should it appear that a relapse to her ways. At the very least I'd recommend a cocktail to alleviate the, uh, minor negative aspects of her weight gain, to fortify her health.”

“Oh, sure, we could do that. Actually I must say that when I spoke with her yesterday, she asked me for a tailor-made version of our Booster. 'Something like my sister Ginny takes,' were her words, I believe.”

“See? See? I'll immediately get to it. I mean, get my techs on it.” Dr. Schwartz turned to the door.

Fukuda sighed. "But it doesn't feel as rewarding when the victim… err, patient asks for it herself, right?”

Wrong, Dr. Schwartz wanted to say but she knew it was unwise to push her luck. Dr. Hinamizawa already admitted to having been wrong, sort of. It would not pay to provoke her too much now. But she couldn't resist adding: “In that case ve could add some more substances into the cocktail. Like Y-09-V1 for a smoother, acne-free skin, girls like that…”

“Yeah, yeah, yeah, don't bother me with minutiae, sort out the details yourself.”

“And Y-15-S to improve her appetite and Y-22-RX to stretch her stomach and…”

“You are incorrigible!” but the harsh words were followed with a happy chuckle.

Dr. Schwartz noticed Fukuda didn't explicitly forbid her from adding anything. And given who the girl's mother was… She chuckled too. “Oh, I have been corrected many times. Everyone must make sacrifices until our great work is done. But as they say in America, easier to ask forgiveness than permission.”

***


If you asked her, Carolina would tell you it was a little unsettling to walk into your hallway after a long hard day at school, only to find a teacher waiting for you there. Even if, this time, the said person was not exactly a teacher. “Auntie Helen? What are you doing here?”

“I vanted to see how my favorite student is doing, mein liebchen,” the Head Counselor had a better look at her and added: “And congratulate you to a brand new uniform?”

“Thanks! Looks fine, doesn't it?” Carrie stopped for a moment to strike a pose. “I gave most of my old clothes to Mrs. Banks and she paid it back to me by using some of the same tricks on this blouse and skirt combo. She said it makes my tummy look smaller?”

“Ach, sicher. It certainly does.” Dr. Schwartz left out that the said 'tummy' was looking far bigger than at the beginning of the semester. She could tell that the Fashion & Design teacher did all she could to mold Carrie's blubber into an overblown hourglass shape but neither her belly nor the expansive behind could yield that much.

The plumped-up student waddled the door meanwhile and paused. “Umm, where are my manners? Sorry, Auntie. Wanna come in, have a tea, coffee? A snack?”

“No, no, no, I shall not burden you for long, liebchen. I just dropped by to give you the first batch of your own personalised Yeng Booster.” And the doctor flourished a sizable vial of full of familiar bluish liquid.

“Oh! I've been looking forward to it. So you say it's a special version only for me?”

“Indeed, Carolina. Look, it is even marked so,” and Dr. Schwartz showed her a large label saying Carolina G-J Stomach Booster. “However, it is merely a first trial run. After you deplete the vial, come tell Auntie Helen how it made you feel. Und ve shall recalibrate.”

“OK, I'll come ASAP.”

“Do not overuse it, though,” she wiggled her finger as a warning. “No more than five drops after each meal and no more than ten times a day. Should undesirable side effects occur, come to me at once.”

“Yeah, right. Thanks a million, Auntie,” and Carrie hugged the little doctor, leaning down to her bluish hair. “You don't know how much that means for me.”

“Ach, but I do, I know your mother, mein liebchen. And do not forget. If you have any problems vith your Booster, do tell me immediately. Goodbye, Carolina.”

“Bet on it. Bye!” and Carrie rushed inside her dorm room, eager to put her own booster to the test.

122331.content:
Exactly one week ago, after a tour across Japan, Kiyomi had signed the contract that allowed her to become a sophomore at Buttercombe. Finally she didn't have to be performing and writing songs and could be going to school like a normal teenage girl. Well not exactly normal as she was in another country, with a new and different culture, and she would be getting special treatment due to her contract. The first benefit was the larger then usual dorm room (even for Buttercombe) that she had just entered.

Is this really my room? Kiyomi thought to herself. Well, I'm glad I signed that contract. Wonder what else they will do to have me keep up the contract.

Kiyomi put her bags on her absurdly large bed and turned towards the closet where her new custom made uniform was.

Guess there's my answer. I still can't believe they let me design my own uniform.

Putting it on and looking at herself in the mirror she continued. They didn't need to give me all the benefits to get me to come here, but I couldn't really refuse. Just getting to go to school was enough. And advertising only Yeng products doesn't seem that bad. Like they make so much stuff that I'll probably be in every magazine and billboard.

Kiyomi walked around her room for awhile taking in all the wonder of going to an academy like this. On the table there was a massive gift basket filled with treats that were making Kiyomi's mouth start to water. Right next to the basket was what looked like a smart-phone. It was special Yeng made prototype that came part of the contract. It was made to help Kiyomi study in English. It also allowed her to see her schedule, order food to her room and allowed her to access and update social media. (The social media was monitored by Yeng, so they could block any harmful information getting in and out of the academy)

After picking up the phone and some sweets from the basket Kiyomi walked to her window and looked outside, where she could see some of the student still arriving and being guided to their dorms. Seeing all the people made her think about something she had been wondering about since she arrived here. All the girls she had seen were large. Even the staff appeared to be larger then anyone she had met. Why could this be. Well she had learned about how different the food culture is in America, maybe it had something to do with that. It could sign of wealth or health being that size here. That must be it, that's just what an attractive woman looks like in the western world, right?

Her mind started quickly wonder towards a different subject. How would people treat her. She definitely stood out with her uniform and being so thin compared to everyone. Would people here even know about her being famous. If they did would they want to be friend or would they think that Kiyomi wouldn't want to be around "regular people". And how would the teacher act, they obviously had to know about her.

All these thoughts were starting to make Kiyomi get nervous, but she snapped out of it as she heard a knock on her door. Who could that be? Wait! Kiyomi was supposed to be getting a tour of the academy and also she had a medical checkup today. Was she late?

Kiyomi went to open the door and saw...
122331.title: Kiyomi's first impressions

choices: Kiyomi is invited to the cafeteria by some students.
Skip to the next day when classes start.
1223312.content:
As Kiyomi went to open her door she could hear people talking on the other side. It sounded like to women. Kiyomi opened the door and in front of her stood two rotund girls wearing Buttercombe uniforms. One of them was a tall brunette wearing glasses, the other was a shorter, and much plumber, blond who was almost hiding her face behind her hair. The two large girls had quickly stopped talking when Kiyomi opened the door, and now they stood there looking at her as if they had seen a ghost.

"You... You're really..."

The taller girl began to talk, but was she was so nervous she was barely able to form words.

"I meann uhhh... We um.. we are here to..."

But before she could finish a third girl stepped from behind the first two, shoving them a bit, and started talking herself.

"Listen. I don't really know who you are but these two weirdos are like your fans or something. And they'd like to have your autographs. So before they faint could you like sign some'ing."

"Oh, sure. I would love to sign an autograph." Kiyomi replied as the third girl stepped back.

Unlike the other two girls, who were definitely overweight, the third girl was only slightly chubby. She was redhead, with a face full of dark make up and ear and nose piercings.

The two girls nervously stepped up holding posters of Kiyomi, that she then began signing.

"With Love from Kiyomi Okura to...?"

"Oh umm.. I'm Margot" said the short blond.

"And I'm Ann" continued the taller brunette, then pointed to the third girl. "And that is Cass".

"She doesn't need my name. I ain't gettin' nothing signed." Cass huffed.


After getting the posters signed the three girls left.

"OMG, I can't believe she's really here!" Margot said whilst clutching her poster.

"I know. And did you she how pretty and thin she is?" Ann replied. "You think we have any classes with her?"

"Thin. In Buttercombe no one's staying thin for long." Cass said under her breath without the other two hearing.

***


Now one of Kiyomis questions was answered. There definitely are some people who know who Kiyomi is. But not everyone, like for example Cass, which shouldn't be surprising as Kiyomi hasn't really hit the mainstream outside of Japan yet.

Kiyomi's day continued after this. Ms. Fukiyama, the school nurse, had come and lead Kiyomi to her office to give her an check up. She was completely healthy, but was given some drugs to adjust to the different air pressure in the mountainous region that Buttercombe was located.

"So just take these for a week and you should be fine" Said Fukiyama.
"Now, your classes will start tomorrow. If there's anything I can help you with to prepare just ask"

"I think everything is fine" Kiyomi replied. "But who will I be going to class with{"/i}

"Oh, you don't know yet. Well you will be attending some of the easier classes with other transfer students for now and your phone should have an tutoring program on it. Also you can always get some help form the teachers and the tutors. After the first courses are done you can look into getting on some more harder classes. Now is there anything else?"

***


After the nurse's check up Kiyomi was free to return to her dorm. She could feel an surprising hunger as she walked through the hallways. Whether it was due to the medicine or just the smell of food coming from other students eating around her, she couldn't resist getting something for herself. She went up to a vending machine and looked inside. Her mouth began watering as she saw the options in front of her. Using her phone she was able to get a handful of chocolate bars for free out of the machine.
As Kiyomi continued her way to her dorm, whilst eating the treats she bought, people had started noticing her and Kiyomi started to feel like she was definitely standing out. But that shouldn't have come as a surprise considering how different she looked to everyone with her idol uniform on.

As such, Juliet thought, the girl certainly needed something to change her around, much like how she was changed in her first year...

"Well Camari... I just finished getting unpacked, perhaps once your done getting your stuff unpacked we can go out, and I can help you explore the school in some fun ways? I know some shortcuts through the school so we can use those paths, we just gotta make sure we don't get caught!"

"Jesus, you take your family name so seriously? What are you, a princess or something? We ain't exactly in a school for royalty, this is just a private school, take your chances to live!" Patting her potbelly in pride, Juliet would feel her belly rumble, before opening the door. "How about we head off to the cafeteria first, school pays for all of our meals, so you'll get to enjoy the best cuisine Buttercombe has to offer!"

"I guess I could have a bite to eat, I am a bit peckish..." 123.title: Buzzing Back Home

choices: Skinny as a pole! Life really isn't fair...

1231.content:
"...not to mention your old lady managed to pull a few strings this year..."

'Huff!'

"...saw some extra space in your schedule some days, so I got you a double lunch break and a meal extension for brunch and for dinner..."

'Sigh...'

"...most girls don't get Tier 3 perks without a physical first, but my Lizzie isn't most girls..."

'Hmm,'

"...a reward for being such a perfect daughter!"

'Argh!'

"Oh, would you cut it out, Lizzie dear? If the car ride is too stressful you can always help yourself to a snack. I have some more brownies in the back seat."

Elizabeth "Lizzie" Thompson leaned over toward the passenger side window and pressed her cheek into the glass as she stared out toward the rolling countryside. This had been the scene for the past two hours now. Stuck in a car while her doting mother ranted and raved about the upcoming year, all the while wishing that she was headed in any other direction than Buttercombe.

"I'm... more than familiar with where the brownies are, Mom, thanks," she replied, staring out the window with a laser focus now. In truth, the brownies were exactly part of the problem. With the windows up, there was nowhere for the smell to escape to except up the nostrils of the listless passenger and nowhere for the confections to escape to except her plump, paunchy pot belly. 3/4ths of the "little snack" that Ms Thompson had decided to "bring for the ride in case anybody gets hungry!" (anybody obviously meaning her daughter) had already found its way past Lizzie's lips. And two whole trays of 25 brownies each was hardly a little...

But Lizzie really, really couldn't help herself. Lizzie ate when she was stressed (or when she was tired, or when she was cranky, or when she was offered) and nothing, nothing could possibly spell out stress like the impressive practically castle-like grandiosity of the Buttercombe Estate finally looming into view.

Most people didn't have the "privilege" of getting to drive up to the private academy with their parents, but Lizzie's mom served dual roles in her life as overbearing (s)mother and as the newly appointed head of the culinary arts department at Buttercombe, a position that Lizzie was... begrudgingly proud of her mom for acquiring.

'She'd better,' Lizzie had inwardly fumed upon finding out. 'An entire summer of taste testing better not have been for nothing.'

"Oh, Honey, try this linguini with flaky cheddar on top! After you're done with your fettuccine alfredo, of course," her mother had cooed.

"Ooh ooh sweetheart! Which cupcake do you like better? Make sure you try them both."

"Oh. My. Gosh. Sugar Booger, this flan is absolutely divine. Here! Have some more!"

And every time Lizzie would whine and prevaricate and sulk... then pretty much give in.

"Sigh... You know I was supposed to start my diet today but whatever."

"Mom, I'm really full already, I- is that whipped topping?"

"No Mommy, my pants don't fit anymore and I need to- mmmm that smells delicious. Did you just make it?"

That entire summer of taste testing was certainly evident on her physique. Ending her sophomore year at just 225 pounds, Lizzie had sworn the vow to end all vows that she would get her weight under control over the summer, or at least manage not to gain so much. Starting off her junior year at over 260 was a cruel wake up call that she had been putting on weight even faster than usual. And this damn school was sure to be absolutely no help.

She had remembered hugging her dad goodbye on the front porch just hours earlier. A jovial man himself, much like his wife, he had given her a firm squeeze on her soft shoulder.
"Careful they don't have to roll you back home this year, pudgy pie," he had guffawed.

"Daaaaaad," Lizzie had whined, stomping her foot petulantly and sending her thick thighs jiggling.

"David!" Her mother had sashayed out the door past him and gave him a stern, disapproving look, one of the few times her face ever formed a frown. "We don't want our daughter feeling self-conscious on her big day back."

"Oh, I'm only Haha," he laughed, barely even able to get through his own joke, "Ha-hoping she follows in the Thompson footsteps," he grinned, giving his own stunningly fat middle a swat. Ms Thompson was a woman with a passion and a real gift for cooking, and that was certainly evident on the frames of her loved ones. Dave Thompson's entire body shook as he chuckled at his own lame sense of humor.

Lizzie had to stifle an embarrassed smile. She swore, her dad was the only person on Earth who was even cheesier than her mom. A match made in Heaven.

But his point still stood, Lizzie had been unfailingly coming back fatter and fatter every year and with all of the "strings and connections" having a Culinary Arts teacher for a mother netted her, she was sincerely worried that this year wouldn't be any different. Not that Lizzie actually needed any help, though.

Lizzie and her willpower had had a bit of a falling out lately, and try as it might to plead with her, remind her how much farther her belly and butt were sticking out or how much wider her hips always seemed to be getting, Elizabeth would listen instead to her sharp cravings and her insatiable tummy.

Said tummy was looking less like a "tummy" and more like a "belly" as of late, pooching out over her seatbelt and into her lap. Lizzie gave it a frustrated jiggle. She didn't tend to gain too much weight in her stomach and wasn't a fan of seeing it start to look more like a "Thompson Belly", as her dad called it. Lizzie's primary concern was her lower half: her ever fleshier cheeks, her ever widening hips, her ever thickening thighs... Her little pot belly sticking out farther than usual might have had something to do with the roughly 30+ brownies she had been cramming down her throat out of anxiety during the whole ride up here. Those on top of the two Number 7s her mother had been so kind to stop for at Big Bob's Best Burgers and and the hearty "going away breakfast" she had consumed before even leaving the house. She knew from experience that her tummy would soon shrink back down to a more reasonable size, the bloat instead traveling downward to fill out her proportionally enormous hips to an even more ludicrous degree.

Of course, Lizzie had done plenty of fretting over how much she had eaten that day but what worried her an even greater degree was that she still wanted even more. The scent of the remaining brownies was calling ever so sweetly to the plump coed and she was trying with every bit of her will not to leap into the back seat and tear them all apart.

Their garish teal SUV pulled up to the great gates of Buttercombe Academy, gates that, although ancient and prestigious-looking, at once began to open electronically, as if to silently usher them in.

Lizzie, at this point, had given in and fetched another brownie from behind her as she surveyed her official surroundings for the next few months. Not much looked to have changed. Having arrived early than most other students with her mother, the usual bustle about the academy had yet to take full swing.

Finishing the brownie in just two bites, she furtively pinched a love handle and sighed, 'I really have to go easy this year,' she thought to herself.

But that was the thing with this place. It just honestly seemed like there was food everywhere. Every hallway you turned there was a vending machine or even two luring students and faculty alike over with flashy displays and scintillating treats. Outside, the campus was dotted with a myriad of different outdoor kiosks and food stands. Classes themselves had no rules against snacking and her mother had mentioned earlier double lunch periods. Lizzie blanched at the thought; it was almost like her mother was trying to fatten her up sometimes. In truth, she wasn't; Ms Thompson just loved to dote on her "perfect little angel" and didn't seem to understand the difference between "comfort" and "comfort food", her natural inclination toward cooking and baking meant that they were her go-to for just about every problem. It was a wonder Lizzie hadn't blown up sooner. Or, as her dad had put it, "followed in the family footsteps".

Lizzie looked over at her mother as she pulled the car to a stop. It was easy to see the resemblance. Dana Thompson was a remarkably pretty woman and so was her daughter. They had the same golden blonde hair, although Dana wore hers a bit shorter and normally had it done up, the same deep blue eyes, the same angular face and soft chin. They had the same laugh, which Lizzie absolutely hated; Lizzie could easily pass for her mother's mini-me. Well, except for the "mini" part.

Other than their striking resemblance to one another, the two women were of drastically different sizes. While Lizzie was quite a bit overweight at just north of 260 pounds, Dana Thompson was...

1232.content:
A large SUV parked close to the school's entrance, and leaned on a side when large girl came out of it. Said girl was fat, really fat, with two large and puffy cheeks on her childlike face and a double chin that rested on her large bosom. She had her brown hair tied into locks that fell on her soft shoulders. Her whole body was round like a giant walking marshmallow but the most noticeable thing were her huge breasts, each the size of her head, that rested on her round belly. Every movement was followed by the quivering of her entire body.

In spite of her large size, she was wearing a trendy and cute pink and black striped t-shirt with frills, which couldn't cover her wide cleavage, a trendy jacket that made her appear even rounder and a skirt in pendant with the shirt. All of this clothes were signed with the mark "Carlyle", a small and new fashion house that was quite popular among plus-sized girls like Rose.

"Here's the bag, Rosey" said a gangling man with a brushy mustache.

"Thanks daddy" said the fat girl kissing her father on the cheek before grabbing her trolley.

"Have a nice school year" said her mother from inside the car "we'll see this winter". Her mother was basically an older Rose... that was more than two houndred pounds slimmer.

"Sure mommy! Bye bye!" Said the brunette she waved her plump hand as the car left.

With a big smile, Rose turned to see the large building behind her. One where she had spent the previous two years, and where she had many many meals, as her body can attest to.

Next to her there was a fat black girl who had just arrived at school. Rosie knew her, she was in the same class after all.

"Hello, Tania" said the fat brunette.

However, the other girl didn't greet back and moved backward. Rose tried to get close, but then Tania turned on her heels and ran 1err... waddled away as if she had seen a ghost.

Rose sighed as she pulled her trolley to school. She was one of the fattest girls of her year, she was already fatter than the majority of graduating students and only a selected few juniors could rival her.

Still, Rose didn't mind all the extra weight she put on during these two years. She thought she looked cute, could still find fashionable clothes and could eat anything she wanted without care, unlike, how her friends said, those "thin girls obsessed with diets". It didn't help that said friends encouraged Rose's fat positive view. Heck, even the school seemed to support her, not only it provided her all the adjustment for a girl of her size, but she got some special and delicious bars that only few other girls received.

Of course, being that fat had its downsides, like getting tired out after a few steps or getting stuck on the desks, but couldn't outweight the pros for the top-heavy girl.

While she waddled, she saw some other girls, and guessed they were all juniors or at least sophomore since they stopped chatting the moment they noticed the buxom brunette. Rose sighed and ignored them.

Rose was a girl as sweet as her appearance and really wanted to make friends. Unfortunately, her first year at Buttercombe she roomed with a certain Violet Sullivan and quickly became friends with her, followed by Violet's close friend (and right hand woman) Sakura Toshima. Rose was happy to have made immediately two new friends, unfortunately, these were the only one she made.

The reason is simple, Violet and Sakura were two big mean girls who liked picking on the weak ones and, since Rose had gotten involved with them, everyone feared her even if she couldn't hurt a fly. Still, Rose didn't want to lose Violet and Sakura, they were really nice to her, but would've liked the possibility of making new friends. After all, friends are like chips, the more you get, the better.

Two years have already passed, that was half of her time as student, and still had two years ahead waiting for her but now the girl was resoluted to make new friends. Many new friends. Maybe she could find some friends who got along with Violet and Sakura, that would've been a dream.

However, the first thing she needed was to catch her breath on a bench. All these steps were tiring for the obese brunette, her new dorm could wait.

12323.content:
“Well I might as well get this out of the way…”Rose figured as she huffed and puffed towards the doctor’s office which mercifully was located on the ground floor. In recent years Buttercombe had gotten a bit stricter and more concerned when it came to the health of its students, and had made routine physicals mandatory on a semester by semester basis.

“Next? ”called Dr. Shiro Fukiyama from behind the thick door of her office. Shiro watched as the door opened wide, then wider, then-

“Gyah! Ohmygodyourehuge…” Shiro spluttered, as the largest girl she’d seen all day tottered into the room.

“Hullo?” asked Rose politely pretending not to have not heard the doctor’s outburst.

The quite skinny Dr. Shiro breathed a sigh of relief, she hadn’t meant to shout like that but the blimp of a student in front of her had to weigh at least three times what she herself did! Fortunately it seemed the girl hadn’t heard her outburst. “Um, yes, hello. I’m Dr. Shiro the new nurse here this year. And you are?” she asked standing up from her seat and sending her long black hair swishing behind her lithe frame.

“Rose, Rose Tyler” the girl said closing the door.

“I said that I’m kinda full, a small but important difference between actually full.” Vera offered a slight smile to her exasperated roomie before looking down at her assortment of food spread in front of her, wondering what to start with first. She was stuffed, but she decided on her way to the cafeteria that she might as well try and push her limits as to how much food she can carry; she was dedicated to her growth. Soon, faster than Harmony expected, all that was left of the potato leek soup was a few stains at the bottom of the now-empty bowl.

She patted the tightly packed sphere of flab and muscle with a smile on her face, while all the while Harmony looked like she was in awe. "I've never seen anyone eat so much as you..." The words escaped Harmony's mouth without her being aware of it, simply too enthralled by how big Vera's stomach had become. "So, like...does it hurt? Gah, sorry, stupid question..."

She Shoves her hands underneath her globe of a belly and stood up, the chubby mitts stabilizing any movement that might have occurred.

Just the carrots alone would be enough to fill her up and then some.

I'm apart of the academy's wrestling team, so when I'm not eating, I'm exercising, and working out always gives me my appetite back." Vera felt giddy as she surveyed her immense mass, drinking in every sensation of her huge, warm, soft body--and fantasizing about what it would feel like to be even bigger. Fatter, larger, more immense. She wanted her gut to fill rooms and then overflow them, and with her appetite and current mass, that wasn’t a far-off goal. All she had to do was keep eating, stuff herself silly, devour more and more. More of Vera, and less of everything else.



Harmony awoke as she heard a series of groans and creaks come over from Vera's bed as her roommate stirred, the titanic albino woman rolling onto her back and pulling off the covers of her mostly naked body. Harmony arose drowsily, remembering her dream as clear as day as the blinding midday sun peered in through the window. She watched the fat hippo of a woman turn around as she heard movement behind her, her belly had shrunk down significantly down to its normal size but had noticeably grown an inch or two from its original size yesterday. Her gigantic thighs still squished together, and her huge, heaving chest was sagging down to her belly, round and soft as they were last night with perhaps a tiny bit more volume.

“Oh hey, You’re up! Ready for breakfast, roomie?”

choices: Meanwhile, with Harmony and Darcy...
While in gym class, Vera meets up with another member of her wrestling team...
Free Choice
123311222232.content:
Breakfast would be simple for the two to get, with Vera getting a large stack of eggs and sausages and Harmony settling for a simple stack of three pancakes and two fried eggs. Normally, Harmony would only get a slice of toast and an egg at home, but something about Vera's appetite was driving herself to eat more, though she was not sure why herself. Once the two were done with their breakfast, the two would split ways, Harmony finding and finding Darcy to head to her first class.

As for Vera, she was off with Josie to head to her first class, which just so happened to be her favorite: Gym class...

___

Fitting herself into a gym uniform while within one of the gym's washrooms, Vera would look at herself in the gym's locker room, checking out her body. She could barely feel any changes, but she had felt like her gym shorts were a bit tighter, and that her gym tee seemed to be riding up the tiniest bit higher, causing her to smile a bit as she would turn around.

"Hey Josie, how are you doing?"

"Having a bit of a problem getting these shorts on, but otherwise fine!"

Waiting for her friend to finish getting into her clothes, Vera would get out of the washroom and meet up with the gut-heavy woman. Looking at her, Vera would notice that the girl's gym clothes were a smaller size than her own, and on Josie's body they looked like they were skin-tight on her body. "Think you may have to get some new clothes soon with how your growing..."

"I know! I'm so excited for that!"

With a smile on their faces, the two girls would join the other students to the gym, seeing the school's round and plump coach, Marsha Alberway munching on a single jumbo-sized dog as she counted the class's attendance. In the past she had tried bringing in a baseball team in a school initiative to bring in sports, but like most of the sports besides wrestling, her baseball team would fall out, though she would stay employed and would eventually be promoted to primary coach.

Today though Marsha seemed to be happy, and as she finished attendance, she would put her board and pencil down. "Ah, normally I would be sad today, but I have some very good news! The old wrestling coach has unfortunately retired, but one of my old students from back when I was new here has agreed to work here as a tertiary coach for here, as well as a temporary coach for the wrestling team! Now, please welcome Cassie Hart!"

Upon hearing the name, Vera would heavily smile, as she watched the blonde-haired and extremely pear-shaped and overweight Cassie Hart pass through the double doors into the gym hall. Vera had known about this woman all her life, knowing her as a champion holding several belts despite her immense size, and being a figure she could look up to as well. And as the albino woman stared at her hero, she would see her rubbing a full belly while walking up to be side by side with her old coach.

"Ah, it's good to meet you again after all these years. It looks like you haven't changed much since I graduated..."

"Heh..." Marsha would nervously laugh a bit as she finished off her chili dog. "You seem smaller than when you graduated though, quite a bit in fact."

"Oh that, well I just didn't get that much to eat after graduation. Being a wrestler doesn't exactly pay well, and I still have to pay for both myself and Jean. Now..." Turning around, Cassie would pat her stomach, letting loose a small belch as she addressed the class. "As you may know, I'm Cassie Hart, winner of some local wrestling championships in this state. Just because I'm big doesn't mean I'm strong, and if you want to do well in this class, you better sure make your all strong too!"

"Yeah!" Vera and a few other new and thin Freshmen would yell, before realizing that they were on their own in chanting and slowly lowering their hands in embarrassment.

"Now, as the coach of the wrestling team, I will let everyone know that while first meeting for all the members of last year who haven't graduated is today after all classes, sign-ups will not begin next week. If you wish to sign up, just ask me or Miss Alberway here and we'll help you get registered."

Walking a bit forward, Marsha would blow her whistle. "Okay, so for now let's do some walking... 5 laps should do for now, and if anyone still has stamina than may-"

"Ha, you gotta push your students harder than that!" Cassie would walk behind Marsha and pat her on the back a bit hard, causing the redhead to blush a bit. "20 laps minimum everyone, no excuses! Go, go, go!"

Heavily happy, Vera would get up and start walking around with all of the other students, her big and plump breasts bouncing with each and every step. While most of the Seniors and Juniors were either mad or depressed at having to walk 20 laps, Josie included, Vera would walk with a joyous stride, both excited at the chance to build some more muscle strength for her fat as well as for a chance to impress her hero as much as the albino woman could...

Harmony & Darcy Stuff Themselves With Hamburger
