131.content:
This is a short list of characters, as the "important" members of this cast are listed below. For now, these are the only options in this field.


Shannon Polluck
48, Blonde, 5'6", 500lbs
Headmistress
The acting headmistress of the Academy, though how much authority she retains these days is questionable.

The partnership between Buttercombe Academy and the Yeng Corporation yields many benefits. And who better to reap the rewards of such a fine synergy than the Headmistress of the Academy herself? Shannon Polluck has positively swollen with the results of Yeng's direct input on how things are run. She's been given an assistant to handle her day-to-day tasks, and she has Fukuda to handle the technical know-how of her job. That leaves Shannon plenty of time for balls, banquets, feasts, and dinners with guests and benefactors! Which is good, because after years of kicking back and letting her lower staff members handle her job, eating is pretty much all our headmistress is good for these days!

Shannon is a positively rotund woman, one of the largest members on staff at Buttercombe Academy.
She wears her hair in a tight bee-hive, and it has begun to fade to platinum as she's aged.


Dr. Fukuda Hinamizawa
43, Black, 5'8", 160lbs
Vice Principal / Yeng Coordinator

After providing years of quality service to her parent company, Dr. Hinamizawa was rewarded with the opportunity to prove herself at Buttercombe Academy.

Though her background in education is small, Fukuda has done a wonderful job more or less running the place. Her eye for detail and penchant for scrutinization serve her well in a job where she's more or less taken over for the headmistress. Meanwhile, she still serves her supervisors at Yeng by providing them in-depth analysis of the effects of their various products. Buttercombe Academy is her testing ground, and the students, faculty, and staff are her test subjects. Given the intensity of her job... can you really blame her for putting on a little weight?

Fukuda begins her story as a somewhat soft doctor who wears glasses. She wears her hair in a professional, but stylish, bun.
She tends to gain weight in her stomach and face, should she continue to snack off-hours...

1311.title: Queen-Sized Queen

choices: Penny Simon, a no nonsense assistant with no flab to speak of…yet
Really rotund, but reliable and ready Ronnie Wilson former R.A to full time help
Your choice to describe! / Other options
13112.content:
With her head lowered in total absorption of the meal, Ms. Polluck continued to gorge on the massive spread in front of her. Her mind solely on the delicious food, she wouldn’t have to think of all the problems she’d soon have to deal with, most important of all, the fact that she still hadn’t found a new assistant for this school year!

Weeks ago she’d though she’d hired a great new prospect. Monica… Wade was it? …Well her name wasn’t important…but Monica ended up having to cancel at the last minute, (some unbelievable story about winning a recall election in her home town as a write-in candidate,) either way Shannon was now without a helper.

Furthermore, no part time T.A or regular student would suffice nowadays, Shannon needed someone she could count on during her full work day because she was always so darn busy eating. Only a week into the school year and Shannon had passed her own paperwork onto the already quite busy vice principal, so even the diligent Doctor Hinamizawa was out of the question as a potential new assistant. Ms. Polluck looked to be truly on her own…

Now lost in this last slice of chocolate cake, she’d have a few more minutes to avoid deciding on what to do about a new assistant.
“~Mmmm cake~” she moaned aloud without a hint of self control, delving her tongue into the amazing chocolate essence…She remembered her past few assistants over the years; Brittney Huan had been quite the dependable worker bee as her student secretary, and Brittney’s classmate Hannah had been a wonderful T.A always there with a helping hand and a helping of doughnuts from the break room, oh and she supposed there was that body guard from her first year, T…something or other. Sadly, all those memories were in the past now, Ms. Polluck savored them as she savored the last few crumbs of her big brunch.

Vrrt! Vrrt! Vrrt!

Suddenly Shannon was wobbling, and more than she usually did! She heard her ringtone and realized it was her phone! She slunk a fat hand into her barely reachable pocket, not before letting the device vibrate against her thick pasty thighs one more time. (Mmmm…she wondered how long had it been since the last time she’d…-No she was on school hours at the moment! No time to dwell on her current feeling of fullness and…well…hungers of another kind.) Using all the will power and self control she still possessed, Ms. Polluck answered her phone.

“Hello? This is Headmistress Polluck.” Said Shannon, wondering who exactly had called her on her personal number.

“Hi, Ms. Polluck. I’m here…for the assistant interview?” said the voice on the other side of the call.

“Uh, oh, of course.” Ms. Polluck had been completely caught off guard by this turn of events, and fumbled for a name, none came to mind. “Well, how are you?”

“I’m fine. I’m just outside your office and wanted to double check…you did say eleven this morning right?”

Shannon again fumbled through her mind, this time for an explanation…“Oh! Yes, right. Right on my way too, just had a bit of personal business to attend to…Ha! Ha! Ha!”

“Oh okay then…Well I can’t wait to meet you.”

“Same here…be right there…” Shannon said ending the call. Shannon slowly got up from the table, leaving the mess she made for someone else to take care of.

“How?!” She muttered a bit to herself as she racked her brain. How could she have forgotten this meeting with a prospective new assistant? In fact this was exactly why she needed a new assistant so badly in the first place! Then, anyone trying to reach the headmistress would have to go through her assistant first. Oh, and she’d make sure who ever she hired would know to absolutely never schedule her meetings during her eatings! Shannon left the cafeteria and began hobbling into her personal SSS cart, perfect for getting the headmistress around the grounds in speed and style. Enjoying the scenery that was Buttercombe’s busy campus, she remembered how many of the young women here depended on her to keep this academy in tip top shape no matter how many business partner deals she needed to make, she would do whatever it took to make sure the students here had the most comfortable experience they could. Shannon felt her mood lightening a bit, reminding herself that just because the day’s first chapter had gotten off to a bad start didn’t mean she couldn’t change things around, right?

She brought her cart to a halt in front of the Office and Administrator’s Building and bumbled towards the semi-secret private elevator that led to her office.

Shannon gave herself a once over and adjusted her hair a bit as the elevator hummed to life. She then started concentrating, really concentrating, on what she could remember about this mysterious new assistant. She remembered going over resumes, favoring those that were available to move immediately rather than on previous work experience. Hmmm….Oh wait! She remembered a few nights ago eating a large lasagna in her room late at night, and then some wine…well LOTS of wine…Focus Shannon!

Okay so there was one resume she remembered that mentioned they and their partner could be there in a week; along with something about running a small bakery business in the past. That had been enough for Shannon to invite them to an interview…but the rest of the night was a little hazy after that. She couldn’t remember the name, and in fact, she wasn’t sure but she might have also sent a few other random invitations that night as well after the bottle of wine had been emptied….

Well if they weren’t “the one”, Shannon would just have to politely decline their offer…It would be extremely hard to turn them down though considering they were right here, and how badly she wanted an assistant….

The elevator gave a soft ding and its doors began to open, peeking out Shannon saw that new potential hire was…
13112.title: A Headmistress in need of Assistance

choices: Penny does what she's told, like a good candidate
Penny brings even more junk food than requested – a perfect candidate
Penny hesitates – does she want to work here or not?
131121.content:
Peeking out of the elevator, Shannon noticed a young woman standing by her office. A slim one; no baker then. What a pity. She drove out and straight to her door, hurrying to have the interview done ASAP. Sitting in her cart, she looked more like oversized blob, her overflowing pillowlike gut being the first thing anyone noticed.

The candidate certainly did. She blinked, taking in the sheer size of her potential boss. Most likely she had never seen a woman of her size before but she rallied quickly. “Hello, Ma'am, I'm Penny Simon. Here to see Mrs. Polluck regarding my application.” She grinned a tad nervously.

Now it was time for Shannon to study her potential personal assistant. She was such a tiny little thing! After years spent dealing with school employees or hobnobbing with other dignitaries who enjoyed all the benefits of associating with Yeng, she could hardly believe someone could be so thin. She could almost wrap her waist in her hands (if her digits weren't so thick).

“Ah, yes, yes, that would be me. Come in, follow me, have a seat.” Penny Simon? The headmistress seemed to recall seeing such a name in the pile of resumes. She even vaguely remembered it stuck out for some reason, but why? Was it good or bad? It didn't matter now anyway. The main thing was that Penny was here now. Hopefully she was ready to serve… err, to assist her boss. She slid behind her desk and smiled widely, causing a little chinquake. “So you would be ready to start immediately?”

“Yes, I would.” The girl (she was nothing more than that) rushed to her seat with enviable ease and pushed her glasses up her nose. “What would my duties involve?”

“Oh, just… organizing my timetable, keeping contact with school sponsors, liaising with the Vice-Principal… Generally assisting me in leading the school.”

“Could you be more specific? Regarding the working hours, remuneration and perks and so on?”

Such insolence! Luckily Shannon remembered the good Dr. Hinamizawa had prepared something of the sort back when they'd discussed this problem. “Actually I can. And I can also show you what your duties would include while we are at it. Pass me the file marked 'Personnel, Admin,' over there,” and she pointed to the upper row in the file cabinet next to her. Sure, she could take it herself but she'd have to stand up. Better use this opportunity to see how helpful the girl is willing to be.

Penny proved to be compliant enough. She jumped up and retrieved the file in a fraction of time it would take the humongous headmistress. “Here you go, Ma'am.”

“Thanks,” Shannon took the file from her and nearly dropped it. It was so heavy! In this kind of situation her gut shelf came in handy. She rested it there while leafing through. “Ah! Here it is.” As she pulled out the single sheet Fukuda had printed her back then, her stomach growled in displeasure. Possibly it didn't like being squished, probably it was feeling peckish again, most likely both.

“But first, would you be so kind and bring me a couple Yeng bars from the vending machine in the hallway? Here, take this,” Shannon reached into her breast pocket gave her a bright pink bracelet, “pass it by the sensor and everything'll be free. Take something for yourself too, if you like.”

She knew she wasn't supposed to let the bracelet out of her sight but what harm could it do? Besides, she'd told dr. Hinamizawa to make it wider, it wasn't her fault it didn't fit around her wrist. “Go on, what are you waiting for?”
131121.title: Assessing Available Assistence

choices: The Councillor wants to speak with her
The school nurse needs to examine her
The Headmistress wants her lunch
1311212.content:
“Go on, what are you waiting for?”

The girl scurried away with remarkable speed, prompted by the Headmistress' words, and she was back incredibly fast too, bringing a not just the bars but a whole armful of treats – there was everything from chocolates to chips, wasn't that a packet of minidonuts? Shannon gaped. “Did you bring all that for yourself?”

“Oh no, no.” Penny unloaded the calorific hoard on the desk. “That's all for you, Ma'am. I was thinking you might still be hungry after eating just two bars. And here's your bracelet.”

“Oh, I see. That is farsighted of you. Thank you.” As she greedily unwrapped her first Yeng bar, Shannon felt her initial wary attitude to Penny changing. She detested brown-nosing like anyone else but there was nothing wrong in proper deference. Besides, the girl was right – she might still be peckish afterwards. And such a clever judge of character certainly deserved to be rewarded. “Here, take these and enjoy,” she passed the minidonuts to her. Truth be told, there were much better – and bigger – ones just being made in Buttercombe kitchens so Shannon didn't regret giving them away… much.

“Umm, thanks but I shouldn't…” Penny's eyes involuntarily slid over the pillowy stomach avalanche settled on the desk opposite her, she gulped but didn't dare refuse. Unwrapping the packet, she took her first bite. “Wow, thefe awe good!” she gushed with her mouth full.

Shannon allowed herself a small smile for her victory. Sure, they couldn't quite compare with Buttercombe ones but Yeng Mini-Donuts were still a treat. Then she recalled she owed the girl something and reached for Fukuda's list. “This is your complete job description.”

“…nk you.” Penny quickly crammed the rest of her donut into her mouth, tried to lick her sticky fingers clean and took the paper. Browsing the text, she quickly got to the perks and benefits of her job. “Uh, may I ask you… ?”

“Yes, dear?”

“Free room and board at the Academy premises, work attire tailored to fit free of charge – is that for real?”

“Yes, of course.” Shannon could not understand the girl's surprise; to her it seemed utterly normal that the Academy provided everything she ever needed.

“Uh, in that case, is the position still open?”

“Yes.” The Headmistress squirmed in her throne, looking for a more comfortable position.

“And… how many candidates are there?”

“Several.” As much as Shannon enjoyed stringing her along, it was keeping her from more important things, namely eating. She cut it short. “However none of them have yet shown up so if you are ready to start right away, you're hired.”

“Oh, I am, I am more than ready. Thank you for this opportunity, thank you, Ma'am!” Penny jumped up, leaned forward as if trying to hug the behemoth in front of her, then she settled for a vigorous shake of Shannon Polluck's bloated hand.

“No need to thank me, I expect you to live up to your today's promise. So… personal agenda falls into the purview of the Vice-Principal. Fukuda's in her office right now, go see her, sign her papers and she'll tell you the rest. And you may take the minidonuts with you.”

“Thank you.”

***


The interview with the Vice-Principal went very differently. They started off on the wrong foot as Penny entered her office munching on a minidonut and holding the open packet. Dr. Hinamizawa, a cool, aloof middle-aged Japanese, raised her eyebrows at the sight, Penny blushed and it went downhill from there.

Penny had to remind herself she wasn't to be working for this iron b*tch but for the Headmistress. Fukuda spent over a dozen minutes grilling her about every minor detail of her (a little doctored) CV, thoroughly interrogating her before she seemed satisfied that the new assistant would acquit herself well. Eventually she asked: “Did the Headmistress give you the list of your duties?”

“Uh, she gave me this,” Penny showed her the paper, a little greasy from the donuts.

“Ah, good, I was worried she may have forgotten. Well, you can keep it,” Fukuda frowned at the smears. “You may have noticed, your duties can be summed up as taking care of our esteemed Headmistress. As you have seen her mobility is a little impaired so essentially you shall be her hands and feet. You'll assist her in whatever way she deems necessary.”

“Yes, Ma'am.”

“Good. Well, here's your contract, a non-disclosure agreement, a tenancy agreement, a health waiver, and some more documents for you to sign.”

At first Penny tried to read it, or at least scan the lines, but feeling Fukuda's tense look she soon gave up on the dozens of pages. The legalese was mostly beyond her grasp anyway. She signed it all, passing one copy of each to the Vice-Principal.

Suddenly all tension was gone and Fukuda smiled. “Good. Just so you know, your phone number is now in the school database and you might expect some other members of the staff to contact you momentarily. You are also slated to receive a Yeng smartphone in a couple days with upgraded safety features as a replacement for your current phone. And the most important thing…”

The Vice-Principal unlocked a safe partly hidden behind a row of monitors, and took out a strangely looking faux-jade bracelet, pressing its surface onto a chip reader. “This device is now coded to your person, please take it everywhere with you and do not let anyone else use it. Among other things it serves as a key to your accommodation. Given your position, you will be staying next door to the Headmistress and while you certainly aren't required to assist her outside your working hours, I would appreciate if you would go out of your way and help her sometimes.”

Penny nodded. "Sure."

“The bracelet also opens your office floor, our spa and many other rooms and corridors. You have Group D access rights which means you can go to most parts of the school – and as part of your duties you certainly will.” The Vice-Principal smiled as if making a joke. “Moreover, the chip lets you eat in the cafeteria and use all the vending machines for free. So don't lose it.”

“No, Ma'am.” Penny slid it on her wrist. It was far too big and dangled loose. Fukuda's advice made perfect sense.

“Well, I am glad to welcome you at our fine Academy. I hope I'll see you grow here and find your place in our team.”

“Thank you, Ma'am.” They shook hands again and Penny dashed out.

***


When she left the Vice-Principal's office, Penny felt an immense weight fall off her shoulders. She was worried nobody would ever employ her again after that little misunderstanding at her last job. And yet here she was, a new personal assistant to the Headmistress of the most prestigious girl's academy on the East Coast!

True, it seemed the real power here rested in the hands of that formidable Japanese woman but if she played her cards right, Penny would surely be able to convince Fukuda she was a valuable team player. And as for the Headmistress, a steady stream of snacks might be enough to keep on her good side. And then… who knows? Little Penny Simon from the wrong side of the tracks might make it big here.

At that moment her cellphone beeped. What was her first duty going to be?
1311212.title: Ample Assistance Rewarded

choices: Her phone rings again
The automated kitchen starts whirling
13112122.content:
Penny Simon was a little puzzled why her job would require a physical (after she'd been hired, no less!) but the text message was clear: the school nurse wanted to see her ASAP. So she asked around, got lost, asked again until eventually she discovered the infirmary.

“Hello?” she knocked. “Penny Simon here. Sorry for the delay.”

“Good, good. Come in, please.”

Once they got over the initial awkward stage, the nurse's soothing voice and gentle mannerisms calmed Penny down. Ms. Fukiyama was another Oriental woman (which made sense given the much-vaunted Yeng sponsorship), even taller and thinner than Dr. Hinamizawa, with long, silky hair just like Penny that framed a somewhat rounder face.

She asked her about allergies, health complications and the like (Penny had none), then she focused on her glasses. “Would you like me check to your eyesight too?”

“No, no, thank you.”

“Are you sure? Do you know that the school covers all your medical expenses? Should you need new glasses, just say so. I'll write you a prescription, you can select frames you like online and when you next visit Wellington – the town next to the Academy – there's an optician there who has a contract with Buttercombe, you can pick your new glasses for free. I'll send you a link.”

“Really? Well, in that case, could you have a look at my eyes, please?” Penny couldn't afford new glasses for ages, this was possibly the best news of the day! Or second best, after being hired here.

Shiro Fukiyama was pretty thorough, making Penny read letters and shining into her eyes before she eventually declared: “And that's it. You do need glasses a little stronger than you have plus the focus in your right eye is a little off so do not put it off too long, OK?”

“Yes, ma'am. And thank you.” Penny rose, thinking it was time to go.

“No, no, no, wait. One more thing left. I need your height and weight. Please step onto this,” the nurse pointed at an industrial-sized scale next to the door. “So you are 5'3'' and… 120 lb. Good.”

Hearing that, Penny sucked in her stomach. “Umm, I know I should lose a couple pounds.”

“Huh?” The nurse gave her the once-over before handing her a clipboard. “No, not really. You're quite healthy, better focus on maintaining your weight. Now please sign here and you can go.”

***

Penny stepped outside and blinked as the bright sun blinded her for a moment. What should she do now?

“Hi!” A woman even smaller than Penny shouted in a voice surprisingly deep for her size, riding on some kind of an oversized golf cart towards her. “Are you Penny Simon? I’m Marcia Flannagan, the housing director of the Academy.”

“Oh- oh, yes, I am. Hello.” Penny shook the offered hand.

“I was told I could find you here. Are you ready to see your new accommodation?”

“Umm, I think so?”

“Perfect. Follow me, please.” The director brushed off her blonde locks and climbed off the golf cart. “It's some fifteen minutes drive but I'm sure you'll love the view. Ah, right,” she paused and gave Penny a searching look. “One more thing – where's your luggage?”

“Umm, still at the gate.”

“Good, we'll drive there to pick it up, it'll help you make yourself familiar with the layout. Come, start driving.” And she pointed at the driver's seat.

“What? You want me to… ?” Penny hesitated.

“Sure! After all, this is your scooter, assigned to you personally. I brought it along. Trust me, you don't want to walk all the way, every day. It's, like, miles! Plus there's been some scare with the lyme disease and whatever. Trust me, it's better to get used to driving about.”

“Oh, fine.” Penny gingerly sat behind the steering wheel and after a couple false starts set off. The path soon forked. “Can you tell me the way?”

“Sure, turn right and drive straight on, down that valley ahead…”

“Isn't it weird that the campus is deserted like this?”

“Oh, it is indeed but the semester has already started last week, see? So most our students are busy with their lessons. So is the staff.” Marcia leaned out to point. “Now turn left, please.”

The drive uphill with her luggage was slow but steady, cabin was small but looked cozy. And the view was just as lovely as Ms. Flannagan promised. The valley spread out below them with all the Academy buildings in sight. Add the mountain air… Penny inhaled, enjoying its freshness. “It's nice here.”

The housing director smiled as if school grounds were her own creation (possibly they were?). “Isn't it? This area is reserved for our most prominent employees. The Headmistress is housed right next to you.” She pointed at the much larger mansion next door.

“Ah. So you- you live here too?”

“Oh, no, no, I couldn't. Too close to the cafeteria, you know,” she chuckled, stopping abruptly when she noticed Penny's blank look. “Anyway, your home may be smaller but it is just as smart as your neighbors', filled with top-notch appliances from the Watanagashi Automated Kitchen to the Himatsubushi 3D Audiovisual Network. The kitchen even has a full starting storage compartment, courtesy of our Yeng sponsor. Just have a look.”

Penny parked the cart in a covered space next to the door and Marcia walked her through her new home. It was a little on the smallish side but Penny didn't mind, she was used to living small and this was the largest space she had ever had to herself. Moreover, what the cabin lacked in size, it more than made up in luxury. The furniture looked and felt sinfully comfortable, Penny was looking forward to testing her bed already.

“Well, that's it. I suppose you're going to be busy soon, I certainly am, so sign here and enjoy your housing. And should anything happen, call me.”

“Yes, yes, thanks. See you.” Plopping down into her kitchen chair, Penny watched the tiny tornado of activity leave. She was glad she would have some time for herself now after all the excitement.

But would she? Not much later her rest was to be interrupted.
13112122.title: Settling In

choices: The Headmistress
Another staff member
131121221.content:
Fifteen minutes later Penny was still resting in her new kitchen. A bag with all her belongings lay in the doorway, reminding her she ought to start unpacking. Numerous sleek steel appliances around her called out to her curiosity, begging to be examined, tested. Didn't Marcia say the kitchen was ready to start? But for now she was content with simply sitting down and letting the stress of her last days slowly seep out of her system.

The ringtone of her phone was a most unwelcome intruder into her oasis of calm.

“Ugh.” Penny looked around, driven by a subconscious desire to run away from the noise. But there was nowhere to run. She had to take it, in all likelihood it was job-related and she didn't want to lose it on the very first day.

The phone rang again.

“Fine!” she reached for it. “Oh no, not again,” she groaned looking at the number.

Who was it?
131121221.title: Rest Interrupted

choices: Onto Part II
Onto Part II?
1311212211.content:
“Finally!” Ms. Polluck's deep bass had an almost physical quality. “Where have you been loafing?! I need you here, stat!”

Penny drove her cart back at a speed it likely wasn't designed for. When she rushed into the office, slightly out of breath, her worst fears were confirmed. Ms. Polluck's mood had significantly worsened since their first meeting.

“I expect my assistants to be available whenever I need them,” she barked out. “Immediately!”

Penny was taken aback by the change of her tone. “Of course, Ma'am. I was just checking in-”

“I'm not interested in any excuses. I'm hungry!” The Headmistress leaned forward, upper folds of her gut bunching up on the desk, threatening to burst out of her honey-coloured blouse. “And when I'm hungry, I want to eat!”

“Yes, Ma'am.” Penny bent her head down to show how contrite she was. “Would you like me to bring you some more snacks from the machine?”

The behemoth's lips puckered. “No! When I am hungry I want a proper meal! Three courses at least!”

Penny glanced at her watch. “Uh, should I go to the cafeteria then? I mean, it's not even 5 yet but they might have something ready…”

“Yes, of course, you silly girl! Do I have to spell everything out for you?!”

“OK, I'll be back right away.” And Penny fled her boss' anger.

Her new job suddenly didn't look as welcoming. Ms. Polluck must have been used to some kind of… routine that her assistant provided. But how could Penny find out, who could advise her what she was supposed to really do?

***


Better focus on the job at hand for now. Cafeterias tended to be downstairs, right? Penny took the elevator to the ground floor, hoping to find some clue there. And as soon as she stepped out, a mix of enticing smells wafted down from an adjacent larger building. Following it, she soon found the cafeteria, a huge busy hall, and behind another set of double doors, there was the kitchen.

After meeting other, normal-sized members of the staff she was beginning to think of the hoggish Headmistress as an outlier, an anomaly. But the cafeteria was so filled with obese students it reminded her of a fat camp (not that Penny would ever visit such a place) and the kitchen was no better – cooks at various stages of obesity, were struggling to move around in the confined space between worktables, stoves and ovens. Now where was the head cook?

After a bit of hesitation, Penny picked the largest of them, a woman so big she almost rivalled Ms. Polluck. She sat at the head of the kitchen, observing her underlings, ordering them around and taste-testing their products. When she heard Penny's steps, she turned her head as far as her chins let her. “Yes?”

“Umm, hello, I am Penny Simon. The new assistant to Ms. Polluck. And she'd like to have a… an early dinner if possible?”

The obese cook chuckled. “Like she always does. I get you, girl. Whatever the Headmistress says, you do. Is that so?”

“Uh, yes, ma'am.”

“Eri Flatterly, happy to meet you. I'm in charge of this madhouse. Girls!” she turned to her staff. “Prepare a tray for the Headmistress as usual. And add some more for her assistant too. Is there something you'd like, umm, Penny?”

“Oh no, no, there's no need to…”

The cook didn't let her finish. “But there is! You're so scrawny, only skin and bones! What would you like? What's your favorite?”

Penny drew her breath in, thinking. “Well, maybe pizza? Pizza pepperoni?”

“Perfect! Girls, get the dinner cart ready and prepare a pizza pepperoni for Miss Penny! You'll like it, we make all our pizzas in-house. While we wait, you can have a sweet roll or two – here – and tell me something about yourself, dear. Where are you from, how did you end up in Buttercombe…”

“Ah, well…” thinking mostly how to leave out her dirty laundry, Penny took a bite. “Wow! That's… that's perfect. I've never tasted something so… so…”

“Oh, you've never had a homemade one, have you? Well, the secret's in good, honest ingredients. You mustn't scrimp on the butter…” and the cook got talking about her favorite subject which suited Penny just fine. Whenever it looked that conversation could steer back to her past, another bite, a compliment and a couple questions kept Eri Flatterly going until the cart was loaded.

“Oh, that's… a lot of food.” Penny interrupted her hostess when she noticed it. “And, uh… is that supposed to be my pizza? All that?” She pointed at the extra-large ring.

“Sure! You need to put some meat on your bones, girl.” The head cook struggled to rise, an avalanche of her fat pushing Penny away. “Well, it was nice chatting with you but I need to check how the lunch's coming along. See you around 9.”

Penny was struggling to get the cart under control but now she looked up. What was this about? “You mean 9 p.m.? To pick up evening tea for the Headmistress?”

“Right you are. Tea and everything else.”

***
/character limit again, sorry/
1311212211.title: Feeding the Beast, Part I

choices: Dinner with Penny and Gabby
Dinner with Shannon Polluck and her appetite
13112122111.content:
As the overloaded dinner cart rattled along the hallway, it was making a lot of noise despite Penny's best efforts. It was noisy enough that a chubby face peaked out of an office. “Is it dinner already?” she asked eagerly.

“Uh, not yet. Soon, I think?”

“Oh, blast. Ah! You must be Ms. Polluck’s new assistant. I'm Gabby. Gabriella Rodriguez from the accounting.” The door opened, revealing a Hispanic even shorter than Penny. She could still be called curvy if you ignored the potbelly fighting her voluminous chest for its place in the sun. She spread her arms to give Penny a soft hug. “Hi! Soo glad to see you!”

“Umm, Penny Simon, hi. Uh, it's not lunch yet but I could share my pizza with you, if you're interested? I mean, I can't eat it all…”

“Wow, really? You've made a friend for life, Penny!” The accountant stepped eagerly aside to let her in the office.

Penny took the giant wheel and cut it in half, marvelling how thick the toppings were. As she was splitting it, she could see an inch-wide layer of gooey cheese topped with a pound of salami. This was definitely no supermarket pizza! She hadn't been feeling hungry until now but the sight – and aroma – were making her salivate. “Here you are. Enjoy.”

“Thanks! And drop by soon, we need to chat. Maybe go to lunch together? Us underlings must stick together, eh?” And Gabby bumped into her with her hips.

“Oh, uh, sure. I mean, unless the Headmistress wants me to tag along to assist her…”

“Heh, don't worry. When it comes to dinner our big boss doesn't like company. She's got her own private dining room next to the kitchens. Of course, people like Ms. Underwood or Dr. Hinamizawa get invited too but us plebes have to eat with the rabble- I mean students. Luckily there won't be too many of them left by then. Anyway, when you're ready, just knock on my door and we can go, OK?”

“Yeah. Bye for now.” And Penny rushed to the cart, reminded that her boss wouldn't be happy with further delays.

***


It was time to feed the beast. As soon as Penny knocked, she heard an angry voice: “Finally! What took you so long?”

“Uh, sorry, the cooks had to prepare everything… Anyway, here you are, Ms. Polluck.” And Penny started unloading the dishes. She guessed that as soon as the Headmistress saw food, she would stop nagging and start eating and she was right, except eating wasn't the right word for the show. Shannon Polluck grabbed an oversized spork with one hand and a huge burger with the other, taking a big bite out of it and topping her mouth up with lasagna. And again and again, at a feverish speed. It was incredible how much she could fit into her mouth and how fast she could swallow. Penny wondered if she even chewed before swallowing.

Penny watched the hoggish spectacle with astonishment, almost forgetting to eat her pizza. Almost but not quite, a while later her hand searched in vain for another piece. Did I really eat half a pizza without noticing? If the lingering greasy aroma on her lips wasn't enough, a warm feeling in her stomach confirmed it. With nothing else to do, she watched her boss eat.

Penny kept staring at her for so long that eventually – when all the food was gone – Shannon Polluck noticed. “What? What's wrong? Is there ketchup on my face?” And the landwhale yawned, tired from the effort.

“Umm, no, no. I didn't expect you to eat it all, Ms. Polluck.”

“Hey, you can’t run a school on an empty stomach,” the Headmistress chuckled, her mood improved. “Now you can leave me alone, I need to read up on some stuff. You can have a look at my tomorrow visitor list meanwhile. By the time I'm done reading, I expect my scooter to be ready for the trip to cafeteria.” Another yawn followed and a wave of her hand. “Take my private elevator. It's parked down there.”

“Yes, ma'am.” She retreated to the front room, her new office, and sure enough, loud snoring soon announced that her boss was 'reading.' Meanwhile Penny was busy finding her way around the school system, by the time she finally found something resembling a scheduler, she could already hear heavy thuds from the office. Shannon Polluck was awake and getting ready for her main dinner.

Penny dropped everything and rushed to the elevator, taking it down to an office converted into a parking space big enough for a particularly large, souped up scooter. She powered it up just in time as a double door opened and the Headmistress lumbered in, her gut stretching most of the way to the ground.

Penny tried to help her and almost regretted it when the behemoth leaned on her heavily. Smothered by the wall of fat, she choked out: “You… you have only… one visitor… tomorrow, ma'am… A, um, Tetsuko Yeng?”

“Ah, dear Tetsuko. I wonder what he'd bring me this time? I mean, bring to our school. Well,” the Headmistress settled her weight in the seat and on the belly rest and seized the controls, “the boy's punctual. I expect you to alert me fifteen minutes before he's due to arrive. Until then you're free.”

“Yes, ma'am.” Penny watched the scooter drive out into the hallway before retreating back upstairs. She would go see Gabby and then it was time for dinner.

***

/and a sidenote: As you must have noticed by now, I got inspiration regarding the fate of little Penny Simon. If you want to return the focus back to Ms. Polluck, feel free to use the other option/
13112122111.title: Feeding the Beast, Part II

choices: Yes, to cement the new friendship
No, that's going too fast for Penny's liking
131121221111.content:
When Penny saw all the food on offer, she nearly regretted eating half a pizza not yet two hours ago. Nearly but not quite, it'd been so good! And now, as all the enticing smells hit her, she was contemplating whether she would be able to fit all three main courses into her stomach and all the desserts on top.

Except there were plenty of warning signs around as to where this could lead. There weren't many students left just like Gabby said, but those that were present were uniformly humongous. Penny had never seen teenagers so big in real life before. At Buttercombe they looked to be the norm. The girl in front of her was a case in point, not much taller but with a waist that stretched her mustard skirt impossibly wide.

“Moderation, girl,” Penny whispered to herself when she saw Gabby piling up lasagna next to a cheeseburger.

“Sorry? What?”

“Oh, nothing. It all looks so delicious. I think I'll have the taco salad.”

“Yeah, that's a good start,” Gabby said absently. “Now, should I have an ice cream float, an apple pie or some sweet rolls? Eh, I'll have all three.”

A good start?! All three?! Evidently her new friend must have grown used to overindulgence at the Academy. “So how long have you been working here?” asked Penny.

“Oh, I know how it must be for you, Penny. It feels like I've been in Buttercombe for ages but in fact I was in your shoes this time last year. New, stumbling along, unsure what to do.”

“Ah.” Penny's eyes shied away from the jiggling orb of fat that rolled out underneath her neighbor's chest. Did Gabby get this fat in a single year? No, no. She must've been fat before, that was it. Surely. “Well, yeah, I do feel a bit out of my depth.”

“Don't worry, you'll adjust quickly. Everyone does, although,” Gabriella giggled, “although I'll say that you've got possibly the worst job at school. Handling old Polluck isn't easy. But don't give up, I can give you some tips. Anyway, now go left, that corner table over there's kind of reserved for us, I mean, for people from the Admin.”

“Right.” Penny noticed that those few students who were still eating tended to avoid that corner despite it being close to the line. “So are we the only ones eating here from Admin?”

“No way! But Amy and Becks'n Freddie and all must've already eaten. I'd've too, if you hadn't shared your pizza, I'd be dying of hunger by now otherwise.” She plopped her overloaded tray on the table and collapsed into a chair, clearly exhausted from carrying it a couple dozen feet. “I am hungry as it is so… bon appetit.”

“Thanks, you too.” At first Penny thought Gabriella was exaggerating but when she saw the frantic verve with which the Hispanic attacked her burger, she had to reassess her estimate. For the next fifteen minutes the gabby girl was unusually silent, ignoring everything but her trough. Her voracious appetite actually affected Penny too. Despite her resolution she had quickly eaten her bowl of taco salad and after a little hesitation she rose again.

This was what made Gabby speak again. “Going for seconds?” she asked with her mouth full of an apple pie.

“Uh, yeah.”

“Could you be a doll and take me another apple pie? If there's any left?”

“OK.” And Penny fled before her bottomless companion would make her bring another full tray. However the words “anything left” awoke old demons in the girl. Although there seemed to be no danger of food scarcity in here, she'd ended carrying an overloaded tray for herself. “You like sweets, right?” she asked as she passed over the pie.

“Yeah, I've got a bit of a sweet tooth,” Gabby chuckled uneasily. “Would you believe that toothpick we've got for a new nurse criticised me for gaining weight just last week? The gall of that girl… But anyway, you're staying in Brittany Huan's old shack now?”

“Whose?” Penny asked, her mouth full of lasagna.

“Oh, Brittany was the Headmistress' assistant before you. We used to chat, do sleepovers… She'd stayed in a small hut right next to Polluck's palace.”

“Yeah, that's my cabin now.”

“Listen, I just got an idea. How about another sleepover? I mean, a sleepover? We could have a good, long chat without all these interruptions,” and Gabby waved around to indicate students, “have a good time, just like the old days with Britt. Huh?”

Penny hesitated. She'd always been wary of too friendly faces but on the other hand she did need allies in this unfamiliar environment. Plus the girl looked harmless and she promised her tips to handle Polluck. Should she agree to the sleepover or not?
131121221111.title: Fine Dining

choices: Their loud sleepover draws outside attention
The next day Penny oversleeps
1311212211111.content:
As she weighed the pros and cons, Penny couldn't resist the welcoming smile on that round face opposite her. How long had it been since she could last enjoy a free evening with her girl friends? “OK, let's do it-”

“Yeah! Perfect!” the Latina accountant pumped her fist.

“-but I need to get an evening snack for Polluck first. I should be free after 9.”

“Yeah, I know. Brittany did it just like that.” Gabriella Rodriguez stuffed the rest of her second apple pie into her mouth and stood up. “Enjoy the rest of your dinner, I need to get ready for our girls' night in,” she winked at her and strode away surprisingly fast, given how much food she'd just consumed.

Penny was left with several courses she'd stacked onto her tray in her scarcity-driven panic earlier.
She doubted she could ever eat all of that but she wasn't one to throw out food, ever – especially not if it tasted this good. She sighed, glanced around and when nobody paid any attention to her, she slid the belt below her growing food baby.

***


Penny was thankful for her new cart. She doubted she'd have ever made it home otherwise. As it was, she parked the cart, staggered inside the cabin and collapsed into the nearest chair, caressing her overworked tummy. “I have to watch myself better from now on.”

Now that she no longer had to move, the unusual sensation of a full stomach actually felt kind of pleasant. It was making her feel cozy, warm and sleepy…

When Penny woke up, it was getting dark outside and the pressure in her stomach receded. She yawned and stretched, feeling refreshed after her nap in the cozy chair. “Now wasn't there something… Oh no!” The kitchen clock showed her it was quarter to nine. She almost overslept! In panic, she rushed to the palace next door and knocked. “Ms. Polluck?”

“Yes?”

“I was told to bring you an evening snack, is that right?”

The disembodied voice took on a disgruntled undertone again: “It should've been here already, girl! Hop to it!”

So Penny hopped into her scooter and as she drove downhill, she felt growing anger (or was it heartburn?). This wasn't in her contract! Was she supposed to serve this hog of a headmistress day and night?

But then she thought back to her cabin with all its trimmings, to all the perks and bonuses of her new job. An extra food run every evening wasn't that bad a trade-off, even if it seriously hampered her private life. But then – what private life did she have anyway? And by the time matters improved, surely she would find a way to handle her new boss… As she was stopping by the cafeteria, Penny was smiling again.

Down in the main campus Eri Flatterly was already waiting by the door, ready to close the shop. “Ah, good, here you are, my dear. I was worried you forgot. Here you go,” she nodded and her two helpers started loading a cart into Penny's scooter. Then she thrust a box into Penny's hands. “And this is for you, my dear, some leftover apple pies. I noticed you took three for dinner,” she winked, “so enjoy.”

“Uh, thanks. Ah! When am I expected to come next?” as Penny asked, she dreaded the answer would be “midnight” or something similar.

The huge cook noticed as well. She chuckled, patted her hand. “No sooner than mid-morning, dear. Say around 11? Our good old Headmistress can take care of herself, mostly.”

“Yeah, fine! See you then!” and Penny rushed back at full throttle, at the staggering speed of 8 mph. She was so focused on getting the food to her boss that she nearly overlooked a round figure standing by the road.

“Hey! Wait for me!” It was Gabby with her arms full of snacks. “I saw you coming and thought I could hitch a hike.”

“Oh, uh, hop in. It's going to be a bit of a squeeze.” Penny took the pie box from a smaller backup seat and put it into her lap where it collided with the bump of her stomach. “Ouch. Uh, Gabby, it's nice of you to bring all that food but I don't think I can eat another bite…”

“That's OK, this is mostly for me! I can't watch movies without snacking!”

When she saw her new friend's hips overflow from the small seat on both sides, Penny had no trouble believing that. “Well, I'll deliver the cart in the back to Ms. Polluck's and we can start.” She turned onto the driveway, slid the cart from her scooter and knocked. “Your evening snack, Ms. Polluck!”

***


Unlocking her cabin, Penny put the pie box on the kitchen table and went back for her travel bag, still lying in the doorway. “Gabby? Go on into the living room, I need to sort this out.” She solved the problem by stuffing the bag in the closet, opening it and taking out her other good suit as an afterthought. She should be smartly dressed tomorrow for the Yeng heir!

By the time she was finished hanging it, the Latina's cheerful voice boomed: “Wow, you've got a pre-paid Netflix, Amazon and Hulu here- Britt didn't have that! I know what we're going to watch.”

“Uh, just pick something easy to watch. Some comedy maybe? I'm not in the mood for heavy thoughts.”

“Right you are, Pen. Oh, I haven't seen this one yet! 'Lightness of Being' sound good?”

“I guess.” When Penny finally made to the living room, Gabriella was already settled in, a plethora of snacks spread around in easy reach, and she was just opening a family bag of chips. “Wanna beer? I think I saw some in my fridge.”

“Really? I wouldn't mind having some.”

“Good. Me too.”

Only now did Penny fully realise how wound up she was from the strain of her first day at Buttercombe. It was nice to unwind with beer and snacks and idle gossip. She didn't remember much of the movies; even of the second one, a horror she chose on a dare. But that might have been because alcohol already clouded her judgment, making her laugh at the scary scenes. Alcohol also helped her forget her resolve not to overeat anymore. So what? Life was good, finally, so she could let her hair down and enjoy.
1311212211111.title: A Pleasantly Buzzed Evening

choices: Another snack run commences
An obstacle appears
13112122111112.content:
The evening was wonderful, what followed was less so. Penny spent half the night awake, listening to – and feeling – her intestines struggle with the overload. The overabundance of alcohol still circulating in her veins made it a bearable experience, even somewhat pleasurable despite the pain. But as time went on, her body was breaking alcohol down and she was gradually feeling worse and worse. “Aah. I'll never try to keep up with Gabby again…”

Penny spent hours tossing in her sinfully soft bed before an idea hatched in her mind. The Academy had her the cabin fully supplied with everything she could ever need. Wasn't it likely that they might have prepared for her present predicament too?

As soon as it occurred to her, Penny was on her bare feet, ignoring the cold as she hurried to the bathroom. She almost knocked over a lamp before remembering to switch the lights on, burst into the bathroom and tore the cabinet door open.

Yes! There it was – a plain-looking bottle labelled Yeng Stomach Aid; Adult Version. Penny hesitated but then she pulled the cork out with her teeth, tilted it and let a couple drops fall on her tongue.

It tasted like most medical concoctions, sort of nice and yet she wanted to gag. She swallowed and returned to the bed at a more sedate pace, hoping it would do its job.

It did. Her digestive system calmed down and Penny could finally shut her eyes.

***


Even before she opened her eyes again, Penny knew there was something wrong. And a look at the (school-provided) alarm clock confirmed what she dreaded.

She overslept!
“No, no, don't panic, Penny,” she tried to calm herself while she sprinted from her bed to get the business suit she'd unpacked yesterday. “You still have… ten minutes before the harpy headmistress starts looking for you.”

Luckily there was still an apple pie left on the kitchen table (only one? Where did the rest of them go?) so she took it along for the ride downhill. Penny drove with one hand, the other alternating between buttoning up her blouse and taking bites of the pie. She made it to the Admin Building with two minutes to spare, rushed into the lift and fifteen seconds early she knocked on her boss' door.

Nobody answered so she opened the door. “I'm here, Ms. … Polluck?” The snoring that resonated throughout the sound-proofed room told her all she needed to know. Penny carefully closed the door again and sat down into her chair, feeling drained after the morning scare.

Drained and peckish. Somehow one pie was not enough to sate her hunger so she stood up again to visit the vending machine and pick some caramel cakes to go with her morning coffee. A visit to the bathroom to do her makeup took care of the rest of her needs and she switched on her tabletop to start the day.

***

Twenty minutes before the Japanese visitor was to arrive, Penny knocked on the door again. “Ms. Polluck? You know you have a visitor coming, right?”

The landwhale was awake now. She grunted, then she remembered her assistant was new. “I know! Let the dear boy in as soon as he comes, do not let him wait.”

“Of course, Ma'am.” 'Dear boy?' This piqued Penny's interest.

Whatever else he was, the Yeng heir was definitely punctual. Five minutes before the hour she heard the lift arrive on the top floor. Knowing it would not hurt to make the best impression, she jumped to open the door. “Good morning, Mr. Yeng, welcome to Buttercombe Academy!”

Tetsuko Yeng looked like a typical Japanese businessman, from immaculate suit to the slick black hair, probably oiled to stay in place. Penny would dearly like to know what set the Yeng heir apart from a run-of-the-mill manager, so she added: “Ms. Polluck is in and she is expecting you;” in the hope of eliciting a response.

No luck. “Thank you.” He strode in and disappeared behind the soundproof door.

Penny felt a little – well, a lot – snubbed by that. Still standing by the open door, she noticed the vending machine in the hallway. She deserved a treat for being treated so nastily, right? It was chocolate butter cakes this time and as she ate, she consoled herself not to expect anything better from such a self-important, self-absorbed… prick.

She would love to know what was going on in the Headmistress' office
To her surprise he didn't breeze past. Instead he sat on the corner of her desk, giving her a good look at his expensively tailored pants. “Hello, we didn't have time to introduce ourselves. I am Tetsuko Yeng.”

“Penny Simon, pleased to meet you,” she squeaked in surprise.

“So, Miss Penny, how are you finding your new work?”

“Oh, you know how it is…” she was not going to elaborate but to her surprise, the Japanese heir used several well-aimed question to get the whole story out of her. When she thought back to it later, she could not believe how smoothly he got her to talk about everything that bugged her in Buttercombe.

The he sighed, patted her hand. “I know from personal experience it is not always easy to get along with Ms. Polluck but she plays a key role in… in the Buttercombe Academy so if there are any hiccups, do not hesitate to call me and I shall do my best to correct matters,” a calling card appeared in his hand.

“Thanks a lot!” Penny smiled cheerfully as she took it.

“Goodbye then, Miss Simon.” he shook her hand and started to leave. “Oh, and I'd lay off those cakes, if I were you. You'd better start watching your weight in this place...”

“Thank you for your advice, Mr. Yeng.” Penny almost managed to keep sarcasm out of her voice. She waited until the door closed and ripped the rest of the package open. There were still two butter cakes left – but not for long. “The nerve!”

After throwing out the empty packing to the bin where it joined its predecessors, Penny licked her lips and hesitated. The cakes tasted good, incomparably better than the standard supermarket rubbish she was used to, but Buttercombe kitchen was much better yet. And right now she could go for something more substantial to get over the oily man. In fact…

She rose and knocked on her boss' door again. “Ms. Polluck? I was thinking I could run into the cafeteria for your mid-morning snack.”

“Good thinking, girl! I was just getting peckish. Hop to it!”
13112122111112.title: A Pawn Between Major Pieces

choices: Penny gets into the groove of her job
Penny gets into trouble with her new smartphone
131121221111122.content:
Just as Penny left her office on a snack run for the Headmistress, her phone buzzed to announce an incoming text message. Come to my office ASAP. Fukuda.

Penny froze. This did not bode well for the recently appointed personal assistant but try as she might, she couldn't think of anything that might have offended the de facto boss of the academy. She knew she had to comply so she rushed across the hallway and knocked. “It's me, Penny Simon!”

“Come in.”

Penny's heart skipped a beat when Dr. Hinamizawa turned her face to her. If looks could kill… “What did the heir want?”

Penny pushed her glasses up to hide her confusion. “Excuse me? Who?”

“I am asking you about Mr. Yeng the Third. What did he want?”

She shrugged. “Umm, I don't know? I wasn't there when he spoke with the Headmistress. I just let him in and…”

“Ugh! I know that! Are you feeble-minded, girl?! What did he want from you? After he left Ms. Polluck!”

It would be interesting to watch Fukuda lose her icy calm, if anyone else but Penny were the source of her ire. So the vice principal somehow knew Tetsuko Yeng spent some time speaking with her? Never mind, now she had to mollify the fire breathing dragon in front of her. “Oh… oh, sorry. No, I mean… Well, he just offered help. In case something went wrong, errr… 'in case of hiccups' were his words, I think, I am to call him and he 'll help me.”

Fukuda's eyes narrowed. “Interesting. Our boy promised to help you? Well, should any 'hiccup' happen, better tell me first. I shall provide you any assistance you may need and decide whether you may call Mr. Yeng too or not.”

Penny shrugged again. What was the fuss about? It was all the same to her. “OK, I will. Anything else?”

The strict matron took a deep breath before forcing her lips into a resemblance of a smile. “As it happens, yes. Since you are here, Miss Simon, I have a gift for you.” She opened a drawer and paused, waiting for her reaction.

Despite herself, Penny felt intrigued. “Yes?”

Fukuda placed a sleek black rectangle on her desk and slid it across. “I bet you haven't seen a smartphone of these qualities, much less owned it. am I right, Miss Simon? Well, courtesy of our most generous sponsor, the Yeng Corporation, it is yours. I hope you shall start using it right away due to its upgraded safety features, though I suppose you would be better motivated by other features, such as pre-paid fast internet, a high-quality camera, a long-lasting battery…”

She kept talking but Penny didn't hear, so entranced she was in the gadget. The pompous Oriental was correct; she had never seen anything like it. She kept turning it in her hands until some words finally pierced her bubble.

“Uh, Miss Simon? I said that was all, Miss Simon!”

“Oh, yeah, right. Thank you, Dr. Hinamizawa. See you, Dr. Hinamizawa.” And Penny staggered out of the office still stunned by her precious gift.

As she was closing the door, the vice principal noticed her vacant expression. “Don't forget to bring the Headmistress her morning snack, Miss Simon!”

“Yes, Dr. Hinamizawa. Thank you, Dr. Hinamizawa. Eh, what?”
131121221111122.title: Beware of Japanese Bearing Gifts

choices: “And I can take you both.”
“And my offer is limited to Penny.”
1311212211111221.content:
By the end of her second week at Buttercombe Penny Simon felt she was getting the hang of it. Her duties essentially consisted of managing the Headmistress (and her hunger) – that meant providing enough fuel for her appetite and adjusting her schedule accordingly. Penny quickly learned that the best time to schedule appointments was 60 minutes after a meal. Earlier the Headmistress would be grumpy that they interfered with her siesta, leave it later than 120 minutes and she would be hungry and ill-tempered to her visitors again.

As long as the beast of her stomach was sated, her fierce temper never surfaced and Ms. Polluck was the best boss she could have. Penny wouldn't admit it to herself yet but she was beginning to like her job, well-paid, leisurely and undemanding. And the benefits! In fact there were so many that she would have forgotten about one of them, had Shiro not reminded her.

It was Friday afternoon, Penny had just finished eating her share of the Headmistress' snack, now she closed the Yeng Social Network app and was lazily contemplating what to do next. She knew without checking that her boss would be in a food coma for the next hour and wouldn't object to her leaving early. In fact, there was only one obstacle to it – her own stomach, filled to the brim with leftover tacos, was making her sleepy too.

So when she heard a knock on the door, she wasn't sure whether to feel angry or relieved that someone was going to keep her in the office. “Come in!”

The school nurse appeared to be in a good mood. “Hi! I hope I'm not disturbing anything important but…”

“Sssh! Not so loud!” Penny whispered urgently. “The Headmistress is, uh, resting her eyes. But come in.”

Shiro Fukiyama slipped inside and toned it down. “Ah, I see. I was just wondering if you've given some thought to your new glasses.”

“Umm…”

“Or would you prefer contacts?”

“Uh, well…” It looked like Penny wouldn't get her well-deserved rest so she stood up with a grunt, picked her purse and smartphone. “Let's go out. Trust me, you don't want to wake up the sleeping dragon.” In the hallway, she could speak normally again. “Actually I've completely forgotten about the glasses.”


”Better not put it off anymore. As it happens, I am going to town tomorrow in my car to pick up some medicine samples. Want me to take you along? I could help you select the best model for you, health-wise.”

“You're going to Wellington? That'd be cool!” Thrilled by the offer Penny raised her voice a little more and it evoked an immediate reaction.

A door opened down the hall and a round face peeked out. “Ooh, a town trip? Can I tag along? Can I? I'll show you all the best restaurants in town!”

“Gabby? Oh, this is Gabriella Rodriguez… Oh, but you must know each other…”

“Yes, we do.” Shiro nodded.
1311212211111221.title: A Trip Into Town

choices: Uhh… glasses?
Pizza, of course!
13112122111112211.content:
It was a rather tight fit in Shiro's compact car for the three of them. Luckily both Gabriella Rodriguez and Penny Simon were on the small side and while Gabby compensated for her height in width, she could have the entire backseat to herself.

“So this is Wellington? I haven't really had a chance to look around on my way to Buttercombe. It looks… different.” Penny thought she had gotten used to the rampant obesity at the Academy, to students and staff waddling along. Wellington brought it to yet another level. Here was a whole town full of fatties who went about their business as if their size was normal and it was Penny

“Yes, the town looks this good because the locals benefit from several Yeng subsidiaries that set up shop nearby.” Shiro's poker face hid whatever opinion she might hold about it. “Anyway, the mall is at the end of this street. I'll take you to the optician, run off to pick up my package in the pharmacy and go back to you to help with the billing, OK? The procedure is a little convoluted but I've had a lot of practice.”

“Uhh…” hearing that, Penny hesitated. She wouldn't want to end up paying for glasses that she should have gotten free.

“Or…” Gabby stretched in the backseat, “or we could wait for you in Papa Cipolli's over there over some pizzas. Right, Penny?”

“Umm, I've just had breakfast…” and yet pizza sounded good.

“Just? We've been driving for over an hour, girl! It's high time for a midmorning snack.” Gabby pushed on, seeing her doubts. “Besides, don't you see that signboard? Doesn't it look yummy? Hey, Shiro! Stop! Why are driving us away? You could park right in front! OK, girls, this is just mean. At least gimme a hand, you two, help me get out of the car, I'm stuck here!”

The tall thin girl turned back and grabbed her plush hand. “See? This is… why you… God, you're heavy! …should give up… more than just one pizza.”

With both Penny's and Shiro's help, Gabby's extra wide hips finally cleared the door, her face flushed with the exertion. She huffed. “Give up?! Huh! It's not my fault you've got a dwarf-sized car! Oh, I get it, you're jealous of my plush curves, skinny. Penny, you settle it. What will it be? A yummy pizza or… glasses?”
13112122111112211.title: Glasses and Gourmands, Part I

choices: “It's not like I have anything better to do.”
“Better not, thanks. I need to watch my figure.”
131121221111122111.content:
/sorry, couldn't quite finish the chapter in one go/

“Uhh… glasses?” A pizza sounded good but Penny was still rather full. Besides, they weren't here to stuff their faces; she wanted to get all the benefits of her new job and she suspected that if they stuffed themselves silly again, Gabby could refuse to move – or worse, she would.

“I am glad that someone has their priorities right,” Shiro Fukiyama had a look at the round Latina and set a brisk pace.

“Oh well,” Gabriella sighed as she waddled after them. “Let's go then, the sooner it's over the sooner we'll eat.”

***


Shiro led them to the optician, gave him Penny's prescription and strode away on her errand. Penny was a little worried Gabby would desert her for food and she would be left alone in there, without the benefit of a friendly advice.

Luckily her new friend soon forgot about her grumbling stomach as they browsed rows upon rows of glass frames. Her funk was replaced with bubbly enthusiasm as she pointed out her favorites. “Oh, these look good! See! Or these? And how about… Err. What would you prefer?”

“Umm…” Most of the frames Gabby liked were too gaudy to Penny's liking. “Maybe something a little more conservative?”

“In that case perhaps you would like to have a look at the next section, ma'am? These are for our younger clientele,” suggested the optician, leading them further inside.

“Thank you.” The next display case was indeed more subdued. Penny started looking but her friend was faster again.

“Oooh! Try these! This is a perfect look for you!” Gabby snatched frames inlaid with mother of pearl and thrust them to Penny.

She hesitantly turned them around, they still drew attention to her more than she would have liked. She put them on her face and squinted to see herself in the mirror. “You think? I look like a secretary.”

Gabby chuckled. “Well, that's what you do. Besides, you look like a sexy secretary. Am I right, Shiro?” she addressed a person behind Penny.

The nurse just walked in, carrying a large package under her arm and looking a little out of breath. “God, I'd swear the pharmacy was much closer… What? Huh, yes, these look fine. They make you look… responsible, competent, in charge. Is that the look you're going for?”

“Really?” Penny would have liked to try more options but her attitude changed when her stomach growled. “Good. In that case, I'll take these.”

“Now, sir, my friend's covered by the Yeng Extended Insurance Policy, if you know what that is?”

“Of course. Most our customers have it, ma'am. Please follow me.” They went to the counter and filled in the forms. Penny put her signature to it and the optician turned to her: “We'll fit in the lenses and send the glasses to your address, if that's OK?”

“Uh, yeah, sure.”

“And the address is?”

Penny blushed. “Oh, right. It's Buttercombe Academy, Cabin 34, uh…”

“That's fine, I can fill in the rest. We've had many satisfied customers from your Academy already, ladies. I hope you'll like your new glasses and come back for more.”

“Sure, I definitely will.” As long as it's free… I ought to ask Shiro how often I can use this benefit. It wouldn't hurt to have one pair of glasses for work, another more daring for clubbing, another… or maybe get contacts?

Gabby's voice tore Penny out of her fantasies. “And now can we finally eat? I'm dying of hunger here!”

“Oh, that would be a tragedy! We can't have you waste away, huh?” Shiro chuckled but there was no malice in her words.

“Come on! That's mean. Besides,” Penny inhaled the enticing smells wafting through the mall. “I'm getting hungry too. Let's go see some of those best restaurants that Gabby promised us.“

***


The list of 'best restaurants' that Gabby had promised was actually rather short. But her two friends gladly agreed that Epicurean Delights more than lived up to its name. They spent a very nourishing hour in there. And Becky's Bakery was shaping up to be even better.

“Oh, my poor stomach,” moaned Penny, cradling the swollen orb. “I can't eat another bite!”

“Then don't,” Shiro shrugged, running her hand over the bulge in her midriff. “I don't think I will either.”

“But I want to! It smells so wonderful!” Penny felt like a little girl in a sweet shop.

Gabby looked at her with pity. “You have to show your stomach who is the boss, young padawan. The longest journey starts with a single step. Don't think about it, empty your mind of all distractions, take a spoon of the yummy cheesecake, put it into your mouth, swallow, and repeat. Slowly, step by step, you will beat your limitations.”

So Penny tried it… and it worked. The heap of cake on her plate grew smaller until she found herself scraping the last leftover bits off the porcelain.

Shiro watched it with amazement. “Want the rest of my tiramisu too? I'm too full to finish it.”

Penny had been too full as well, but it didn't stop her. Some laborious chewing and swallowing later she cleared Shiro's plate too. “I did it!”

“Good job, girl, but you still got a long way to go.” Gabby smiled smugly. She managed to demolish a whole chocolate cake in the meantime.

“I wonder how the two of you will make it to the car.” Shiro had claimed there was no need to drive “a couple hundred yards” to park closer to the bakery. Now all three were regretting it. The walk back to their car was pure torture even for Shiro who'd tried to hold back. “Next time… I'll pay more heed to your advice, Gabby,” the tall girl sighed after first few steps.

“Right.”

To avoid wondering whether her stomach could really explode, Penny looked around for a diversion. And she soon found one. Watching stuffed Gabby walk was… educational. She was leaning backward to compensate for the heavy load in her gut, her legs spread wide apart and feet at 90° so as to better carry it. She was making short steps, her foot always made a little circle before stepping down and sending shockwaves all over her body.

This puzzled Penny until she noticed that the girl couldn't properly see the ground over her voluminous chest. She was essentially walking blind. And that searching motion of her feet was apparently so ingrained in her that Gabby was doing it subconsciously. Her conscious actions were limited to sipping a milkshake she took 'to go,' bemoaning the heat and wiping perspiration off her forehead.

Not that Penny would fare any better, despite being much lighter on her feet. When they finally reached Shiro's car and stuffed Gabriella in the back, she collapsed into her seat, her face red from all the exertion. She did not envy the nurse who now had to drive them back all the way to the Academy. And she'd helped with the optician… Perhaps Penny should pay it back to her somehow? “Uh, Shiro? We're having a movie night with Gabby today. Wanna join us?”

Shiro turned to her and paused, thinking. “Well…”
131121221111122111.title: Glasses and Gourmands, Part II

choices: Onwards to Part II
1311212211111221111.content:
“Why not?” shrugged Shiro. “It's not like I have anything better to do.”

“Oh come on! It'll be a blast, you'll see.” At least Penny hoped so, although Gabby's dark look from the backseat promised a blast of a different kind.

“We'll see.”

Soon enough the trio could see the buildings of the Buttercombe Academy rising in the hills before them, sunlight reflecting off the dome on the main building. “Home, sweet home,” joked Penny, except it was not quite a joke. She'd been here what- a week? - and yet she already felt more at home here than at any her previous post.

“Yeah, I can't wait 'till we get there,” agreed Gabby. “Oh, Shiro? Could we stop by the gate? I need to pick up my mail. Could we do it on the way back?”

Shiro stepped on the gas to climb the last hill. “Good idea. I ought to do drop by too. Even if it's probably just junk mail. All right, ladies, get your bracelets ready, we're here.”

When their car stopped at the gate, an enormously fat guard waddled out of the guardhouse. “Getting back from town?” she huffed as she tried to steady her tremendous olive coloured gut, pouring out of several sizes too small white uniform.

“Yes. Good afternoon, Rio.” Shiro opened the glove compartment and Penny was astonished to see her take out the biggest chocolate she'd ever seen. “Here's something for your trouble.”

The guard beamed as she snatched it. “Ah, good! You may drive in, Nurse.” And she slowly turned around. “I'll lift the bar… in a minute.”

“Oh, and we'll also be picking up some mail!” Gabby shouted at her slowly retreating back.

“Good… Come inside… to the counter… you know… the drill. I won't be… lugging it out… for you.”

Shiro drove to a small parking place just behind the gate and turned to Penny. “Don't get me wrong, please. As a medical professional, normally I'd never offer empty calories to someone as morbidly obese as Ms. Ayala,” she lowered her voice to a whisper. “But the last time I drove back from Wellington she made so much fuss about it. I almost had to strip naked! And when I complained to Dr. Schwartz, she told me – well, she literally ordered me– to appease the guards with something sweet. The bigger the better. So…”

“So now we'll have to help Gabby get out, huh?” Penny stood up, slid her seat forward and reached to grab Gabby's hands.

“Hey, it's not my fault that someone has too small a car,” she complained when she made it out.

“Fine,” Shiro shrugged. “You can walk the rest.”

The rotund accountant halted. “Oh, please! Don't you see I was joking?”

The two went inside still bickering. With nothing better to do, Penny trudged after them. Perhaps she ought to intervene? But there was no need, they stopped as soon as they saw the guard – Rio? - was already waiting at the counter, catching her breath after the hike. “Now as you know, ladies, I need to see your IDs, please. Bracelets won't be enough.”

“Yeah, right,” Gabby fished in her purse until she found her identification badge. Penny knew what it looked like from her own – three separate holograms, three identification codes for various on-campus services as well as her picture and start date.

The guard now looked at it and sighed. “Ms. Rodriguez, how many times have I told you that you have to update the photo? I cannot accept this as your proof of identity.”

“OK, OK, I'll update it,” Gabby sighed heavily and took a Yeng bar from her purse. “Can you make an exception, just once?”

The bar disappeared as if by magic. “But only once. The next time you have to have it updated. Here you go, Ms. Rodriguez, I'll fetch your mail.” And the guard started sliding across the floor in her heavily reinforced chair rather than walk a couple steps.

Gabby was turning her ID in hand, frowning.

“Lemme see… Wow!” Penny saw a slim, conventionally beautiful face. That was supposed to be Gabriella a year ago? She looked at the familiar face of her friend, dominated by plump cheeks and ringed with a thick second chin.

“Yeah, I know, right? I looked like such a child. Thank you, Ms. …” Gabby glanced at her nametag, “Ms. Ayala. See you.”

Shiro collected her mail without any hitch and as they went back to Shiro's car, Penny suddenly had a horrible thought. Did she miss a delivery to Ms. Polluck? She froze for a moment, let out a sigh of relief. “Girls, you don't know how happy I am that it's the weekend.”

Behind her, Gabby shrugged. “That goes for all of us, right?”

“No- Well yes but it's more than that. Saturday and Sunday are the only days of the week when I don't have to wait on our Headmistress hand and foot, you see?”

***


“So this is my humble abode.” Despite her words, Penny actually felt proud of her home for the first time ever. And Shiro's open admiration made her feel good.

“Come on, it looks beautiful, much better than my own shack. Oh, you've even got a shake maker. That's…”

“Awesome, right? I wish I had one in my cabin too. So, I know Penny loves caramel milk shakes-” Gabby started punching orders “-I'll have chocolate one, of course and which do you prefer, Shiro?”

“But we've just eaten… Oh, uh, mint, I suppose.”

“Actually, I'd eat something. It's been a long time since lunch.” Not really; an hour sitting in the car, fifteen minutes sorting out the mail and stopping at Gabby's and Shiro's cabin. But Penny was already under the Buttercombe spell and she was feeling peckish again. “Just a small snack. You always need snacks for watching movies, right?”

She took three family-sized bags of chips from the pantry, regularly re-stocked by Buttercombe caretakers, and put them on the coffee table next to the shakes, adding a carton of cookies as an afterthought.

“So, everything's ready except- What are we going to watch?”

“Uh, I don't know.” Gabby has already made herself comfortable in the loveseat and was opening the first bag. “Maybe look at Netflix or Hulu what's new? Shiro, can you imagine? Penny's got all the networks, everything fully paid for! Can you imagine?”

“Huh, well,” Shiro finally joined Penny on the sofa, “I don't watch TV that much. But I suppose it is a big deal.”

“You joking? That's da bomb!”

“Anyway, back to my question.” Penny tried to steer the conversation away from yet another stumbling block. “Is there anything you'd prefer, Shiro?”

“Not really, no.”

“Well then, let's have a look what's new on Netflix. Hopefully it's something good…” and while she handled the remote, her other hand grabbed first chips.

***

Two hours later and half an hour into their third movie, Penny shrugged. “Well, this one is a dud too. Anyone wants to see more?”

“Less, if it were ever possible,” Shiro sighed. “A pity that some things cannot be unseen.”

“I feel like I've forgotten something,” Penny looked around, hoping something might jog her memory. “Oh well, better tidy up in here, the room is a mess.” And she started picking up empty wrappers.

“I know!” Gabby suddenly piped up. “It's time for dinner!”

“Dinner? I feel like I've just finished my snack.” The nurse's blouse was strewn with chip dust. It may have been the first time the thin girl indulged like this.

“Exactly. That means it's time for dinner,” the tubby accountant agreed, chuckling. “I mean, seriously. It's half past six and you know the cafeteria's closing earlier today since they don't cook for students over the weekend. It's high time to order, especially since it's Italian Night today and you know what means!”

“Yeah! Pizza!” Recalling the taste of homemade Buttercombe pizza Penny almost forgot how her stomach churned, processing everything else she'd eaten today.

“Actually I planned to go for lasagna today but…” Shiro sighed. “I am too full to go there and they refuse to deliver by phone.” She shared a look with Penny across the sofa. Neither of them wanted to go all the way downhill, even if it were to dinner.

Surprisingly the biggest of the trio was the most mobile (or at least the one most eager to get more food). Gabriella stood up and waddled to the door. “So that's one pizza, a pan of lasagna-”

“Just one portion!”

“Nonsense. We'll want to have a taste too. Right, Penny? Pizza, lasagna, some mozzarella sticks, I suppose there'll be Italian ice cream- oh, and I need to take something for me too…” Her voice slowly faded away, muffled by the puttering of the scooter.

The two Buttercombe novices shared an uneasy look. “We don't have to eat it all, you know? You've got a huge fridge.”

“Well, yeah, I do…” Neither of them wanted to admit she didn't trust her willpower anymore.


***

/character limit strikes again/
1311212211111221111.title: An Evening to Remember and Forget, Part I

choices: Tomorrow...
Time goes on...
13112122111112211111.content:
It got dark outside but in Penny's cabin nobody noticed. Even Harrison Ford running away from the Nazis on the extra-wide TV screen received little attention as all three girls focused on their stomachs. Silence was occasionally broken with moans and groans, half from pain, half from pleasure.

And no wonder. Every horizontal surface within reach was full of empty dishes. There were two large pizza plates, a lasagna pan, an empty tray with cream smears (all that was left of tiramisu), three bowls that used to contain ice cream floats. Only Gabby's hand was still moving, operating on autopilot as it stuffed more mozzarella sticks into her mouth at regular intervals.

As she watched her friend, Penny wondered where the girl was putting it all. She gingerly caressed her stomach. “Oof, I ate too much again!”

“I know, right?” Shiro sighed. “I don't get this school. Everything seems to be designed to push more food on you. And it's so delicious it is hard to resist.”

“Isn't it awesome?” Gabby finally stopped munching. “I've never eaten so well in my life.”

“Well, yes, me neither. It is but what about the consequences?”

“You mean like weight gain? Screw it! All this eating is worth a couple pounds.”

“A couple pounds? Can you hear yourself? I warned you against this attitude during your check-up, Gabriella.”

“Girls, girls,” Penny intervened to stop the impending quarrel. She frantically thought what could make the two shut up. “How about we have one last dessert and call it a night?”

“Already? The night's still young.” Gabby

“The night may be young but I feel as old as the hills,” Penny sighed. “All that bustle and excitement in the town wore me out. Sorry. Uhhh…” she groaned.
