As she stretched to grab a package of cupcakes on a shelf underneath the coffee table, she pressed her sensitive tummy into the sofa cushion and for a moment she was sure she would burst. “Oomph. Here you go,” she offered a cupcake to Shiro.

“Uh, no, thanks. I am FULL.”

“I'll have one. Or two. Can I have Shiro's too?”

“Sure, here you go. Thank God it's Sunday tomorrow,” Penny sighed as she tore into her cupcake. “I won't leave my bed all day. I need to relax sooo badly, today was sooo exhausting.”

“You tell me. I am going to read all the medical journals I brought today and not even think about food.”

“Right.” Penny punctuated her consent by slamming the empty cupcake wrapper on the coffee table.

“Oh? So I can't count on you to come with me to the cafeteria, Penny? You know it's Burger Day again.”

“Uhh… well, maybe. But I'll only have something small.”

Chatting about their plans – or lack thereof – they polished their last cupcakes and looked around as they tried to gather the strength to stand up.

As expected, Shiro was the first to succeed. “No need to stand up, Penny, we'll find the way out. Right, Gabby?” she turned to the Latina and tugged, dislodging her huge behind from the loveseat.

“Uh, thanks, girls. Only, could you bring me something from the bathroom before you go?”

“Sure. What is it?”

“Oh, just a small vial labelled Stomach Aid?”

“Ah, good idea, Penny. Mind if I have a go too?” and the tubby accountant waddled to the bathroom at a remarkable speed.

The conversation left Shiro puzzled. “What the hell were you two speaking about?”

“You don't know, Shiro? Aren't you the nurse around here?”

“That I am but…”

“It's no rocket science, look.” Returning Gabby took a big swig before giving the vial to her.

“Yeng Stomach Aid? Ah, I see, a digestive. I never needed it before.” Shiro turned the vial around. “Interesting. Never heard about it before either. I must have a look at it, when I have some free time.” She passed it to Penny. “Anyway, good night.”

“Uh… g'night.”

Penny emptied the rest of the bottle and made herself comfortable on the sofa, unwilling (or unable?) to move any further. As she watched her stomach rising high, stuffed full with all the yummy Buttercombe food, a mix of shame and curiosity overtook her. I overate so much today. I wonder if I would be able to fit in even more tomorrow?
13112122111112211111.title: An Evening to Remember and Forget, Part II

choices: …her boss
…her wardrobe
131121221111122111111.content:
On Sunday shortly after noon loud ringing tore Penny out of her slumber. She swallowed a swearword and looked at her phone display. “Hi, Gabby. Yesterday girls' night was good, eh?”

“It was, only too short. Coming to lunch with me?”

“Umm… How about we invite Shiro along?” Penny's suggestion was not entirely selfless. She noticed that with Shiro present she tended to hold herself back a tiny bit more. More importantly, the tall girl soaked up calories that would otherwise end in her stomach. And her sweatpants were feeling a little snug today.

“Really? I don't know.” Gabby sounded like she did know. “I don't much care for her barbs. Why must she always harp about my weight?”

“Come on, it wasn't so bad yesterday. In fact, the longer the evening went on, the less she harped, remember? Maybe we could tame her.”

Gabby chuckled. “Huh, well. That's not a bad idea actually. OK, let her tag along. If she wants to at all, eh?”

***


In hindsight it wasn't so strange that Penny, Shiro and Gabriela bonded. True, they didn't share much in common personality-wise. Shiro was cold and aloof, Gabby just as talkative as her name suggested and a little childish, and Penny mostly silent and guarded. However, circumstances conspired to push them together. In a place where everything else was about education and students, their jobs set them aside and their youth and relative inexperience set them apart from more senior members of the staff.

Having said that, their new friendship did have its hiccups too. It was inevitable – they were three different women, with very different upbringing, lifestyle and hobbies. Nowhere else was it as apparent as when the trio went to eat.

Gabriella Rodriguez seemed determined to help her friends enjoy Buttercombe to the fullest, literally so. Like the following Wednesday: she opened her door as Penny was hauling Ms. Polluck's lunch cart along the hallway. “Ah, good, here you are! Come with me to the cafeteria! It's lunchtime!”

“But I'm still full from our midmorning snack.” As she said it, Penny subconsciously licked her lips. Gabby made her eat a whole apple pie and now that she recalled its taste, she felt getting peckish again.

“So what? Today it's German Cuisine Day! You can't miss that! Dr. Schwartz is always overseeing the cooking, personally! It's to die for!”

“You say that about every meal here. Besides, I need to deliver Ms. Polluck's lunch.”

“So? That'll take you ten minutes and you told me you have two hours free after that. Pleease. I don't want to go to cafeteria all alone.”

“Oh, OK, fine, I'll go. But I'll have only something light. And we'll stop in the infirmary to take Shiro.”

Needless to say 'something light' turned into a grilled two-pound bratwurst with sauerkraut and a huge bagel. Later, as Penny watched her two friends still eating, thirst (and renewed hunger) made her go for some juice, and a second helping of marble kuchen.



On another occasion all three women were sprawled in their cafeteria seats, busy digesting their large dinner, when Gabby stood up. “I'm going for another dessert, girls. Want me to bring you some too?”

Her friends shared an amused look. “No way, I'm stuffed!” protested Shiro. “I couldn't eat a single bite-” and Penny finished her declaration with a burp smelling of garlic.

Gabby shrugged and a while later she returned with another full tray so heavy that she barely managed to carry it all.

“Are you going to eat all that, Gabs? Are you bottomless or what?”

“Oh, no, no.” And she placed a bowl of chocolate pudding with all the trimmings before each girl. “That's yours.”

“Why?!”

“I thought you might get peckish soon. Don't tell me ”

By the time Gabriella ate the rest of her tray, both puddings were gone too. She grinned at her groaning friends, “See, what did I tell you?”



And sometimes Gabby's attention was simply unwelcome. “Oooh, are those stretchmarks?” she asked when they were leaving Penny's cabin after another girls' night. “Look, Shiro, you are an expert!”

“What? No!” and Penny quickly pulled her shirt down over the annoying love handle that peeked out.

“Oh, that's nothing to be ashamed of, everyone has them. I can give you the perfect cream that makes them disappear…”

“I told you I don't have any stretchmarks!! But I'll take your cream, just in case.”

***


On the other hand, a friendly Shiro Fukiyama did not lose her focus on healthy living just because she befriended Gabriella Rodriguez. She did mellow out and sometimes her advice sounded just a little bit hypocritical.

Such as when they were resting after another major meal in Penny's house. Shiro caressed her stuffed tummy as she addressed them: “Remember, girls, when you are past 25, your metabolism starts slowing down. Even if you eat the same, you start putting on weight. You need to watch what you eat.”

Gabby winked at Penny. “You mean watch like this?” and she poured another box of truffles into the bowl that Shiro just emptied.

"Oh no, I shouldn't… I mean, really!" Even before she said it, she poured the first handful into her mouth. “But they're divine!”



Another time she said gravely to her friend: “Gabby, I don't need a scale to tell you're still gaining. And do not think you are spared either just because the number on your scale does not rise,” she turned to Penny. “It is pretty obvious that you are losing muscle mass and replacing it with fat.”

“Umm…” it probably wasn't the best moment to say that the number on Penny's scale was rising. She chose to counterattack instead. “Then I suppose you alone are immune to weight gain? Since you've just polished an entire bag of bacon-flavoured chips? A family-sized bag?”

“Oh, uh, but- but that doesn't make it any less true!”

“Don't get your pants in a twist, Shiro. After all, I clearly remember you telling me I ought to watch myself eat. So I do, all day long.”

“I said watch what you eat!”

“Shiro? Another bag of chips? Bacon-flavoured, your favorite.” And Penny threw the bag on her to stop the nascent quarrel.

***


Penny Simon liked to think of herself as the voice of reason, moderating both extremes. However, as time went on (and her stomach stretched) she found herself drifting ever more towards Gabby's viewpoint: more pie? Yes, please! Exercise? Ugh.

Shiro must have noticed the change in their group dynamic too, judging by the fact that her pleas were turning into demands. She was getting more confrontational every day, driven to frustration by her own expanding waist. Still, Penny couldn't care less about her weight. She was enjoying the day, this was a problem for tomorrow, now bring the cake!

There were other shadows in her paradise though, most notably…
131121221111122111111.title: Blossoming Friendship

choices: High time to go clothes shopping with her bonus
High time to go clothes shopping but there is no bonus
1311212211111221111111.content:
Penny had never had it so good. Never before had she felt so welcome. At Buttercombe she had an easy job, amazing food, good friends, an incredible house, wonderful food, plenty of free time, so many benefits and the food was to die for… and if (when) she overate, there was the Yeng digestive to make everything better. In short, Penny took to life at the Academy like a duck to water.

That was not to say there weren't any shadows in Penny's paradise. Her clothes, for one thing. Sometimes her body felt like a bowl of dough, rising higher every day. And yet she could not afford to splurge on new things for the time being so she was forced to wear her ever-tighter wardrobe every day to work. She consoled herself she wasn't alone in her plight, Shiro and Gabby were in the same boat.

But an even bigger shadow in her garden of Eden, the biggest one – literally – was her boss. Dealing with the Headmistress Shannon Polluck often felt like trying to tame a hungry dragon. Yes, Penny had learned that as long as she kept her boss' stomach topped up at all times, everything was fine. But God forbid if she ever let her guard down.

Like that one day a couple weeks after she settled into her comfortable routine at Buttercombe. She awoke with a start again. She had been spending most evenings with her BFFs lately and her sleep periods had shrunk to 4-5 hours at most. She enjoyed those evenings but every morning after she was paying the price for her nightly indulgence.

“Ugh! Oh my head.” Penny rolled over on her bed to see her alarm clock. “What time… ? Almost nine already?! Oh no, I can't be late again!”

Hopefully she wouldn't. But Penny needed a quick pick-me-up. She was constantly craving sugar these mornings to keep her awake and alert. Like so many times lately, she started her coffeemaker, dashed to the bathroom, threw on her business suit and grabbed the finished coffee along with some cookies from her endlessly restocked cupboard.

She unloaded the armful onto the other seat of her scooter, sipped her cream and started driving downhill, praying between munches to make it on time.

***


“Ah. So you've finally made it!” a cranky voice greeted her when she rushed in.

“Umm…” A quick glance at her phone told Penny she was twenty seconds early. But she knew there was no point arguing with her boss when she was in this mood. She bent forward, hands on her thighs, trying to catch her breath. “Yes, Ms. Polluck… What's wrong?”

“Don't you see, girl? My scooter's broken.”

Penny looked the behemoth all over but she could not see anything wrong. “Where?”

“Are you bloody blind? My bellyrest's all but collapsed! Why am I even paying you if you're so useless, girl!”

“Oh.” Ms. Polluck's incredible gut did appear to be sloping a little to one side but it was hard to tell what was wrong – the bottom shelf designed to prop it up was buried deep in an avalanche of flab. As she tried to come up with an idea what next, Penny's thoughts were rudely interrupted. Her stomach growled, demanding sustenance after so much exercise and stress. That settled her priorities. “Umm, how about I drop to the kitchen for some snacks and then we'll order an upgrade for you?”

The behemoth blinked. It was obvious she was working up to another outburst but the prospect of more food had taken an edge off it. “Well, fine,” she grumbled for the sake of it. “But hurry up, girl, I'm starving here.”

***


In the end the two spent all morning picking up a new, personalised SSS cart with all the bells and whistles Watanagashi could provide, perfect for getting the Headmistress around the school grounds in speed and style. Then Penny dashed down to the cafeteria (well, drove down in her own decidedly downgrade scooter) for her boss' first lunch while the said boss fiddled with last details.

“Your meal is here, Ms. Polluck.”

“Ah, good. Give it to me and finalise the purchase,” her boss turned her computer over. “Here you are. Make sure to tick 'express delivery' and pay it from the special expenses account.”

Penny paused in the middle of unloading food from the cart. “Uh, what account?”

“You know which! The one Yeng keeps open for us for exactly this kind of accidents.”

“Oh, uh, but I've never… I mean, I am working here only for what, five, six weeks?”

“Ugh! And do you want to keep on working for me? Just take this card,” a swollen hand rummaged between empty wrappers on the table until it resurfaced, “and don't disturb my lunch. The password is 'password1234'.” And Ms. Polluck buried her head in a turkey.

“Yes, ma'am.” While she did as she was instructed, Penny again reflected on how much easier life was when you had money to burn. “There! I've finished your order, ma'am, your new scooter should be delivered some time tomorrow.”

“Ah, good.” Temporarily sated, the landwhale smiled at her gofer. “You did well, girl. I'll make sure you get a special bonus with your paycheck. Now go tell Eri Flatterly to send me a girl with one more turkey and some desserts, and you can have the afternoon free. It's been such an exhausting morning… we'll call it a day.”

“Yes ma'am!” Just then Penny felt an itch on her side so she reached there to scratch her ribs. Except she couldn't, they were hidden under an inch of fat, possibly even more. “Huh, maybe Shiro is right,” she grumbled as she walked out of the office. Her boss was the biggest warning sign about dangers of unbridled gluttony there could be and Penny knew she was putting on weight. She was not living in denial, no way! “Maybe I should start watching what I eat, just a little.”

But then her phone rang. “Hi, Gabby! Lunch? Sure! Right now? I'd be happy to!” And Penny waddled out, all restraint forgotten.

***


“You know, I loooove turkey day,” confided Gabby as they walked to the serving counters. “There's no reason why we should eat turkey only on holidays, huh?”

“Exactly.” Penny felt she was salivating as she looked over the heaps of food. There was turkey salad (not exactly a diet food), turkey subs and sandwiches, turkey tortilla wraps and obviously plenty of turkeys with stuffing and mashed potatoes.

Gabby's voice tore her out of her reverie: “Hey, Penny, how d'you feel about sharing a turkey?”

“A whole one?” It sounded like a lot, on the other hand… “My boss already ate two, can you imagine? Well, not yet but she'll have eaten the second one soon.”

Gabriella chuckled at the thought. “Heh, well, we can hold back. Half a turkey's enough, no?”

“Right! And maybe some tortillas…”

“And a cake! Every lunch needs a dessert!”

“Exactly.”
1311212211111221111111.title: Taming of the Beast

choices: Penny was right – nobody misses the money
Penny's crime is found out
13112122111112211111112.content:
Two weeks later Penny's stomach woke her up early. After sating it with an early pre-breakfast snack she decided to use this break in her routine for a bath. It was enjoyable but the alarm cut it too short. And while she was grabbing her towel, she noticed her reflection in the mirror. “Oh? Is that me?” In the shadows her bottom looked so big!

The image set Penny's mind ablaze. She couldn't shake it off as she wiped herself dry. There was no way she could properly see her body in the relatively small bathroom mirror so she went to the closet for a better look… and gasped.

“Holy cow!” the girl looking back from the full-length mirror looked like her twin, sure, no doubt about it. But it was a well-fed twin, with fuller chest, wider hips and the hint of a tiny belly. It must have been at least 30 new pounds. With the way they spread evenly all over her body, from plumper cheeks to fuller thighs and upper arms, the real damage may have been even worse.

But Penny Simon did not want to know, her scale was the only appliance in her cabin which she studiously avoided. Probbing the soft flesh, she promised: I'll diet and lose this flab again… even if it doesn't look so bad yet. It's not like I was the size of Gabby.

She shifted her weight uneasily, noting how it made various parts of her body jiggle. She wouldn't mind getting bigger up top but when she made a pirouette the mirror revealed her behind jiggling as well, for several seconds after she stopped moving. Oh, well. I'll just wear something looser until I lose weight and nobody will notice a thing. If I can afford it.

The last bit reminded her of another unpleasantness she had to deal with it. Inwardly cursing her boss, she plopped down on the sofa and opened her Y-Pad to have a look at her account. “Bloody-!” she swallowed the rest with a wary glance at the not-quite-hidden camera in the ceiling.

Penny had every right to feel angry. The bonus which the Headmistress had promised for arranging her new ride still failed to materialise. And probably never would, that selfish hog Polluck must have forgotten all about it as soon as she started stuffing her face again, Penny thought acidly.

She opened the tab she'd saved yesterday, the one at Boutique Fabrice for a business suit she'd fallen in love as soon as she'd seen it. It was lavender with details in dark mauve, sexy and yet professional, and now that she checked, it was available in her new size! A pity about the price, she could barely afford it on her current Buttercombe income.

As Penny stared at the Order button, she wasn't sure whether to cry or swear. It was all the fault of that fat hog! Except… her finger moved almost on its own and clicked. After all, she still had the card to the special expenses account. She could correct Ms. Polluck's oversight and the boss wouldn't be any the wiser.

When a confirmation screen popped up, she paused. This is the same shit that got you fired last time, girl. Are you that stupid?

She hit enter and a while later the app informed her that the money transfer was executed. I may be stupid but I refuse to be forever poor. Besides, I doubt these accounts are ever checked, she reasoned. Ms. Polluck's free to do whatever she wants with it… and I can take advantage of that. And look at the leftover balance, it's huge! Nobody will miss these money, it's just small change.

The rush of adrenaline made her hungry again. Penny took out leftover lasagna from the fridge and ravenously attacked them with a spoon. Revenge is a dish best eaten cold, after all.
13112122111112211111112.title: Revenge is a Dish…

choices: Go along with Fukuda
Seek alternatives
131121221111122111111122.content:
Maybe if it ended there, with one purchase, Penny Simon would have got away with it. But she'd never had a particularly strong willpower and two months in Buttercombe had further eroded it. No wonder that she used the special expenses account again a couple days later while browsing her favorite fashion pages when she found another outfit to her liking; and then for some impressive-looking flats the next day (high heels were getting so uncomfortable lately!) and…

And she was just looking at a nice silver necklace with rubies when the door opened and her boss drove in. The XLR-8x was a beautiful piece of art. A sleek tricycle, all streamlined chrome in front, a wide upholstered belly rest jutting up in the middle to accommodate the Headmistress' dominant body part. Its wheels were small but wide to better distribute its weight on the floor – Penny had seen this quote at least a dozen times as she'd pored over the specs a month ago. A plush purple settee occupied all the space available on top, with a large chrome hump behind it housing the engine and essential engineering.

In short it looked awesome but its enormous occupant looked fearsome right now. “Where's my first lunch, girl?!” she scowled. “I've been starving here!”

Recently Ms. Polluck stopped coming to cafeteria altogether, sending her assistant to lug it all up instead. In fact she barely left her office at all these days, except for various banquets with Academy partners and sponsors.

It meant more work for Penny and more insults to swallow. Filled with rightful anger (and several muffins) she made another transfer before shutting down her computer. “Yes, ma'am. I'm going now.”

***


Some more days later Penny had already served the dragoness her midday sacrifice and now she was seated with her friends at a table full of empty plates. As she leaned back to give her stomach more room to digest, a cold sensation on her neck reminded her of her newest acquisition. “Gabby, look! See this necklace?”

“Oooh, shiny! Pretty! And looks expensive. Are those rubies genuine? You sure you can afford it?”

“Eh, well, it's a bonus for helping Ms. Polluck pick her new scooter.” Which it was, more or less, Penny argued with her conscience.

“Wow! I wish my boss was so considerate. All day long I take care of students whining about indigestion while she sits on her fat butt stuffing her face,” the only one still eating, Shiro paused in her diatribe to take a bite of her blackberry pie, “and what do I get out of it? Nothing!”

“We've picked a wrong profession,” sighed Gabby. “Secretaries have it so easy. Just suck up to your boss and you're set for life. Oh, well, some more pies, girls?”

“Not for me, thanks.” The still slim nurse looked ready to burst.

Penny licked her lips. Her new skirt didn't pinch or choke, it was stretchy, nicely hugging her tummy and letting it expand. “I could eat one more… or not,” she corrected herself when her phone rang. “Yes?”

“Miss Simon? To my office. Now!” It was the Vice-Principal's voice and she did not sound happy.

***


If looks could kill, Fukuda Hinamizawa would have murdered Penny as soon as she showed up. Instead she waited in icy silence until the the poor girl collapsed into the chair, red in face from all the running on full stomach. “Do you know what an embezzlement is? You deserve a nice, long vacation for your efforts, Ms. Simon. All expenses paid. All expenses paid by the taxpayers,” she smiled grimly at her own joke.

Penny's worst fears were fulfilled. She scrambled around for an excuse. “But… but… I was just taking what I was entitled to! Ms. Polluck's promised me a big bonus and never delivered! So I thought…”

“Really? Stay where you are, Miss Simon.” Doctor Hinamizawa donned a headset and turned to her computer. Her fingers flew across the keyboard, in a moment she found what she was looking for. Penny, peeking over her shoulder, could see a smudged view of Ms. Polluck's office. So the Vice-Principal had it bugged?

The formidable Japanese took her time verifying the claim. She watched several more recorded videos before turning back. “This is unexpected,” she admitted grudgingly. “It appears your claim indeed holds up to scrutiny, Ms. Simon.”

“Yes, of course! I'd never lie to you, Dr. Hinamizawa!” Unless she had to. Penny took off her glasses – she knew it made her look young and vulnerable. “Besides, I needed those money. None of my clothes fit me anymore!”

“Indeed? What shall I do with you now?” The look Fukuda gave her was still stern but a lot of the ice melted as it slid over the bulge in Penny's lap.

Hope swelled in her chest – or was it the burritos she'd had for lunch? “Please, don't kick me out, I'll be good. I'll- I'll make it up any way you want, I'll do anything!”

”Truly anything? Well, in that case I believe we can write off your expenses, past and future, as school representation.” And future?! Penny felt a huge boulder fall off her chest. “However, that does not solve the issue of your own future at our establishment. Namely, your job description.

“You see, you are here to assist Ms. Polluck in every way. She is a symbol, a leader who should not be bothered with the minutiae of running a school. Moreover, our partners and sponsors have certain expectations from a living embodiment of the Academy spirit. However, her ascent to greatness has recently been, umm, slowed. Therefore we would like you to help her along.”

“What? Do you mean… Are you speaking about her size?”

Fukuda wasn't finished yet, though. “And given your, uh, present financial situation we can offer you the best kind of incentive. You will be paid $1000 for every pound our esteemed Headmistress gains. Are you in?”

Privately Penny thought it to be a ploy by Dr. Hinamizawa to completely eliminate Polluck from the running of the Academy but whatever. That selfish hog definitely deserved it, she shouldn't have treated Penny like garbage. Besides, beggars can't be choosers. “Yes, I am.”

“Good. You show some promise, young lady, it would be a pity if you wasted it. I hope I will be seeing more of you.”

As Penny shook the offered hand, she was frantically thinking about her chances. Should she blindly trust Fukuda and go along with her far-fetched plan? Or should she check some alternatives first?
131121221111122111111122.title: Crime and Punishment

choices: Try Tetsuko Yeng
Trust Ms. Polluck
1311212211111221111111222.content:
Penny wasn't born yesterday. Ethical aspects aside, she knew from personal experience that when managers quarrelled, it was usually their underlings who suffered the consequences. And she wouldn't want to lose such a cushy job.

So she sat down in her office with a mug of hot chocolate and some donuts to help her think, and considered her other options. The obvious one was to tell the boss. Ms. Polluck would definitely be interested to hear that her supposed second-in-command was trying to sabotage her diet (even further). However…

Penny's thoughts were rudely interrupted by the said boss' summons. “Girl! Where's my second lunch?! Run to the cafeteria, stat!”

The poor secretary couldn't run even if she wanted. She rose with a grunt, her full stomach weighing her down. God, how many donuts have I eaten? A quick glance at her plate told her the answer. All of them. She stepped inside the main office. “Yes, ma'am! Right away. I'll hurry.”

“You'd better!”

This latest encounter reminded Penny that Ms. Polluck's gratitude was definitely lacking. But she needed someone powerful if she were to stand up against the de facto ruler of Buttercombe. Actually even the Hog Headmistress may not be good enough... While she was thinking, her eyes slid over the chrome on Ms. Polluck's new scooter, until they stopped on the logo, prominently positioned in front. Of course, that was it!

That young Yeng heir, what was his name? Tetsuo? No, Tetsuko? He gave me his calling card, where'd I put it? Penny rushed back to her desk. Ah, here it is. Should I trust Ms. Polluck after all that or turn to Tetsuko?
1311212211111221111111222.title: Pondering Her Choices

choices: Onward to Wellington
13112122111112211111112221.content:
Penny was very busy that afternoon, ferrying a cart after cart loaded with delicacies from school cafeteria to the Headmistress. She wanted to make Dr. Hinamizawa believe she was going along with her plan. She was certain her movements would be followed and wanted to make the impression of a worker bee diligently fulfilling her task.

While she did so, she was frantically thinking how she could contact Mr. Tetsuko Yeng without alerting the formidable Vice-Principal. That is, she came up with a way in the first five minutes but she spent the rest of her afternoon trying to think of something that wouldn't require her to go outside, especially now that it was cold and drizzling.

But nothing else came to her mind that would be fast enough, so Penny went on a hike around her cabin – her very first since moving in. She knew it would look suspicious but making this phone call within the reach of school cameras would be plain stupid.

When she waded through the autumn leaves, their pristine state made it obvious she wasn't alone in ignoring the outdoors. Actually, she did not even know her neighbors, apart from Polluck. She'd never seen anybody outside, unless they zipped past in their scooters. Well, at least nobody would see her on the phone - her private one which she fished from the bottom of a drawer. It laid there for over two months, buried under a growing heap of clothes that shrunk in the wash.

She picked a nice secluded spot away from the roads, leaned on a tree to catch her breath and waited before dialling.

“Tetsuko Yeng speaking.”

She took a deep breath and plunged in. “Hello, Mr. Yeng. I am Penny Simon, the secretary from Buttercombe Academy. We spoke earlier this year and you said I should call…”

His tone changed from disinterested to wary. “Yes? Did something important happen?”

“Well, yeah, something you should know about, I feel. You see, the Vice-Principal, doctor-”

“I know, I know,” he interrupted her again. “No names, please. No specifics either.”

“Well, she had a really weird request regarding the Headmistress. I thought it would be best to run it by you first…”

“Oh, really, did she? In that case we should meet in person, this seems like a too sensitive issue to deal by phone. Wait a second,” Penny heard tapping on the keys. “Can you come to, uh, that small town nearby, Wellington? This Saturday?”

“Yes, sir.”

“Good. And do you know the restaurant, uh, the Belt Buster Buffet? No? Well, it is in the only mall in that town. You know which?

“Yes, sir.”

“Good. Be there at 2 p.m. and sit down next to me 'by accident.'”

“Yes-”

“Bye.”

Penny felt as if her entire stomach was trying to climb up through her mouth. She gulped down the bile and rushed back to her cabin to calm her nerves with something sweet.

***

Having made the first step, now Penny needed a good pretense to go to Wellington on Saturday. The first time she went there for her new glasses so… maybe she could claim she was going shopping for contact lenses? Or perhaps buy new contacts? The more she thought about it, the more she liked it. Her new glasses made her look professional but she also felt they added half a decade to her age. Perhaps contacts would rectify that. And since they would be free, why wait any longer?

Having settled on the reason for her visit, she had to find the means. She knew Shiro would gladly drive her again but that would mean she – and Gabby – would insist on tagging along. And Penny needed privacy for her meeting with Mr. Yeng. In the end she wrote an e-mail to Marcia Flannagan asking if she could borrow an Academy car.

You can take the Polluck's car, it's not like she is driving anywhere farther than the cafeteria, Marcia replied promptly. At least someone will clean out the cobwebs. Come to my office, sign the papers and I'll give you the key.

Penny chuckled at that, checked that her boss was still sound asleep after her last meal and visited the Housing and Services Department. Having signed the liability forms, she got a shining new key from Marcia.

And then, come Saturday morning, Penny enjoyed a leisurely drive in the comfort of a Mercedes limo as she made her way to the Belt Buster Buffet in Wellington. Contacts first, she made sure to reserve an appointment at the optician, but then the buffet. Just thinking about it made her tummy growl in anticipation.
13112122111112211111112221.title: Eat, Drink and Be Wary, Part I

choices: Operation Hogmistress goes under way
The plot blows up
131121221111122111111122211.content:
She'd never been to this buffet before. When she entered, she was shocked by its sheer size as well as variety it offered. It felt like someone transported her to New York or Atlanta, was this establishment really in a podunk mountain town? There were so many theme sections around. Driven by her nerves, Penny stopped for a plate from each: Italian, French, Chinese, Indian, Thai, Mexican, Japanese…

Only when there was absolutely no free space left on her tray, did she park it down in a corner at one of the last empty tables; empty apart from a sleek Oriental guy politely watching her approach.

“Hello, I am…” She got no further.

“Hello. Bon appetit.” And Tetsuko Yeng went back to his laptop, typing busily along. His plate held several dainty little sushi pieces and nothing else.

Penny shrugged. If he wanted to play a stranger, that was fine with her. She pulled her tray closer and dug in.

It was really good. In fact it tasted just as good as Buttercombe cuisine did, possibly for the same reasons too. But she didn't think about the whys and hows, filling her mouth with one exquisite morsel after another, losing herself in the pleasure of eating.

Penny ignored the whole world, focusing on moving as much food from the plates to her stomach as fast as possible. Only when most her plates were empty, was she brought out of her reverie by an unpleasant pressure. Her full, taut tummy was pressing into the new stylish belt she had bought recently (courtesy of the Buttercombe Academy, of course). It would be unfortunate if The Belt Buster Buffet name were to be taken literally. She slid it below the stuffed orb, sighing with relief.

Tetsuko watched her with unreadable expression. “So, what prompted you to request our randezvous, Ms. Simon? What did Dr. Hinamizawa do?”

“Well, in a nutshell, she asked me to, uh, well, fatten up the Headmistress?” She kept warily watching the prim Japanese manager as she explained the situation to him.

“I see…” he nodded, slowly and deliberately, when she finished her tale. “You did well to turn to me, Ms. Simon. I believe we can work with this- this 'plan' and turn it to our advantage. Ours and yours, Ms. Simon. For the moment please go along with Fukuda's plan and if you play it right, you can be the one who ends in charge, de facto if not de iure. Does that appeal to you?”

When Penny nodded, he went on: “Good. We shall keep in touch- actually, no, we can do something better. I can provide you with, uh, experimental bulking powder if you are willing to go that far?”

“Sure.” She had nothing to lose.

“From what I recall, it is usually served in milkshakes with flavouring – chocolate, mint… But I believe I can leave finding the best delivery method up to you. I'll send you the details tomorrow by e-mail.”

“Thanks. Is that all? I'm still feeling a little peckish and that cheesecake over there looks so tempting.” Penny rose, careful not to squish her full tummy against the table. Then she recalled their first conversation. “Aren't you going to tell me to watch my weight again?”

“I can see you can take care of yourself, Ms. Simon. I wouldn't want to get between you and your…” was he going to say cake? “Goals. Goodbye.” He picked up his laptop and left, leaving one piece of uneaten sushi.

“Goodbye.” A wave of relief washed over Penny. As she walked to the desserts section, she felt her nerve-induced hunger return. And there were so many enticing smells wafting towards her…

She licked her lips and sped up, her tummy wobbling in anticipation of the treat.

1312.content:
Fukuda's office was the prime real estate of Buttercombe Academy.

The courtyard reflected from the lenses in her glasses as she stared out the large bay windows. She could see what more or less amounted to the entire campus. A few buildings escaped her eye, namely the dormitories, but the view could hardly be called spoiled. Natural light filled the vast, apartment-sized office, reflecting off of the sheen from the newly installed hardwood floors.

Behind her, artwork hung from the walls of her native Japan. Not exactly priceless, but certainly expensive enough to impress. The recent addition of a set of wooden masks had arrived not long ago, and stared off into the view with her. The decor, she liked to think, was a nice mixture of Eastern essentialism and Western comfort. A very minimalist approach to decorating was important in playing the part of a humble, overworked Vice Principal.

The picture that the two of them painted—her and Shannon—helped complete the image. Ms. Polluck, headmistress and decadent to the extreme, where Dr. Hinamizawa was rather svelte and modest. Shannon was loud, satisfied by the material. Fukuda was quiet and approached problems with a more subtle approach.

Most importantly, Shannon was fat. And Fukuda was not.

The headmistress of the Academy was a greedy piglet, suckling on the teat of the Yeng corporation til she'd burst. The partnership between the two of their organizations, at this point, existed largely as a formality. Everyone, she'd like to think, knew who really ran things around campus. While Headmistress Polluck was stuffing her face with the finest foods that money could buy, shirking her responsibilities to nap at her desk, or busying herself with what little public relations work she bothered herself with these days, Dr. Fukuda Hinamizawa was busy running everything else. On the administrative side of things, she'd address any issues of student and staff, negotiate prices for things like textbooks, classroom amenities (whatever Yeng couldn't provide for the school itself without raising too many eyebrows.)

And on the business side of things...

"Look at them all." Dr. Hinamizawa watched a gaggle of particularly overweight girls plod slowly along the sidwalks of her courtyard. The three of them were so broad in their backsides that they had to walk in a V, lest their pillowy pillars of legs or fleshy thigh meat collide and bump them into the grass. "They're coming along so nicely."

She could recognize them from here. Abby Ackers, Bianca Boulevardez, and Callie Comacho. Sophomores, all of the same graduating class. Part of Group X3-94—experimental group B, given hormones that stimulate growth in the rear, as well as appetite. Placed on SSS upon enrollment, given a steady diet laced with aforementioned chemicals. All three were up nearly a hundred pounds since their enrollment, with their natural fat distributions overridden to coincide with that of the compound they'd been given. Her supervisors would be pleased with the results.

Yeng was happy to provide Buttercombe Academy with funding. It was happy to shill out money for equipment, food, furniture, anything that fat hog in the office across the hall could dream up in her greediest wet dreams. But it had assets to protect. And after a twenty year career in protecting those assets in Daven's Port, Dr. Hinamizawa had more than proved she was the woman for the job.

Ever since she'd taken over administrative duties, the school had never run more quietly. Shannon was the triply-chinned face of the school, but Dr. Hinamizawa had quickly become its heart and soul.

She took a sip of her wine. Viscous red liquid sloshed lazily in the glass.

It was good to be in charge.

"Dr. Hinamizawa?" her assistant's voice pierced her silence from the intercom, "Call for you on line one."

"Of course." Fukuda said with a practiced smile in her heavy accent, "Thank you."

Who's on the phone?

13122.content:
“Hello, Fukuda, this is Helen, Dr. Schwartz speaking. Have you forgotten the meeting we have scheduled for our weigh-in analysis? I have a nice presentation ready, some snacks… You know I wanted to practice my spiel with you before going to the powers that be.”

“Oh, right. Been so busy it slipped my mind, sorry.”

“So can you find the time for it? Are you coming?”

“Certainly, I wouldn't want to miss it. I am on my way. See you.” Dr. Schwartz had her office on the same floor so it took Fukuda only a couple minutes to get there.

“Hello again, have a seat, have a bite,” there was a spread of snacks and sweets next to the reinforced armchair for the doctor's guests/patients.

Fukuda sat down, feeling a little lost in the double-wide chair, and sighed. “Oh, Helen, how many times did I tell you I am not one of your charges? You know these tricks don’t work on me, don’t you?”

“Sorry, sorry, force of habit, you know. You don’t have to eat anything, just leave it here for my next visitor.” Helen gave her an unrepentant grin, knowing that lately even the formidable Fukuda Hinamizawa started having a bite here and there. “Anyway, to my presentation. Errm, as you know we finally received results from the first weigh-in of our new school year.”

She pressed a button and the large screen on the side lit up. “First of all, the first-years. And new arrivals in general. The trend continues with newly enrolled students being slightly ahead of the curve, weighing some 15 pounds more than the average teenager of their age. This trend is especially pronounced among daughters of our alumni, with 41 excess pounds per girl, and the paying students, weighing in at 18 plus. Merit students, on the other hand, arrive with their weight 7 pounds below the norm. It is therefore recommended to increase the allocation of funds for ‘merit’ or scholarship students for the next school year to ensure a representative sample group.”

Fukuda chuckled. “Oh, just admit it, Helen, you want more pawns to play with.”

“I’m not admitting anything,” the portly doctor shrugged, “and my argument is perfectly legitimate. We do need a representative sample with enough girls to take all the new compounds as well as to make up a sufficiently large control group each year. So…”

She let the sentence linger before going on, as another graph appeared, “to our returning students. It appears even our run-of-the-mill products have improved their long-term lingering effects as even in the control group, only 16 percent lost some weight over the summer, 39 maintained their weight and full 44 percent gained, an improvement of 8 percent compared to last year.”

“Really?” normally Fukuda would be eagerly probing new statistics but today it felt just like another boring day in the office. How to enliven this? “Uh, can you show any specific examples?”

“Oh, sure. Wait a second,” Helen peered into the files before displaying before-and-after shots of a student. “This is Kayla Williamson, a sophomore, gaining 16 pounds over the summer completely unassisted – apart from off-the-shelf Yeng products she keeps eating – on top of 47 pounds she put on in her freshman year. A true success story.”

“Really?” this drew Fukuda's interest. “You swear you did not have a hand in it, by any chance?”

“Nein! I don’t have time to personally feed every girl at our school! Like I said, it was completely unassisted. Caused purely by environment and peer pressure.”

“Good. Uh, could you send the data to my private account? I mean, the raw data. I prefer to do my own… analysing.”

“Certainly.” Dr. Schwartz made a few clicks and hit enter. “And now to the compound testers. The formula Y-39Z, designed to increase cravings and assertiveness, did especially well; the group gained an average of 19 pounds. Your favorite Camela Mencia excelled, putting on full 28 pounds.” And without prompting she put the Latina lardball on screen.

“Huh… not bad.”

The plump doctor paused at that bland reaction and gave her a searching look. “Is anything wrong, mein liebchen?”

Fukuda noticed her host slipping into her shrink mode. She bristled, pushing her glasses up her nose. “Certainly not! Just… tired, that's all. I have too much on my plate.”

“I see…” Dr. Schwartz glanced at the open packet of cupcakes, now half empty. “Is that why you left Daven's Port, dear? Left the Yeng management to come here? Sorry for prying but we have never covered this so if you don’t mind me asking, why did you give it all up?”

“Excuse me? What do you mean?”

“You had a whole city, the whole world as your playground, why give it up and limit yourself to a single school?”

Fukuda hesitated. Maybe Helen did have a right to ask. After all, they had been working together for nearly two decades… Except they hadn't, not really. They had worked alongside, usually not at cross purposes, but seldom together.

Should Fukuda confide in her anyway?

131221.content:
"I don't..." Dr. Hinamizawa paused, clicking her tongue contemplatively, "...see my position at Buttercombe as a step down, per se."

The smaller woman steepled her fingers as she sunk into the chair that Dr. Schwartz had provided for her. While oversized, it was quite comfortable. She slouched a bit, her soft stomach folding beneath her purple blazer. Fukuda rarely ever let her employees—Yeng appointed or otherwise—see such a bend in her normally rigid demeanor. For whatever reason, Fukuda couldn't say much as to why, she suddenly felt the need to unburden herself.

However insidious (and frankly, scary) Dr. Schwartz could be... she was still a therapist.

"I see." the round woman waddled to her desk and took her seat, "Go on."

"When I was offered my position here, to be the Vice Headmistress, and all that entailed..." the phrase had become shorthand for affiliated characters so as to avoid openly discussing Yeng-related matters. Even in private conversation, the habit still lingered. "I saw it as a reward for my hard work. Perseverance. And it was, please do not misconstrue—"

"I would never." Helen said with a little smile, "Please, continue. Do not edit yourself schätzchen, feel free to be honest with me."

Honest with Dr. Schwartz. The thought was laughable. Seeing what she had done to some of their most prized assets, knowing her skillset, made it almost impossible to think about being so trusting. Her skills in manipulation and double-think were unparalleled; it's the precise reason why she'd been stationed at Buttercombe Academy as the guidance counselor. The less that their charges would fret about the changes that they were being subjected to, the better.

However...

"What we are doing here is very important, you no doubt agree." Dr. Hinamizawa turned to her colleague, temporarily her therapist, with an open palm, "It's just... I have been stationed here for ten years now. Far longer than I was ever the head of the R&D Department in Daven's Port."

"So you are bored then, ja?" Helen blinked, "Ach, to say it as if it were some big mystery."

"Not bored, perhaps." Fukuda searched the ether for a more fitting description, "You are not a native English speaker, so you must understand the difficulty of when you want to say a word, but—"

"But it does not sound right in English." Helen chuckled, her double chin bobbing, "I am quite familiar."

"Man-neri." Fukuda answered with a rare smile, "I am... caught."

"Ach—you are in a rut, mein liebchen." Helen said with a confident click of her pen, "You are not bored, simply dissatisfied. Day in, day out, you feel as if you do not experience anything new."

"That is much closer to what I meant to say." Fukuda said with a small sigh

"This is good news, and a simple solution." Dr. Schwartz said, clapping her chubby hands together. Her wide arm wings wobbled with the motion, and her round cheeks bunched into a pleased smile, "All you must do is to find a way to break your routine."

"I'm sorry?" Dr. Hinamizawa looked up at the doctor, right into her eyes, "I'm afraid that you do not understand. I am, effectively, the headmistress. I do not have time to—"

"Dr. Hinamizawa, you are not listening to me." Helen said more sternly, her big hypnotic eyes widening, "I said, in order to break out of your rut, you must first find a way to break through your routine."

And somehow, that seemed to sink in a little better. Dr. Hinamizawa sunk back into her chair, processing the diagnosis of one of her longtime colleagues. After all, she was a doctor. This was her field of study. She had come to her in the first place, and, if anyone would know how to get her feeling back into sorts, it would be Dr. Schwartz.

"I see your point." Dr. Hinamizawa said with a resigned huff, "But how do you suggest that I do such a thing? I have almost no free time."

"Nonsense, you will only have time if you make time." Dr. Schwartz said, her chipper tone of voice returning, "Might I suggest...

1312213.content:
Fukuda faltered a bit as soon as the words left Dr. Schwartz's lips. The two of them, have lunch with one another? It had been so long since Fukuda had ever ventured outside of her office during the lunch hour that she allocated every day, and it had been who knew how much longer since someone had actually asked her to eat lunch with them.

         Dumbfounded, the vice administrator could only blink in response.

         "You don't have to say yes, you know." Dr. Schwartz laughed, "It was merely a suggestion."

         "No, no..." Dr. Hinamizawa gripped the armrests of Schwartz's oversized seat and pushed herself to a standing position, "I will see you... after classes, then."

***


         Later that evening, Dr. Schwartz's trusty cart puttered up to Fukuda's cabin. She was precisely on time, perhaps even a little early if the microwave timer was to be believed; a trait that Dr. Hinamizawa had always appreciated in her coworkers and personal company. Tonight, they would overlap, as Dr. Schwartz... Helen... attempted to help her break through the rut that she had driven herself into. If she was going to learn how to cook, it might as well be on her time.

         Dr. Schwartz was a bit more experience in these matters. Like Fukuda she knew far too much about what went into the food to trust anything served at Buttercombe or any Yeng Facility, but unlike Fukuda she could not afford to eat out as often and as extravagantly as Fukuda.

         Today she arrived with some garlic, some sausage, a few pieces of flank steak, and an onion, and she hoped Fukuda would have anything else she needed.

***


         “Is something wrong with it?” Fukuda simply asked

         “It’s one of Evie’s.” The plump little doctor opened up the bottle and took a sniff.

         “Addictive?” Fukuda asked with trepidation, not having really expected an answer to that question.

         Helen shrugged. “A bit. But more importantly, fake. It’s not fermented, it’s adulterated.”

         “Does that matter?” Fukuda said, curious what Helen was getting at.

         “Well of course it matters. It tastes different. Stay here, I’ll be back with the real thing.”

         Fukuda was uncertain what to do while she waited, looking at the steak awaiting marination. She reached for the bottle, and prepared to just do it herself. After all, what difference did it make? When Helen came back in proudly holding a large bottle wrapped in simple white paper, with Kanji markings on it. Fukada inspected it carefully. Kishibori Soyu, it was a kind of soy sauce fermented with toasted wheat. The level of craftsmanship in the bottle alone convinced Fukuda this was soy sauce made as it had been in Japan for centuries.

         “Where did you find this?” Fukuda marveled.

         “Shopping online.” Helen smiled.

         “I didn’t realize you had such an appreciation of Japanese Cuisine.” Fukuda said appreciatively.

         “I don’t.” Helen said bluntly. Fukuda turned away from her, and Helen realized that once again German directness had gotten her in trouble with Japanese subtlety. “I mean, I would like to have such an appreciation” she amended. “But I have rarely had a chance to try authentic Japanese food. I just sometimes use the sauce when I want something different.”

         “Then why something sourced carefully?”

         “Because anything worth doing is worth enjoying.”

***


         “You cannot find joy at Buttercombe because you draw most of your happiness from the pride you take in ignoring or suppressing your needs. You’ve grown tired of that, but you’re still...blocked up. Unable to open yourself to new joys.”

         “I see. There may be some truth there but...how can one draw happiness from suppressing their needs? That seems like a very rare problem.”

         “Oh, it’s very common. We have a term for it.”

         “And what is that?”

         “The technical term is anal retentive.”

***


         Fukuda sat in her chair, hands gripping the rests, her back straight as a rod. Helen and food in the same room set her on edge. Helen either didn’t notice, or chose not to acknowledge her fear as she sat cutting up the sausage into bite sized pieces, then the apple, then the cheese, and finally the fresh black rye bread. She stuck the fork through a single piece of sausage, and held it in front of Fukuda’s mouth, like playing airplane with a toddler.

         The toddler was fussy. Fukuda pulled her head back. “This is one of your plots. You’re trying to make me fat.”

         Helen chuckled. “No, I’m not. If I was, you wouldn’t know it." Helen could see her dark humor didn't put her boss at ease, so she quickly shifted to a different tact. "I’m your friend, and your therapist. This is not an exercise in eating more, it is an exercise in mindfulness. A joie de vivre doesn’t make one fat, and a philistine relationship with food doesn’t make one skinny...otherwise our customers would be.” Helen joked.

         Fukuda closed her eyes, tightly, and bit the bullet. Or sausage, as it were. She chewed it hard and quickly. This was how Fukuda took most of her meals. She ate as quickly as etiquette would allow, so she could finish her meal and move on to more important things.

         “Good.” Helen encouraged “Chew slower. How does it taste.”

         “It tastes fine, I suppose.” Fukuda said, sounding distracted.

         “No, no.” Helen shook her head. “How does it taste. What does it taste like, describe it for me.”

         Fukuda swallowed the last of it. “It tastes like sausage.”

         “Describe it to me. In as much detail as possible. What tastes are there.” Helen said, holding out another piece playfully.

         Fukuda gave the piece of meat a hard look before she decided to continue. “Fat.”

         “Good.” Helen nodded, encouraging her to keep going.

         “Pork fat. It dribbles down my throat, in a way that’s not unpleasant.” She slowed her chewing to think about the question. “But there’s also spices.”

         “Can you make them out?” Helen asked. Fukuda was starting to enjoy this. It had becoming challenging.

         “Hmmm, I’m not very good at spices. I don’t know anything about cooking.”

         “It’s okay to guess. Or describe them.” Helen said, guiding her along the baby steps of this challenge.

         “Well...there is Pepper, I think. It has a little heat. There, there is definitely Ginger in this. I can tell because it’s not used in as many western dishes, and it’s a familiar taste.” Her caution gave way to optimism and excitement, it was like a floodgate was opening. “The other spices are very earthy. I cannot name them but they taste...green. They make me think of walking through a forest.” She was getting a little flush in the face like this.

         “Very good, Fukuda.” Helen said with a smile. She reached out and touched the other woman’s hand, and gave it a squeeze. Fukuda very rarely was touched like that, but the doctor had a talent for making it feel intimate, establishing an immediate connection of trust through touch and sincerity. “How are you liking the sausage now?”

         “Much better, thank you, Doctor.” Fukuda said, relieved. She felt the burden of her Man-neri lifted.

13122131.content:
"Ach, I have the perfect pairing for that." the German doctor said with a smile as she suddenly let go of Fukuda's hand and retreated towards the door, "You wait right here, and enjoy your meal. I will return shortly."

For a moment, Fukuda was tempted to ask the small doctor to not go. She couldn't quite explain why. She and Helen had been having... fun? Was that the appropriate word? It had been so long since she'd associated with anyone outside of the office setting, and Helen's cooking was so sublime. Yes, fun. They'd been having fun. And the thought of Helen walking out the door seemed, in a juvenile way, to threaten the existence of the small levity that she'd gleaned from Helen's visit to her cabin.

Thankfully for Fukuda's momentary lapse in maturity, Helen was not in fact gone forever.

"Now, far be it from me to suggest that sausage should go with anything other than a good stout ale." Helen said jovially as she entered Fukuda's cabin with a small corked bottle, "But in preperation for our little zusammenkommen, I thought to get you a... erm... house warming present! that's how you say it in English, ja?"

The chubby woman held in one hand a fine bottle of sake. As Fukuda would later learn, it was from the snowy region of Niigata. Helen had procured it in a small brown bottle with a tag describing its make, content, and distillery in kanji. It was obviously imported and far from Helen's taste. Honestly, Fukuda couldn't remember the last time that she'd had alcohol from her home country instead of the viscous red wine that she so frequently partook in during her time in America...

"You brought me a bottle of sake?" Fukuda asked, feeling more touched than suspicious for the first time in a long time, "Helen, that's so..."

"Thoughtful, I'm aware." the little blue-haired psychologist snorted, "I thought to myself, how often does Doktor Hinamizawa invite me over to her cabin? I might as well make it a very special occasion indeed!"

For once, though not for a lack of trying, Fukuda was at a loss for words. For most of her career, she'd disregarded Helen's presence. Then, upon learning her great talent and skillset, she'd done her best to stay on her good side while maintaining a professional distance. To think that she'd be given such a simple gift, but one that struck her so deeply for some inelegant reason... Fukuda was honestly baffled at the thought. They weren't friends by any stretch—but here, Helen was treating being invited to her home as such an event!

"Thank you, doctor." Fukuda defaulted to her typical Japanese politeness, "This is... very thoughtful. I will be sure to savor every drop."

"You obviously don't know how Germans like to drink!" Helen wrapped an arm boistrously around Fukuda's shoulder, "I would consider it a personal insult if we didn't reach the bottom of the bottle by the end of tonight!"

Fukuda's face grew flush at her coworker's invasion of her personal bubble, not to mention the idea of getting hammered. Sake was strong stuff—she could smell it through the cork and the bottle! No doubt if they got to the bottom of the bottle, they'd have quite the hangover to deal with in the morning...

"Ah... it is... late, yes?"

"And Friday, ja?" Helen piqued an eyebrow provocatively, already pouring a cup for the two of them, "Come, frau doktor! Let us enjoy ourselves! Do away with... what did you call it in your language?"

"Man-neri." Fukuda said, holding back a smile as her shot was being poured

"Right. Man-neri." Helen did her best, but faltered on the pronounciation, "Let us dig you out of your rut!"

The clicked glasses, and tilted their heads back...

***


The rest of the night was... spotty, to say the least.

It had been a long time since Fukuda had partaken in something so strong. She had never possessed a particularly strong tolerance in the first place, and Helen's sake had been exceptionally strong. No, it wasn't developed by Yeng as Fukuda was ask at least three times during her drunken escapades, but in fact hand-grown in Japan and yes, she was just a lightweight. No additives, no anything. Which, for a Fukuda without inhibitions, seemed strange.

"It's so odd for us to deal with real things, isn't it?" she slurred, taking another shot of the half-emptied bottle, "Doing what we do."

"Yes, it is." Helen was only buzzed, not long-gone like her fellow doctor, "Although, they're not to blame for your low tolerance!"

"Ha ha." Fukuda stuck out her tongue, like a schoolgirl, before downing her last shot, "Don't pretend that you are not satisfied with yourself. Seeing me in such a state."

"I would be lying if I said I wasn't." Helen smiled, "You are kind of cute when you're drunk."

Fukuda smiled in an exaggerated fashion before pouring herself yet another shot. She had been responsible for at least half of the bottle being emptied, which meant that only a fourth of the bottle had been sloshing around in her belly on top of the sausage. Whether it was a testament to the alcoholic content of Helen's gift, or her inability to drink anything stronger than cheap red wine, she could not especially guess. However, in her drunken state, she concurred that this was a far better alternative to her evening meditation and going over reports.

"I did not always used to be so... Eigo de dō iimasu ka?" Fukuda tapped her chin, "Uptight. I was not always so uptight."

"Ach! I cannot believe it!" Helen put a hand on her full chest in mock surprise, "Fukuda, you devil!"

"It's true, I was quite the devil." the Asian doctor smiled as she poured herself yet another (!) shot of sake. She was beginning to lose herself now. Her inihibitions had faded into the very back of her mind. She was running entirely on alcohol now, for better or worse, "I still am, to some extent."

"When necessary." Helen added slyly...

"Always." Fukuda winked provocatively, "I will always be the sixteen year old girl in Namba flirting with old geezers for free drinks."

"Fukuda!" Helen exclaimed in genuine surprise, "I would have never guessed."

"You would be surprised about the things you learn about me." Fukuda giggled dimly

There was a slight pause as Dr. Schwartz's honed instincts came to a head.

"Oh?" the small, blue haired woman steepled her fingers, "Tell me Frau Doktor... Fukuda... what would surprise me so?"

"Well..." Fukuda giggled drunkenly, "What if I told you, that..."

131221313.content:
“Really?” Helen chuckled. “Well you had a funny way of showing it.”

         “...I should not have brought it up.” Fukuda said suddenly defensive after exposing her feelings like that. Helen put a chubby comforting hand on her shoulder.

         “I’m sorry. I shouldn’t have teased. But it is a little confusing for me.”

         “...I am surprised you were not able to see through me.” Fukuda said.

         “Maybe I could, and I was just playing along.” Helen winked. Fukuda smiled. Things were a lot better now that Helen was a friend rather than an adversary.

         “Always with the headgames...” Fukuda shook her head. “It’s easier for me to appreciate what you two had, what you two brought to the company, without corporate breathing down my neck. You two were geniuses together. I should say, you’re both geniuses separately, but to see you in a room together was like magic. Problems that seemed decades off would get solved by you in a weekend.” She smiled wistfully, before turning to Helen to tease her. “But only if it would benefit your little games.”

         Helen also seemed wistful. And sad. That was a face Fukuda had never seen from the doctor. “It was magic. I look back on it as the best years of my life. I miss her every day. And now she’s off achieving...greatness.” Dr. Schwartz, a woman that Fukuda often lived in terror of for many years, was crying. Maybe it was the Sake, maybe it was their budding relationship, but Fukuda hugged her. Feeling the doctors round softness envelop her thin frail frame felt so good, so natural.

         “All I could think at the time was how to meet quarterly goals. I think I was jealous that I could not join in your games.” Fukuda said, almost like an apology. Helen wiped her tears.

         “You know. It’s not too late. The game isn’t as fun without another player. I’ve been in a rut just working on projects for myself. And you’re well positioned.” She smiled, getting excited.

         “I don’t know, Helen…” Fukuda said nervously. “I’m not like you.”

         “Oh Doktor.” Helen’s smile became a little menacing. “No one is like Helen Schwartz.”

1321.content:
It wasn’t always easy, doing what she did.

In her own private office, given to her through the generosity of her administration at Buttercombe Academy, when she was alone with her thoughts Shiro would often question the path that she was on.

Working towards her accreditation was always a good thing. And this program set up through the Yeng Corporation was wonderful because it allowed her to get practice in her field while also getting paid. Her cabin was free of charge so she could save up her money, and almost everything that she would require was taken care of.

But looking at the medical chart in front of her—clipboard feeling heavy in her hands—she could help but question the ethics of it all.

She may have only just started over the Summer, but this was the fourth student today who had come into her offices on recommendation for the SSS program.

It was only the first day!

According to her charts, Ginny Cutter had come to this Academy weighing one hundred and ten pounds—a perfectly reasonable weight for a girl of her height and age. She was a young and developing woman, after all. But the girl in front of her looked to be almost twice that!

“Two hundred and… eight pounds.” Shiro clicked her pretty pink pen, circling the number on her chart, “That’s… a little higher than what you weighed in at this time last year.”

You would have thought that the young doctor-to-be had just told her she’d never walk again. Poor Ginny looked down at her soft, flabby belly with the utmost disappointment. It was clear that she had been hoping for a lower number—Shiro could hardly blame her. Almost doubling her weight in just two short semesters and a Summer vacation… that was unreal!

Except it wasn’t. The other three girls that Shiro had seen today had been more or less the same. One girl had gone the extra mile and put on an extra thirty pounds to what the red-faced little Buddha in front of her had gained. How was this real? Four girls, all at once… practically back to back!

“So…” she squeaked, her voice was high and tinny, “Does that mean…”

She gulped, looking up at Shiro with big doe eyes.

“Does that mean that you have to put me on SSS?”

Shiro’s thin lips tugged to one side. This one didn’t seem too pleased with the prospect, unlike some others that came to mind. Honestly, Shiro wasn’t too big of a fan of the SSS program in general. At least, how it was handled…

But now wasn’t the time for sternness—what Ginny needed was comfort. A little bedside manner. And that, Shiro thought with some pride, was her favorite part of the job.

She put one of her long elegant hands on the poor girl’s fluffy shoulder. Bent down just a little to accommodate for the difference in height, and smiled as warmly as she could manage to the sitting, sniffling patient.

“No, of course not.” Shiro hummed, “You’re still a way’s away from needing the next tier up.”

Shiro was exaggerating, of course, to make the girl feel better. Truthfully, Ginny was just a mere 10 pounds away from qualifying. But that seemed to help her.

“I am?” Ginny sniffled hopefully

“Yes, you are. But you do need to start exercising more. And eating less.” Shiro offered in as benign a way as possible, “Just keep taking your medication and you’ll be fine. Maybe… I don’t know… do any of your friends jog?”

Ginny snorted—of course they didn’t jog. That’s what was wrong with this place.

“No.” Ginny said a little less hopelessly, “My friends are all lazy.”

“Well… then you could always go by yourself.” Shiro countered, “But like I said, if you don’t want to wind up on Tier 3, then just keep taking your meds and cut back a little. You’ll be fine.”

Her problems momentarily alleviated, Ginny hopped down to the floor with joy. Her whole body quivered and quaked with the impact of her weight to the hard linoleum floor. Shiro refilled her prescription, one last warning, and sent the poor little plumper on her way.

Hopefully she wouldn’t come back next year another hundred pounds heavier.

Sixteen and over 200 pounds… Shiro gulped, That’s nuts…

It wasn’t any of her business, of course. Yeng and Buttercombe paid her to do her job, and that’s what she did. She doled out the medication and operated within their prescribed limits. But something about all these girls, gaining upwards of a hundred pounds in a year… it didn’t seem right.

Maybe she should talk to somebody about this?

1322.content:
“Good morning, Hypatia!” Helen beamed with excitement, as her cat climbed up on the breakfast table to try and eat out of Helen’s cereal bowl. Helen Schwartz was 45 years old. She lived alone with her cat. She hadn’t been on a date in years. Most women would dread being in her position. But Helen greeted each day with new excitement and joy.

         How? Well, she kept her stress levels low. Despite her size, she kept in shape, mentally and physically with a strong Yoga routine. Her job and lack of children allowed her a great deal of self-care, bubble baths, trips to visit her parents in the Yucatan in the summer.

         And, oh right. Bending and breaking the entire staff and student body of Buttercombe’s Academy for Growing Girls to her will, and sending them spiraling further into obesity. That kept her happy. And she was looking forward to doing that today, same as every day.

         She poured a pot of tea into her thermos, and headed out, letting her cat lick what it liked out of her breakfast bowl. Her trip through the halls to her office was a joyous one. Even at 250 pounds, Helen was one of the most physically capable members of the faculty. She headed to work with a spring in her step and to move circles around her more sedentary coworkers. Like Marsha Alberway, for example. Helen spied a sliver of the coach’s belly hanging out of her new jersey, and smiled. Or Carrie Porter. She swore that woman looked more like her sister every day. Oh how she missed Cerys Porter’s presence on campus!

         And the students! Camela Mencia! How Dr. Schwartz loved conversing with her in Spanish during their meetings. And how she enjoyed how many treats out of her candy bowl Camela would have during those meetings. And how those treats padded out her behind.

         Even the new ones! Hunter Black. Helen had such a fondness for the Black Family! All of them, but especially Hunter’s sister. Her letter of recommendation helped ensure Hunter’s acceptance, and she intended to do her best to mold Hunter into her own ideal of a young woman.

         Yes, there was endless opportunities, and endless pleasures waiting for her at her desk every morning. When her close-minded, so-called ‘superiors’ weren’t getting in her way. So she sat down to get to work, took a sip of tea, and checked her answering machine with a smile.

13221.content:
As one might expect of a woman in her position, Dr. Schwartz saw many clients.

Freshmen, by and large, were those who Helen saw most frequently. And this was to be expected, of course. After all, the relocation from one's home, friends and family to come and live in a strange setting that was largely isolated could be emotionally devastating to a young, developing woman. Especially when a setting such as Buttercombe Academy had already developed so differently than the schema that those poor girls were used to.

However, older girls were not uncommon. The troubles of being a teenager weren't assuaged simply because their parents were miles and miles away. The issues of cliques and social anxiety, combined with body issues abound (Helen chuckled to herself at the thought of some of the interesting variations on developmental anxiety that had come through her office doors during her time here) Dr. Schwartz often saw Sophomores, Juniors, and Seniors with a similar frequency.

It wasn't unheard of for even the faculty and staff to make time to speak to Helen, either through informal pop-ins or by actually making appointments. Teaching was a very difficult job, especially with the peculiar task of raising (mostly) young well-to-do girls from rich families, where a phone call to someone's parents could have disastrous effects on a teacher's future if handled wrongly...

All of this and more, Dr. Helen Schwartz could handle—and so well.

With her peculiar kind of guidance, Helen could help almost anybody become who they needed to be for any given obstacle. Or rather, whom she felt they needed to be...

This morning's meeting was with one of her favorite personal projects...

132211.content:
Dr. Schwartz had watched Hunter very closely, and not just since her enrollment into Buttercombe Academy.

Call her a family friend—Helen had been over Research & Development of the Yeng Corporation's Daven's Port branch for years, where plenty of the Black family had worked at various points in their lives. Her mother Harper had been her secretary for a while (and put on a good clean 40 pounds to even out her hourglass figure that seemed to have stuck to this day) and the oldest sister Parker had interned there for a few weeks before being... let go. The second-oldest Black daughter, Piper, was still working diligently as a lab rat consultant when Dr. Schwartz had been reassigned. They kept in touch, and Piper was how Helen had heard of Hunter's application to Buttercombe, and pulled the requisite strings with the Headmistress (the ones attached to her voracious appetite) to net her a sure thing in the form of a scholarship.

Helen had been so happy to hear of Hunter's academic aspirations and accomplishments over the years; she felt almost like an aunt towards the young girl! She'd known her since not long after she was born, after all.

But looking at the picture of her old staff that she kept on her desk, as she often did during her moments of nostalgia, it wasn't difficult to see another side to Helen's fascination with Hunter...

Ach, Helen clicked her tongue as Hunter's voicemail played in the background, she looks so much like her sister.

***


To Hunter, Dr. Schwartz was really more of another source of anxiety. It was all well and good when she was trying to get Hunter into Buttercombe Academy, but her mama had made it very clear that she was in that tiny, blue-haired woman's debt—and deeply so.

"Dr. Schwartz got you a seat in that nice school, so make sure you don't go a day without thanking her!" her mother had told her probably a billion times before they'd arrived, "Ya got that?"

And it was just so... ugh! Like, not only was she the first person in her family to get into this kind of ritzy school, but it almost felt like she didn't earn it. Like, just because Piper's old boss works here, she got in for free. And... and.. Hunter was smart! She earned this! And... And...

"You feel invalidated because of my involvement in your enrollment." Dr. Schwartz clicked her tongue, and her pen, as she listened dutifully from the other side of her desk, "Is that not right?"

"No! Of course not!" Hunter hastily corrected herself, "I just... I mean..."

Hunter looked so very much like her sisters when they were her age. Olive skin, dark hair, and perfectly sculpted features. The women of the Black family tended to be gorgeous, Helen had noted over the years. From Harper to that freeloading older one to Piper, even as she continued to swell up. Especially as she continued to swell up, Helen corrected herself.

How much had Piper weighed before she left, all those years ago?

"I feel like my Mom's just putting so much pressure on me." Hunter continued, oblivious to Helen's inner monologue, "Like, okay, I get it, Parker dropped out of college. Whatever, I shouldn't have to work on the line like Piper does... no offense."

"None taken." Helen flashed a smile. Was it 500? "Continue, please."

"Okay, it's just. I'm not either of them, you know? I'm my own person and I'm already under so much pressure. The school work is a lot harder than I'm used to and I've never been goodatdealingwithgirlsandI'mjustso—"

"Hunter." Dr. Schwartz softly interjected

"IfeellikeeveryoneknowsthatI'mnotsupposedtobeherey'knowan d—"

"Hunter."

"I'mjustsofreakedoutallthetimeand—"

"Hunter." Dr. Schwartz said a bit more sternly, her German accent slipping through a bit more roughly than she would have liked, "I understand. You feel that you are put under a lot of pressure here, yah? It's completely understandable for you to want to avoid comparison with your sister."

"Sis...Sisters." Hunter weakly corrected

"Is Parker really a comparison to you?" Helen said with a smile, "You have come so very far and, honestly mein libschen, I had very little to do with it. Everything you have earned here, you have earned yourself."

"R-Really?" Hunter sniffled. Her eyes were watery. She'd clearly worked herself up quite a bit.

"Of course I do—would I ever lie to you?" Helen paused

"Now, about your stress." She switched to a more informal seating. Her plush tummy cut into the desk as she leaned forward on her plump arms. She did her best to seem "soft" to Hunter. The poor girl was so skittish as it is, and it wouldn't do her any favors to seem untrustworthy...
